rin: Nagtatago iya.
eng: She was hiding.

rin: Si Nana Kuring, su paraaling ni mama niya, naturakan iya sadto dating zaguan sadto sirong ku lumang baloy.
eng: Nana Kuring, her mother's yaya, found her in what was once the zaguan under the old house.

rin: Na nguwan bodega na ku ngamin na bagay na pinaglumaan, pinaglingawan, o ka para myentras diri na kaipuwan.
eng: Which now served as the bodega for all the things unwanted, forgotten, or not needed for the time being.

rin: Aros nakatalbong sadto kangitngitan su sadit na igin na babayi.
eng: The little girl was almost buried in the dark.

rin: Natatawban ku mga lumang isinaray, utak na katre, kawoy na ruweda sa kareta.
eng: Hidden by old junk, a metal bed, a wooden carriage wheel.

rin: Mga sako sa diri pa namumulinong paroy.
eng: Sacks of the unmilled paroy.

rin: Ag pinalilibutan iya sa alumuom na parong ku sementadong ringring.
eng: And surrounded by the musty smell of concrete walls.

rin: Ag ku matam-is na parong ku kopra.
eng: And the sweetness of copra.

rin: La niyang ati sa kasusuksok sadto pigtataguan niya.
eng: She was filthy from burrowing into the dust of her hiding place.

rin: Ag sadto lalawgon niya a ating an kinuritan na ku mga itinurong luwa niya.
eng: And in her face that filth was streaked by tearstains.

rin: Igin, uno piggigibo mo sadi?
eng: Igin, what are you doing here?

rin: Unga ni Nana Kuring, nangalas, ku su liwanag ku apon na naglagbas sadto bukas na pirtan nasilawan kin sari su igin na babayi nagtatago.
eng: Nana Kuring asked, surprised, as the afternoon light that filtered through the open door illuminated where the little girl was hiding.

rin: Nagsilong sana kanya su igin.
eng: The child only looked back at her.

rin: Pa'la mas sinuksok sadto kangitngitan.
eng: And then huddled deeper into the dark.

rin: Ku narungog nirang darwa su magaan na lakang sadto kawoy na salog sadto itaas, sigeng balik-balik, sigeng balik-balik, bagana agko pig-aanap.
eng: When both of them heard the light footsteps on the wooden floorboards above, coming and going, coming and going, as if searching.

rin: Usad na pirtan su nagsarado pa'la tuninong na utro.
eng: A door closed and there was silence once more.

rin: Bagana pati 'ding pinsan mo mata pa man ata dapat pariyo kamong turog para sa syesta.
eng: It seems even your cousin is awake when both of you should be asleep for siesta.

rin: Paangos na sabi ni Nana Kuring.
eng: Nana Kuring sighed.

rin: Nanuog su igin.
eng: The child stiffened.

rin: Uno yan?
eng: What is it?

rin: Unga ni Nana Kuring, narisa su alarma ku igin, na nagrarani paiyan kanya.
eng: Nana Kuring asked, noting the child's alarm, moving towards her.

rin: Pig-akoy niya su nakasuksok na awak para gakuson pero nagbulagting su igin ag rinnayo.
eng: She drew the huddled body into an embrace but the child flinched and pulled away

rin: Sinilngan ni Nana Kuring su diri nagkikimat-kimat na tiurong kanya pa'la pakauban-uban luway na nagsabing.
eng: Nana Kuring looked at her unblinking stare and after a time gently said.

rin: Pwede mong sabiyon kanako.
eng: You can tell me.

rin: Binukasan ku igin su nganga niya pero uda ngangabilon na nag-abot kanya ag uda man nangga'd nasayod.
eng: The child opened her mouth but no words came to her and none came out.

rin: Nabayad ni Nana Kuring na piggukpan ku igin su nganga niya ag tinulon su mga luwa niya.
eng: Nana Kuring watched the child close her mouth and swallow her tears.

rin: Mayang na, igin.
eng: Come, child.

rin: Luway niya 'ding pig-alok na magsunod.
eng: She softly bade her to follow with a nod of her head.

rin: Maan na diri niya 'di makaputan.
eng: Careful that she wouldn't touch her.

rin: Maan na nagbuwat su igin ag likay na nagsunod kanya paluwas sadto bodega.
eng: The child gingerly stood up and warily followed her out of the bodega.

rin: Paiyan sadto liwanang ku apon.
eng: Into the afternoon light.

rin: Sadto kuru-kusina su baloy-baloy na kaabay ku kabaluyan.
eng: And through the dirty-kitchen-a hut beside the main house.

rin: Kin sari su mga gurang na babayi gigirison a ngamin sadto maabang lamesa.
eng: Where the old women chopped everything on a long wooden table.

rin: Ag magluluto sadto pugon na piggatungan sa irutong.
eng: And cooked in a kiln banked by dried wood.

rin: Pinasunod iya ku gurang na babayi sadto bumba'an kaabay kadi.
eng: The old woman led her to the deep-well pump beside it.

rin: Su igin punok na nag-ulat labing pig-aalsa ni Nana Kuring su planggana na bagana tamanyo sa saparilya sa soft drink.
eng: The child waited silently as Nana Kuring lifted the tin basin that was shaped like a soft drink bottle crown.

rin: Ag puno sa lalaban 'nganing maisuno 'di sa payo kadi labing nakaukrong ta pigpupurot su palo-palo.
eng: And filled with laundry to hoist it on top of her head while bending to pick up the palo-palo.

rin: Nagrawat nang mag-agi su gurang na babayi parani sadto trangkahan paluwas sadto tinampo.
eng: The old woman began walking towards the gate that led to the road.

rin: Pa'la, pakatapos sa usad na dosenang lakang, pinundo adi ku narisa niyang diri man nagsusunod su igin kanya.
eng: And then, after a dozen steps, stopped when she realized that the child wasn't following her.

rin: Su igin nakatangad sadto bintana ku lumang baloy.
eng: The child was looking up the windows of the old house.

rin: Sadto nakasaradong bintanang kapis, pala nagsilong kanya.
eng: At those shuttered shell windowpanes, and then looked at her.

rin: Pigkayab ni Nana Kuring ku palo-palo niya su igin.
eng: Nana Kuring swung the palo-palo in a forward motion to the child.

rin: Ag su igin na babayi dali-daling nagsusunod sadto gurang na babayi.
eng: And the little girl hurried after the old woman.

rin: Nagluwas sira sadto pulang pigtataklang trang-kahan ku lumang baloy paiyan sadto ispaltadong tinampo, nauuna iya pa'la su igin nagsususunod.
eng: They walked out of the old house's red rusting gate into the deserted asphalt road, with her leading and the child following.

rin: Ku una namamati sana ku igin su init ku aldow sadto bok niya ag pigsusunod sana niya su tiil ku gurang na nabayad babayi.
eng: For a time the child only felt the sun on her hair and followed the old woman's feet.

rin: Anggan na sana niya na nag-aagi na iya sa raga ag mga layang dawon.
eng: Until she saw that she was walking on soil and dead leaves.

rin: Uda raran.
eng: There was no path.

rin: Uda aldow.
eng: There was no sun.

rin: Agko sana ragot ku mga kawoy ag ragisnis ku mga dawon.
eng: There was only the creak-ing of the trees and the rustling of the leaves.

rin: Bigla iyang nagpundo.
eng: She suddenly stopped.

rin: Pinundo man su mga tunog ag namati niya na agko matang nag-iinirib kanya.
eng: The sounds ceased too and she felt eyes watching her.

rin: Pigtangad ku igin su nakaukrong niyang payo 'nganing silngan su taludtod ni Nana Kuring.
eng: The child raised her bowed head to look at Nana Kuring's back.

rin: Diri ika makatakot.
eng: "Don't be afraid.

rin: Sabi ku gurang na babayi na diri naglilili.
eng: The old woman said without looking back.

rin: Si Tata Ulyan sana yan.
eng: That's just Tata Ulyan.

rin: Narurumruman mo iya, amigo baga iya ni Papa 'Iton mo?
eng: Remember him, your Papa 'Iton's good friend?

rin: Mag-iiyan baga iya minsan sadto baloy pag miggagab-i na.
eng: He would sometimes come to the house after dusk.

rin: Si Papa 'Iton mo gayod minandan iyang susunuron kita.
eng: Your Papa 'Iton probably sent him after us.

rin: Narurumruman ku igin su gurang na lalaki na agko dakulong bayak-bayak imbes na urong na pirming agko darang minasbad.
eng: The child remembered an old man with a big sac for a nose who would always carry a minasbad with him.

rin: Su kawoy na sarungan kadi napapaha sadto puputlan niya sa lubid na abaka.
eng: Its wooden scabbard belted around his hip with a hemp rope.

rin: Ag su bagana payo sa ayam a nakaturno sadto pulo ku espada.
eng: And what looked like a dog head carved as the wooden handle of the sword.

rin: Sabi kanya ku pukuapuon niyang lalaki nauda kuno si Tata Ulyan sadto bukid usad na gab-i pa'la inuling agko regalo galin sa bukid.
eng: Her grandfather told her that Tata Ulyan had wandered into the mountain one night and returned with the mountain's gift.

rin: Naglili iya ag sadto man nanggad adi.
eng: She looked behind her and there he was.

rin: Usad na kulor-ragang ayam na nangitom na ku matang nakasilong kanya.
eng: A brown dog looking at her with the blackest eyes.

rin: Nagsilong iya utro ki Nana Kuring na naglili para daliang ngumisi kanya.
eng: She looked back at Nana Kuring who had turned to smile briefly at her.

rin: Bistado niya 'ding raga ag dakol iyang ising istorya arog ni pukuapuon mo.
eng: He knows this land and knows as many stories as your grandfather.

rin: Naglili utro su igin na babayi, pero uda na su ayam.
eng: The little girl looked behind her once more, but the dog was gone.

rin: Nagbaklay na sira utro pa'la pakanganod-nganod pigtugal ni Nana Kuring su igin na babayi na upsuon su istip-in niya.
eng: They began walking again and soon Nana Kuring asked the child to take off her step-ins.

rin: Pa'la nag-aagi na su tiil niya sadto bukal.
eng: Then her feet were walking into a bukal.

rin: Usad na tuninong na sagop ku sapa.
eng: A tranquil pool formed by a stream.

rin: Lang agnow ku tubig kaya namuti su tiil niya.
eng: The water was so cold and had turned her feet white.

rin: Paglamutaw nira sadto mababow na puro, dinara sira ku maluway na sulog paiyan sadto luyo.
eng: Wading through its shallow end, the soft current carried them to the other side.

rin: Kin sari pigtatago ku mga dakulong bato su duru diretsong bulos galin sadto irarom ku siwang sadto gilid ku bukid.
eng: Where boulders hid a steady stream that ran from under a crevice in the mountain wall.

rin: Pigtangad niya su ringring ku bukid pala narumruman niya su inistorya kanya ku pukuapuon niya.
eng: She looked up the mountain wall and remembered a story that her grandfather told her.

rin: Sabi ku Papa 'Iton niya na san kuno baryo, a bukid a kagnubo ka ngamin na nilalang.
eng: Her Papa 'Iton had said that in that barrio, the mountain was the father of every creature.

rin: Pa'la kuno a tubig ka sapa na an amo a rugo ka bukid.
eng: And that the water from that stream was the blood of the mountain.

rin: Sabi niya a rugo kuno ka bukid amo a nagpapadakulo ka mga bato.
eng: He said that the blood of the mountain made the rocks grow bigger.

rin: Sabi niya pag a rugo mo kuno nakasalak sa rugo ka bukid mabibisto ika ka bukid pa'la reregaluwan ika.
eng: He said that if your blood mixed with the mountain's blood then the mountain would know you and gift you.

rin: Pero mas maray kuno na diri mabisto ag maregaluwan ka bukid.
eng: But it is best not to be known and gifted by the mountain.

rin: Mas maray na pabayaan sana ka usad na biyo nang malakagurang.
eng: Best to be left alone by one so old.

rin: Ta a mga regalo nira bukong angay para kanato.
eng: Because its gifts are not meant for us.

rin: Amo yan sabi ku apuon niyang lalaki.
eng: Her grandfather had said.

rin: Pigsisilngan niya si Nana Kuring na pigbubutang su mga bado sadto dakulong bato na aros lapnad pala pulinas na.
eng: She watched Nana Kuring lay the clothes on a boulder that was almost flat and smooth.

rin: Pausad-usad, piglulubto ku gurang na babayi su mga bado.
eng: One by one, the old woman drenched the clothes in the water.

rin: Pigsusuway-suway niya sadto bato pa'la pigpupukpok niya ku palo-palo.
eng: Bunched them on the boulder and pounded on them with the palo-palo.

rin: Usad na beses, darwang beses, tulong beses.
eng: Once, twice, thrice.

rin: Lubto, pukpok, pukpok, pukpok, lubto.
eng: Drench, pound, pound, pound, drench.

rin: Anggan sa uda matuda ag ngamin nabiribdan nang malinig pa'la pigluru-luknong sadto planggana.
eng: Until nothing remained and everything was wrung clean and stacked in the tin basin.

rin: Punok, itinurol ni Nana Kuring sadto igin su palo-palo.
eng: Silently, Nana Kuring held the palo-palo out to the child.

rin: Pig-uba ku igin su bado niya.
eng: The child took off her clothes.

rin: Nilubto sadto tubig.
eng: Drenched them in the water.

rin: Binutang sadto dakulong bato.
eng: Laid them on the boulder.

rin: Kinuko su palo-palo, pa'la pinukpok, ag pinukpok, ag pinukpok.
eng: Took the palo-palo and then pounded, and pounded, and pounded.

rin: Nakauba, pigparapamarukpukan niya 'ding malakaungot.
eng: Naked, she kept pounding furiously.

rin: Anggan sa nakanin-anan na ku kawoy su kulit ku palad niya.
eng: Until the wood bit into the skin of her palm.

rin: Diri niya narisa na nagdalugdog na sadto dakulong bato su rugo niya pa'la nagturo sadto tubig.
eng: She didn't notice that her blood had trickled on the boulder and fell into the water.

rin: Diri iya pinundo sa pagpukpok anggan nagkukubog-kubog na su abaga niya ag nagkabubura na.
eng: She kept on pounding until her shoulders were shaking and she was almost sobbing.

rin: Biniliwan niya su palo-palo ag pinugong su nganga.
eng: She dropped the palo-palo and covered her mouth.

rin: Papugol na kinagat su silok-sigok niya.
eng: Biting back her sobs.

rin: Pigtatatago su boses niya sa sadiri man sana niya.
eng: Keeping her voice inside her.

rin: Kinaputan ni Nana Kuring su abaga niya ag dinara iya sadto bukal kin sari iya pigrigos.
eng: Nana Kuring took her shoulders and led her into the bukal where she bathed her.

rin: Pa'la pinunasan su luwa ag rugo sadto nganga niya.
eng: And then wiped the tears and blood off her mouth.

rin: Luway-luway na piglubto ni Nana Kuring su payo ku igin sadto tubig.
eng: Nana Kuring gently submerged the child's head underwater.

rin: Sadto irarom ku tubig, kin sari uda ibang tunog ag uda ibang makarurungog kanya, pigbukasan na ku igin su nganga niya 'nganing magrait ag nakatulon adi sa tubig.
eng: Under the water, where there was no other sound and no one could hear her, the child finally opened her mouth to scream and swallowed water.

rin: Pa'la nagbutwa utro su igin ag binnalik iya sa tunog, punok na utro.
eng: Then the child surfaced and returned to sound, silent once more.

rin: Pigtapisan iya ni Nana Kuring.
eng: Nana Kuring draped her tapis around her.

rin: Namati ku igin na nakasulit na iya sa sadiri pero iba na.
eng: The child felt like herself once again but different.

rin: Su tubig na natulon maagnow sa pagmati sadto buros niya.
eng: The water she had swallowed felt cold in her stomach.

rin: Pakatapos, nagbaklay na sira pauli sadto lumang baloy labing su aldow pigmamara su kulit nira.
eng: After, they walked back to the old house with the sun drying their skins.

rin: Ku nag-iiratong na sira sadto trangkahan, bagana su ngamin na natuturog naggigios na.
eng: As they neared the gate, it seemed that everyone asleep was beginning to stir.

rin: Pig-ibanan ni Nana Kuring su igin na babayi paiyan sadto kuru-kusina.
eng: Nana Kuring led the little girl through the dirty-kitchen.

rin: Pa'la pinatindog iya sadto atubangan ku usad na kawoy sadto tarikuran ku lumang baloy.
eng: And then stood her before a tree in the back of the old house.

rin: Arani sadto alad na kawoy ag matarom na alambre na amo solar.
eng: Near the wooden and barbed wire fence that served as the border.

rin: Si Papa Iton niya a nagtanom ku kawoy na adto ku aldow na pinangigin iya.
eng: Her Papa 'Iton had planted that tree on the day that she was born.

rin: Kin diri mo masabi kanako o kiisay man kin uno nangyari, iing-ing mo sana san kawoy.
eng: If you can't tell me or anyone what has happened, then whisper it to the tree.

rin: Ading kawoy na adi amo kaibanan mo sa buway.
eng: This tree is your life companion.

rin: Nagdadakulo adi labing nagdadakulo man ika.
eng: It grows as you grow.

rin: Pirmi ding mig-irungog ag mig-intindi kanimo.
eng: It will always listen and understand you.

rin: Sabi ni Nana Kuring pa'la binayaan niya 'ding solo.
eng: Nana Kuring said and then left her alone.

rin: Pigsulod ku silong ku igin si Nana Kuring pa'la pigsilngan su kawoy.
eng: The child looked after Nana Kuring and then looked at the tree.

rin: Na bagana nag-uulat adi.
eng: It seemed to be waiting.

rin: Narumruman niya su pigsabi kanya ku pukuapuon niyang lalaki manungod sa mga kawoy.
eng: She remembered what her grandfather told her about trees.

rin: Na kin agko iya maraot na pangaturganan, kaipuwan niya 'ding sabiyon sa kawoy tanganing diri adi magkamatuod.
eng: And that when she had a bad dream, she should tell a tree so that it would not come true.

rin: Nagrapo iya pa'la nag-ing-ing.
eng: She leaned closer and whispered.

rin: Pa'la diri na niya narumruman su mga pigngabil niya pakatapos.
eng: And she would no longer remember what she said after.

rin: Minsan gusto kintana ku igin na babayi na iing-ing a mararaot na pangaturganan niya pag nagsisyesta sadto pukuapuon niyang lalaki.
eng: The little girl would sometimes wish that she could whisper her bad dream she would have at siesta to her grandfather.

rin: Pero gurang na 'di ag sige nang kubog-kubog.
eng: But he was old and he shook and shook.

rin: Sasabiyon kanya ku ngamin na gurang na babayi na diri niya adi pagdisturbuwon.
eng: All the old women would tell her not to disturb him.

rin: Minsan ngani magpupundo adi sa bitnga ka istorya niya ta biyong mangungubog-kubog a boses.
eng: Sometimes he would even stop in the middle of his stories because his voice shook too much.

rin: Ag ngamin niyang istorya bagana mga pusang ngangabilon ag tunog na sana.
eng: And all his stories would just be broken words and sounds.

rin: Pa'la migrapo si Nana Kuring tanganing kabiton su igin parayo sadto gilid ku batangan ku pukuapuon niya.
eng: Then Nana Kuring would come and lead the child away from her grandfather's bedside.

rin: Minsan pag san kanda si Tata Ulyan pagsulnop ka aldow, miggulom adi kanya pa'la amo na 'di migtapos ka istorya para ki Papa 'Iton niya.
eng: Sometimes when Tata Ulyan was there after dusk with them, he would smile at her and complete the stories for her Papa 'Iton.

rin: Minsan pag gab-i, pigkakaputan niya su batalon na kamot ka pukuapuon niyang lalaki labing a mga gurang na babayi nakatiklod.
eng: Sometimes at night, she held her grandfather's callused hands while the old women knelt.

rin: Ag nangangadyi ka rosaryo sadto itom na estatwa ni Inang Maria.
eng: And prayed the rosary to a black statue of Mama Mary.

rin: Magpupundo adi sa kubog-kubog.
eng: He would stop shaking.

rin: Pa'la minsan pag uda ibang tawo, iya na a mag-iistorya ka mga istorya ka apuon niyang lalaki kanya ag sa sadiri niya.
eng: And sometimes when no one else was around, she would be the one telling her grandfather's stories to him and to herself.

rin: Kaya man, kada apon pag tag-init, mag-iing-ing iya sadto kawoy pa'la malilingawan niya.
eng: So on and on, every summer afternoon, she had whispered to the tree and she had forgotten.

rin: Kada apon, magpaparaulat su kawoy pa'la palilingawon iya na pirmi man sanang pariyong maraot na pangaturganan.
eng: Every afternoon, the tree waited and made her forget that it was always the same bad dream.

rin: Manungod sadto alimaw na iniiyan kanya na pigbabag-ot a kamot saka parong maanggo pag natuturog iya.
eng: About the same monster that would come for her with sweating hands and reeking of musk while she was asleep.

rin: Kada tag-init, itatagak iya ni mama niya sadto lumang baloy 'nganing sadto mag-istar kaiba si Papa 'Iton niya.
eng: Every summer, her mother would leave her in that old house to live with her Papa 'Iton.

rin: Payaba ku igin na babayi su pukuapuon niyang lalaki pati su mga istorya na ipagpaparaistorya kanya.
eng: The little girl loved her grandfather and the stories he would tell her.

rin: Pero bago iya magluog sadto pulang pigtataklang trangkahan, mikimairak iya ki mama niya na diri iya ipagtagak.
eng: But just before she would enter the red rusting gate, she would beg her mother not to leave her.

rin: Biyo iyang makakatakot na maglabos sadto trangkahan ag magluluog sadto lumang baloy na adto na diri niya isi kin ngata.
eng: She would dread walking through the gate and entering that old house without knowing why.

rin: Diri ika pakaigin-iginon pa'la dungas.
eng: Do not be so childish and silly.

rin: Sasaritaan iya ni mama niya.
eng: Her mother would chide her.

rin: Payaba ika saka diri ika sadi mauuno ta babalikan ko man ika tulos.
eng: You are loved and safe here and I will come back for you soon.

rin: Ag kada pagtapos ka tag-init, susungkaton na iya ni mama niya pa'la migbalik na sira sadto syudad.
eng: And at the end of each summer, her mother would come for her and they would return to the city.

rin: Uda basang nakamangno na 'lakapunok na ku igin na babayi.
eng: No one had noticed that the girl had become so quiet.

rin: Na nagin iba na iya, kada paglabos ka tag-init sadto lumang baloy na adto.
eng: Had become something else, as each summer passed in that old house.

rin: Sa pagtapos ku usad na tag-init paglabos sa unom na taon, pinundo nang magparakubog-kubog si Papa 'Iton niya.
eng: At the end of one summer six years later, her Papa 'Iton had finally stopped shaking.

rin: Pigdara iya ni Nana Kuring sadto gilid ku batangan kadi.
eng: Nana Kuring took her to his bedside.

rin: Pigsilngan niya su di na nag-iiwag kading awak, pa'la nag-ukrong parani sadto talinga kadi.
eng: She looked at his still body, then crouched towards his ear.

rin: Ag pig-ing-ing su maraot niyang pangaturganan.
eng: And whispered her bad dream.

rin: liba mo na sana po ako kanimo.
eng: Please take me with you.

rin: Naglaom iya na narungog iya kadi ag migsimbag kanya.
eng: She had hoped that he had heard and would answer her.

rin: Pero su mga mata kadi nakabuklat sana, nakatiurong sadto kisame, bago 'di tawban kana kamot ni Nana Kuring ku puting isapoy.
eng: But his eyes remained blank, staring at the ceiling, just before Nana Kuring's hands covered them with the white blanket.

rin: Pa'la nagluwas iya, nagtindog sadto atubangan ku kawoy ag pig-ing-ing su pagraan ku pukuapuon niyang lalaki.
eng: Then she went outside, stood before the tree and whispered to it her grandfather's death.

rin: Nag-ing-ing iya pero diri nalingaw ku apon na adto kin ngata ta agko mga luwa na nanananggilid sadto pisngi niya.
eng: She whispered but did not forget that afternoon why there were tears sliding down her cheek.

rin: Ku miggagab-i na, nag-abot si Tata Ulyan 'nganing magtaong onra sadto apuon niya.
eng: At dusk, Tata Ulyan came to pay his last respects to her grandfather.

rin: Paiyan sadto kuru-kusina, nabayad kadi su tisong na awak ku igin na babayi na nakatindog arani sadto alad.
eng: As he came to the dirty-kitchen, he saw the girl's still figure standing near the fence.

rin: Nagrapo adi sadto tisong na pigura niya 'nganing iiba iya pabalik sadto luog ku baloy.
eng: He walked towards her to take her back into the house.

rin: Ag sabiyan na mig-abot na si mama niya kinaugmaan.
eng: And to tell her that her mother would be arriving the next day.

rin: Naisipan kadi na mag-istorya kanya manungod ku lugar na iiyanan ku apuon niya.
eng: He thought of telling her a story about the place where her grandfather was going.

rin: Pero agko iba sadto pakatindog niya.
eng: But there was something about the way she stood.

rin: Ag su anino na nabibilog kadtong nag-iingagdan na liwanag na nagpapaspas ku pag-agi kadi paiyan kanya.
eng: And the shadows that were cast in the dying light that made him walk faster towards her.

rin: Ku arani na 'di, narungog kading nag-iing-ing iya.
eng: As he came nearer, he heard her whispering.

rin: Tabi kuonon mo na 'di kanako.
eng: Please take it away from me.

rin: Ngata ta abo mong magrungog kanako?
eng: Why won't you listen to me?

rin: Pa'la nabayad kadi su kawoy na pig-iing-ingan niya.
eng: Then he saw the tree she was whispering to.

rin: Dinalagan na 'di kanya, pig-uulbot sadto saru-ngan na nakasukbit su minasbad niya, pigwasiwas sadto kawoy.
eng: He ran towards her, unsheathing the minasbad from his hip, swung it towards the tree.

rin: Agko rait.
eng: There was a scream.

rin: Namati ku igin su butong sadto puso niya ku unang tigbas ku minasbad.
eng: The child felt a wrench in her heart at the minasbad's first bite.

rin: Gusto man niyang magrait, pero napasilong sana iya labing su mga siyak ni Tata Ulyan.
eng: She wanted to scream, too, but she could only watch while Tata Ulyan's shouts.

rin: Ag wasiwas ku minasbad nagraranog sadto kangitngitan.
eng: And the minasbad's swings resounded in the dark.

rin: Nakarungog iya sa mas dakol pang tiil na nagdadalagan paiyan kanda.
eng: She heard more feet running towards them.

rin: Nagrurugo su kawoy.
eng: The tree was bleeding.

rin: Buko ining pulot.
eng: It was not sap.

rin: Nagsilong sana 'ya.
eng: She only watched.

rin: Among tuod iyang munyika sa Intsik na nakaasag sadto salog ku sala.
eng: She almost looked like a China doll sprawled on the sala floor.

rin: A bulaw na kurong niyang bok.
eng: With her curly brown hair.

rin: Namula nang ngabil.
eng: Full red lips.

rin: Losang kutis na nakuko niya sadto kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: Porcelain complexion that she got from her mother.

rin: Ag su pangas na angog.
eng: And the high forehead.

rin: Pangong urong.
eng: Button nose.

rin: Saka singkit na bulaw na mata na nakuko niya sadto kag-igin niyang lalaki.
eng: And the slanting brown eyes that she got from her father.

rin: Solo sana iya.
eng: She was alone.

rin: Nag-aagung-ong sa uda man malmag na tono.
eng: Humming a senseless tune under her breath.

rin: Labing nakaukrong sadto darwang libro manungod sa mga engkanto saka su nagrunggal nang mga ngayamnan.
eng: As she bent over two fairy tale books and her scattered toys.

rin: Nagdodrowing sadto kopon ban gamit su itom na krayola.
eng: Drawing on a coupon bond with a black crayon.

rin: Pinnundo su kamot niya ku nakarungog iya sa silok-sigok sadto kusina pa'la pinnundo man iyang mag-agung-ong.
eng: Her hand paused as she heard a sob from the kitchen, and she stopped humming.

rin: Bagana amo sana adto su tunog na narungog niya sadto baloy nira na nangungumon-ngumon na.
eng: It seemed to be the only sound she had heard in their house for a while now.

rin: Uda na mga 'lang ranog na mga boses o namumuyang urok-utok.
eng: There were no more raised voices or happy squeals of laughter.

rin: Amo sana adto tunog na marurungog sadto baloy nira nguwan na aldow.
eng: It was the only sound that could be heard in their house this day.

rin: Pagkatapos sa pirang oras na iring-ingan na agko pa pagtapi-tapi sadto payo niya.
eng: After hours of hushed voices and murmurs that came with pats on her head.

rin: Nakarungog utro iya sa pugol na silok-sigok ag inigot su kapot niya sadto krayola.
eng: She heard another muffled sob and her hand held the crayon tighter.

rin: Pagkatapos sa kwarenta diyas sadto na niya namating uda na si papa niya.
eng: After forty days she finally felt her daddy's absence.

rin: Kadtong momentong adto, intero na niyang naintindiyan kin uno nangyari.
eng: At that moment, she completely understood what had happened.

rin: Por medyo ta pinnundo na su puso ni papa niya sa kuradkutad diri na 'di mig-balik.
eng: That because her daddy's heart had stopped beating he would never come back.

rin: Nagngayo-ngayo iya.
eng: She wished.

rin: Nagngayo-ngayo iya na a mga bagay-bagay magin pariyo sana ku dati.
eng: She wished that things would be the same way they were before.

rin: Na a mga bagay-bagay magin iba man kin uno na sira nguwan.
eng: That things would be different from the way they were now.

rin: Nagngayo-ngayo iyang si papa niya isadi pa.
eng: She wished that her daddy was still here.

rin: Nakamati iya sa inda mang malain.
eng: She felt strangely ill.

rin: Pigkukurukalintura saka nakatatakot.
eng: Feverish and afraid.

rin: Gusto niyang magbura saka makaibanan si papa niya.
eng: She wanted to cry and to have her daddy.

rin: Magkaagko kaibanan.
eng: To have someone.

rin: Gakuson iya.
eng: Hug her.

rin: Binuksan niya su wala niyang kamot, pinabayaan maulog su krayola sadto namiminlod niyang palad.
eng: She opened her left hand, letting the black crayon slip from her tingling palm.

rin: Diri niya nabayad kin pauno su kurit sa buway sadto palad niya biglang naputol.
eng: She did not see how the life line in her palm had suddenly broken.

rin: Pa'la pinuon naman utro sa malakasadit na linya.
eng: And began once more on a faint line.

rin: Tinnindog iya, pinalpag su kulor rosas niyang bado, pa'la nag-agi iya paiyan sadto pasilyo.
eng: She stood up, brushed her pink dress into place, and walked towards the hallway.

rin: Linnakang ako paluwas sadto anino niya tapos innukrong 'nganing baydon kin uno su drinowing niya sadto kopon ban.
eng: I stepped out of her shadow and bent to look at what she drew on the coupon bond.

rin: Sinnirang su kag-igin niyang babayi sadto pirtan ku kusina pa'la nabayad niya ako.
eng: Her mother peered through the kitchen door and saw me.

rin: Nag-agi iya paiyan kanako pa'la pinirang sadto abaga ko 'nganing mabayad su drowing.
eng: She walked towards me and looked over my shoulder to look at the drawing.

rin: Nagsingot iya pa'la pigtapi-tapi su payo ko.
eng: She sniffled and patted my head.

rin: Linili ko su payo ko 'nganing babaydon ko iya saka ginnulum.
eng: I turned my head to look at her and smiled.

rin: Su kag-igin niyang babayi naggulom sa primerong beses, pero 'da buway, pa'la nag-agi man nanggad paiyan sadto pasilyo.
eng: Her mother smiled for the first time, but wanly, and then walked towards the hallway, too.

rin: Bukong sadto pa sana ika sala?
eng: Weren't you just in the sala?

rin: su kag-igin niyang babayi nag-unga ku nabayad niya su igin niyang babayi sadto pasilyo na nag-aagi paiyan sadto kwarto nira ni ermana niyang mas gurang kanya, si Ate Lynn.
eng: Her mother asked as she saw her daughter in the hallway walking towards the bedroom she shared with her older sister, her Ate Lynn.

rin: Napaaplos su kamot sadto angog ku kag-igin niyang babayi sa kalibungan ag kapagalan labing nagsingot iya utro.
eng: Her mother placed a hand on her forehead in confusion and exhaustion as she sniffled once more.

rin: Nabayad ko ika sadto, nagdodrowing.
eng: I saw you there, drawing.

rin: Naglilili iya 'nganing silngan si mama niya.
eng: She turned around to look at her mother.

rin: Diri, Mommy, sadi ako.
eng: No, Mommy, I'm here.

rin: Ngurob-ngurob niya, pa'la su sadit, mamundo niyang awak tinalikod 'nganing mag-agi parayo.
eng: She mumbled, and her small, sad figure turned around to walk away.

rin: Amo, doble ko, sadi ako.
eng: Yes, I echoed, I'm here.

rin: Sinilngan ko su drowing niyang nabayaan na buko pang tapos.
eng: I looked at the drawing that she had left unfinished.

rin: Drowing adto ku pamilya nira saka baloy nira.
eng: It was a drawing of their family and their house.

rin: Su usad sa mga lalawgon na agko putol-kalalawgon niya.
eng: One of the faces with broken lines almost looked like her.

rin: Pero ako adto su putol na linya aros pigkukurit niya.
eng: But she was drawing me.

rin: Su buway nira diri man nagin maray pagkagraan ku papa niya.
eng: Their lives had not gotten better after her daddy died.

rin: Su kag-igin niyang babayi pirming mamundo saka nadipisilan bayaran su mga kautangan galin sadto negosyong nabayaan ku papa niya.
eng: Her mother was always sad and struggled to pay off the debts from the business her daddy left.

rin: Tanganing mabuway pa nanggad su pamilya, 'nganing matipon sana sira pirmi.
eng: To keep their family surviving, to keep them all together.

rin: Su Ate Lynn niya pirming nakaalalay sadto kag-igin nira.
eng: Her Ate Lynn was always there for their mother.

rin: Alagad bagana mas gurang ag mas pagal silngan kisa edadon niya labing pigtatabangan kadi su kag-igin nirang atamanon su pamilya nira.
eng: And had grown old and tired beyond her years as she helped their mother take care of their family.

rin: Mantang su ngod nirang gurang na lalaki linuwas sadto bukid anggan sa magin estranghero sa buway nira.
eng: While her older brother had gone off to the mountains and became a guest in their lives.

rin: Kin minsan makakaresibi sira sa surat galin sadi.
eng: Sometimes they would receive letters from him.

rin: Agko usad na a sabi nangagom na iya sadto bukid.
eng: One saying that he had married a girl in the mountain.

rin: Pa'la agko man usad na nangumon-ngumon na a sabi kanda su agom ag igin niya mga nagraan.
eng: And another much later telling them that his wife and child had died

rin: Ag sa paglipas ku mga taon, iya nagin marawraw, susupgon, saka abungera.
eng: And through the years, she grew up restless, withdrawn, and quarrelsome.

rin: Pirmi iyang mag-uuno-uno, pa'la magpaparakagrat anggan sa mapaas kin a mga bagay-bagay bukong pabor kanya.
eng: She would often throw tantrums, and scream until she was hoarse when things would not go her way.

rin: Kin minsan ako maggugulom para kanya.
eng: Sometimes I would smile on behalf of her.

rin: Tanganing mamuya su kag-igin niyang babayi ag su Ate Lynn niya kawasang diri basang iya maggulom.
eng: To make her mother and her Ate Lynn happy because she never did.

rin: Ku marisa man nanggad niyang kapambihira nirang maggulom kanya, nagpuon iyang mag-isip kin uno na nangyari kanya labing naggugurang iya.
eng: When she finally noticed that they rarely smiled at her, she began thinking of what she had become as she got older.

rin: Bagana uda nabubuot kanya.
eng: It seemed that no one liked her.

rin: Nginayo-ngayo iyang kintana iba man iya.
eng: She wished she were different.

rin: Nagpuon iyang magsilong sa luog ka sadiri niya pala sa luwas ku sadiri niya, sa luwas, sa ibang tawo.
eng: She began looking inside herself and then outside herself, outside, at other people.

rin: Tapos usad na aldow nagdara iya sa kagrado niya pauli kanda.
eng: Then one day she took a classmate home with her.

rin: Sabi niya su kag-igin na lalaki ku kagrado niya paglalamasahon adi.
eng: She said that her classmate's father was beating her.

rin: Gusto niyang su mama niya ibanan iya sadto Barangay Hall tanganing isumbong adto.
eng: She wanted her mother to come with her to the Barangay Hall to report it.

rin: Sabi niya sala adto kaya agko dapat gibuwon.
eng: She said that it was wrong and that something should be done.

rin: Dakol iyang nabayad ag naturakan na salang mga bagay-bagay sa luwas.
eng: She saw and found more and more wrong things outside.

rin: Nag-iba iya sa mga rally.
eng: She joined rallies.

rin: Isisilyak a makauungot ag kaapiyan.
eng: Screaming outrage and injustice.

rin: Nagkakagrat 'nganing ma-rungog iya ka mga tawo.
eng: Screaming so people would hear.

rin: Pero bagana uda gustong mag-irungog.
eng: But it seemed no one wanted to listen.

rin: Ngayo-ngayo niyang agko iya maginibo.
eng: She wished she could do something.

rin: Usad na bagay na agko saysay, bagay na mapapamaray su mga salang nabayad niya.
eng: Something more, something to make the wrongs that she saw better.

rin: Usad na aldow nag-imo na sana 'ya ku mga gamit niya pala sinabiyan si mama niyang paiyan iya sa darwang semanang immersion.
eng: One day she simply packed her bags and told her mother that she was going on a two-week immersion.

rin: Tanganing lalong makatuod sa pagbago ka banwa ag ka buway.
eng: To learn more about changing how the country and life was.

rin: Tanganing umiyan kin sari iya mas makakatabang, saka makabayad sa pagbabago.
eng: To go where she could really help, and to see change.

rin: Pinugulan iya ni mama niya.
eng: Her mother tried to stop her.

rin: Pero diri iya kaya pariyong binsiron na diri maggalin o igapos tanganing di' makagalin.
eng: But could neither convince her not to go nor tie her down.

rin: Sa uri, su mama niya migsabing uda man basang kuno patara-tara na su igin niyang ba-bayi arog kadto namamati, na arog kadto kakusog.
eng: Later, her mother would say that there had been no warning that her daughter had felt like that, or that strongly.

rin: Uda risang senyales arog ka mga pulang librong binasa man ngaya.
eng: No telltale signs of red books being read.

rin: Uda mga sikretong tagbuan pagkatapos ka klase.
eng: No secret after-school meetings.

rin: Uda mga ibinoses na kaisipan manungod sa pulitika.
eng: No voiced thoughts on politics.

rin: Su igin niyang babayi pirming mag-uuli sa tamang oras.
eng: Her daughter would always come home on time.

rin: Miggibo sa mga gibo sa baloy ag pang-iskwela.
eng: Do her chores and assignments.

rin: Mikistorya sa pamilya, saka makitawanan kanda.
eng: Talk to her family, and laugh with them.

rin: Amo man nanggad su buot sa maray na kauryan na igin na babayi ag ubin na ngod na babayi.
eng: Very much the desired youngest daughter and younger sister.

rin: Uda basang patara-tara na su igin niya nagigin igin sa kawsa.
eng: There was no warning that her child was becoming the child of a cause.

rin: Si Ate Lynn niya pinirit iyang suludon ku ramrag na naggalin iya, pigbabaoy su ngaran niya duru-doble.
eng: Her Ate Lynn tried to go after her on the morning she left, calling her name over and over.

rin: Pero nagngisi sana iya saka nagkaway anggan sa mauda na sa panilag su jeep na linulunadan niya.
eng: But she just smiled and waved until the jeepney she was riding disappeared from view.

rin: Nauda iya sa buway nira, nag-iyan man sa bukid, arog ni Kuya niya.
eng: She disappeared from their lives, going off into the mountains, too, like her Kuya.

rin: Su una niyang bukid a baoy Sagrada.
eng: Her first mountain was called Sagrada.

rin: Su barangay na tanuman sa mais sa Iriga.
eng: This barangay of cornfields in Iriga.

rin: Tadi na naman su mga malang puputi.
eng: The fair ones have come again.

rin: Amo masasabi manungod kanya saka ku mga arog niya ku mga tawo na arog kabulaw ku mga magugurang nang mga sanga sa kawoy labing nagsisilong kandang nag-aaging nakalinya.
eng: As she and others like her would be said of among themselves by the people who were as brown as old tree branches watching them trooping in lines.

rin: Su mga beses na su kag-igin niyang babayi nagmurong kin nabayad iya sadto tindahan.
eng: The times that her mother thought that she saw her in the grocery store.

rin: O nag-uulat sadto luwas ku baloy nira kanya.
eng: Or waiting outside their house for her.

rin: O su mga beses na si Ate Lynn niya naisip kin nabayad man nanggad niya iya sadto iskwelan niya o sadto kwarto nira.
eng: Or the times her Ate Lynn thought that she saw her in her school or in their room.

rin: O su ngamin na beses na naisip nirang kaiba nira iya.
eng: Or all those times that they thought she was with them.

rin: Ako talaga su nababayad nira.
eng: They were really seeing me.

rin: Pala nag-arabutan na su mga surat, sinurat sa amarilyong papel na pinadara sa puting sobre na a selyo galin sa iba-ibang banwaan.
eng: Then the letters came, written in yellow paper and sent in plain white envelopes stamped from different towns.

rin: Su mga surat pirming a sabi maray man iya.
eng: The letters would always say that she was all right.

rin: Na mamuya iya kin sari man iya, ginigibo kin uno man gibo niya.
eng: That she was happy wherever she was, doing what she did.

rin: Pirmi niyang sasabiyan si mama ag Ate Lynn niya na diri magparaadit.
eng: She would always tell her mother and Ate Lynn not to worry.

rin: Diri niya sinabing usad na beses nagngayo-ngayo iyang kintana diri na sana niya pinutol su maaba niyang bulaw na bok.
eng: She didn't say that once she wished that she didn't have to shear off all her long brown hair.

rin: Ta kawasang mala kadi kapilpilsa kuto.
eng: Because it was infested with lice.

rin: Diri niya sinabing minsan magngangayo-ngayo iyang nagkakaon iya sa masiram na pagkaon, o natuturog sa kumportableng lugar.
eng: She didn't say that sometimes she wished she were eating better food or sleeping in better places.

rin: Diri niya sinabing nagngayo-ngayo iyang iya ag su mga kaibanan niyang ibang tawo diri na kaipuwan magdulag sadto mga suldados na nagsusulod kanda.
eng: She didn't say that she wished she and the people with her didn't have to flee from the soldiers pursuing them.

rin: Diri nira kaipuwan magparadudulag.
eng: Didn't have to run for their lives.

rin: Kin uugkuron uda man sira ginigibong maraot.
eng: After all they were not doing anything wrong.

rin: Tinnatabang man sana sira.
eng: They were only helping.

rin: Saka kin minsan magngangayo-ngayo iyang diri na sana niya ginibo su mga bagay na ginibo na niya.
eng: And that sometimes she wished that she didn't have to do some of the things that she had done.

rin: Puru-pirmi nagngayo-ngayo iyang dawa sari iya, nagbabago a buway saka mas nagigin tultol na.
eng: Most of the time she wished that wherever she was, life was really changing and it was getting better.

rin: Diri niya sinabing nagngayo-ngayo iyang mag-pundo sa pag-isip na bagana agko tawo o bagay na nagsusulod kanya.
eng: She didn't say that she wished that she would stop feeling as if someone or something was running after her.

rin: Na gustong abuton iya.
eng: Trying to catch up on her.

rin: Nagbabaoy kanya.
eng: Calling her.

rin: Su mga surat niya uda sabing pag nalilipungow talaga iya ku kag-igin niyang babayi saka ki Ate Lynn niya nagngayo-ngayo iyang pumauli na sana iya.
eng: Her letters didn't say that when she really missed her mother and her Ate Lynn she wished that she could just go home.

rin: Nagngayo-ngayo iya, pero tinnuyo iya saka diri nag-agrangay.
eng: She wished, but she stayed and she never complained.

rin: Ku mas lalo iyang nagparangayo-ngayo, mas lalo man lugod na su mga tawong nakakabisto kanya.
eng: And the more that she wished, the more that people who knew her.

rin: Su mga natagak niya.
eng: Those she had left behind.

rin: Ba'na mababayad iya kin sari alagad mas gurang na iya, na agko ginigibong ibang bagay, kin minsan.
eng: Would catch a glimpse of an older her somewhere else, doing something else, sometimes.

rin: Pag nababayad nira ako, su kag-igin niyang babayi saka ngod na babayi mapapaangos sa ginnawa.
eng: When they would see me, her mother and sister would sigh in relief.

rin: Pupuon na magngisi.
eng: Begin to smile.

rin: Magkimat.
eng: Blink.

rin: Ag pag sinnilong utro, uda na ako.
eng: And the next time they looked, I would be gone, too.

rin: Pag-agi sa pirang taon, su tiil niya biyong nasurip labing pigtatabangan niya su mga parakaingin.
eng: Years later, her feet got badly infected while she was helping the kaingin farmers.

rin: Ag pina-uli iya 'nganing magpabulong saka magparay.
eng: And she was sent home to get the proper medical treatments and to heal.

rin: Innabot iya sadto baloy nira usad na ramrag.
eng: She arrived at their house one morning.

rin: Bago magliwanag.
eng: Just before dawn.

rin: Kiay-kiay na.
eng: Limping.

rin: Su kag-igin niyang babayi ag su Ate Lynn niya napabura sa kasindakan.
eng: Her mother and her Ate Lynn had cried in shock.

rin: Diri makatubod na sadto man nangga'd iya.
eng: Unbelieving that she was really there.

rin: Tapos sa andal pagkabayad ku tiil niya.
eng: And then in worry upon seeing her feet.

rin: Pero muya sira, muya na napauli iya.
eng: But they were happy, happy that she was home.

rin: Namuya iyang nakauli ag ako man mamuyang binalik sadto anino niya.
eng: She was happy to be home and I was happy to return to her shadow.

rin: Maugma iyang nakauli.
eng: She was happy to stay at home.

rin: Tuni-nong na makakaon saka maturog.
eng: To eat and sleep in peace.

rin: Lutuan sira.
eng: To cook for them.

rin: Makausip sira manungod ka buway-buway nira pero nungka ku buway niya.
eng: To talk to them about their lives but never about her life.

rin: Saka gumibo sa mga bagay na gibo-gibo ka mga igin na babaying arog niya.
eng: And to do some of the things that girls her age would do.

rin: Arog baga ngaya ka magkape sa Starbucks o paiyan sa mall.
eng: Like having coffee at Starbucks or going to the mall.

rin: Paglipas sa pirang bulan, sinelebrar nira su pandisiotsong kumpleanyo niya kaya su kag-igin niyang babayi nagpuon nang maglaom na pumpirmi na iya.
eng: After several months, they celebrated her 18th birthday and her mother began to hope that she would stay.

rin: Usad na gabi na pariyo sirang nagbabatang sadto katre ku mga kag-igin niya amo man nanggad na sinabi ku kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: One night they were both lying down on her parents' bed and her mother said as much.

rin: Tibaad pwede ikang bumalik sa hayskul 'nganing makagradwar.
eng: Maybe you can go back to high school and graduate.

rin: O kin diri, magluog ika sa culinary school ta kagusto mo man sa maray na magpaparaluto.
eng: Or if not, enroll in a culinary school since you love cooking so much.

rin: Ugday kanya ku kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: Her mother suggested to her.

rin: Tuninong sana iyang nagtindog pa'la naggalin sadto kwarto.
eng: She quietly stood up and left the room.

rin: Binalik ako, ginakos ko su kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: I returned, hugging her mother.

rin: Kin pwede sanang magngayo-ngayo, migngayo-ngayo kintana akong mag-istar na sana sadto kanamo, uli, sabi ko.
eng: If only I could wish, I would have wished that I could stay home, too, I said.

rin: Pero nagtutubod ako sa kin uno mga ginigibo ko saka isi ko kin uno kaabutan.
eng: But I believe in what I'm doing and I know the consequences.

rin: Su kag-igin niyang babayi inangos sana saka tinnango.
eng: Her mother had only sighed and nodded.

rin: Pagmata nira kinaramragan, uda na iya.
eng: When they woke up the next day, she was gone.

rin: Sa paglipas ku panawon, pauuli iya saka mag-gagalin na bagana kitkilat, migsabi sanang diri iya pwedeng mag-uban.
eng: As time passed, she would come and leave like lightning, saying that she couldn't stay.

rin: Migsabi sanang bukong areglado.
eng: Saying that it wasn't safe.

rin: Migsabi sanang gusto sana niya sirang mabayad.
eng: Saying that she just wanted to see them.

rin: Sa paglipas ku mga panawon, su kag-igin niyang babayi ag Ate Lynn niya natuod na sana ka mauban niyang kaudaan, saka madalian na presensya.
eng: As time passed, her mother and Ate Lynn had learned to get used to her long absences, and fleeting presence.

rin: Tapos usad na aldow kin uno man su nginangayo-ngayo nirang diri magkamatuod nagkamatuod.
eng: Then one day what they wished would not come true did.

rin: Kaya nag-iyan ako kanda sa oras kin kuno iya mag-aabot pag nag-uuli.
eng: And I came to them at the hour that she would usually come home.

rin: Pag-una ku kag-igin niyang babayi ako iya, maugma ku una.
eng: Her mother thought I was she, happy at first.

rin: Tapos nakatakot ku mabayad man nanggad niyang buko ako su igin niyang babayi.
eng: Then afraid when she finally saw that I wasn't her daughter.

rin: Diri iya nag-unga kin isay ako, kin uno ako.
eng: She did not ask who I was, what I was.

rin: Sabiya raw kanako.
eng: Tell me.

rin: Pakiusip ku kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: Her mother asked.

rin: Sabiyon mo kanakong buway pa iya.
eng: Tell me she's alive.

rin: Diri ko magibo, kaya kinnuyong sana su payo ko.
eng: I could not, so I shook my head.

rin: Su lalawgon ku kag-igin niyang babayi nagpabayad sa sindak pa'la biglang napasibog ta agko tinningab kanyang malang rarom.
eng: Her mother's face showed shock and then she flinched as something deeper gouged her.

rin: Diri ko mapunan maisip kin uno man namati ku kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: I could not even begin to imagine how her mother felt.

rin: Pig-iisip ko na kin uno man su sinnabrit kanya kadto magigin pag-ako na sana sa kaubanan.
eng: Wondering if what had raked her raw would someday give way to acceptance.

rin: Tuninong niyang pig-uunga kin pauno nagraan su igin niyang babayi.
eng: She was silently asking how her daughter died.

rin: Gusto ko iyang sabiyan na su igin niya diri nagraan na solo.
eng: I wanted to tell her that her daughter did not die alone.

rin: Na kaibanan niya ako.
eng: That I was with her.

rin: Pero diri ko masabi kanya.
eng: But I could not tell her.

rin: Diri ko sinabi kanyang nag-aagi sana iya, na bagana naglalamyerda sadto mga uma.
eng: I did not tell her that she was just walking, as if taking a stroll in the fields.

rin: Tinangad su payo niya sadto aldow tapos pinirong su mata sadto init.
eng: Turning her head up to the sun and closing her eyes against its warmth.

rin: Na nakangisi iya.
eng: That she was smiling.

rin: Tapos biglang binnuklat su mata.
eng: Then her eyes had snapped open.

rin: Pa'la nauda na su ngisi sadto lalawgon niya ta su mga kaibanan niya sinilyakan na iyang dumalagan.
eng: And the smile was wiped off her face when her companions screamed at her to run.

rin: Kasyan su dalagan niya, nagngangayo-ngayo na agko mataguan sadto mga uma sa irarom ku aldow.
eng: How she ran, wishing for cover in the fields under the sun.

rin: A narurungog sana su ininga niya, bungog sadto mga silyak saka tunog ku mga putok sa badil.
eng: Hearing only her breath, deaf to the shouts and sounds of gunfire.

rin: Diri ko iya sinabiyan kin paunong su parong ku putok sa badil nag-alingasngas na.
eng: I did not tell her how the smell of gunfire became a stench.

rin: Kin unong kulog namati niya ku su mga balang tinnama ag linnagbas kanya.
eng: What pain she felt when the bullets went into and through her.

rin: Na a pagmati niya bagana iya nasusulo, saka diri makainga.
eng: That she felt as if she were burning, and that she couldn't breathe.

rin: Diri ngani niya namatian su kulog sadto payo o tod niya pagtumba niya.
eng: She did not even feel the pain on her head or knees when she fell.

rin: Su kamot niya luway-luway na inniyan sadto rurug'gan niya labing binabayad kin sari iya nagrurugo.
eng: Her hands weakly flew to her chest as she looked at where she was bleeding.

rin: Sige su ingab-ingab niya labing nagtutuprik su rugo sadto nganga niya, nagbubura.
eng: She kept on gasping for breath as blood spurted out of her mouth, crying.

rin: Nag-uuro-uro sa kulog.
eng: Moaning a tune of pain.

rin: Ngana su katakutan niya.
eng: How afraid she was.

rin: Diri ko iya sinabiyan na nagngayo-ngayo iyang kintana su mga bagay-bagay diri nagin arog kadto.
eng: I did not tell her that she wished that things did not turn out that way.

rin: Na nagngayo-ngayo iyang su kag-igin niyang babayi ag si Ate Lynn niya diri iya mabayad na arog kadi.
eng: That she wished that her mother and her Ate Lynn would not see her like that.

rin: Na nagngayo-ngayo iyang kintana agko iya kaibanan.
eng: That she wished someone was with her.

rin: Diri ko sinabi sadto kag-igin niyang babayi na nabayad ko iyang arog kadto.
eng: I did not tell her mother that I saw her like that.

rin: Diri ko iya sinabiyan na kaibanan ko su igin niyang babayi, pero uda ako maginibo para kanya.
eng: I did not tell her that I was with her daughter, but I could not do anything for her.

rin: Diri ko iya sinabiyan na nagraan adto na nagngangayo-ngayo na su labi-labing kasakitan mauda, pero diri man nangga'd nauda.
eng: I did not tell her that she died wishing that the tearing agony would go away, but it never did.

rin: Iya, pariyo ka ngamin na tawo, tinawan sana sa baynte-unong ngayo-ngayo.
eng: She, like everyone else, was only granted 21 wishes.

rin: Su ngayo-ngayo niya ku nag-iingagdan sinobra na sa usad sadto kin pira sana a itinao ka mga linya sadto palad niya.
eng: Her dying wish was one more than what the lines of the palms would allow.

rin: Kin makakapagngayo-ngayo sana 'ko, migngayo-ngayo akong sa ngamin niyang pinagngayo-ngayo, su pinakauri niya nagin matuod.
eng: If only I could wish, I would have wished that among all her wishes, that last come true.

rin: Su kag-igin niyang babayi nagparaisip kin pa-uno iyang nagraan pero diri ako namasol na diri ko kanya sinabi.
eng: Her mother was wondering how she died but I would not regret not telling her.

rin: Ku apon na, agko mga tawong nag-iyan sadto baloy nira sa Quezon City pa'la sinabiyan iya na su igin niyang babayi naguraan kaibanan su ibang pag iriba ku sinakyada ku mga suldados sa gubyerno su pigsususpetsaran na kampo sa New Peoples Army.
eng: Later that day, people came to their house in Quezon City and told her that her daughter was killed along with others when government troops overran a suspected New People's Army camp.

rin: Su kag-igin niyang babayi nag-iyan sadto banwaan na arani sa dagat sadto Bicol kinaramragan, naglunad sa bus, 'nganing kuon su bangkay ku igin niyang babayi.
eng: Her mother went to that coastal town in Bicol the next day, taking the bus, to claim her daughter's body.

rin: Naturakan niya adto na nababangkay sa kawoy na kaban sadto munisipyo kadtong banwaan.
eng: She found her lying in a wooden coffin in the municipal hall of that town.

rin: Nakabado sa kulor-rosang bestida.
eng: Dressed in someone else's pink dress.

rin: Bagana man sana utro natuturog na munyika sa Intsik.
eng: Looking once more like a sleeping China doll.

rin: Su mga estranghero magpupundo 'nganing sumilong pa'la pisadto man sana.
eng: Strangers stopped to look in and then moved on.

rin: Agko nagkapipirang mga tawo na nagsabi kanyang bistado nira su igin niyang babayi ta tinabangan sira kadto.
eng: Some of the villagers told her that they knew her daughter and that she helped them.

rin: Tinutturuan kuno sira kadto manungod sa mga bulong na galin sa masitas, na naturan kadto sadto kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: She had taught them about herbal medicine, something she had learned from her mother.

rin: Mala pa niya kaubin.
eng: She was just so young.

rin: Rawitdawit ku kag-igin niyang babayi.
eng: Her mother later lamented.

rin: Pariyo man ku mga rawitdawit ku mga suldados pagkatapos.
eng: It was the same lament of the soldiers after.

rin: Mala pa nira ngamin ka mga ubin.
eng: They were all too young.

rin: Uno piggigibo nira sadto?
eng: What were they doing there?

rin: Nagraan iya bago magbaynte-uno.
eng: She had died just before she turned 21.

rin: Diri ko pigsabiyan su kag-igin niyang babayi na kadtong panawon na nagraan su igin niya, nakamati ako sa malakanganang kalibungan.
eng: I did not tell her mother that at the moment of her daughter's death, I felt this raging bafflement.

rin: Gusto man sana niyang gibuwon na mapatultol a buway.
eng: She just wanted to make life better.

rin: Pero su mga suldados iniisip na sadto sira tanganing mapatultol man a buway.
eng: And the soldiers thought that they were just making life better, too.

rin: Pariyo sirang ginigibo kin uno sa silong nira tama pero ngata ta malakasala ku kinatapusan?
eng: They were both doing what they thought was right yet why did it end so wrong?

rin: Kin makakapagngayo-ngayo sana ako, migngayo-ngayo akong su mga bagay-bagay iba man kinatapusan.
eng: And if only I could wish, I would wish that things would have ended differently.

rin: Saka 'nganing a mga tawo diri iya malingawan pati na adtong ibang mga kaubinan, mala pa ka mga ubin arog niya, o mamatian ading nagmundo nang uda kamalmagan.
eng: And that people would not forget her and all those other young people, too young like her, nor feel this sad futility.

rin: Kin makakapagngayo-ngayo sana ako, migngayo-ngayo ako na a mga ngayo-ngayo ko magkamatuod.
eng: If only I could wish, I would wish that my wishes would come true.

rin: Ngamin kita namundag por dahil sa usad na ngayo-ngayo.
eng: We are all born because of a wish.

rin: Pinangigin iya ta su kag-igin niyang babayi ag lalaki, pariyong 35, nagngayo-ngayo na a pagkabuot nira magin laman.
eng: She was born because her mother and father, both at 35, wished their love to be made into flesh.

rin: Biyong ka mga muya na nagkaturakan sirang darwa pagkatapos na makisuwayan sadto mga dating agom nira.
eng: So happy to have found each other after each of their marriages failed.

rin: Agko iya ngod na babayi sadto kag-igin niyang babayi ag ngod na lalaki sadto kag-igin niyang lalaki kaya biyo iyang pinayaba ku ngamin sadto pamilya nira.
eng: She had a sister from her mother and a brother from her father and everyone in her family loved her.

rin: Ngamin sadto pamilya niya mauban na nabuway 'nganing mabayad iyang mag-iskwela saka makatapos sa kolehiyo.
eng: Everyone in her family would live long to see her go to school and finish college.

rin: Magkaagko maray na mga amigo ag maray na trabawo.
eng: Have good friends and a good job.

rin: Makatupar saka maagom su pinakanabubutan niya sa buway pa'la magkaagko sadiri niyang pamilya.
eng: Meet and marry the love of her life and have her own family.

rin: Tatawan niya su mga kag-igin niya sa mga makuapo saka su mga ngod niya sa mga pamangkin na pigpaurugon.
eng: She would give her parents grandchildren and her brother and sister nephews and nieces to spoil.

rin: Matutuparan niya a mga puru-pirming problema sa buway.
eng: She would go through the usual problems in life.

rin: Pero mabubuway iya sa mauban saka magigin mamuya.
eng: But she would live long and be happy.

rin: Diri iya migngayo-ngayo sa kin uno pa man.
eng: She would not wish for anything more.

rin: Pero agko mga tawong pinagigin ta a mga tawo a ngayo-ngayo magin iba man a buway sa kin uno man kinamattan nira-magin iba man na tawo o maiyan sa ibang lugar.
eng: But then there are those who are born because people wish for their worlds to be just different from as they were to be someone else or to be somewhere else.

rin: Kaya san ako saka ibang tawong arog ko namundag, pag a mga tawo nagngangayo-ngayo sa mga bagay na a pag-una imposible.
eng: That is when I and the others like me are born, when people wish for what is deemed the impossible.

rin: Kada magngayo-ngayo sira kadi, na sinayod sa pinakatuninong nirang kaisipan, natutugbok an sa linya ka mga palad nira.
eng: Each time they make this wish, uttered in the most quiet of thoughts, it becomes etched into the lines of their palms.

rin: Binnabago ka linya ka mga buway nira saka a nakasabod na mga buway sa tawong kaibanan nira kada pitong taon.
eng: Changing the lines of their lives and the intertwining lives of people around them in the course of every seven years.

rin: Kan ninyo kami mapupunan na mabayad.
eng: That is when you begin seeing us.

rin: Mababayad a kadoble ka mga tawong bistado ninyo ka mga panahon na an.
eng: Seeing the double of the people you know then.

rin: O kin uno man magigin itsura nira kin nagbago sa gatingay o naggurang.
eng: Or of how they would look if they were a little changed or older.

rin: San pirming paggibo ka mga ngayo-ngayong an, mas lalo kaming mababayad.
eng: The more that these wishes are made, the more that we are seen.

rin: Su mga payaba niya sa buway mababayad sana 'ko pag nag-iisip sira minsan kin sari o napauno na iya.
eng: Her loved ones would see me when they would wonder sometimes where or how she was.

rin: Naiisip kin uno man baga ngaya iya kin iya o su buway niya nagin iba man.
eng: Wonder how it would have been for her if she or her life were different.

rin: Pag biyo sirang nalilipungow kanya.
eng: When they really missed her.

rin: Pag narurumruman iya.
eng: When they were reminded of her.

rin: O kin nagngangayo-ngayo sirang kintana buway pa iya.
eng: Or when they wished that she were still alive.

rin: Pero bago a tawo maggibo ka mga ngayo-ngayo nira, ako saka a mga arog ko nabubuway san anino, san mga anino ninyo.
eng: But before people make their wishes, I and the others like me live in the shadows, in your shadows.

rin: Kin uugkuron, diri man kami namundag 'nganing kuon a buway ninyo.
eng: After all, we are not born to take over your lives.

rin: Magin sanang anino sa kin uno man kintana.
eng: Just to be the shadow of what might have been.

rin: Sa mga uno raw.
eng: Of the what if.

rin: Ka mga ngayo-ngayo na usad na aldow gigibuwon ninyo.
eng: Of that wish that someday you will make.

rin: Namundag kami ta nagngayo-ngayo kamo.
eng: We are born because you make wishes.

rin: Namundag kami 'nganing a ngayo-ngayo ninyo magin matuod.
eng: We are born so that your wishes would come true.

rin: Sa kinatapusan, kami a natutuda 'nganing magrumrom ka mga ngayo-ngayo ninyo.
eng: And in the end, we are left to remember your wishes.

rin: Nabuway ako sadto anino niya.
eng: I lived in her shadow.

rin: Mamumundag ako usad na aldow pala migluwas ako sadto anino niya ta pag-abot ka aldow migngayo-ngayo man iya.
eng: I will be born someday and step out of her shadow because someday she will make that first wish, too.

rin: Tapos migparangayo-ngayo iya, arog man sana ka kangaminan.
eng: Then she will keep on wishing, like everyone else.

rin: Ag a mga ngayo-ngayo magigin matuod.
eng: And wishes do come true.

rin: Punan ta sa pinakauna kong narurumruman bilang usad na babayi.
eng: Let us begin with my earliest memory as a lady.

rin: nagreklamo si Daddy ki Iyay na paraaling ko na agko kulang kuno sa kusog ka tulang ag piad ko.
eng: Daddy had complained to Iyay who was my yaya that I was lacking something strong in my bones and in my hips.

rin: Ag paraaling man niya dati pa'la paraaling man ni Mama niya dati pa.
eng: And his yaya before and his mama's yaya before that.

rin: Sabi niya nakakaapekto kuno 'di ka agi ko ta bagana kuno 'ko nag-aaging tindog na pato.
eng: He said that it was affecting my walk because I was walking like an upright duck.

rin: Sabi niya dapat kuno pakaunon kadi ako sa dakol na manok san sabow ko.
eng: He said she should feed me more chicken in my broth.

rin: Bugtong na igin niya.
eng: His only begotten son.

rin: Isi man ni Amang Dyos na malakabastante ku mga manok sadto raya niyang manukan, ngurob-ngurob niya.
eng: God knows there were enough chickens in his spread of a poultry farm, he had grumbled.

rin: Diri niya isi, ag diri niya nababayad, na nag-aagi na 'kong bagana babayi.
eng: He did not know, and he could not see, that I was already walking like a lady.

rin: Pero isi ni Iyay ag pa'la isi naman ku mga kangayamon ko ag binansagan na nira ko.
eng: But Iyay knew and later on my playmates also knew and they gave me my nickname.

rin: Kin pauno naiisiyan ka mga gurang a mga bagay.
eng: The way old people just know things.

rin: Kin pauno naiisiyan ka mga igin a mga bagay.
eng: The way children just know things.

rin: Ku nakakangabil na 'ko sa kumpletong panaysay, pag-uunaon ko na pigsasayod ko a bansag ko.
eng: When I could already talk in complete sentences, I would imagine saying my nickname.

rin: Ag a ngaran ka baryo kin sari ako galin sa usad na beauty contest ngaya na inibanan ko.
eng: And the name of the barrio where I come from in the imaginary beauty contests that I would join.

rin: Syempre, kaipuwan kong itago a pagigi kong babayi-na-nakakalabos-sa-awak-sa-lalaki ki Daddy.
eng: Of course, I had to hide my being a lady-trapped-in-a-boy's-body from my Daddy.

rin: Ay, mauungot pati iya pag binabaoy ko 'ya kan ta sabi niya a "Papa" kuno mas tunog haciendero ag mas macho.
eng: Oh, he hated it when I would call him that because he said that "Papa" sound-ed more haciendero and more macho.

rin: Amo, macho si Daddy- alangkaw, maitom, ag kasing-isog ka unglo.
eng: Yes, Daddy was macho- tall, dark, and as mean as a tikbalang.

rin: Buko man sa kalalawgon niya a unglo.
eng: Not that he looked like a tikbalang.

rin: Napapangas na ngani iya kaya narurumruman ko a tusar niya pirming bagana si Mr. Clean.
eng: He was growing bald and had sported Mr. Clean's hairdo for as long as I could remember.

rin: Iya a big-time hadi sa kopra/paroy/mais/manok/pambulang-na-manok sa ngamin na macho sa syudad namo.
eng: He was the big-time copra/palay/corn/chicken/fighting-cocks king of all the machos in our city.

rin: A pagbaoy ko kaya kanyang "Daddy" mas pambabayi para kanako.
eng: Calling him "Daddy" was more ladylike for me.

rin: Kaya salamat sa Dyos na diri ko 'ya binaoy na Papa ta pa'la kan babauyon ko man palan su 'lakagwapo kong jowa sa "Papa".
eng: And thank goodness I did not call him Papa because later on I would call my own handsome jowa "Papa".

rin: Ay bayai na a pagkakaiba sa ruon gagagirl.
eng: Ay never mind the difference in stress gagagirl.

rin: Pariyo man sana yan.
eng: It's the same thing.

rin: Ya, si Mommy dearest na nagrag-os kading alang-alang ninyo alangkaw man, maitom, ag gwapo.
eng: Anyway, Mommy dearest who gave birth to yours truly was also tall, dark, and handsome.

rin: Lang langkaw niya, 'lang itom pala 'lakagwapo.
eng: She was very tall, very dark and very handsome.

rin: Arog kaitom ka ariw na mo sa irarom ka kaldero o ka uring.
eng: As dark as that soot you see under the pot or charcoal.

rin: Arog ka ibang babayi na talagang gwapo.
eng: Like some women are just really handsome.

rin: Pwede ngani iyang mabidbiran na usad sa mga ngod niyang lalaki na intero man ka mga gwapo ngamin.
eng: She could have passed for one of her brothers who were very handsome men.

rin: Gusto ko kintanang sabiyon na black beauty talaga 'ya pero buko.
eng: I wish I could say that she was really a black beauty but she wasn't.

rin: Saka buko man niyang kalalawgon tabi a kabayo, excuse me.
eng: And she certainly didn't look like a horse, excuse me.

rin: Sa kamaturan, uda man ako reklamo manungod ka pigsalak na lahi ni Daddy ag ni Mommy dearest ta a tapos ko lugod kalalawgon ko man si Romnick Sarmenta.
eng: And really, I couldn't complain about Daddy and Mommy dearest's combined genes because I ended up looking like Romnick Sarmenta.

rin: Pero mas maitom ako, mas mataba amo tabi.
eng: But I am darker, chubbier really.

rin: Baby fat adi pa'la agko mga gura sa kanin-an sa punggod.
eng: It's baby fat and with traces of acne scars.

rin: Pero dakol man na mga pampagayon na produkto na mig-asikaso kan.
eng: But there are so many beauty products that would take care of those.

rin: Pa'la san man si Doktora Vicki Belo.
eng: And there's always Doktora Vicki Belo.

rin: Ya, maray tabi akong duru-daragita kadto ag payaba ko si Mommy.
eng: Anyway, I was a good little lady then and I loved my Mommy.

rin: Saka para kanako iya a most beautiful animal on the skin of the earth.
eng: And for me she was the most beautiful animal in the skin of the earth.

rin: Ku una ko 'yang nabayad na piglayid su Gumamela-red-lipstick niya sadto ngabil niya.
eng: The first time I saw her slide her Gumamela-red-lipstick over her lips.

rin: Nagin bagana arog iya ku mga exotic na loro.
eng: It made her look like one of those exotic parrots.

rin: Ag bukong arog ka ordinaryong bayong na nababayad ta sa uma.
eng: And not like the usual birds we see in the farm.

rin: Pa'la gusto ko man na magbutang ku lipstick niya ta k'wasa pa'la kan magigin babayi naman ako arog niya.
eng: And I wanted to put on her lipstick because then I would be a lady just like her.

rin: Kaya man paggalin tulos niya sadto tukador niya ag pagluwas niya sadto kwarto nira, nilistuwan ko su lipstick niya pa'la pignusnos ko 'di sa intero kong ngabil.
eng: So as soon as she moved away from her dresser and left their bedroom, I dived for her lipstick and rubbed it all over my lips.

rin: Pigngungusngos ko 'ding ngabil ko sa pag-ultanan ka pagrait.
eng: I was puckering my lips in between squealing.

rin: Pa'la tatawban ko 'ding nganga ko.
eng: Then covering my mouth.

rin: Pa'la mig-upak.
eng: Then clapping.

rin: Pa'la mig-ulangto.
eng: Then jumping.

rin: Pa'la uutruwon adi ngamin.
eng: Then repeating everything all over again.

rin: Ay 'gayon!
eng: Ay beautiful!

rin: Ngamin adtong ribok a nagpadali-dali ki Mommy dearest pabalik sadto kwarto, sinusunod si Iyay.
eng: It was all that ruckus that made Mommy dearest rush back to their bedroom, followed by Iyay.

rin: Ta nagngangalas sira kin siisay man sa langit ag sa mga manok ni San Pedro a nagbubuno sa manok kuno sadto kwarto?!
eng: Because they were wondering who in heavens and St. Peter's chicken was butchering a chicken in the bedroom?!

rin: Pa'la nabayad nira 'ko, ag nabayad ko sira sadto salming.
eng: Then they saw me, and I saw them through the mirror.

rin: Diri ako nag-iwag na bagana napikiting ayop, ta pig-iisip ko kin diri ako mag-iwag 'baad gumalin na sana sira.
eng: I held myself still like a cornered animal, thinking that if I didn't move maybe they would go away.

rin: Pa'la si Mommy dearest nagkakagrat na ku namansayan na niya sa maray kin uno su itsura ko.
eng: Then my Mommy dearest screamed when she got a good look at how I looked.

rin: Kaya nagkagrat naman ako pala nagtatangis na 'ko.
eng: So I also screamed and started crying.

rin: Pa'la pinugong niya su nganga niya ku usad na kamot labing napakapot man ki Iyay su usad.
eng: And then she covered her mouth with one hand while clutching Iyay with the other.

rin: Nagrapo si Iyay parani kanako pero si Mommy dearest nagsabing.
eng: Iyay moved towards me but Mommy dearest said.

rin: Diri, diri, diri an pagkaputan!
eng: No, no, don't touch it!

rin: A manok na sinanib san awak niya 'baad maungot!
eng: The chicken that has taken over his body might get angry!

rin: Nagtawa sana si lyay, nagrani kanako, pa'la ti-nanggal adtong lipstick sadto ngabil ko gamit su sagayad ku daster niya.
eng: Iyay only laughed, came up to me, and removed the lipstick from my lips with the hem of her daster.

rin: Pariyong pinili kading darwang babayi na diri magsabi kin uno pa man manungod kadi ki Daddy.
eng: Both women chose not to say anything about it to Daddy.

rin: Binsido si Mommy dearest na nasaniban ako sa demonyong manok.
eng: Mommy dearest was convinced that an evil chicken had possessed me.

rin: Pero sa irarom ka puso niya isi niya na babayi talaga 'ko.
eng: But deep in her heart she knew that I was really a lady.

rin: Si Mommy dearest usad talagang denial queen, tunay.
eng: Mommy dearest was a denial queen, really.

rin: Pero pakatapos kadto si Iyay nagin Fairy God-Aswang ko.
eng: But after that Iyay became my Fairy God-Aswang.

rin: Buko ta kalalawgon niya a aswang.
eng: Not that she looked like an aswang.

rin: Pag pigsisilngan ko ya ag nababayad ko a kurupos ag nagtatayog tayog na kulit san takyag ag tutulnan niya, pirmi kong maisip a pabo.
eng: Whenever I would look at her and see the wrinkly wobbly skin on her arms and throat, I would always think of a turkey.

rin: Pero sa kamaturan, aswang iya.
eng: But really, she's an aswang.

rin: Sa Los Angeles, isi ka mga tawo na aswang iya.
eng: In Los Angeles, people knew that she was an aswang.

rin: Pero uda man iya pigkukulgan na isay man ag tatabangan pa ngani niya aros ngamin.
eng: But she never really hurt anybody and would help almost everybody.

rin: Ya so what chocnut kin iniisip ka ngamin na a tawa niya tunog-demonyo.
eng: And so what chocnut if everybody thought that her laugh sounded evil.

rin: O a tikmong tawa niya pinggirabuwon a mga bok ka awak mo.
eng: Or that her toothless smile would make your body hair stand.

rin: O na iya magigin ayop usad na beses kada bulan.
eng: Or that she would change into an animal once a month.

rin: O pipilion na diri magkaon o kaputan o parungon a bawang.
eng: Or would prefer not to eat or touch or smell garlic.

rin: O ta gusto niya pagparaparungon a mga mabros na babayi paminsan-minsan.
eng: Or that she liked to smell pregnant women every now and then.

rin: Dakol na ising bagay si lyay manungod sa dakol na bagay, pero dapat sana man sa edad niyang an.
eng: Iyay knew a lot of things about many things, and she should at her age.

rin: Diri mo sana iya pag-ungaon kin pirang taon na 'ya.
eng: Just don't ask her how old she is.

rin: A mga aswang, lalo na su mga gurang na babaying aswang, 'laka mga sensitibo manungod ka edad nira.
eng: Aswangs, especially very old female aswangs, are very sensitive about their age.

rin: Ungaon mo na sana su patal na paradaog-daog na pag-una niya mas gwapo iya ki Aga Muhlach.
eng: Just ask that stupid bully who thought he was cuter than Aga Muhlach.

rin: Isi ko, 'laka pang-Bagets!
eng: I know, it's so Bagets!

rin: Pero ku nagdadakulo kaya ako, si Aga Muhlach su crush-ng-bayan.
eng: But growing up, Aga Muhlach was the crush-ng-bayan.

rin: Pero nguwan si yummy-ulam-pahingi-pa-ng-kanin Papa Piolo Pascual!
eng: And now it's just yummy-ulam-pahingi-pa-ng-kanin Papa Piolo Pascual!

rin: Entonces, su feeling-Aga pigsabiyan iya na sa kagurangan kuno niyang an.
eng: So, feeling-Aga had sassed to her that she's so old.

rin: Kin virgin pa iya, a hymen niya among tuod na kagumoy sa goma.
eng: That if she were a virgin, her hymen would be as tough as rubber.

rin: Su kinatapusan niya agko 'ya dysmenorrhea uru-aldow anggan sa mag-ayat iya sa dispensa ki Iyay ku ginibo niyang uda supog na tuyaw.
eng: He ended up with dysmenorrhea every day until he apologized to Iyay for making such ungentlemanly remarks.

rin: Pa'la diri na iya nakamati ku kulog pag nakakaulangan pakatapos.
eng: And he stopped having menstrual pain after.

rin: Ya, pirmi niyang maiisiyan maski uda man iya sari man sa arani ko kin bumbigay na 'ko sa petal attraction ko sa Gumamela-red-lipstick ni Mommy dearest.
eng: Anyway, she would always know without being anywhere near me when I would give in to my petal attraction to Mommy dearest's Gumamela-red lipstick.

rin: Bubutwa na sana 'ya galin kin sari na bagana kurakding.
eng: She would just pop out of nowhere like a mushroom.

rin: Tanganing punason adi sa ngabil ko pirang minuto bago 'ko mabayad ni Daddy.
eng: To wipe it off my mouth just minutes before Daddy would see me.

rin: Pa'la gigibuwon niya yan pa'la tatanggalon niya adtong tuwalya na ipuputos ko sa payo.
eng: Later on she would be doing that and taking off the towel I would wrap around my head.

rin: Na gagamiton kong wig.
eng: Which I would use as a wig.

rin: O papadali-dalion niya 'kong upsuon su heels ni Mommy dearest.
eng: Or hurrying me out of Mommy dearest's heels.

rin: Pigpadagos niya adtong gibuwon anggan sa ako tatakon na usad na tag-init.
eng: She continued to do that until I was circumcised one summer.

rin: Ag su bagana ngamin na igin na lalaki sa bilog na Los Angeles.
eng: And the rest of the boys in the whole of Los Angeles it seemed.

rin: Bagana adto langit kanako.
eng: It was heaven for me.

rin: Syempre, 'lang kulog na bagana nasa impyerno na tatakon.
eng: Of course, it hurt like hell being circumcised.

rin: Ag kin pwede sana na diri ko na 'di inagyan, noh!
eng: And I wished I didn't have to go through it, noh!

rin: Pero bayda, nakasupong ako sa palda sa pirang semana labing nagpaparay ako.
eng: But see, I got to wear a skirt for weeks while I healed.

rin: Gusto ko sa maray kin pauno matutukyab a palda sa palibot ko pag maangin.
eng: I loved how the skirt would billow around me when it was windy.

rin: O kin paunong bagana ko babaying pagsilngan labing pig-uusay ko a palda pag mig-ula ako.
eng: Or how ladylike I appeared while arranging my skirt when I would sit down.

rin: Pero narisa ni Daddy na mala naman uban na nagsusupong ako ku palda.
eng: But Daddy had noticed that I was wearing the skirt for too long.

rin: Pigtugal niya si Iyay na pasupa-supaon pa 'ko sa dakol na dawon sa bayabas pa'la ipayid su ginuma-gumang bayabas sadi junior ko.
eng: He had asked Iyay to make me chew more guava leaves and apply the paste on my junior.

rin: Tanganing mapila na tulos tanganing magpundo na 'ko sa pagsupong ka lintian na paldang an.
eng: So that I would heal faster and stop wearing the damn skirt.

rin: Pa'la usad na aldow nagkaagko problema su kapangyariyan sa aswang ni lyay.
eng: Then one day there was a glitch in lyay's aswang powers.

rin: Ag nabayad ako ni Daddy na nakasupong ku tuwalya, lipstick, palda, ag heels.
eng: And Daddy saw me wearing the towel, lipstick, skirt, and heels.

rin: Pa'la bagana si Mother Melanie Marquez sa atubangan ku salming.
eng: And sashaying like Mother Melanie Marquez in front of the mirror.

rin: Ngayo-ngayo na akong pinurbaran niya kong lumuson sa drum, o sadto salog kintana.
eng: I wished he had tried to drown me in a drum, or in the river, too.

rin: Tanganing nakarait man kintana ako na buko akong lalaki kindi sirena po!
eng: So that I could also scream that I was not a boy but a sirena po!

rin: Pero, diri, diri, diri.
eng: But, no, no, no.

rin: Ading lauman sa manok kanako.
eng: It was the chicken coops for me.

rin: Tunay, para sa usad na eredero sa chickendom.
eng: Really, for someone who was an heir to a chickendom.

rin: Matuod akong manok pag-abot sa mga manok.
eng: I was a real chicken when it came to chickens.

rin: Ata, magdudulag pa ngani ako na nagkakagrat sadto mga isiw, sister!
eng: I mean, I would even run away screaming from chicks, sister!

rin: Kaya adto, pigbubutong akong nagrarait na nagsisingot-singot arog ka siisay man na sadit na babaying igin ni Daddy.
eng: So there I was, being hauled screaming and sniveling like any little girl by Daddy.

rin: Labing piglalamasa 'ko ku dakulong paha niyang balat na agko bulawan na Texas na manok na ebilya.
eng: While he was beating me with his big leather belt with the gold Texas chicken buckle.

rin: Ag nagtatangis ako ki Mommy dearest pala ki Iyay ag ki Inang Maria na isalbar ako.
eng: And I was crying for Mommy dearest and Iyay and Mama Mary to save me.

rin: Isinalya 'ko sadto pinakaaraning lauman.
eng: I was thrust into the nearest coop.

rin: Bagana 'ko linaom sa bartolina labing nakakapot ako ag nagsisirang sadto ringring na kawayan.
eng: Looking like I was caged in a bartolina as I held and peered through the bamboo slats.

rin: Pero kamaturan, su lauman sa manok arog kadakulo sa dakulong kwarto.
eng: But really, the chicken coop was as big as a big room.

rin: Nagkakalintar si Daddy ta kadakol ko kunong piglaspag na panawon sa mga binabaying bagay imbes na mag-asikaso ka mga manok na nagpapakaon, nagbabado, ag nagtataong istaran kanamo.
eng: Daddy was roaring that I had spent way too much time doing sissy things rather than minding the chickens that fed, clothed, and sheltered us.

rin: Pa'la nagkalintar pa'ya na migpirmi nguna kuno ako sadto ag diri pagtawan sa pagkaon pa'la tubig anggan sa diri ako nagkakaagko panlalaki ag panmanok na kasipan sa sadiri ko.
eng: Then he roared some more that I was to stay there and be given no food and no water until I had gotten some manly and chicken sense into me.

rin: Nagkalintar pa iya sa ibang bagay pero diri ko talaga iya maintindiyan k'wasa sigeng lasik ku wiloy galin sadto nganga niya.
eng: He roared some other things but I couldn't really understand him because of the spittle coming out of his mouth.

rin: Ya kawasa, diri ko isi kin uno talaga makukuko ko labing nakalaom sadto luog kadtong lauman sa manok, noh?
eng: Really, I didn't know what I was supposed to get while being stuck inside a chicken coop, noh?

rin: Mas makakaray raw a pagkakaagko panlalaki o panmanok na kaisipan?
eng: Was having manly or chicken sense better?

rin: Pa'la naparong ko na su mga manok na dyos ko su bata nirang abot sa kauru-itaasi ka kalangitan!
eng: Then I finally smelled the chickens and good lord they stank to high heavens!

rin: Pa'la namangno ko na solo na sana palan ako kaiba su mga kinakataktan, namata nang mga manok.
eng: Then I realized that I was all alone with the feared, stinky chickens.

rin: Luway akong nag-atras sadto pinakaaraning kanto, luway na nagsasayod.
eng: I slowly backed myself into the nearest corner, softly saying.

rin: Nagsuksukan sira ngamin sadto usad na puro ku lauman labing ako sadto man balyong puro.
eng: They all huddled in one end of the coop while I stayed in the other.

rin: Ya, nagpalusot si Iyay kanako sa pagkaon ag tubig ku turog na si Daddy ku gab-ing adto pa'la kada gab-i pakatapos kadto.
eng: Anyway, Iyay had sneaked food and water to me as soon as Daddy was asleep that night and every night after.

rin: Sabi niya kanako uda dapat katakutan.
eng: She told me that there was nothing to be afraid of.

rin: Na a mga manok mabubuot man.
eng: That the chickens were really nice.

rin: Ag kin mag-imati sana 'ko sa maray marurungog ko sira na magbisara pala makakabisara ko man sira.
