eng: And that if I listened closely I would hear them talk and I could talk to them, too.

rin: Ag tunay, mas takot akong magraan sa kalangkagan- kisa tusayon anggan sa magraan.
eng: And really, I was scared to death more of being bored to death rather than being pecked to death.

rin: o mapuot ka parong ka ipot ka manok anggan magraan.
eng: Or suffocating on the smell of chicken shit to death.

rin: Ta uda man ako makabisarang siisay man o sa kin uno man.
eng: Because I could not talk to anybody or anything.

rin: Pag-agi sa pirang aldow, kaparong ko naman sira kaya nagdesisyon na 'kong kausipon na sana sira.
eng: After several days, I smelled like them so I decided that I might as well talk to them.

rin: Ay mader, nakakangabil a mga manok.
eng: And mother, the chickens could talk.

rin: Ag pag nagpuon na sirang magkutkutat diri na sira mapu-pundo!
eng: And once they start to squawk they couldn't stop!

rin: Rugang pa sadto pag-istorya nira manungod ka problema nira sa salud, kaya nirang daugon sa tsimisan si Ate Luds o si Cristy Fermin.
eng: In addition to telling me their health problems, they could out-gossip Ate Luds or Cristy Fermin.

rin: Narungog ko na ading manok na adi agko relasyon sadi sulog na adi ngaya.
eng: I heard that this chicken was having an affair with this rooster.

rin: Pa'la a ama ka mga itlog ka manok na adto buko man palan su ama ngaya.
eng: And the father of the eggs of that chicken was not the father.

rin: Pa'la kada ika-44 na aldow agko daliyan a mga manok.
eng: And that every 44th day there was an orgy among the chickens.

rin: Pigsabi ko ki Iyay ngamin na pig-istorya kanako ku mga manok pa'la a simbag sana kadi su bruha niyang tawa.
eng: I told Iyay all that the chickens told me and she replied with that bruha cackle.

rin: Uda sadto mga manok nagsuspetsa na ngamin sira migraan pagkatapos ka 45 na aldow.
eng: None of the chickens suspected that they were all going to die after 45 days.

rin: Pero namati nira na kaipuwan nirang magselebrar ka ika-44 na aldow.
eng: But they felt the need to party on the 44th day.

rin: Abo ko man na rauton a okasyon nira sa paagi ka pagsabi ko kanda na migraan sira ngamin pakatapos kan.
eng: I didn't want to ruin their party by telling them that they were all going to die after that.

rin: Ay ta girl, a mga manok pwede talagang magpyesta anggan sa mautsan sira.
eng: And girl, the chickens could really party to death.

rin: Sa kinatapusan pinaluwas na 'ko ni Daddy ku oras na su mga manok dadarawon na sadto kin sari man sira dadarawon.
eng: Daddy finally let me out when it was time for the chickens to be delivered to wherever they were supposed to go.

rin: Sinabiyan iya ni Iyay na agko na kuno 'ko panmanok na kaisipan.
eng: Iyay had told him that I had gained my chicken sense.

rin: Gusto kong magtangis ag magkaway sa beauty-queen-goodbye kanda.
eng: I wanted to cry and wave a beauty-queen-goodbye to them.

rin: Ta isi kong migraan sira sa 'lang takot na kagranan pa'la a tapos nira sa plato kin kiisay man na Chicken Joy o kin uno pa man.
eng: Because I knew that they were going to die horrible deaths and end up in someone's plate as Chicken Joy or something.

rin: Ay tunay, nakabayad nayka kin uno gigibuwon nira sa manok na lulutuon na à la pinikpikan?
eng: Really, have you seen what they do to a chicken cooked à la pinikpikan?

rin: Pero a pagtangis ag pagkaway bukong gibong panlalaki.
eng: But crying and waving wasn't a manly thing to do.

rin: Ag pa'la isasalya naman sana 'ko utro pabalik sadto lauman kin gibuwon ko yan.
eng: And I would just be hauled right back into the coops if I did that.

rin: Saka mala ko na kadesperadong marigos.
eng: And I was desperate for a bath.

rin: Lain pa, diri man maririsa ku mga manok a uno pa man na bagay k'wasang 'la pa ka mga burat.
eng: Besides, the chickens wouldn't have noticed anything anyway because they were too hungover.

rin: Nagpundo 'kong magkaon sa manok pakatapos.
eng: I stopped eating chicken after.

rin: Ta diri ko kayang kaunon a mga madiyon ko o mga arayong erensya nira, noh?!
eng: I couldn't eat my kumares or some distant relative of theirs, noh?!

rin: Diri man nagreklamo si Daddy ta abo mo naman talaga magkaon sa manok kin ika man nag-aangos ag nag-aataman kanda sa bilog mong buway.
eng: Daddy didn't complain because you wouldn't want to eat chickens, too, when you're breathing and minding them for the rest of your life.

rin: Pig-oorgulyo ni Daddy kin pauno kong masasabi kin uno sala sa aring manok.
eng: Daddy was proud of how I could tell what was wrong with which chicken.

rin: Na maiisiyan ko pag chikahan namo ka mga chicas.
eng: Which I would find out during my chikahan with the chicas.

rin: Pig-oorgulyo man niya kin paunong nagin lagong ading boses ko.
eng: He was also proud of how my voice got deeper.

rin: Ag kin pauno 'kong 'lang abladang mag-agi na bagana lalong.
eng: And how I strutted around like a cock.

rin: Na amo pigpagibo kanako ku mga manok.
eng: Which the chickens had advised me to do.

rin: Nagkuko pa ngani sira sa sulog 'nganing ipabayad kanako.
eng: They even got a rooster to show me.

rin: Basta sa diri sana ako makigkigan.
eng: And as long as I wasn't surprised.

rin: Ta a lagong kong boses magigin rait pala migtaas a palad ag mga guramoy ko na agko kasabay na Aaaaay!
eng: Which would transform my deep voice into a squeal and make my palm and fingers fling upwards with matching Aaaaay!

rin: Pirmi sana 'kong bagana su pangaturganan niyang igin na lalaki.
eng: I appeared to be more like his dream son.

rin: La niya kamuya na maray nanggad nang nagsusoltero na 'ko na diri na niya nariparo na nagpuon na 'kong magpaaba sa bok.
eng: He was so happy that I was finally turning more and more into a young man that he didn't even mind when I began growing my hair long.

rin: Sa baryo namo, sikat a rock music, lalo na a Guns N' Roses.
eng: In our barrio, rock music was a hit after all, especially Guns N' Roses.

rin: Uda bayliyan sa barangay a natatapos na diri pinapatugtog a "Sweet Child of Mine" ag ngamin na tawo makakapay na bagana rungaw na ayam sa chorus.
eng: Not a baylihan or a barangay dance went by without "Sweet Child of Mine" being played and all the people would go crazy-dog-wild to the chorus.

rin: Agko 'ko poster nira sa kwarto ko kaibanan su White Lion, Skid Row, Metallica, pala Bon Jovi.
eng: I had posters of them in my room, together with White Lion, Skid Row, Metallica, and Bon Jovi.

rin: Pa'la nag-uyon si Daddy na ngamin sira machong pagsilngan dawa na a iba kanda maaba a bok ag maati ag demonyong pagsilngan.
eng: And Daddy agreed that they all looked macho even if some of them had long hair and looked dirty and evil.

rin: Muya sana si Daddy na nagrurungog ako sa machong kanta dawa na maribok adi.
eng: Daddy was just so happy that I was listening to macho music even if it was noisy.

rin: Kisa man magkanta ka "Kapag Tumibok ang Puso" ni Donna Cruz.
eng: Instead of singing to Donna Cruz's "Kapag Tumibok ang Puso".

rin: Diri isi ni Daddy na crush ko kadaklan kanda pa'la pag-aarukan ko a poster nira labing pigsusukray ko sa 100 na beses a bok ko.
eng: Daddy didn't know that I had a crush on most of them and that I would kiss their posters as I combed my hair 100 times.

rin: Pig-iisip ko na mas maray nanggad a agko maabang bok kisa magsupong sa wig na tuwalya.
eng: Thinking that having long hair was so much better than wearing a towel for a wig.

rin: Sabi ko ki Daddy na a mga rock idols ko ag a mga machong barbarians ku panawon, arog ni Conan the Destroyer, maaba a bok.
eng: I told Daddy that my rock idols and the macho barbarians of old, like Conan the Destroyer, had long hair.

rin: Pigpipirit niya na diri ko 'di pagpaabaon lampas sa tingron ta bagana kuno ko babaying pagsilngan.
eng: He insisted that I should at least not let it grow past my nape because I just looked too damn girly.

rin: Pig-unga niya 'ko kin ngata uda ako poster sa mga babayi sa kwarto ko.
eng: He did ask why I didn't have posters of girls in my room.

rin: Sabi ko kanya mapili sana talaga 'ko pero agko ko nakuko galin sadto usad na lalaki sadto tanuman.
eng: I told him that I was picky but I did get from one of our boys in our farm.

rin: Su kalendaryo sa alak na agko litrato sa mga babaying nakabikini kada bulan.
eng: That calendar of some liquor with pictures of women in bikinis for each month.

rin: Kada gab-i, gusto ko na magin arog man lugod nira ka-sexy.
eng: Every night, I would wish that I would be as sexy as they were.

rin: Sa ibang gab-i, gusto ko na magsupong man sa pulang bikini.
eng: On some nights, I would even wish that I would also get to wear a red bikini.

rin: Ag maglunad sa puting kabayo paiyan sa puting kastilyo kin sari nag-uulat su Prince Charming ag kin sari kami mig-istar na mamuya sagkod pa man.
eng: And ride that white horse to a white castle where Prince Charming was waiting and where we could live happily ever after.

rin: Pa'la kada aldow pigpupurbaran ko na diri bumigay sadto fatal attraction ko sadto lipstick ni Mommy dearest o isupong su heels niya.
eng: And every day I tried so hard not to give in to my fatal attraction to Mommy dearest's lipstick or slip into her heels.

rin: Ku high school, risa man na mas intresado 'ko sa mga lalaki.
eng: In high school, obviously I was more interested in the boys.

rin: Usad o darwa kanda intresado man kanako, pero maray tabi akong babayi kaya pigpapaalagan ko a pagigin birhen ko.
eng: One or two of them were interested in me, too, but I was a lady and I prized my virginity.

rin: Saka, sabi ku mga madre mamamabros kuno 'ka kin pakaputan mo sa lalaki a kamot mo o arukan ika.
eng: Besides, the nuns said that you could get pregnant if you allowed a boy to touch your hand or kiss you.

rin: Pa'la makakaiyan ika sa impyerno.
eng: And then you would go to hell.

rin: Tubod man ako kanda.
eng: I believed them.

rin: Ag pig-uulat ko su tamang lalaki na mag-abot na migtao kanako ka loving-lightning-feeling na agko matching fireworks ag singsing sa kasal.
eng: And I was waiting for the right man to come who would give me that loving-lightning-feeling with matching fireworks and wedding ring.

rin: Arog pa man kan, nagdrowing ako sa puso na agko "Prince Charming" na nakasurat sa bitnga pa'la pana na naglagbas sadi.
eng: Anyway, I had drawn hearts with "Prince Charming" written in the middle and an arrow passing right through it.

rin: Buko sanang mga babayi tabi agko monopolyo san.
eng: The girls didn't have a monopoly on that.

rin: Su ibang mga babayi intresado man kanako ag kin pwede ko sana kandang sabiyon.
eng: Some of the girls were interested in me, too, and I wished I could tell them.

rin: Babayi man ako, noh?!
eng: I'm a girl, too, noh?!

rin: Gusto ko sirang santaringon ta sigeng pilik-pilik ka mga pirok pa'la irik-itik.
eng: They made me want to slap them because of their eyelash-batting and giggling.

rin: Lalo na pag sige man nirang durat sadto ngamin kong crush.
eng: Especially when they were also flirting with all my crushes.

rin: Sa kamaturan mas magayon ako ag kaya ko tabi papilik-pilikon a 'lang itom kong pirok na mas maispid ag mas matibay.
eng: And really I was prettier and I could bat my sooty eyelashes faster and better.

rin: Mas maganting pa ngani akong bumayli sa bayliyan kisa kandang makakanos, mga walawon a tiil na haliparot na pigparatagisan ako pag nakakarapo kanako.
eng: I even danced better in social dancing than those ugly, left-footed haliparots who kept on rubbing themselves against me every chance they could get.

rin: Ata na, a mga babaying an ginibong full body-contact a tango kanako!
eng: I swear, those girls made tango a full body-contact sport for me!

rin: Nagdududa na si Daddy ka interes ko sa ballroom dancing.
eng: Daddy was suspicious though about my interest in ballroom dancing.

rin: Pero diri iya opisyal na makareklamo ta si lola ako a gustong kapadis.
eng: But he couldn't officially complain because my grandmother liked having me as her partner.

rin: Maray an ka osteoporosis niya tabi, isi mo.
eng: It's good for her osteoporosis, you know.

rin: Pa'la panawon na para sa kolehiyo.
eng: Then it was time for college.

rin: Buot ko raw na magin paratutturo, inhenyero, abogado, nars, doktor, o padi?
eng: Did I want to be a teacher, an engineer, a lawyer, a nurse, a doctor or a priest?

rin: Gusto ko raw sa tuberculosis, math, libro, rugo, dakol na libro pa'la dakol na rugo.
eng: Did I want tuberculosis, math, books, blood, more books and more blood.

rin: Ag marapado sa palo-palo ag magkaon sa tapayas bilang pandulsi sagkod pa man?
eng: And being whacked by a paddle and having papaya for dessert forever?

rin: Ay no deal, bakla!
eng: No deal, bakla!

rin: A pinakagusto ko talaga a magluog sa fashion school pa'la makatuod magdisenyo ag maggibo sa gowns.
eng: What I really wanted was to go to fashion school and learn how to design and make gowns.

rin: Pa'la syempre maggamit sa mas maray na ngaran kisa sa "Pitoy Moreno".
eng: And definitely use a better name than "Pitoy Moreno".

rin: Sa ngabilon kaya namo, a ngaran niya buot sabiyon su junior.
eng: In our dialect, his first name refers to junior.

rin: Kanos!
eng: Ugly!

rin: Si Daddy gusto 'kong magluog sa Philippine Military Academy.
eng: Daddy wanted me to go to Philippine Military Academy.

rin: Pigsumite na niya su application ko pa'la pigpirit niya 'kong mag-test.
eng: He filed my application and forced me to take the test.

rin: Milagro, nakapasar ako!
eng: And milagro, I passed!

rin: Sabi ni Daddy gusto talaga niya na a igin niya na magin big-time General kopra/paroy/mais/manok/pambulang-na-manok na hadi ka ngamin na macho sa syudad.
eng: Daddy said that he had always wanted his son to be a bigtime General copra/palay/corn/chicken/fighting-cocks king of all the machos in our city.

rin: Su palad ag mga guramoy ko apos nang lu-mipad pataas ag makakarait pa 'ko.
eng: My palms and fingers almost flew upwards and I almost squealed.

rin: Mapapalibutan man kintana 'ko sadto PMA sa kadakol na masisiram na unipormadong lalaki, narungog ko man na kakadugon nira a mga binabaying arog ko.
eng: As much as I would be surrounded in PMA by a lot of delicious men in uniform, I heard that they beat up lady boys like me.

rin: Pa'la kaipuwan kong tusaran ading bok ko!
eng: And I had to cut my hair!

rin: Uda makakakapot kading crowning glory ko!
eng: Nobody touches my crowning glory!

rin: Kaya nagdulag ako sadto Los Angeles, sadto magigin bok ko sa PMA, pala nagpaiyan ako sa Metro Manila.
eng: So I ran away from Los Angeles, from my future hair in PMA, and went to Metro Manila.

rin: Nagdagos muna 'ko sadto mga pinsan ko, pero sinabiyan sira ni Daddy na diri ako pagpadaguson 'nganing mapiritan akong pumauli.
eng: I first stayed with my cousins, but Daddy had told them not to take me in so that I would be forced to go home.

rin: Su tapos ko nagturutambay ako sa Remedios Circle sa Malate ta narungog ko na sadto a mga tawong arog ko.
eng: I ended up hanging around Remedios Circle in Malate because I heard that's where people like me were.

rin: Uda sintabo pa'la nag-aalop, inako ko su imbitasyon ku gurang na lalaki, na pag-una ko maray na Samaritano.
eng: With no money and going hungry, I accepted the invitation of an older man, whom I thought was a Good Samaritan.

rin: Para sa pagkaon ag inumon na diri ko isi na agko palan rabadonkey pakatapos.
eng: For a meal and drinks without knowing that there was rabadonkey after.

rin: Buko iyang Prince Charming pa'la uda man kikilat with matching fireworks.
eng: He was not Prince Charming and there was certainly no lightning with matching fireworks.

rin: The truth is diri ko talaga iya pig-isipan sa maray.
eng: The truth is I did not think about it much.

rin: Pa'la abo kong mag-arte na bagana baktin na pigbubuno arog ni Kris Aquino sadto pelikulang "Vizconde Massacre".
eng: And I didn't want to act like a pig being gutted like Kris Aquino in the movie Vizconde Massacre.

rin: O magin matuod na teleserye queen na magtatangis sa binaldeng tubig pa'la ubag nang pagsilngan a lalawgon ko pakatapos.
eng: Or be a true-to-life teleserye queen who would cry buckets and buckets of water and have my face looking bloated after.

rin: Saka su hormones ko baga biyong inaarangkada pala agko man pangangaipo a awak ko, isi mo man.
eng: Besides my hormones were raging and my body had needs, too, you know.

rin: Magkaon, mag-inom, pa'la rabadonkey sa sunod-sunod na lalaki.
eng: It was meals, drinks, and rabadonkey with one man after the other.

rin: Ay mader, a iba kanda diri mo ngani uunaon na mga mama man.
eng: And mother, some of them you wouldn't think were mamas.

rin: A rabadonkey, naturan ko, pagsulbong man sana ka tab A sadto slot A o C ta babayi man sana a agko slot B.
eng: The rabadonkey, I had learned, was a matter of inserting tab a into slot A or C because only women had slot B.

rin: Pa'la kin a pagkaon, inuman pala rabadonkey tapos na, migturog muna 'ko sa gatingay anggan sa gisungon ako ta oras na 'nganing maggalin.
eng: And when the meals, drinks, and rabadonkey were done, I got a little deep until I was woken up because it was time to leave.

rin: Sa kadaklan ka panaworn tatawan ako sa sintabo pala balik na sa Remedios Circle.
eng: Most of the time I was given money then it was back to Remedios Circle

rin: Udang load sa cell phone o rubber shoes o bling bling para kanako.
eng: No cell phone load or rubber shoes or bling bling for me.

rin: Amo talaga, ku panawon na adto kadaklan sa mga cell phone analog ag kaipuwan mo kadto sa linya.
eng: Really, at that time, most cell phones were analog and you had to have a line.

rin: Ag nagngangalas ngani ako minsan kin pauno a gift-rubber-shoes-giving nagpuon.
eng: And I wonder sometimes how the whole gift-rubber-shoes giving began.

rin: Sabi ko ngani diri ko man pig-isipan a mga an sa maray.
eng: As I said I did not think about it much.

rin: Lang pagal pero mamuya man.
eng: It was tiring but it was also fun.

rin: Ag para kanako, I was just a girl who wanted to have fun.
eng: And as far as I was concerned, I was a girl who just want ed to have fun.

rin: Pa'la nakatipon ako sa sintabo 'nganing makaarkila sa kwarto kaiba 'ding tulo man na binabayi.
eng: In time I had saved enough money to be able to afford to rent a room with three other lady boys.

rin: Nagpundo na 'kong magsupong kading mesh-shirts ko ta sabi nira buko kuno 'kong magayon na supong adi.
eng: I had stopped wearing my mesh shirts because they said I definitely didn't look beautiful in them.

rin: Nakatuod naman akong magbutang sa foundation na bukong espasol na pagsilngan.
eng: I had also learned to apply foundation without looking like an espasol.

rin: Pa'la lipstick na bukong bagana agko Gumamela sa ngabil ko.
eng: And lipstick without looking like I had a Gumamela on my lips.

rin: Sadto usad sa mga group dates na adto ko natuparan ading future papa ko.
eng: It was in one of those group dates that I met my future papa.

rin: Kaiba iya kading grupo sa mga bading na bagana mga bukong mga bading na pagsilngan na nakipagbayadan kading grupo ko man sa mga binabayi.
eng: He was with this group of gays who didn't look like they were gay who met up with my group of lady boys.

rin: Bagana 'di su pabayli sa barangay namo talaga na agko darwang grupong nag-iing-ingan sa kada usad kin siisay a para kiisay.
eng: It was like our barangay dance all over again with both groups whispering to each other about who would be for whom.

rin: Tunay su padis namo.
eng: And what a pair we made.

rin: Iya su tipong punok, pormal pala ako man su probinsyanong bakla sa silong ku kadaklan.
eng: He was the silent, stuffy type and I was the probinsyanong bakla as far as everyone was concerned.

rin: Ku bilog na gab-i nagngangalas ako kin kuno kami mig-uno.
eng: The whole night I was wondering when we would get down to it.

rin: Pero pigparaunga sana niya 'ko sa mga ungang pang-slumbook pala gusto sanang magparabisara pa'la bisara pala bisara.
eng: But he just asked me slumbook questions and wanted to talk and talk and talk.

rin: Gusto sana niyang magparabisara labing nagkakaon ag nag-iinom kami ku sunod na gab-ing magkaibanan kami pala ku sunod pa'la ku sunod pa.
eng: He also just wanted to talk while we ate and drank the next night we were together and the next and the next.

rin: Nauda na 'ko sa bilang ag nagpundo na 'kong magpara-isip na agko mingyari pa kanamong darwa.
eng: I lost count eventually and stopped thinking that something would happen between the two of us.

rin: Inunga ko sadiri ko.
eng: I had asked myself.

rin: Uno man adi?
eng: Ano ba ito?

rin: Agko problema sa darwang payo ka awak?
eng: There's a problem with two heads of the body?

rin: Pero ta gusto sana man niyang magbisara, eh di go with the bisara!
eng: But since he just wanted to talk, eh 'di go with the talk!

rin: Pakatapos man ka ngamin, tatawan niya 'ko sa sintabo tanganing magparapakibisara sana kanako ag diri makipagdaliyan kanako.
eng: After all, he would give me money just to talk to me and never had sex with me.

rin: Nagpuon na 'kong maglaom ag magparalaom na mababayad ko iya pa'la makaibanan iya.
eng: I began looking more and more forward to seeing him and spending time with him.

rin: Bagana ngani ako makakapay kin uno pipilion na isusupong, pag-isip kin uno sasabiyon ag ngamin.
eng: Going through the motions of going crazy picking out what to wear, thinking about what to say and all.

rin: Pa'la usad na gab-i labing nag-uulat kanako sa usad na restawran, nagtangad iya.
eng: Then one night while waiting for me in a restaurant, he looked up.

rin: Pala ku nagsabi iya na "hello", bagana 'ko natamaan sa kitkilat.
eng: And when he said "hello", it hit me like lightning.

rin: Pero syempre diri ko man isi kin uno pagmati ka matamaan sa kitkilat, sabay sana sa sulog bakla.
eng: But of course I really didn't know how being hit by lightning felt, just go with the flow bakla.

rin: Payaba ko iya.
eng: I loved him.

rin: Uda na rason ta amo yan a pagpayaba, bukong amo?
eng: No more explanations because that's love, right?

rin: Bagana rosaryo, misteryoso!
eng: Like a rosary, it's mysterious!

rin: Kaya amo, he had me at "hello".
eng: So yes, he had me at "hello".

rin: Ku gab-ing adto, inunga man niya 'ko.
eng: That night, he also asked me.

rin: Lady Boy, will you be my girlfriend?
eng: Lady Boy, will you be my girlfriend?

rin: Ag amo nagrait ako pa'la nag-arteng arog ka isay man na beauty queen na nanggana sa Miss Universe title.
eng: And I squealed and acted just like any beauty queen who won the Miss Universe title.

rin: Pigyapyapan a lalawgon.
eng: Fanned the face.

rin: Nagtatangis labing nagsasabing "I don't want to cry".
eng: Cried while saying "I don't want to cry".

rin: Nagtawa pa'la nagsabing "I can't believe it!".
eng: Laughed and said "I can't believe it!".

rin: Pa'la tawa pa'la sabing "Yes!" faster than four o-clock bago niya 'di mabawi.
eng: And then smiled and said "Yes!" faster than 4 o'clock before he took it back.

rin: Ta naturakan ko na a Prince Charming ko ag with matching fireworks show ku gab-ing adto!
eng: I had finally found my Prince Charming and there was a matching fireworks show that night!

rin: Pigtrato niya 'kong bagana prinsesa pakatapos ka normal na rabungan manungod kadi ag kan na chorva.
eng: I was treated like a princess after with the usual fights about this and that chorva.

rin: Abo ta man ikang magraan sa ibog o magkilas-kilas ika ka ngamin na detalye.
eng: I don't want you to die with envy or make your eyes roll with all the details.

rin: Pero sabi niya papayabaon niya 'ko forever pa'la mabubuway kami happily ever after.
eng: But he said he would love me forever and we would live happily ever after.

rin: Pa'la biyo ko man iyang payaba ag gusto ko 'yang biyong mammuya kaya nagbakal ako pa'la binasa ko a Kama Sutra.
eng: And I loved him so much and I wanted to please him so much that I even bought and read Kama Sutra.

rin: Ginibo ko su iba sadto, kaya sige niya balik-balik 'nganing sige pa.
eng: I did some of the things there, that's why he kept on coming back for more.

rin: Amo sige pa, amo, amo, diri, diri, diri na, sige pa!
eng: Yes more, yes, no, no more, more!

rin: Bakla, su iba sadto pigpurbaran kong gibuwon kindi diri ko talaga kayang gibuwon!
eng: Bakla, some of the things there I tried to do but I cannot really do!

rin: Dyos ko, uda ako ka gamit para sa ngamin na posisyon, noh?!
eng: My god, I don't have the equipment for all those positions, noh?!

rin: Arog pa man kan, nagin prinsesa 'ko na agko ka mga ordinaryong problema sa relasyon sa luog sa usad na taon, onseng bulan, ag baynte-tres na aldow 'nganing eksakto.
eng: Anyway, I was a princess with the usual relationship problems for one year, eleven months, and 23 days to be exact.

rin: K'wasa usad na aldow pakatapos kan sinabiyan niya 'ko na kakasalon na iya ag risa man na buko ako su bride.
eng: Because a day after that, he told me that he was getting married and obviously I wasn't the bride.

rin: Buko ta payaba talaga niya adto.
eng: Not because he really loved her.

rin: Ta ako man talaga a payaba ngaya niya.
eng: Because it was me he really loved.

rin: Pero magkaiba na sira kadto together forever ag gusto niya sa mga igin pa'la nilalauman talaga adto ka mga pamilya nira.
eng: But they had been together forever and he wanted kids and it was expected by their families.

rin: Su kadaklan udang saysay ta sa payo ko nagtatumbling akong pasiko-siko.
eng: The rest did not make sense because in my head I was tumbling in a zigzag.

rin: Uno kuno?!
eng: What is it?!

rin: Agko iya nobya?
eng: He had a girlfriend?

rin: Ag sa payo ko agko ka ingab-ingab na an: Dyos ko!
eng: And in my head there was that gasp: My God!

rin: A kinatapusan ko arog man ki Mother Denial Queen!
eng: I ended up with someone just like my Mother Denial Queen!

rin: Ibang Oedipal Complex adi!
eng: This is another Oedipal Complex!

rin: Pa'la mas dakol na tumbling na pasiko-siko pa sa payo ko.
eng: More tumbling in a zigzag in my head.

rin: Pa'la mader, usad adtong Nora Aunor ag Vilma Santos all-in-one moment.
eng: Then mother, it was a Nora Aunor and Vilma Santos all-in-one moment.

rin: Pigtutubtob ko iya sa rurug'gan niya labing nagsasabing "You lied to me!".
eng: I was pummeling his chest while saying "You lied to me!".

rin: Pa'la "You said you love me!".
eng: And "You said you love me!".

rin: Pa'la "Stay with me!".
eng: And "Stay with me!".

rin: Pa'la "Fight for us!".
eng: And "Fight for us!".

rin: Pa'la "I gave you my heart, body and soul!" na agko kaibang hayop, hayop, hayop.
eng: And "I gave you my heart, body, and soul!" with matching animal, animal, animal.

rin: Isi mo kin kuno pinakamakulog?
eng: You know what hurt the most?

rin: Bagana adto bukang maapros na binububuan sa suka.
eng: It was like spraying vinegar on an open wound.

rin: Lang kulog talaga, ha?
eng: That really hurt, ha?

rin: Pigmamawot ko kada gab-i sa kada star light.
eng: I had been wishing every night on every star light.

rin: Star bright galin sa bottom of my hypothalamus na babayi talaga 'ko, isi mo.
eng: Star bright from the bottom of my hypothalamus that I was really a lady, too, you know.

rin: Ata mas dakol pa na tagubtob ag dakol pang hayop, hayop, hayop.
eng: More pummeling and more animal, animal, animal.

rin: Pakatapos ka ngamin, pinalayas niya 'ko sadto apartment na pig-aarkila niya.
eng: After all, he kicked me out of the apartment that he was paying for.

rin: Pa'la pakatapos pigpurbaran kong magbalik utro sadto gibo ko dati, pero diri ko na kaya.
eng: Afterwards I tried to go back to the way I was before, but I couldn't.

rin: Kaya nagdesisyon ako na pumauli na sadto baloy sadto Los Angeles.
eng: I decided to go home to Los Angeles.

rin: Ya syempre, diri ako sinabat sadto baloy na arog sa usad na alibughang igin na lalaki kwasa risa man na mas bagana 'ko alibughang igin na babayi.
eng: Of course, I wasn't welcomed home like the prodigal son because it was obvious that I was more like the prodigal daughter.

rin: Pero maray sanang diri ako pinag-alow.
eng: But at least I wasn't turned away.

rin: Si Iyay su unang nakabisto kanako.
eng: Iyay was the first to recognize me.

rin: Pala sinabat niya 'ko ku 'lang singgayang tikmong tawa.
eng: And she welcomed me with her beaming toothless smile.

rin: Mas gurang na iyang silngan nguwan pero diri ko yan sinabi kanya.
eng: She definitely looked older but I didn't tell her that.

rin: Ta dawa 'la ko kagustong magin babayi, abo ko na magka-dysmenorrhea tabi.
eng: As much as I wanted to be a lady, I didn't want to end up with dysmenorrhea, too.

rin: Pigpadagos niya a pagtutturo kanako manungod kadi ag kiton na kaaswangan.
eng: She resumed teaching me about this and that kaaswangan.

rin: Sinilngan sana ako ni Daddy.
eng: Daddy had simply looked at me.

rin: Funda, lipstick, pa'la maabang itom na makintab na bok galore.
eng: Funda, lipstick, and long black shiny hair galore.

rin: Pala nagsayuma na silngan ako o kausipon ako pakatapos.
eng: And then refused to look at me or talk to me after.

rin: In fairness, diri niya 'ko linumos, o linaom, o ginuraan.
eng: In fairness, he didn't drown me, or cage me, or kill me.

rin: Ku nagpundo na 'kong magbutang sa foundation pa'la nag-moisturizer na sana 'ko, sinisimbag na niya 'ko pag nag-uunga ako kanya gamit su lagong kong boses manungod sa kopra, mais, paroy, ag mga manok.
eng: When I stopped wearing the foundation and settled for moisturizer, he then answered me whenever I would ask him in my deep voice something about the copra, palay, corn, and chickens.

rin: Magbutang sa lip gloss kisa sa lipstick.
eng: Wore lip gloss instead of lipstick.

rin: Pa'la pinaputulan ko a bok ko paabot sa abaga,
eng: And cut my hair to my shoulder.

rin: Pigbawasan ko sana 'di, sisters, ta matutunow a make-up tabi ka init sadi Los Angeles.
eng: I just toned it down, sisters, because the heat would melt make-up in Los Angeles anyway.

rin: A mga pambulang na manok pa nanggad a te-ritoryo ni Daddy.
eng: The fighting cocks were still Daddy's sole territory.

rin: Agko ko mas maray na relasyon sa mga manok k'wasa a ngamin na mga lalong pigparakantyawan ako.
eng: I had better relationship with the chickens because the cocks were all heckling me.

rin: Ay, kin isi sana nira na a iba kanda arog ko man ngani, noh?!
eng: Ay, if they only knew that some of them were like me, too, noh?!

rin: Si Mommy dearest nag-uraol pa'la piggakos ako.
eng: Mommy dearest had wailed and embraced me.

rin: Pa'la nag-uraol sa gatingay pa.
eng: And wailed some more.

rin: Pa'la nagpuon nang mangadyi sa 200 na Tara Kagurangnan Maria uru-aldow 'nganing su demonyong espiritu na nagsanib kuno kanako gumalin na.
eng: And then began to pray 200 Hail Marys every day for the evil spirit that had possessed me to go away.

rin: Minsan magigisong ako na a kamot niya sa ibabow ka payo ko labing pig-iing-ing, "You devil, you devil, go away!".
eng: Sometimes I would wake up to her hand just above my head while she whispered, "You devil, you devil, go away!".

rin: Pa'la mas dakol na Tara Kagurangnan Maria pa.
eng: And then more Hail Marys.

rin: Pa'la pirang semana 'kong magparangisli ka hayop na an labing nag-aasikaso ka mga kopra, paroy, mais, ag mga manok.
eng: And for weeks I would cry over that animal while I took care of the copra, palay, corn, and chickens.

rin: Sasabiyon ko ngamin sa kada grupo ka mga manok sa uru-aldow namong chika lain sana ka parte kin sari ngamin sira madali nang matitigbak.
eng: I told each batch of chickens in our daily chika everything except the part wherein they're all going to die soon.

rin: Sabi ko kanda na su hayop na adto mas manok pa kisa kanda.
eng: I told them that animal was more of a chicken than they were.

rin: No offense meant ag sabi nira uda man an kanda.
eng: No offense meant and they said none taken.

rin: Pig-unga ko si Iyay kin agko orasyon na pwede 'kong gibuwon na tunay na babayi.
eng: I had also asked Iyay if there was a spell that could transform me into a real lady.

rin: Pa'la pakatapos sa dakol na 45-days, sinabiyan ako ni Iyay na pumundo na 'ko sa pagparaistorya san mga manok ka istorya ko ta biyong nalululdok sira pa'la nagkakailang na.
eng: Then after many 45-days, Iyay finally told me to stop telling the chickens my story because it was depressing them and it was making them sick.

rin: Pigsilngan ko sira, ay true!
eng: I looked at them, ay true!

rin: Nabayad ko na ngamin sira nagkaagko trangkaso.
eng: I saw that they all had the flu.

rin: Bukong Bird Flu, gagagirl.
eng: Not Bird Flu, gagagirl.

rin: Nagluwas an pakatapos ku Y2K bug.
eng: That came out after the Y2K bug.

rin: Pero kadto 'ko nakakuko sa ideya na tawan ana bird ni ex-jowa ka trangkaso.
eng: But it was then that I got the idea of giving my ex-jowa's bird the flu.

rin: Isi mo, su bagana 'di agko sipon na diri mauuda.
eng: You know, like it had a cold that would never go away.

rin: Kaya inunga ko si Iyay kin posible 'di.
eng: So I asked Iyay if it was possible.

rin: Nagtawa sana ya na bagana demonyo na buot sabiyon "amo" pero agko kondisyon.
eng: She gave me that evil laugh which meant "yes" but there was a catch.

rin: Ta naglalagbas na 'ko sa linya sa pag-ultanan ka garden of good and evil.
eng: Because I was crossing the line between the garden of good and evil.

rin: Gusto kong makakulog, bukong makatabang.
eng: I wanted to hurt, not help.

rin: Syempre gusto kong kulgan a ex-jowa ko!
eng: Of course I wanted to hurt my ex-jowa!

rin: Pa'la sabi ni Iyay na kin tututturuan niya 'ko kin pauno gibuwon an, ako 'umbalyo sa pwesto niya bilang residenteng aswang ka Los Angeles.
eng: Then Iyay said that if she taught me how to do that, I would take her place as the resident aswang of Los Angeles.

rin: Pagal na iya ag mas gurang pa sa gurang, gusto na niyang magretiro pa'la magraan tabi.
eng: She was tired and older than old, wanted to retire and die already, you know.

rin: A usad sanang paagi 'nganing makaretiro iya pa'la magraan amo kin maipasa niya a kapangyariyan niya bilang aswang sa kiisay man pero amo sa lady boy.
eng: And the only way she could retire and die was if she would pass on her aswang powers to someone but yes to lady boy.

rin: Ay ta, a pagigin aswang equal opportunity career man palan.
eng: Oh my, being an aswang was an equal opportunity career after all.

rin: Nguwan gaumno ko talaga gustong kulgan a ex-jowa ko ag magin aswang sa proseso?
eng: Now how bad did I want to hurt my ex-jowa and become an aswang in the process?

rin: Pigparauna-una ko 'di aldow ag gab-i, pig-iisip ko a manungod ka mga love quotes pa'la love songs kada aldow ag gab-i.
eng: I had thought about it day and night, thinking about love quotes and love songs day and night.

rin: Pa'la pigparaunga ko man si lyay kada aldow ag gab-i manungod ka makangangalas na kinaban ka ka-ugman ag sindak ka pagigin aswang.
eng: And I had also asked Iyay day and night about the wonderful world of joys and horrors of being an aswang.

rin: Ya uno na nangyaring sunod?
eng: So what happened next?

rin: Diri, talaga, sikreto 'ding seremonya na diri ko pwedeng sabiyon ta agko saradong kontrata na kadakol na patara-tara.
eng: No, really, it's a secret ceremony that I'm not allowed to tell because of a binding contract with so many clauses.

rin: Nakaistar pa nanggad ako sa Los Angeles ag a mga tawo baoy kanako Mother Lady Boy na nguwan.
eng: I still live in Los Angeles and people call me Mother Lady Boy now.

rin: Mas magayon a tunog kisa sa Mother Ricky o Kuya Boy, 'kong amo?
eng: Sounds more fabulous than Mother Ricky or Kuya Boy, 'di ba?

rin: And so what chocnut kin iniisip ka mga tawo na magigin baklang manananggal ako usad na beses sa usad na bulan kuno.
eng: And so what chocnut if people think that I would change into a baklang manananggal once a month.

rin: O diri ako magkakaon sa manok ta ginagamit ko di para sa orasyon kuno.
eng: Or that I don't eat chicken because I use it for orations.

rin: O kin lalaki ika pa'la naparong ko a bag-ot mo magigin instant-ulam ta nayka kuno.
eng: Or that if you were a man and I smelled your sweat you would be my instant-dish.

rin: O ikamamangli 'ko sa multong bakla pag nadadak'lan ko a pagbutang sa funda.
eng: Or that I'm mistaken for the multong bakla when I wear too much funda.

rin: Ako na a nagpapadalagan ka kopra/paroy/mais/manok kingdom namo nguwan ag magtatabang aros sa ngamin pa'la aros diri man ako nangungulog kiisay man.
eng: I'm running our copra/palay/corn/chicken king-dom now and would help almost everybody and almost never really hurt anybody.

rin: Pa'la si Daddy na magigin bulangero King ka ngamin na senior citizen macho sa syudad namo.
eng: And daddy will soon be the fighting-cocks king of all the senior citizen machos in our city.

rin: Diri niya pig iistorya sa mga macho senior citizen a manungod kanako, ya syempre.
eng: He doesn't talk to the macho senior citizens about me, of course.

rin: Si Mommy dearest sige pa pangadyi sa 200 na Tara Kagurangnan Maria uru-aldow.
eng: Mommy dearest is still praying 200 Hail Marys every day.

rin: Ag naglalaom na mingagom ako pa'la tatawan iya sa mga mukuapo kin umabot man a panawon.
eng: And still hopes that I would marry and give her grandchildren someday.

rin: Denial queen pa nanggad, ading mudra dearest ko.
eng: Still a denial queen, my mudra dearest.

rin: Single ag available pa ako.
eng: I'm still single and available.

rin: Pa'la a mga manok pigsasadol ako to get into the dating program, sister, with matching cluck.
eng: And the chickens are encouraging me to get into the dating program, sister, with matching cluck.

rin: Pangaturganan ko pa nanggad na mag-iba sa beauty contests, pero nguwan gusto ko na magin Miss Gay Universe.
eng: I still dream of joining beauty contests, but this time I want to be Miss Gay Universe.

rin: Pag-ulat ka Agua de Mayo.
eng: Waiting for Agua de Mayo.

rin: Uda sadi dragon.
eng: There are no dragons here.

rin: Amo yan sabi sadi maribok, maati, ag matawong syudad.
eng: That's what they say in this bustling, polluted, and overcrowded city.

rin: A "dragon" ngangabilon na balon ka mga Espanyol, Amerikano, ag Briton, ag a kandang mga libro ag mga pelikula.
eng: The "dragon" was a word brought by the Spaniards, Americans, and British, and their books and movies.

rin: Maski ngani pigdidiskutir ka iba na a kanato kunong mga pag-abayan na mga Thai, Indonesian, ag Tsino a unang nagdara.
eng: Although some would argue that our neighbors, the Thai, Indonesians, and Chinese brought it first.

rin: A mga dragon nilalang na nagigin matuod sa mga pigpapatpat na mga istorya kading mga dayong tawong adi na 'baad nagtubod sa usad na punto na matuod mananggad adi.
eng: The dragon was a creature made real by stories spun by these strange men and women who may have even believed that they were real at one time.

rin: A mga dragon kuno, sabi nira, amo a mga dyos kading kinaban na nagbuburwalyuwan sa pag-ultanan ka pagigin mga among ag maestro.
eng: Dragons, according to them, were once the lords of the world who alternated between being our masters and teachers.

rin: Depende sa klase ka dragon o depende sa klase ka tawong nag-iistorya.
eng: Depending on the kind of dragon or the kind of person telling their stories.

rin: Ngaya na a tawo ag napagkausaran na sugidon nagparadakol sira, sabi nira.
eng: But man became too many and decided to hunt them down, they said.

rin: Sabi man ku usad na librong nabasa ko mabuot kunong nagdesisyon sirang bayaan a mga tawo ag maglipat na sana sa ibang kinaban.
eng: One book I read even said that they magnanimously decided to leave mankind alone and retired to another dimension.

rin: Alagad sa pangkangaminan, a dragon naglalayog ag nagbubuga sa kalayo.
eng: But generally, dragons flew and breathed fire.

rin: Nakikipaglaban pangala kina-kaon sa mga kabalyero, alagad magrarawat man sira sa karnero ag baka.
eng: They battled and then ate knights, but they ate sheep and cows, too.

rin: Mangunguko man sira sa magagayon na raraga ag mga prinsesa ag sa isip ko 'baad ngani kakaunon man sira.
eng: They took beautiful maidens and princesses and I suppose they ate them, too.

rin: Ag syempre nagparatipon man sira sa mga bulawan ag pigbabantayan man nira a yaman nira.
eng: And of course, they hoarded gold and guarded their treasure.

rin: Pag pig-uuna-una ko a mga dragon ag kin pauno sira kadesididong magtipon sa mga yaman ag bantayan adi, naiisip ko a sangraan ag mga bangko ag panic-buying.
eng: When I thought about dragons and how they obsessively hoarded and guarded their treasure, I simply thought of pawnshops and banks and panic-buying.

rin: Nagtawa sana su kabistado kong dragon ka pigsabi ko, ta pariyo man a sinabi ko kanya ku Agua de Mayo man ku mauban nang panawon.
eng: The dragon I knew laughed at what I just said, the same thing I said to it a long time ago on Agua de Mayo.

rin: Buko man akong arog kading mga dayong dragon na adi alagad kausad ako ka ragang adi.
eng: I am not what these foreign dragons are, but I am one of this land.

rin: Una, labas sanang isura ag gulay a pigkakaon ko diri pa ninyo ising mga tawo anggang nguwan na mas maray an sa awak?
eng: To begin with, I only eat fish and some vegetables don't you people know by now that they're better for your health?

rin: Saka siisay man baya a gustong magkaon sa buway na baka o sa mga patal ag makasadiring tawo na nakabado sa utak?
eng: Who wants to eat a live cow or some stupid, egotistic man dressed in metal anyway?

rin: Isipa raw kin pauno magkisam-kisam ag tumulon kan na mga an?
eng: Can you imagine chewing and swallowing those things?

rin: A mga magagayon ag mala-birhen na nalabyan man sa estimar, ag uno man baya a gigibuwon ko ka mga bulawan na an?
eng: Beautiful and virginal women are overrated, and what do you think will I do with all that gold?

rin: Ibakal sa labas na isura san mga pobreng paraisusura?
eng: Buy fish with it from some poor fisherman?

rin: Ag amo talaga, gusto kong sadiriyon sana a yaman ko.
eng: And yes, I like keeping my treasure to myself.

rin: Uda sadi dragon, maablada kong pigsabi kanya.
eng: There are no dragons here, I had arrogantly pointed out to it.

rin: Lain pa, diri man ngani ika nakakalayog ag buko man basang ikang kalalawgon ka dragon.
eng: "Besides, you can't fly and you don't even look like how a dragon is supposed to look.

rin: Bagana ika tabi dakulong buaya.
eng: You look like a giant crocodile.

rin: Alagad sadto iya, pigsasabing usad iya.
eng: But there it was, telling me it was one.

rin: Kin sinabi ko kadto sa mga kapinsanan ko ag sadto paraaling na nakatupar ako sa buway na dragon, urog na 'ding nilalang na adi, magtubod man raw sira kanako?
eng: If I had told my cousins and the yaya that I met a live dragon then, especially this particular creature, would they have believed me?

rin: Amo, siisay man migtubod kanimo?
eng: Yes, who would believe you?

rin: Su nagsurang nang 'lakadakulong berdeng bukol nang-intrimis.
eng: That infuriating hulk of green lumps had taunted.

rin: Dilaan mo ta mala mong raot saka 'la mo kakusong na igin.
eng: Serves you right for being a bad, stubborn, little girl.

rin: Saka bago mo pa man isipon na kapay ako, bayai 'kong mag-istorya kin pauno ko nabisto su dragon.
eng: And before you think that I'm delusional, let me tell you how I met the dragon.

rin: Nabunggo, amo, nabunggo tabi ako kanya usad na apon ku tag-init sa Santiago.
eng: I bumped, yes, bumped into it one summer afternoon in Santiago.

rin: Kin sari ako magbabakasyon ku igin pa 'ko pag tag-init sadto baloy ag tanuman ku apuon ko.
eng: Where I used to spend my summers as a child in my grandfather's ancestral home and farm.

rin: Sabi ku mga gurang na babayi sadto diri kuno mag-iyan sadto salog, su salog na nagbubulos puon sa bukid paiyan sadto syudad ka Iriga, kin tuyong Agua de Mayo.
eng: The old women there told us never to come to the salog, the river that ran from the mountain to Iriga City, on Agua de Mayo.

rin: A unang uran na nagbabandilyong tapos na a tag-init.
eng: The first rain signaling summer's end.

rin: A unang uran kuno agko kapangyariyan na makabulong.
eng: The first rain was supposed to have curative powers.

rin: Alagad nagtugon man su mga gurang na babayi na diri kuno kami magrigos sa salog ka aldow na an ta nagigin kulor lumot kuno a tubig.
eng: But those old women also told us never to swim in the river on that day because the water became deep green.

rin: Ag 'baad masapot kami kana mga nagluluyloy na mga sanga ka mga gurang na kawoy.
eng: And you could get tangled in the overhanging branches from the old trees.

rin: Rugang pa nira na a ugot kuno magluluwas sadto istaran niya, 'nganing maglangoy ag manginaon sadto puro ka salog ta kan sana magrararom a tubig.
eng: They added that the bayawak would then come out of its lair, to swim and hunt farther down the river because it was only then that it was that deep.

rin: Kayang itago ag darawon a kadakuluan niya ka tubig ag ibulos pababa.
eng: The deep water could hide and carry its bulk downstream.

rin: Kin maglangoy ika sa salog pag nag-uuran, matutuparan ika ka ugot ag kakaunon ika.
eng: If you swim in the river when it's raining, the bayawak will find you and eat you.

rin: Amo di sasabiyon nira sa katapusan ka kandang litanya.
eng: That's what they said to end their litany.

rin: Diri ako nagtubod ni usad sa nginabil nira, syempre.
eng: I didn't believe a word of it, of course.

rin: Pigsasabi man sana yan ku mga gurang na babayi 'nganing tuodon namo a mga pigsasabi nira.
eng: Those old women were just saying those things so that we would do what they told us to do.

rin: Ag 'nganing diri sira mapagal magparabantay ka mga nagpaparakagrat ag nagngangayamon na mga igin na pala pwede sirang mabasa pag pig-awas nira kami sa salog.
eng: And for them to get out of the tedious task of watching over screaming and frolicking children who would likely drench them in the process of getting us out of the river.

rin: Saka uno baya a pagkakaiba?
eng: What was the difference anyway?

rin: Mababasa man sana sira ka uran.
eng: They would have been wet, too, because of the rain.

rin: Uno pa man, pinili pa nanggad ku mga igin na sundon su mga gurang na babayi ta a pigpilian man sana a malamasa.
eng: Still, the children chose to follow the old women for the alternative was to get beaten.

rin: Saka agko man nangga'd posibilidad na malumos.
eng: And there was also the possibility of drowning.

rin: Alagad ku apon na adto na tag-init, dinulag ako paiyan sadto salog.
eng: But that summer afternoon, I sneaked out and went to the river.

rin: Sa kabublayan ko sa angsa ag kamunduan ta ngamin turog ta syesta.
eng: Listless from the humidity and feeling lonely as everyone in the house was asleep for siesta.

rin: Diri ko isi kin pauno sira nakaturog sadto namuot nang angsang adto.
eng: I didn't know how they were able to sleep in that stifling heat.

rin: A sobrang angsa sadi ubaliw isusubol ikang maglaom sa luog ka pridvider o maglubto sa salog.
eng: Humidity in the boondocks would make you want to imprison yourself in the freezer or dunk yourself in the river.

rin: Pinili ko su uri.
eng: I chose the latter.

rin: Abang nag-aagi, nagpuon nang magtagiti pangala nag-uuran na.
eng: While walking, it began to drizzle and then suddenly the rain was pouring.

rin: Diri ko napugulan na mag-urok-utok abang pigmamati su kaginawaan ku uran na nagtuturo sa payo ag lalawgon ko.
eng: I couldn't help but giggle as I felt the soothing balm of the rain on my head and face.

rin: Ag pigpaparong ko kin pauno kading pigsisigbo su pahang ispaltadong tinampo ag raga.
eng: And smelled how it quenched the parched asphalt road and soil.

rin: Narungog ko na su arayong ugong ku salog ag nagdalagan na ako parani.
eng: I heard the distant roaring of the river and I began running towards it.

rin: Pag-uban-uban nakaabot na 'ko sadto pangpang ag pigsilngan ko sana su nagbubulos na 'lang lumot na tubig abang nag-aangos-angos.
eng: After a time I reached its banks and just looked at the rushing green waters as I gasped for breath.

rin: Uda su mga babaying naglalaba sadi salog, ag uda su mga damulag na kaibang naririgos ka mga mariribok na igin.
eng: There were no women washing clothes in the river, and no carabaos bathing together with squealing children.

rin: Pig-isip ko man na malalamasa 'ko ku paraaling gamit su bugtong.
eng: I did think of getting beaten by the yaya with the bugtong.

rin: Su manipis na kalap na biniribdan a puro sa lubid na abaka.
eng: This thin, bamboo stick with its tip wrapped in a rope of hemp.

rin: Na piggagamit nirang panakot kanamo pero panlapdos sa damulag 'nganing umiwag.
eng: Which they threatened us with but was used to swat the carabaos into motion.

rin: Pig-iisip ko man kin gaumno 'di kasanit abang nagsisibog parayo sadto pangpang ku salog.
eng: I thought of how much it would sting as I backed away from the river's edge.

rin: Pa'la pig-isip ko man na maray pa 'kong maglalangoy kin malalapnitan man sana ko.
eng: Then I thought that I might as well swim if I would be punished for it.

rin: Abang dinalagan akong binwelo palukso sadto salog.
eng: As I ran forward to launch myself to jump into the river.

rin: Linanding ako sa dakulong bato sadto irarom ku tubig.
eng: I landed on a boulder underwater.

rin: Nagngungurot, pig-apulas ko su lubot ko ag narutaan kading kamot ko su dakulong bato.
eng: Wincing, I rubbed my backside and my hand grazed the boulder.

rin: Pa'la nag-iwag su bato.
eng: Then the boulder moved.

rin: Nagbaliskad ako ag naglangoy pararom 'nganing mamansayan sa arani.
eng: I turned over and swam deeper to take a closer look.

rin: Nabayad ko na sadto man nanggad su bato, uda man makangangalas sadto.
eng: I saw that the boulder was right where it was, nothing special about it.

rin: Anggan sa umiwag adi utro pa'la sadto ko narisang usad palan na 'lakadakulong mata.
eng: Until it moved again and I realized that it was a giant eye.

rin: Syempre nagrait ako.
eng: Of course I screamed.

rin: Raot sa pagmati.
eng: Awful sensation.

rin: Nagrarait ag nagtutulon sa tubig.
eng: Screaming and swallowing water.

rin: Isipon mo a nagkukutkutat na manok na nagkukupad-kupad a pakpak sa irarom ka tubig.
eng: Imagine a squawking chicken flapping its wings while underwater.

rin: Arog ako kan su itsura ko.
eng: That's how I looked.

rin: Ag pa'la naiitganan na 'ko.
eng: And then I was choking.

rin: Pa'la nag-iwag su bilog na espasyo sa irarom ko ag nakakaangos na utro 'ko sa angin sa pag-ultanan ka pag-ubo ka tubig.
eng: And then the whole space beneath me moved and I was breathing air once more in between coughing out water.

rin: Ag pa'la ibinusol ako paiyan sadto ababow na parte ag piglilili ko kin uno su nagbusol kanako.
eng: And then I was pushed to the shallow end and I turned around to see what had pushed me.

rin: Ag pa'la nabayad ko su nilalang, o parte sana niya, bagana 'di payo sa buaya, pero sampulong beses a pagkadakulo.
eng: And then I saw the creature, or at least a part of it, it looked like a crocodile's head, only ten times bigger.

rin: Nagrait ako utro ag pigdali ko 'ya diretso sa alinuwnow ku gugom ko.
eng: I screamed once more and hit it right in its pupil with my fist.

rin: Nagrait ako "Aww!" abang pig-aapulas ko su kamot ko, tinalikod ag kinuripas makaawas sa salog.
eng: I screamed "Ouch!" as I cradled my hand, turning and scrambling out of the river.

rin: Sabi niya "Aww!" sa pag-ultanan ka pagngurob-ngurob "Nabuta ko! Nabuta ko!" .
eng: It said "Ouch!" in between mumbling "I'm blind! I'm blind!".

rin: Ag pigbabaoy niya 'kong usad na "Sadit na dyablong isura!".
eng: And calling me a "Little evil fish!".

rin: Buko tabi akong sadit na dyablong isura!
eng: I am not a little evil fish!

rin: Sadit akong babaying igin!
eng: I'm a little girl!

rin: Pigsilyakan ko 'ya abang pabirik ako 'nganing atubangon iya.
eng: I screamed at it as I turned around to face it.

rin: Diri mo 'ko pag-ungaon kin pauno kong naintindiyan su pigsasabi niya.
eng: Don't ask me how I understood what it was saying.

rin: Diri mo man 'ko ungaon kin ngata ta arog kadto su reaksyon ko.
eng: Don't ask me either why I reacted that way.

rin: Baad nasindakan man sana 'ko.
eng: It must've been shock.

rin: O 'baad sutil man nangga'd ading tagasyudad kong rira.
eng: Or just my wayward city tongue.

rin: O 'baad ading pagigin malakaubin ko, o kadungasan sana talaga.
eng: Or being terribly young, or sheer stupidity.

rin: Isi ko yan, kapatal mo man, Nining!
eng: I know that, you stupid little girl!

rin: Di' nira ika sinabiyan na diri mag-iyan san salog pag Agua de Mayo?
eng: Didn't they tell you not to come to the river on Agua de Mayo?

rin: Nagrarait, biyong nauungot.
eng: It cried, affronted.

rin: Nang-angsa na ag gusto kong maglangoy! tirada ko.
eng: It was so hot and I wanted to swim! I sniped.

rin: Amo sana kintana di panawon na masasadiri ko ding salog ag rinaot mo pa, sabi niya.
eng: The only time I can have the river to myself and you ruin it, it muttered.

rin: Ngata? Kanimo 'ding salog ha? pigsilyakan ko iya.
eng: Why? Is the river yours? I screamed at it.

rin: Ta pigsisilyakan mo 'ko?
eng: Why are you screaming at me?

rin: Ugot baga 'ko!
eng: I'm the bayawak!

rin: Mag-tao ikang galang!
eng: Show a little respect!

rin: Makatakot man ika! Nagrait adi.
eng: Show fear! It roared.

rin: Ugot, amo yan baoy nira sadto dragon ko.
eng: The bayawak, that's what they called my dragon.

rin: A atungal na an a nagpaisip kanako ag napangabil manungod sa dragon.
eng: And it was that roar that made me think and chatter of dragons.

rin: Siguro nakatakot sana 'ko na kaunon niya 'ko kaya pig-aabala ko sana a pag-ablo niya, kaya sige kong rimong-rimong.
eng: Maybe I was really terrified that it would eat me and I was delaying its feast, and that was why I babbled.

rin: Syempre diri niya 'ko kinaon, pero nagsabi iya na migkaon iya sa tawo kin alop ag ungot iya.
eng: Obviously, it didn't eat me, but it did say that it would eat a human being if it were hungry and angry.

rin: Pangala naglubto na iya sadto tubig labing nag-uula ako sadto pangpang ag kinabisara niya ko.
eng: Anyway, it settled in the water as I sat on the riverbank and it talked to me.

rin: Nagparatuab-tuab sana iya manungod kadi, manungod kiton, nag-unga iya kanako labing pig-iistoryanan ko iya manungod ku pamilya ko, pag-iskwela, a syudad, a telebisyon, Betamax, ag pagbuway-buway.
eng: And it yakked and yakked about this and that, asking me questions as I told it about my family, school, the city, the television, Betamax, and life.

rin: Sinabiyan ko iya kin ngata ta kada babayi malakagustong i-tease a bok nira ag pa'la ispriyan sa Aquanet, ag pa'la kagusto nirang magsusupong sa shoulder pads.
eng: I told it how every girl liked to tease her hair and spray Aquanet all over it, and that they liked to wear shoulder pads.

rin: Sinabiyan ko man iya na kagusto kong magparangayamon sa Atari video games alagad diri man ako makakangayamon kadi anggan sa gusto ko ta si Daddy pirmi a nagngangayamon kadi.
eng: I told it how much I liked to play Atari video games but I couldn't play with it as much as I wanted to because Daddy was playing with it all the time.

rin: Diri ko man ngani naiintindiyan maski kabanga sana ku pigbibisara niya ta diri ko man isi a buot sabiyon ka ibang ngangabilon na piggagamit niya.
eng: I didn't even understand half of what it said at that time because I didn't know what some words it used meant.

rin: Ya, uno baya ginigibo mo sadi?
eng: So, what are you doing here?

rin: Pig-unga ko iya ku nagpundo iya sa pagparaunga ag pagsimbag sa mga sinasabi ko.
eng: I asked when it paused in its questioning and reacting to what I said.

rin: Buko man sana ika a napupurisaw ka init.
eng: You're not the only one who's bothered by the heat.

rin: Kadto sana namo narisa na nagpundo na palan su uran ag nagbababow na su salog.
eng: It was then that we noticed that it had stopped raining and that the river was becoming shallow once more.

rin: Miggalin na ika?
eng: You have to go?

rin: Unga ko, nagdudurdarwa ag mamundo sa gatingay.
eng: I asked, uncertain and a little sad.

rin: Abo ko iyang maggalin.
eng: I did not want it to go away.

rin: Amo.
eng: Yes.

rin: Okay. Mig-uli naman lugod ako.
eng: Okay. I have to go back, too.

rin: Pig-aanap na gayod nira ko.
eng: They might be looking for me.

rin: Pig-aanap naman gayod ika ku pamilya mo?
eng: Your family might be looking for you, too?

rin: Pig-unga ko 'ya pero diri iya nagsimbag.
eng: I asked but it didn't answer.

rin: Migbayadan kita utro, ngani?
eng: Anyway, I'll see you again, right?

rin: Baydon ta sa sunod na Agua de Mayo, kin ika o ako makatunga sadi.
eng: Let's see until the next Agua de Mayo, if you or I will be here.

rin: Mas maray kin diri mo ipag-istorya sa iba a manungod kanako.
eng: It's best if you don't tell anyone about me.

rin: Ngata man ta diri?
eng: Why not?

rin: Unga ko, pig-iisip ko man kin agko man nanggayod magtubod kanako.
eng: I asked, wondering if anyone would believe me anyway.

rin: Ya amo! Ulat, ika na sana a sikreto kong amigo!
eng: Fine! Wait, you can be my secret friend!

rin: Alagad naggalin na su ugot.
eng: But the bayawak had gone.

rin: Uri ko nang naisip labing nag-aagi pabalik sadto baloy ku pakuapuon ko na diri ko isi su ngaran niya.
eng: I later realized as I walked back to my grandfather's house that I didn't even know its proper name.

rin: Ag diri man niya isi su ngaran ko.
eng: And it didn't even know mine.

rin: Pangala nagpundo na 'kong pagparaisipon iya abang nag-iiratong sadto baloy, pig-iisip ko kin pauno koeksplikar ading basa kong bado.
eng: Then I stopped worrying about it as I neared the house, worrying instead of how I would explain my wet clothes.

rin: Pigsabi ko kanda ngamin na naisipan kong magngayamon sa uran ta Agua de Mayo man.
eng: I told everyone that I decided to play in the rain since it was Agua de Mayo.

rin: Amo 'di pirmi kong palusot kanda ngamin kada pagtapos ka tag-init.
eng: It was the same excuse I would give every sommer's end to everyone.

rin: Sa sunod na tag-init ag kada tag-init pagkatapos kadto, migparaiyan ako sadto salog pag nag-uran na man nanggayod.
eng: The next summer and every summer after that I would come to the river when the rain had finally come.

rin: Su ugot pirming sadto, nagpaparaulat kanako.
eng: The bayawak waiting for me was always there.

rin: Su pangarwang beses ko iyang nabayad, nagtuytoy ako sa kaabaan ku taludtod niya, na puno sa lumot na bagana bato.
eng: The second time I saw it, I walked the length of its back, full of green lumps as hard as rocks.

rin: Alagad bagana guma sa pagmati, pigsusukol ko 'ya, kaiba su ikog niya, gamit su plastik na ruler na dara ko.
eng: But which felt like rubber, measuring it, including its tail, with the plastic ruler I brought with me.

rin: Ginamit ko pa sana adtong ruler ku nagngayamon kami sa uru-espadahan ku pinsan ko.
eng: I used the ruler before that in a mini-sword fight with one of my cousins.

rin: Pigtabangan niya 'ko na magkwenta sa 12 pulgada na pirang beses abang pinapaligid-ligid ko su ruler, arog ka pantira sa shato, 26 na beses.
eng: It helped me add 12 inches so many times as I rolled the ruler, like a stick in shato, 26 times.

rin: Sinabi niya kanako na agko 12 pulgada sa usad na pye ag agko 3.28 na pye sa usad na metro.
eng: It told me that there were 12 inches in one foot and there were 3.28 feet in one meter.

rin: Kaya gaumno 'di kaaba sa pulgada, sa pye, ag sa metro ag kwentahon ko kuno.
eng: So how long was it in inches, feet, and meter and I should do the math.

rin: Mala ko kapagal ag ribong pakatapos.
eng: I was really tired and confused after.

rin: Su ikatulong beses kong nabayad iya, pigtugal ko iyang mag-asag.
eng: The third time I saw it, I asked it to turn over.

rin: Ag nabayad ko su kulit niya sa buros na kulor gatas ag ku kinaputan ko, bagana 'ko nagkapot sa basang kuskos sa isura o sa basang tugaw.
eng: And I saw that the skin of its belly was off-white and when I touched it, it felt like touching wet fish scales or a wet lizard.

rin: Su ikaupat na beses kong nabayad iya, pigtugal ko iyang buksan su panga niya 'nganing mabayad ko a ngipon niya alagad nagsayuma su ugot ta pagmati kuno niya bagana iya kabayo.
eng: The fourth time I saw it, I asked it to open its jaws so that I could see its teeth but the bayawak refused to do so because it said that I made it feel like a horse.

rin: Amo nadto su katapusan ku pisikal na eksaminasyon ko kanya.
eng: That was the end of my physical examination of it.

rin: Pirmi niya 'kong dadarawon sadto salog lunad san payo niya.
eng: It would often take me up the river on its head.

rin: Ag dadarawon niya ako sa mga lugar na uda pa basang nakakaabot ag nakakabayad
eng: And would take me to places where no one had been and seen

rin: Lain sa pirang mga agta na minsan nag-aagi-agi, sabi niya.
eng: Except some Aetas who would wander off every now and then, it said.

rin: Bagana 'ko su igin na lalaking nakalunad sa taludtod ku dragon sadto The NeverEnding Story.
eng: I felt like that boy riding on a dragon's back from the The NeverEnding Story.

rin: Ag nagrait ako na bagana sadit na igin na babayi pag naglangoy iya sa 'lang ispid.
eng: And I did squeal like a little girl when it swam faster.

rin: Sabi niya kanako pumundo kuno 'ko tabi sa rait na bagana sadit na igin na babayi.
eng: It told me to please stop squealing like a little girl.

rin: Itututturo ag pagngangaranan niya a mga kawoy, burak, ag mga ayop, ag pirmi iyang agko gatingay na istorya manungod kading mga bagay na adi.
eng: It would point and name trees, flowers and animals, and always with a little story about these things.

rin: Alimbawa, pigtutturo niya usad na beses su salamander, na a baoy namo tuko.
eng: For example, he pointed out a salamander once, which we called tuko.

rin: Ag sinabi niya kanako na maiisiyan ko kuno kin mig-uran o mig-init kinaugmaan pag binilang ko kin pirang beses adi magtu-"tuko".
eng: And told me that I could tell whether it would be rainy or sunny the next day by counting how many times it cried "tuko".

rin: Ultanan a "init" ag "uran" abang pigbibilang ko kin pirang beses adi nagtangis.
eng: To alternate "sun" and "rain" as I count the number of times it cried.

rin: Kin uno su masakto sa uring numero amo yan magigin panawon pag sunod na aldow.
eng: Whichever falls on the last number would be the weather for the next day.

rin: Kada ginigibo ko yan, pagsunod na aldow tama man.
eng: Every time I did that, the next day would prove it right.

rin: Pigsabiyan niya ako ka mga bagay na arog kan.
eng: It told me things like that.

rin: Ag pirmi, ibabalik ako ka ugot kin sari kami primerong nagkabayadan abang nag-uurow na a unang uran.
eng: And always, the bayawak would return me to where we met just as the first rain was about to end.

rin: Abang nag-aagi a taon, a usipan namo nagda-dalagan man: mga munyika, mga mararaot na maestro, pastidyong mga igin na lalaki, ag nagdadakulong mga suso.
eng: Through the years, our conversations progressed: dolls, evil teachers, mean boys, and growing breasts.

rin: Sa silong mo migdakulo abang pigtutuldo ko 'ding rurug'gan ko sa kauyaman. man raw adi?
eng: Do you think these would grow bigger?

rin: Unga ko abang pigtutuldo ko 'ding rurug'gan ko sa kauyaman.
eng: I asked as I pointed to my chest in disgust.

rin: Sa mga nabayad ko, amo.
eng: From what I've seen, yes.

rin: Nakakaupol sana di ag kaipuwan ko pa lugod magsupong sa bra ag diri ako makainga, naggumod-gumod ako ag nag-irik-itik iya.
eng: They only get in the way and I have to wear these bras and I can't breathe, I grumbled and it sniggered.

rin: Diri ko isi na kaya palan an gibuwon ka mga dragon.
eng: I didn't know that dragons could actually do that.

rin: Uno ta nagpatusar palan ika?
eng: Why did you cut your hair?

rin: K'wasang su usad na babayi sadto iskwelan inumaliwan ako sa kuto kaya pinatusaran ako ni Mama sadto parlor.
eng: Because one of the girls in school gave me lice and Mama had my hair cut in the parlor.

rin: Uno man kan, kalalawgon ko na nguwan si Demi Moore ag 'lang gayon baga niya!
eng: Besides, I now look like Demi Moore and she's so pretty!

rin: Siisay?
eng: Who?

rin: Ag pa'la pig-istoryawan ko na iya ku pelikulang Ghost.
eng: And then I told it about the movie Ghost.

rin: Pa'la manungod na sa VHS players ag Laser Discs, high school, crushes, kin paunong ma-in love ki Kurt Cobain, pagbasa sa Sweet Dreams ag Sweet Valley ag Mills & Boon, ag magkaulangan.
eng: Then it was about VHS players and Laser Discs, high school, crushes, being in love with Kurt Cobain, reading Sweet Dreams and Sweet Valley and Mills & Boon, and having my period.

rin: Uno yan na supong mo?
eng: What are you wearing?

rin: Bagana ika paralimos.
eng: You look like a beggar.

rin: Gusto man raw an ni Kurt Cobain a itsura mo?
eng: Does this Kurt Cobain like how you look?

rin: Bata mo ya?
eng: Is he your boyfriend?

rin: Pigsilngan ko su gasi kong pantalon ag lubad na bado, "Grunge adi."
eng: I looked at my torn jeans and faded shirt, "It's grunge."

rin: Ag pig-istoryawan ko iya manungod ka Nirvana ag ku musika nira ag ta sa agko 'ko maabang bok mas makaka-headbang akong tunay.
eng: And I told it about Nirvana and their music and that because I had long hair I could headbang better.

rin: Naririsa kong nalalangkag na adi abang nasa pangpang ako ku salog, nagduduru-darwang maglubto.
eng: I could see that it was growing impatient as I stayed by the riverbank, hesitating to go into the river.

rin: Uno ta abo mong maglubto sadi tubig?
eng: Why won't you get into the water?

rin: Uno maraot kanimo nguwan na aldow?
eng: What's wrong with you today?

rin: Iba a parong mo.
eng: You smell different.

rin: Diri mo tabi pagsabiyon na malangsi, ngurob ko.
eng: Please don't say fishy, I muttered.

rin: Uno?
eng: What?

rin: Diri ako nguwan makakalangoy kasabay mo.
eng: I can't swim with you today.

rin: Diri ako pwedeng mabasa.
eng: I can't even get wet.

rin: Sabi ku mga gurang makakapay kuno 'ko kin mabasa ako.
eng: The old women said that I would go crazy if I did.

rin: Ag pigpupulikat ako sa maray ag diri ako makaiwag ag sabi pa nira arog talaga kuno kadi a mga bagay ta parte kuno 'di ka pagkastigo ka Dyos ka orihinal na kasalan ni Eba.
eng: And I'm cramping so bad and I can barely move and they said that it's just the way things are because it's all part of God's punishment for Eve's Original Sin.

rin: Siisay man nagsabi kanimo ka masimot na an?
eng: Who told you that shit?

rin: Diri ika magmuda!
eng: Don't curse!

rin: Una pigtutturuan mo 'ko, pala abo mong gamiton ko su pigtutturo mo kanako.
eng: First you teach me, then you don't want me to use what you taught me.

rin: Bukong sinabiyan ika nira na DIRI mo pagdiktawan a mga gurang kin uno nira gigibuwon?
eng: Didn't they ever tell you NOT to tell an elder what to do?

rin: Nguwan, uno baya problema mo?
eng: Now, what's wrong with you?

rin: Nagkakaulangan ako, amo?
eng: I have my period, okay?

rin: Sabi niya "Ah" na bagana naintindiyan na niya ngamin.
eng: It said "Ah" like everything suddenly made sense.

rin: Ay pumundo ika.
eng: Oh, shut up.

rin: Ag syempre ginibo niya.
eng: And of course it did just that.

rin: Tanganing uyamon ako o 'baad nagigin mabuot sana iya ta pigsabiyan ko.
eng: Just to exasperate me or maybe it was being considerate because I asked it to.

rin: Baad, 'baad, 'baad, amo sana yan ngamin naiisip ko pag agko 'ko regla.
eng: Maybe, maybe, maybe, that was all I could think whenever I had my period.

rin: Kaya ku apon na adto, nag-ula sana 'ko sadto pangpang ku salog ag pig-iisip ko na nakakapay na 'ko abang nag-uulat sana iyang punok sadto tubig.
eng: So that afternoon, I sat by the riverbank and thought that I was going crazy and it just waited in the water and kept quiet.

rin: Ku nag-urow na su uran, nagray na su pagmati ko.
eng: When the rain had stopped, I felt better.

rin: Ag dawa nabasa ako, diri man ako nakapay arog ku sabi ku mga gurang na babayi.
eng: And even though I got wet, I didn't go crazy like the old women said.

rin: Ag dangan, ku mga uring taon, manungod na sa VCD players, mga problema sa pamilya, college, kauragan ka mga lalaki.
eng: And then, in the later years, it was about VCD players, family problems, college, men-are-bastards.

rin: Ag kin uno mga gusto kong gibuwon sa buway.
eng: And what I wanted to do with my life.

rin: Ay, dakol man nanggad na kauragan ka mga lalaki.
eng: Oh, men can be bastards.

rin: Diri ika tinutturuan ka mga libro ag pelikula mo kan?
eng: Didn't your books and movies teach you that?

rin: Sa silong ko, kin sari man an, agko usad na perpektong lalaking ka among tuod ka ideal man mo.
eng: But I suppose, somewhere out there, there's a man who is as perfect as your ideal man.

rin: Baad ipinako man sa krus, ka usad na opinyonadang babaying arog mo.
eng: Probably nailed to a cross, too, by some opinionated woman like you.

rin: O 'baad ginusto man na niya 'ding gibuwon na sana sa sadiri niya, sabi kadi.
eng: Or he probably decided to do it himself, it muttered.

rin: Pero su ugot, pirming iniiwas sa ibang mga unga ko.
eng: The bayawak, on the other hand, would always shy away from certain questions I asked.

rin: Arog baga kin agko iya pamilya.
eng: Like if it had a family.

rin: Sari iya nag-iistar?
eng: Where it lived?

rin: Sari iya galin?
eng: Where it came from?

rin: Uno ta 'la niya kadakulo?
eng: Why it was so big?

rin: Pira na edad niya?
eng: How old it was?

rin: Kin makikibisara man iya sa iba.
eng: If it could talk to anyone else.

rin: Kin babayi o lalaki iya.
eng: If it was male or female.

rin: Kin magraraan man iya.
eng: If it could die.

rin: Naturan ko sa pag-agi ku mga taon na diri na magparaunga ag akuon na sana kin uno iya.
eng: I learned through the years to stop asking and simply accept it for what it was.

rin: Kadto adto napatalukso kin gaumno kamundo magin ugot.
eng: That was when it had let slip how lonely it was being the bayawak.

rin: Alimbawa, Agua de Mayo sana a solamen-teng panawon na makakadulag iya sadto prisuwan na ginibo na niyang istaran.
eng: For instance, Agua de Mayo was the only time it could escape its prison which it had made into its home.

rin: Minsan, agko iya amigo na arog ko kadtong mala nang ubang panawon, ag su babayi nag-istar kaibanan niya.
eng: Once, it had a friend like me a long, long time ago, and the girl came to live with it.

rin: Pero naggurang adi saka nagraan.
eng: But she grew old and died.

rin: Uda iya pamilya ag diri niya marumruman na nagkaagko iya kadi, lain sana kadtong babaying adto.
eng: And that it had no family and didn't remember ever having one, except for that girl.

rin: Saka bukong mamuya na kinakatakutan.
eng: Or that it was no fun to be feared.

rin: Kinakatakutan iya ta diri iya naiintindiyan.
eng: It was feared because it was not understood.

rin: Ag ta miling pigtatakutan, dapat pagsusugidon ag titigbakon.
eng: And because it was feared, it was to be hunted and destroyed.

rin: Arog kan mag-iwag a kinaban.
eng: That's the way the world works.

rin: Ag amo yan a rason kin ngata ta pigpapromisa manungod niya ko na diri mag-istorya kiisay man kading agi-agi ag iristoryawan namo pag Agua de Mayo.
eng: And that was why it made me promise not to tell anyone about our journeys and conversations on Agua de Mayo.

rin: Ag diri mag-iba maski siisay.
eng: And never to bring anyone.

rin: Ngata ta diri?
eng: But why not?

rin: Unga ko kanya labing binnababa ako sadto taludtod niya paiyan sadto pangpang ku salog.
eng: I asked as I scrambled off its back and waded towards the riverbank.

rin: Maray man ikang nilalang.
eng: You are a nice creature.

rin: Kin isi sana nira kin gaumnoy 'ka karay, diri na ika nira rarakupon ag gagamiton pantakot sa mga igin.
eng: If they only knew how nice you are, then they won't hunt you anymore or use you to scare children.

rin: Pangala pwede na ikang makibistuwan ag makibisara sa ibang tawo.
eng: Then you can meet and talk to other people.

rin: Kawasa patal a mga tawo.
eng: Because people are stupid.

rin: Narumruman mo man ngamin na pakaraot na sinabi nira manungod sa mga dragon ag manungod kanako.
eng: Remember all that rubbish they say about dragons and about me.

rin: Mag-imati ika, kin ibang tawo nakabayad kanako ku aldow na adto pirang taon na nakakaagi, biyo man nanggayod sirang "freaked out" arog ku sabi mo.
eng: Listen, if it were any other person who saw me that day years ago, they would have "freaked out" as you put it.

rin: Gigibuwon nira kintana a pinakamaray ag pinakamagalang na bagay, a magdalagan padulag ag diri na magbalik, o atakiyon sa puso.
eng: They would have done the sensible and respectable thing to do, which was run and never come back, or have a heart attack.

rin: Ya mala?
eng: But see?

rin: Di' ko baga ginibo, reklamo ko.
eng: I didn't, I protested.

rin: Amo, buot sabiyon iba man ika.
eng: Yes, which goes to show that you're different.

rin: Kapay kaya ika.
eng: You're weird.

rin: Salamat ha, o 'baad kapay sana ikang dragon.
eng: Thanks a lot, or maybe you're just a weird dragon.

rin: Simbag ko kanya.
eng: I retorted.

rin: Nagtawa sana 'ya, o 'baad sa isip ko sana na nagtawa iya.
eng: It laughed, or at least I thought it did.

rin: Nagpundo na sa uran.
eng: The rain has stopped.

rin: Sabi ko pa'la nabayad kong uda na naman su ugot.
eng: I said but I saw that the bayawak had gone once more.

rin: Ku sunod na taon, nag-iyan ako sadto salog bago iya mag-abot.
eng: The next year, I came to the river before it did.

rin: Pigparaulat ko iya pati su uran.
eng: I waited for it and waited for the rain.

rin: Sigurado ako na pariyo sirang umaabot labing nag-uulat ako.
eng: Certain that both would come as I waited.

rin: Pa'la, nag-abot na su uran ag su ugot napasilag na.
eng: Soon, the rain had come and the bayawak had surfaced.

rin: Nagtindog ako sadto gilid ku salog ag pigsilngan ko sana 'di.
eng: I stood by the bank and simply looked at it.

rin: Uno pa pig-uulat mo?
eng: What are you waiting for?

rin: Mayna, nguwan na aldow, ipapabayad ko kanimo kin sari ako nakaistar.
eng: Come, today, I'll show you where I live.

rin: Agko 'ko kaiba, sabi ko labing pigkakayab ko na magrapo su lalaking nagtatago ag nagsisirong sadto irarom ku kawoy.
eng: I brought someone with me, I said as I waved a man over who was hiding and seeking shelter from the rain under a tree.

rin: Iya su lalaking papakasalan ko.
eng: It's the man I will marry.

rin: Gusto kong mabisto mo iya.
eng: I want you to meet him.

rin: Uno?
eng: What?

rin: Nag-atungal iya.
eng: It roared.

rin: Nagpromisa ika!
eng: You promised!

rin: Ag padagos iyang nag-aatungal.
eng: And it kept on roaring.

rin: Diri ko maintindiyan kin ngata ta 'lakaungot niya.
eng: I did not fully understand why it was so angry.

rin: Piglamasa ku ugot su ikog niya sadto tubig, na nagpapakaraw-kasaw ag napapaalon.
eng: The bayawak was whipping its tail against the water, causing splashes and waves.

rin: Su pag-aatungal niya bagana daguldol.
eng: Its roars sounded like thunder.

rin: Su lalaking nasa talikuran ko nagparakagrat ku nabayad niya 'di ag nagdalagan parayo labing nagkakagrat.
eng: The man behind me screamed as soon as he saw it and ran away still screaming.

rin: Nag-atungal pang usad na beses su ugot pa'la nauda na sadto tubig.
eng: The bayawak roared once more and then disappeared under the water.

rin: Ulat!
eng: Wait!

rin: Iyak ko, diri ako sigurado kin kiisay ako nag-iiyak, 'baad sadto darwa o sadto sana usad.
eng: I cried, uncertain to whom I was saying it, perhaps to both or only one.

rin: Su kinatapusan, nabayaan akong solo.
eng: In the end, I was left alone.

rin: Su lalaking papakasalan ko bagana pigsusubi-subing nagparapamarita na kapay kuno 'ko, ag agko kuno alimaw sadto salog.
eng: The man I was supposed to marry hysterically babbled to everyone that I was crazy, and that there was a monster in the river.

rin: Syempre binayaan ko adtong tapayason na adto.
eng: Of course I dumped that coward.

rin: Pero nagtubod su mga tawo, pala agko na uring-uding na agko naibanan kuno 'ko ku ugot.
eng: But people believed him, and soon there were whispers that I was enchanted by the bayawak.

rin: Ngaya isi man nira na sala ta gurang na 'ko para magngayamon sa uran pag Agua de Mayo.
eng: That they should have known that something was wrong because I was too old to play in the rain on Agua de Mayo.

rin: Dinara 'ko sa mga doktor sa payo ag sa mga albularyo pero uda ako sinabi kanda manungod sadto dragon ko.
eng: I was taken to head doctors and quack doctors but I never said anything about my dragon.

rin: Pa'la pinabayaan naman sana nira 'ko ta normal man ako, uda man ipinagkaiba sa iba.
eng: They soon left me alone because I was so normal, nothing special, after all.

rin: Paglabos ku panawon, nagin kaibanan na sana ako sa mga istorya ku mga gurang na babayi manungod sa ugot.
eng: Later on, I became just a figment in old women's stories about the bayawak.

rin: Ag kin ngata ta a mga igin ag mga tawo magrayo dapat sa salog pag Agua de Mayo.
eng: And why children and people should stay away from the river on Agua de Mayo.

rin: Pa'la nag-abot na su mga pararakop sa ayop ag mga turista, ngamin gusto sa palas ku ugot.
eng: Then hunting parties and tourists soon followed, all wanting a piece of the bayawak.

rin: Narungog kaya nira na a namit kuno kadi bagana man sana manok, mas masiram pa ngani kuno.
eng: They heard that it would taste just like chicken, only better.

rin: Pigparaulat nira adto, a sunod na Agua de Mayo.
eng: They all waited for it, for the next Agua de Mayo.

rin: Uda man nakabayad o nakarakop kadto, syempre, ta uda man makatukod kin kuno mig-abot a unang uran.
eng: Nobody saw or caught it, of course, because nobody could predict when the first rain would come.

rin: Kapatal talaga ka mga tawo.
eng: People really are stupid.

rin: Una talaga nira migpabayad an?
eng: Did they really think that it would show itself?

rin: Salamat na sana ta madaling malangkag ag malingaw a mga tawo.
eng: Thankfully people bore and forget easily.

rin: Pag-agi sa usad na taon ag usad pang taon ag usad pa, pinabayaan na su salog ag su ugot.
eng: After a year and then another and another, the river and the bayawak were left alone once more.

rin: Narurungog ko minsan na agko pa mga tawong mag-iiyan na pig-aanap adi.
eng: I heard that sometimes there were still some people who came looking for it.

rin: Alagad mag-iiyan sirang sala sa panawon ag pirming para sa salang rason.
eng: But they came on the wrong season and always for the wrong reason.

rin: Ku ikaupat na taon, nag-ulat ako sadto gilid ku salog labing nag-iiratong a iuuran ag nag-iinapos man a tag-init.
eng: In the fourth year, I waited by the river as soon as the rain had come and summer had ended.

rin: Isi kong san sana iya ag isi niya na bumabalik ako, alagad diri iya nagpasilag.
eng: I knew that it was there just as it knew that I would come back, but it never showed itself.

rin: Patawad, sabi ko sadto malumot na tubig.
eng: I'm sorry, I said to the green waters.

rin: Bumalik ika, sabi ko sadto malumot na tubig ku sunod na taon.
eng: Come back, I said to the green waters in the next year.

rin: Baad, kin kunong Agua de Mayo, migbalik ako ag 'baad kan mapatawad mo na 'ko.
eng: Maybe, on some Agua de Mayo, I will come back and by then you would have forgiven me.

rin: Baad kan magigin amiga mo na ako utro, sabi ko ku sunod na taon.
eng: Maybe then I can be your friend again, I said in the year after.

rin: Alagad diri iya nagsimbag.
eng: But it never answered.
