rin: Diri nauban naggalin na ako sa sadiring banwaan ag nagdesisyon na maglipat sadi syudad na adi kin sari bagana pirming nagmamadali a mga tawo.
eng: I soon left my hometown and decided to move to this city where everyone always seemed to be rushing.

rin: Ag pinalid na 'ko ka kasibutan ka pagbuway.
eng: And I was swept away by the tasks of living.

rin: Nagtatrabaho ag diri nababayadan sa tama.
eng: Working and never getting paid enough.

rin: Nagbabayad sa mga bayaran.
eng: Paying bills.

rin: Nag-iinom sa mga bar.
eng: Drinking in bars.

rin: Nakikitagbuan ag nakikitawaan sa mga tawo 'nganing mabawasan a kamunduan.
eng: Meeting and laughing with people to ease our loneliness.

rin: Ag nagpapa-ayaay sa spas.
eng: And relaxing in spas.

rin: Sa paglabos ku mga taon, nalingawan ko na a manungod sa Agua de Mayo.
eng: And as the years passed, I have forgotten about Agua de Mayo.

rin: Madaling malingaw sadi syudad na adi.
eng: It is easy to forget in this city.

rin: Diri mag-uuran o init kin kuno dapat na mag-uran o init.
eng: It doesn't rain or shine when it's supposed to.

rin: Aros magtubod na 'ko na su ugot pantasya ko man sana ku igin pa 'ko o pangaturganan sana.
eng: I was almost convinced that the bayawak was a childhood fancy or a dream.

rin: Alagad usad na apon na tag-init, naturakan ko a sadiri ko na nakaula sa usad na kaunan na dating lumang baloy sa usad na lugar sa Greenhills.
eng: But one summer afternoon, I found myself sitting inside one of the restaurants that used to be an old house somewhere in Greenhills.

rin: Pig-uulat ko su kaiba ko ku nagsirang ako sadto bintana abang nag-iigop sa iced tea.
eng: I was waiting for my companion when I looked out the window as I sipped my iced tea.

rin: Pagsilong mo sa luwas, iisipon mo na nasa apwera ikang lugar-agko natad, kawoy, ag mga sulog na manok.
eng: Looking outside, you would almost think that you were in some far-flung town with the yard, trees, and the roosters.

rin: Namati kong nagpundo su kinaban.
eng: I felt the whole world pause.

rin: Bagana agko pig-uulat.
eng: It seemed to be waiting for something.

rin: Pa'la nagturo na su unang uran, gatingay ag maluway.
eng: Then the first drops of rain came, few and slow.

rin: Pa'la dagos-dagos na ag pa'la nagbubulos na.
eng: Then it became steady and then it poured.

rin: Pa'la nag-angos su bilog na kinaban.
eng: And the whole world sighed.

rin: Narumruman ko su Agua de Mayo ag su ugot labing pigsisilngan ko su turo ku uran na nanananggilid sadto salming na bintana.
eng: I remembered Agua de Mayo and the bayawak as I watched raindrops slide down the glass windows.

rin: Isi kong bagana ko itsurang kapay.
eng: I knew that I looked silly.

rin: Ading ordinaryong 28 anyos na babayi na solong nakaula na nagtatangis bayad kading mga diri niya kabisto.
eng: This ordinary 28-year-old woman sitting alone and crying in view of these strangers.

rin: Alagad uda man mikilabot kanimo sadi syudad na adi.
eng: But no one would really care in this city.

rin: Uda sadi dragon.
eng: There are no dragons here.

rin: Amo yan sabi sadi maribok, maati, ag matawong syudad.
eng: That's what they say in this bustling, polluted, overcrowded city.

rin: Uda man nanggad dragon sadi syudad na adi.
eng: Of course there is no dragon in this city.

rin: Alagad agko raw migtubod kanako kin sabiyon ko na agko usad sadi.
eng: But would anyone believe me if I said that there is one here.

rin: A sadiri tang klaseng dragon.
eng: Our own kind of dragon.

rin: Ag nakaistar adi sa salog na malumot a tubig mga 400 kilometro pa-sur sa usad na baryo na a baoy Santiago?
eng: And it lives in a river of green waters 400 or so kilometers to the south in a barrio called Santiago?

rin: Magtubod raw ika kanako na magpapasilag adi pag Agua de Mayo ag pig-uulat pa nanggad ako kadi?
eng: Would you believe me if I told you that it still comes out on Agua de Mayo and it is still waiting for me?

rin: Mawot ko na kabisaranon na niya 'ko ag akuon na utro niya 'kong amiga.
eng: I hope it will talk to me and take me back as its friend.

rin: Baad istoryawan ko iya manungod ka DVDs ag ka Internet ag iPods ag kin uno pa.
eng: Maybe I will even get to tell it about DVDs and the Internet and iPods and all.

rin: Baad istoryawan ko iya manungod sa droga ag pulitika.
eng: Maybe I might even get to tell it about drugs and politics.

rin: Migtao naman adi sa usad pang pagkakataon kanya na manarita kin gaumno kita kapatal ag paradanyar ngamin.
eng: It would give it another opportunity to launch into a lecture about how stupid and self-destructive we all are.

rin: Baad iiba na niya 'ko ag darawon sadto istaran niya.
eng: Maybe it will even take me away and take me to its home.

rin: Baad diri na niya 'ko paulion.
eng: Maybe it will ask me to stay.

rin: Baad kapay sana talaga akong babayi na pinnili sa kapay man na dragon na magin kaibanan sa buway.
eng: Maybe I'm just a weird woman who chooses a weird dragon for a life companion.

rin: Magtubod raw ika kanako?
eng: Would you believe me?

rin: Amo adi Begas ta.
eng: This is our Vegas.

rin: Amo yan sasabiyon ni Padre Bobby.
eng: That's what Father Bobby says.

rin: Inaabot pa sana iya galin sadto banwaan nira, ading Muerta Caxerex.
eng: He has just arrived from their hometown, Muerta Caxerex.

rin: Paraugbon sa mga puta, paralulugos, ag mas dakol pang padi.
eng: Birth mother to prostitutes, rapists, and more priests.

rin: Ta iaatod niya su desterado niyang kag-igin na babayi sadto landingan nganing lumupad naman adi pabalik sa Libertad ka sunod 'a gab-i.
eng: To send off his own exiled mother to the airport to fly back abroad to Liberty the next night.

rin: Sadto Muerta Caxerex, su kag-gin niyang babayi bistado na amo Ina ku Ranow ka Buhi.
eng: In Muerta Caxerex, his mother is known as the Lady of Lake Buhi.

rin: Kin sari su pinakasadit na isura dinakulo nang mga ampak.
eng: Where the smallest fish have grown into monsters.

rin: Naudaan na kaya su ranow ku Ina nira mala lugod ta pigpaparabaha na su mga kaabay na mga nalulupang banwaan.
eng: The lake has lost its mother and is now flooding all the nearby rotting towns.

rin: Su Ina pinag-alow pirang dekada na nakalalabos ku ayupan kading agom na pinurbaran man niyang guranon pirang beses.
eng: The Lady was driven away decades ago by an animal of a husband whom she has tried to kill several times.

rin: Iya nagpatanid sa kaungutan na a mga mistisong unglo malain na mapangangagom.
eng: She has said in seething sighs that mestizo Tikbalangs make bad husbands.

rin: Ta amo yan su pagka-kabayo nirang nasalakan sa tawo na sugid sadto mga Kagnubo ku mga Dayo sa Pagtubod.
eng: That it's the horse in them mixed with man directly descended from the Patriarchs of the Hounds of Faith.

rin: Narakop ko si Amay na pinupurbaran puoton si Apay ku ulunan, Son.
eng: I caught Ma this time trying to smother Pa with a pillow, Son.

rin: Sabi ni Padre Bobby ki Sonny, na tinawa.
eng: Father Bobby says to Sonny, and the latter laughs.

rin: Pirmi man si Sonny magtatawa dawa kin buko man patawang bagay.
eng: Sonny always laughs at unfunny things.

rin: Arog baga ngaya kading si Ina nira na arani nang supuon su ama nirang nag-ampon kanya na nguwan tawo na sana ta naatake.
eng: Like the Lady's almost killing his adoptive father who is now reduced to his man-form because of a stroke.

rin: Ading pagpurbar na pagguraan kadi sa gulay.
eng: Her attempted murder of a vegetable.

rin: Sari si Mary, Son?
eng: Where is Mary, Son?

rin: Si Mary puta na sadi Begas ta, guy.
eng: Mary is now a whore in our Vegas, mehn.

rin: Amo yan diri sasabiyon ni Sonny.
eng: That's what Sonny does not say.

rin: Si Sonny nabansagan nang Sonny'ng Dungas puon ku sampulong taunon pa sana sirang magkagrado sa iskwelan.
eng: Sonny has been called Sonny Da Dumbass ever since they were ten-year-old schoolmates.

rin: Pa'la nagin paraimpormar.
eng: And had run around as an informant.

rin: Anggan sa magin suldado sadto mga Gera ku mga Kanto sa Triangulo.
eng: Then as a soldier in the Triangulo Gang Wars.

rin: Su mga sa kanto sadto Triangulo puro man sa tawo pag aldow.
eng: The Triangulo Gangs were all human in the daylight.

rin: Pag gab-i, miglabanan sira ngamin sa kin sa unong Rugo.
eng: At night, they fought each other in their Blood-forms.

rin: Tanganing magin amo Kagurangnan ka Laman sa pagpuputa.
eng: To be the Flesh Lords of prostitution.

rin: Tanganing magin amo Kagurangnan ka Dados sa huwego.
eng: To be the Dice Lords of gambling.

rin: Tanganing magin amo Kagurangan ka Kristal sa narkotiko.
eng: To be the Crystal Lords of narcotics.

rin: Ngamin na kasalan naginibo na sadto trayanggulong adto para sa lakwat ag pagsadiri ku mga sa Rugo.
eng: Every sin was committed in that triangle for space and ownership of the Bloods.

rin: Mga gibong ikukumpisal man sana sa mga padi tapos ipingangadyi ki Nuestra Señora tanganing mapatawad.
eng: Acts they all would confess to the priests and pray to Nuestra Señora to forgive.

rin: Nungkang nangastor o nakasturan si Sonny ta si Padre Bobby pirming isadto.
eng: Sonny never made or took a hit though because Father Bobby was always there.

rin: Urog na ku buko pa 'ding padi.
eng: Back when the latter was not yet the priest.

rin: Kindi usad na napiritang kapong na mala man nangga'd isog ka rugo.
eng: But the reluctant punk with the raging alpha blood.

rin: Na nakamana sa usad na kanto sadto trayanggulong adto sa mga teritoryo galin sadto mga desterado ag mga paraguraan niyang mga ermano.
eng: Who inherited one side of that triangle of territories from his exiled and murdering brothers.

rin: Ngamin tutok sana sa sadiri, ag ngamin sana transaksyon.
eng: Everything was personal, and everything was business.

rin: Amo yan si Padre Bobby puon sa kapinuonan.
eng: It has always been so with Father Bobby ever since.

rin: Ag si Sonny su dungas na nagpabura ki Mary kadto ta sinabiyan niyang kakabayuwan adi niya.
eng: And Sonny was the dumbass who had made Mary cry then when he told her that he was going to ride her like a horse.

rin: Su igin pang Bobby, na uda pautaot magsugot ki Mary, binudalan su lalawgon ni Sonny.
eng: Young Bobby, who had always been mercilessly teasing her, beat Sonny's face.

rin: Si Mary, na interong diri pigsisisino si Bobby, sinnilung man nangga'd kanya pa'la inarukan su nagru-rugo niyang mga kamot.
eng: Mary, who had religiously ignored Bobby, finally looked at him and kissed his bloodied fists.

rin: Pala nagngisi ki Sonny saka lininggan su lalawgon niya.
eng: Then smiled at Sonny and cleaned up his face.

rin: Kaya su tulo nagin mag-amigo puon kadto.
eng: And the three have been best friends ever since.

rin: Begas ta'di, 'Yaba.
eng: Our Vegas, baby.

rin: Amo yan sasabiyon ni Mary.
eng: That's what Mary says.

rin: Pirmi sadto sa Rugo na mag-iiyan kanya, kindi urog pa ki Sonny.
eng: Always to the Blood who come to her, but more so to Sonny.

rin: Ni nungkang pinurbaran iya kadi.
eng: He has never touched her.

rin: Si buko man malakadungas.
eng: Sonny is not that dumb.

rin: Ta isi niyang titigbakon iya ni Padre Bobby.
eng: For he knows Father Bobby would kill him.

rin: Si Sonny baga a migprotehir kanya sadi, kaya a sabi niya ki Padre Bobby uru-utro.
eng: Sonny is supposed to protect her here, and he says to Father Bobby again and again.

rin: Diri ko adi pakarauton, guy.
eng: I don't mess up in this, mehn.

rin: Si Mary pigpaparaliman-limanan sana su nagpaparaurog-udog na telepono.
eng: Mary has been ignoring the vibrating phone.

rin: Sari na ika?
eng: Where are you?

rin: Anggan su pang-unom niya kadtong aldow 'a adto naggalin na ading kabangang-babayi ag kabangang-tawong lipod na kaipwanan a sustansya ka suso niya sinimbag su baoy pa'la narungog si Sonny.
eng: Until her sixth for the day had left, this half-woman and half-elemental that needed the nourishment from her breast, picks up the call and hears Sonny.

rin: Sadi na iya, gusto ikang mabayad.
eng: He's here, wants to see you.

rin: Isi ko.
eng: I know.

rin: Si Sonny nagngurob-ngurob.
eng: Sonny mutters.

rin: Ya ngata ta diri ika nagsimbag?
eng: Then why wouldn't you answer?

rin: Si Mary tinnawa sana.
eng: Mary laughs.

rin: Naglalaom ikang sisim-bagon ko iyang nagtatrabawo ako?
eng: You expect me to answer him while I'm working?

rin: Ay. Amo palan.
eng: Oh. Right.

rin: Si Mary nag-angos pa'la nag-unga kin sari saka unong oras, pa'la nagpatuod nang miggalin ag tinukuran su sadiri niya sa ngisi.
eng: Mary sighs and asks where and what time, then says goodbye and braces herself with a smile.

rin: Para adi kanimo, Mama.
eng: This is for you, Mother.

rin: Labing su pampito niya kadtong aldow a adto nagluog na sadto kwartong agko pa nanggad na parong sa nilinggang kaduan pa'la pinuonan na iyang sambawon sadto ringring.
eng: As her seventh for the day comes into the room that smells of sanitized sex and begins worshipping her against the wall.

rin: Su mga Rugo nira rinurukay su laman niya, na itinatao man niya kanda.
eng: Their Blood calls for her flesh, which she gives up for them.

rin: Pag pinabaoy iya ni Padre Bobby, pirmi niyang luluwason.
eng: When Father Bobby calls for her, she always comes.

rin: Dagos tabi utro sadi Begas ta, guy.
eng: Welcome back to our Vegas, mehn.

rin: Amo yan sasabiyon ni Sonny.
eng: That's what Sonny says.

rin: Binuktutan sana naman su usad 'a baldi sa pulang serbesa sa mga kabayo.
eng: He slouches through another bucket of red beer for horses.

rin: Solamenteng amo sana kayang inumon ka arog niya.
eng: The only thing his kind can take.

rin: Biyo nang sa dayo, amo yan si Sonny.
eng: Too much of a mongrel, Sonny is.

rin: Kabangang-Unglo saka kabangang-Kapre.
eng: Half-Tikbalang and half-Kapre.

rin: Na pigninigaran ka pariyong lado ag intinatakwil na bigik.
eng: And both sides denying each other and disowning this runt.

rin: A pagkabuway niya utang na buot niya ki Padre Bobby.
eng: His existence he owes to Father Bobby.

rin: A talingkas niyang makapag-agi-aging uda kinatatakutan sa Muerta Caxerex kadto.
eng: The freedom to walk without fear in Muerta Caxerex then.

rin: Areglado sadto mga Kagurangnan ka Dado ag Kagurangnan ka Laman na mangunguko sa mga igin na halo a lahi na arog niya nganing bunuon.
eng: Safe from the Dice Lords and Flesh Lords who would take mix-breed children like him to be slaughtered.

rin: Amga rugo saka tulang nira gagamiton sa paggibo ka mga tuytoy saka edipisyo para nungkang maraot.
eng: With their blood and bones used to make bridges and buildings indestructible.

rin: Si Padre Bobby isinalbar iya sadto mga bisyong mana ka rugong kapre niya.
eng: Father Bobby had saved him from his Kapre Blood's vice, too.

rin: Adtong aso galin sa pipa na pamana ka lahi niyang pigprasadol ku mga Kagurangnan ka Kristal kadtong Gera sa mga Kanto sa Triangulo.
eng: That smoke from pipes, that was the legacy of his genetics spurred by the Crystal Lords of the Triangulo Gang Wars.

rin: A puturo niya sa Muerta Caxerex narumpag kadtong mga tarhetang kagranan ku mga utang ku pipa na diri mabayaran sa payo niya.
eng: His future in Muerta Caxerex had been destroyed by the death tag of unpayable debts of the pipes on his head.

rin: Kaya diri na iya makauli.
eng: And he could not go home.

rin: Nguwan sige sana niya patianod sa mga edipisyo kading Sunshine Consortium sadi kapitolyo, na agko nakasungsong na headset.
eng: Now he drifts through the buildings of the Sunshine Consortium in the capital, jacked into a headset.

rin: Tapos nagigin bampirang ba'na robot guru-gab-i ta amo dikta ka ekonomiya saka ka Libertidad.
eng: And becoming a robotic vampire every night by the demands of economics and Liberty.

rin: Pagpapara-ursinuwon sana mga 'Bisor niya manungod sadto guraan nang pukuapuon niyang babayi na nagraan na naman ngaya na amo ginibong rason kin ngata ta nagpalta iya nganing libreng makiurong-udong ki Padre Bobby.
eng: Lying to his Supervisors about his dead grandmother dying again as reason for his absence so as to be free to meet Father Bobby.

rin: Si Sonny su nag-ataman ki Padre Bobby para diri adi marungaw ku Gera ag pagkatapos, pirmi niya ading kinukulibat manungod ki Mary.
eng: Sonny has kept Father Bobby from turning feral in the Wars and after, always reminding him of Mary.

rin: Sinilngan ni Padre Bobby su mga kamot ni Sonny.
eng: Father Bobby looks at Sonny's hands.

rin: Magpaparakubog-kubog pa yan, Son?
eng: Do they still shake, Son?

rin: Nagtawa sana si Sonny.
eng: Sonny laughs.

rin: Diri kin agko ako kapot 'a bras saka pinta, guy.
eng: Not when I'm holding paints and brush, mehn.

rin: O kin suso saka lubot sa babayi.
eng: Or some chick's tits and ass.

rin: La puta, Son, tistingon ko ika.
eng: Di puta, Son, I can test you.

rin: Nag-angal si Sonny.
eng: Sonny protests.

rin: Atang amo, guy!
eng: Swear, mehn!

rin: Nagtuga ika ki Mary na uda na pipa, Son.
eng: You promised Mary no more pipe, Son.

rin: Naggulom si Sonny.
eng: Sonny smiles.

rin: Dawa uno para ki Mary. puru-pirmi, guy.
eng: Anything for Mary, always, mehn.

rin: Su unang beses na nagpinta si Sonny disisais iya ag nagraraan na sa pipa.
eng: The first time Sonny painted was when he was sixteen and he was already dying from the pipe.

rin: Su ipininta niya a Sagrada Familia, ginibo niya adto para ki Mary.
eng: It was a painting of the Sagrada Familia, and he did it for Mary.

rin: Gumalin na ika sadi Begas ta, tabi.
eng: Leave our Vegas, please.

rin: Amo yan buot sabiyon ni Padre Bobby ki Mary kada migbyahe iya sa labing 400 kilometro pa-norte sadto kapitolyo.
eng: That's what Father Bobby wants to say to Mary every time he would travel the more than 400 kilometers north to the capital.

rin: Namati na niya si Mary bago niya nabayad.
eng: He feels Mary before he sees her.

rin: Nabayad niyang tinnulid su awak ni Sonny.
eng: Sees Sonny's form straighten.

rin: Nakasilong labing dinnaguso adi sadto nag-uulat na gakos ni Sonny.
eng: Looks as she barrels into Sonny's waiting hug.

rin: Inalsa pa'la pinapiring-piting iya ni Sonny labing sige niya urok-utok.
eng: Sonny lifts her up and twirls her around as she giggles.

rin: Napasilyak si Padre Bobby.
eng: Father Bobby snaps.

rin: Malulupuan mo iya!
eng: You'll break her bones!

rin: Ibaba mo 'ya, Son!
eng: Put her down, Son!

rin: Nag-ayat sa dispensa si Sonny labing renisibe ni Mary su gakos ni Padre Bobby saka su darwang luway na tapi sadto payo niya.
eng: Sonny says sorry as Mary receives Father Bobby's exhaling hug and two pats on her head.

rin: Pa'la innatras adi, pigsilngan su 6' saka 6'1" na mamula-mulang bulaw nirang kulit sa awak, pangalas.
eng: Then she draws back, surveys their 6' and 6'1" red-brown-skin frames, and marvels.

rin: Pirmi 'kong lingaw kin gaumno kamong darwa kalangkaw.
eng: I always forget how you two are so tall.

rin: Nagsimbag si Padre Bobby.
eng: Father Bobby answers.

rin: Ag ika 'la mong niwang, Baba.
eng: And you're too thin, Baba.

rin: Nagpaliman-liman sana si Mary pa'la inunga si Sonny.
eng: Mary ignores this and says to Sonny.

rin: Ya uno naman an nguwan, bibi?
eng: Now what is it this time, baby?

rin: Nagngisi si Sonny.
eng: Sonny smiles.

rin: Agko kaya usad na babayi.
eng: There's this girl.

rin: Agko na iya igin.
eng: She has a kid.

rin: Gusto ko iya.
eng: I want her.

rin: Nagsilong si Padre Bobby ki Sonny.
eng: Father Bobby looks at Sonny.

rin: Di' mo 'di sinabi kanako.
eng: You didn't tell me this.

rin: Sinabad si Mary.
eng: Mary interrupts.

rin: Namumuot ika, bibi?
eng: Are you in love, baby?

rin: Napatawa si Sonny.
eng: Sonny laughs.

rin: Diri ko isi, magpapara-silong ako kanya magbalibol.
eng: I don't know,  I watch her volleyball games.

rin: Sinnugrot si Padre Bobby.
eng: Father Bobby snorts.

rin: Uno ika? Nasa hayskul?!
eng: What are you? In high school?!

rin: Pinakuro-kuro ni Sonny su pirok niya.
eng: Sonny wags his eyebrows.

rin: Sangbay iya sa iba.
eng: She's someone's mistress.

rin: Nagngurusdot si Mary.
eng: Mary frowns.

rin: Kiisay?
eng: Whose?

rin: Nagtawa utro si Sonny.
eng: Sonny laughs again.

rin: Sa kapre sa Guadalupe, guy.
eng: A troll of Guadalupe, mehn.

rin: Putok ni Padre Bobby.
eng: Father Bobby explodes.

rin: Gusto mong magin bata a sangbay sa pulis?!
eng: You want to get it on with a cop's mistress?!

rin: Kadungas mo!
eng: Dumbass!

rin: Migraan ika kiton!
eng: You're going to end up dead!

rin: Dyos ko, Son!
eng: Dios mío, Son!

rin: Mga buaya iton na kakaunon sana ikang buway!
eng: They are crocodiles and will eat you alive!

rin: Nag-unga si Mary.
eng: Mary asks.

rin: Ka-Rugo ta 'ya, bibi?
eng: Is she of our Blood, baby?

rin: Buko.
eng: No.

rin: Nag-angos si Mary.
eng: Mary sighs.

rin: Ya diri mo 'ya pwedeng kuonon.
eng: Then you can't take her.

rin: Uda kita permisong makiiba sa buko ta man ka-Rugo, isi mo yan.
eng: We are not allowed to be with those who are not of our Blood, you know that.

rin: Narungog mo 'ko, bibi?
eng: You hear me, baby?

rin: Nagngurob-ngurob si Sonny.
eng: Sonny grumbles.

rin: Amo, Mary.
eng: Yes, Mary.

rin: Nagsilong si Mary ki Padre Bobby.
eng: Mary looks at Father Bobby.

rin: Uda tabi malain na mangyari kanya, Padre, dawa uno gibuwon niya, dawa sari.
eng: No harm will happen to him, Father, whatever he does, wherever.

rin: Napaiktin si Padre Bobby, nagpromisa utro na amo usad sa mga natutudang ganador ku Gera ku mga Kanto sa Triangulo.
eng: Father Bobby flinches, promises again as once the surviving victor of the Triangulo Gang Wars.

rin: Ya amo.
eng: Of course.

rin: Pakatapos sinabi man nanggad kadi.
eng: And he finally brings up.

rin: Pig-uulat pa nanggayod ika ni Nuestra Señora.
eng: Nuestra Señora is still waiting for you.

rin: Kaligtasan sadi Begas ta, Padre.
eng: Salvation in our Vegas, Father.

rin: Amo yan pirming sinasabi ni Mary.
eng: That's what Mary always says.

rin: Su kag-igin niyang babayi dati usad na duru-daragita, amo su napiling igin na babayi ka Muerta Caxerex, ag a Rugo ag puturo kadi nata awak niya.
eng: Her mother was once a young girl, the chosen daughter of Muerta Caxerex, and its Blood and future were in her flesh.

rin: Ku kadtong panawon kag-igin niyang babayi pinaglulugos ku Ama.
eng: A long time ago, her mother had been raped by the Patriarch.

rin: Ag su mga Dayo sa Pagtubod iginapos iya sa matrimonya sa Pagtubod.
eng: And the Hounds of Faith had bound her in matrimony with the Faith.

rin: Su talas na kalag ku karag-an inilaom sadto imahen niyang naurma sa rugong bulawan.
eng: The land's wild soul entrapped in her image cast in blood gold.

rin: Su urma ku mabros niyang awak na pinagpalas-palas ta nag-umang tumtumang kaibanan su mga sa Rugo.
eng: The urn of her pregnant body which had been butchered for threatening to call the Blood to rebellion.

rin: Su Pagtubod agko mga kalalakiyan nagtugang poprotehiran iya, su mga Boyadores, kaya pagdadarawon nira su imahen palibot sadto Muerta Caxerex na iaagi sa salog nganing mabendisyunan su mga banwaan ag nganing mapasunod su sa Rugo sadto Pagtubod.
eng: The Faith had men who pledged to protect her, the Voyadores, and they took her image around Muerta Caxerex via its river to bless the towns and keep the Blood in the Faith.

rin: Pinaninindugan pirmi ku mga kalalakiyan na mga nakalingaw na sa pag-agi ku panawon na sadto sira ku kapinunan nganing pugulan iyang lumuson su sadiri niya sadto salog.
eng: Upheld always by these men who had forgotten through time that they were there in the beginning to keep her from drowning herself in the river.

rin: Su Amay niya amo si Nuestra Señora, na amo Ina ka Muerta Caxerex.
eng: Her mother is Nuestra Señora, and she is Muerta Caxerex's Matriarch.

rin: Pagkakantawon nira a pangadyi nira sadto kag-igin niyang babayi, na napuonan ngamin 300 taon na nakaagi.
eng: They sing their prayers to her mother, and this all began 300 years ago.

rin: Puon kadto, su kag-igin niyang babayi pirmi nang ipagpaparada palibot sa Muerta Caxerex, na anggan nguwan amo pa nanggayod
eng: Since then, her mother has always been moved around to bless Muerta Caxerex, which still remains as is.

rin: Pobre ag raot.
eng: Poor and corrupted.

rin: Na agko mga pugong na putok sa badil sa luwas ka mga bilyaran ag a mga bakla pagpupugutan saka susuluon.
eng: With hushed gunshots outside billiard halls and homosexuals beheaded and burned.

rin: Ngamin ngaya mapapakaray pag su ilong namundag.
eng: All will be well when the orphan born.

rin: Su igin na amo bumbaoy ka ngamin na sa Rugo sa Muerta Caxerex na tumiklod.
eng: The child who could call all of Muerte Caxerex's Blood to its knees.

rin: Kin su nabuway liwat na laman ni Nuestra Señora bumalik na.
eng: Nuestra Señoras reincarnated flesh returns.

rin: Ading tipan sa kapatawaran para sa mga kasalan sa Muerta Caxerex nagpuon kadto pang mala nang uban na panawon.
eng: This covenant of forgiveness for the sin against Muerte Caxerex began a long time ago.

rin: Dakol sadi si Inang mga nauudang dinulag, ag di' na sira makauli.
eng: Mother has lost runaways here, and they can't come home.

rin: Ading mga kalalakiyan saka kababayian na mag-iiyan kanya.
eng: These men and women who come to ser her.

rin: Ngamin na destyerong sa Rugo sa Muerta Caxerex sadto kapitolyo.
eng: All of Muerta Caxerex's Blood exiles in the capital.

rin: Na inaanap su maitatao ku matris na obligasyon ku kag-igin niyang babayi na dinulagan niya sadto Muerta Caxerex.
eng: Seeking what her Mother's womb was bound to give and which Mary ran away from in Muerta Caxerex.

rin: Su biyaya na magin mga nilalang kin uno man sira.
eng: This blessing to be the creatures that they are.

rin: Patawaron mo 'ko sa Begas ta, 'Baba.
eng: Forgive me in our Vegas, 'Baba.

rin: Amo yan pagsasabiyon pirmi ni Padre Bobby.
eng: That's what Father Bobby always says.

rin: Su padi na amo magigin Ama ku Muerta Caxerex pinayaba na si Mary puon pa ku dyes anyos sira.
eng: The priest who is the future Patriarch of Muerta Caxerex has loved Mary ever since they were ten.

rin: Pero iya su kauriyan na igin na lalaki na pigdulot ku Ina para sa kaligtasan ku kalag ku ngamin niyang igin na lalaki saka agom.
eng: But he is the youngest son and the Lady's sacrifice for the salvation of all her sons and husband's souls.

rin: A mga igin na lalaki ka Muerta Caxerex pirming magtutuod sa mga kag-igin nirang babayi.
eng: And the sons of Muerta Caxerex always obey their mothers.

rin: Pero si Padre Bobby igin man ka kag-igin niyang lalaki.
eng: But Father Bobby is also his father's son.

rin: Kaya a rugo niya maaling ba'na sili ag a rugo niya pirming babaoy ki Mary.
eng: And his blood is sili-hot and his blood has always called for Mary's.

rin: Ading diri niya pwedeng makuko ta amo a piniling igin na babyi ni Nuestra Señora.
eng: She whom he cannot have for she is Nuestra Señora's chosen daughter.

rin: A pag-aguman nira kintana kamurawayan para sa Muerta Caxerex.
eng: The union would have been perfect for Muerta Caxerex.

rin: Kindi kin uno man su nangyari 300 taon na nakaagi diri na dapat mangyari utro.
eng: But what happened 300 years ago cannot happen again.

rin: Kaya si Padre Bobby mag-aanap sa kabalyo.
eng: So Father Bobby finds substitutes.

rin: Arog ka mga awak ka mga paraampak o kadaklan na oras para sa pulang serbesa na para sa mga kabayo.
eng: Like penitent bodies or hours of this red beer for horses.

rin: Tangani sanang maibsan a kakul'gan niya.
eng: To dull his aching.

rin: Uno gusto mong kapatawaran naman nguwan?
eng: What do you want forgiven this time?

rin: Nagkumpisal si Padre Bobby.
eng: Father Bobby confesses.

rin: Nagin amo na ako kin uno su Apay ko.
eng: I have become my father.

rin: Usad naman?
eng: Another one?

rin: Pampira na di nguwan?
eng: What is this now?

rin: Pang-upat na?
eng: The fourth?

rin: Nagtango si Padre Bobby.
eng: Father Bobby nods.

rin: Saka usad naman na igin na lalaki.
eng: And another son.

rin: Pundo na.
eng: Enough already.

rin: Makaigin pa ika sa usad pa ikagu-guraan na ka puso ko.
eng: Siring another will kill my heart.

rin: Nag-ukrong si Padre Bobby pa'la nagtango utro.
eng: Father Bobby bows his head and nods once again.

rin: Pinnirong si Mary ag diri na nginabil su isi naman niya.
eng: Mary closes her eyes and does not say what they already know.

rin: Sadi sana Begas ta, guy.
eng: Only in our Vegas, mehn.

rin: Amo yan pagsasabiyon ni Sonny.
eng: That's what Sonny says.

rin: Nakasilong iya labing su Padre Bobby tiniklod para ibutang su angog niya sadto buros ni Mary, iningang paluog.
eng: He watches as Father Bobby kneels to lay his forehead on Mary's womb, inhaling.

rin: Nangungubog-kubog ka kagustuwan ku rugo niya.
eng: Trembling from his blood's desiring.

rin: Su tuong kamot ni Mary nagtaas, pa'la luway-luway niyang binutang sadto payo ni Padre Bobby saka inapulas su bok.
eng: Mary's right hand hovers, then she gently places it on his head and strokes his hair.

rin: Sinilngan niya su ngamin na sulo na itinatago su mga mangitngit na tinampo kin sari su mga igin ka Muerta Caxerex.
eng: She looks at all the lights that hide the dark streets where the children of Muerta Caxerex are.

rin: Dawa ika.
eng: Even you.

rin: Lalo na ika.
eng: More so you.

rin: Pero buko ika.
eng: But never you.

rin: Nag-angos si Padre Bobby, napundo na su kubog-kubog, tinnindog pa'la ginalin na.
eng: Father Bobby exhales, the trembling ceases, stands up and leaves.

rin: Tumtuyo ako o miggalin, Mary?
eng: Do I stay or go, Mary?

rin: Ibani na 'ya, bibi.
eng: Go with him, baby.

rin: Nagkuyong si Sonny.
eng: Sonny shakes his head.

rin: Kamo bayang darwa, isi mong bumbalik man sana 'ya.
eng: You two, you know he will come back again.

rin: Nagngisi si Mary.
eng: Mary smiles.

rin: Pirming sadi sana.
eng: Always only here.

rin: Malang tabil ni Mamee.
eng: Mamee talks a lot.

rin: Malang sumabi sa achuchuchu ag kin uno-uno sa mga amiga niya.
eng: Says achuchuchu a lot and whatever to her friends.

rin: Su mga kurupos na tawo magsasabi kin minsan na arog kan si Mamee.
eng: The wrinkled people would sometimes say that Mamee's like that.

rin: Binnabawi iya ku ngamin na panawon na tuninong iya ta diri iya makangabil ku sadit pa iya na arog ko.
eng: She's making up for all that quiet-time ta she could not talk when she was little like me.

rin: Su ibang mga kurupos na tawo amo yan sabi.
eng: Some of the wrinkled people say it is.

rin: Ta diri kuno iya makainga ku bago iyang ipangigin.
eng: Because she couldn't breathe when she was a baby.

rin: Bagana por medyo kuno adto ku parong sa bagong semento sadto baloy na inistaran niya, sabi ku mga Lola Doktora ko.
eng: Something to do with the smell of new cement in the house where she lived, my Lola Doktoras say.

rin: Nadanyaran su baga niya ag sabi ku mga Lola Doktora ko nagraan na kuno sa pirang beses si Mamee pero naisalbar iya ku mga bulong nira.
eng: It made her lungs sick and my Lola Doktoras say that Mamee had already died but their medicines saved her.

rin: Su ibang mga kurupos na tawo a sabi maraot kuno adi.
eng: Some of the wrinkled people say that this was bad.

rin: Tapos a mga kurupos na tawo o mga gurang arog nira Lola Doktora ko o si Mamee migrason sa mga bagay-bagay.
eng: And the wrinkled people and older people like my Lola Doktoras or Mamee give the reason for something.

rin: Su mga kurupos na tawo a sabi kaya kuno nabuway si Mamee.
eng: The wrinkled people say Mamee lived.

rin: Su Mama ni Mamee nagparatangis ag pigparabaoy su ngaran na diri dapat pigsasabi 'nganing maisulit iya.
eng: Mamee's Mama had cried and cried and kept on calling on this name that's not supposed to be said to bring her back.

rin: Nagparapromisa.
eng: Making promises.

rin: Ag su Mama ni Mamee pigparauyupan na su malungsi nang nganga ni Mamee.
eng: And Mamee's Mama had kept on breathing into Mamee's blue mouth.

rin: Si Mamee pa'la pigdara saka nagdakulo na sadto lumang baloy ku Mama niya sadto ubaliw mga darwang oras a distansya puon sadi.
eng: Mamee was then taken to and grew up in her Mama's old house in a barrio two hours away from here.

rin: Ta sabi ku mga Lola Doktora ko mas maray kuno adto para kanya.
eng: Because my Lola Doktoras say that this was better for her.

rin: Su mga kurupos na tawo sabi malang raot kuno kadi.
eng: The wrinkled people say it was a very bad thing.

rin: Arog ku mga mumo na nag-iistar sa mga baloy saka mga kadlagan saka mga kweba na si 'Uya saka si Anay pig-iistorya kanakong maraot.
eng: Just like the mumos that lived in houses and forests and caves that my 'Uya and 'Anay tell me about are bad.

rin: Pero si Mamee makangangabil na kadto.
eng: But Mamee could really talk then.

rin: Kaya pagkakausipon niya su Lolo 'Iton ag Lolo Kulas niya.
eng: And she would talk to her Lolo 'Iton and Lolo Kulas.

rin: Mga pukuapuon niya adtong lalaki saka amo man a mga amigo niya sadto ubaliw kaya pagkakausipon iya.
eng: They were her grandpas and her friends in that barrio and they would talk to her.

rin: Su mga pukuapuon na babayi ni Mamee pagsasabiyan iyang ipangadyi su mga pukuapuon niyang lalaki.
eng: Mamee's Lolas would tell her to pray for them.

rin: Ta maray kuno yan saka ta kaipuhan nira sa pangadyi.
eng: Because this is good and they need the prayers.

rin: Bayda na kuno nangyari sadto pamilya saka mga igin nira.
eng: Look at what their families and children had become.

rin: Kin diri nakikiistoryan si Mamee sadto mga pukuapuon niyang lalaki, pirmi iyang nagngangayamon arani sadto kulor raga ag berdeng punggok na kawoy sadto luwas ku baloy ku Inang Maria na a supong asul na bado.
eng: When Mamee's not talking to her Lolos, she mostly liked playing near that brown-green stout tree outside that house of the Mama Mary in a blue dress.

rin: Su baloy ku Mama ni Mamee arani sadto kawoy na adto.
eng: Mamee's Mama's house was near that tree.

rin: Agko mga igin na kagustong magparangayamon man sadto kaya nagin mga amigo niya.
eng: Some children liked playing there, too, and they became her friends.

rin: Sa mga gab-ing a mga ayam sigeng awoooooo, marurungog ka mga tawo si Mamee saka su mga amigo niyang nagpaparatawa sadto kawoy.
eng: On nights when the dogs would awooooo, people would hear Mamee and her friends laughing by the tree.

rin: Su mga kurupos na tawo a sabi su mga kangayamon ni Mamee nakaistar kuno sadto kawoy na adto.
eng: The wrinkled people say that Mamee's playmates lived in the tree.

rin: Pa'la nabababayad na kuno ku mga tawo si Mamee na nakikiusip kanda.
eng: And that people began seeing Mamee talking to them.

rin: A iba ngani kaabay pa niyang nakaula.
eng: Some of them would even be sitting beside her.

rin: A iba man mala na karungdong ku mga nganga nira sadto nganga ni Mamee.
eng: Some of them would almost have their mouths on Mamee's mouth.

rin: Na bagana pigkakaon ngamin na ngangabilon ni Mamee.
eng: Like they were eating all that Mamee would say.

rin: Diri dapat nababayad ka mga tawo a mga kangayamon niya.
eng: People are not supposed to see her playmates.

rin: Su mga kangayamon niya uda man dapat sadto.
eng: Her playmates are not supposed to be there.

rin: Si Mamee diri ngani dapat nakakausip sira.
eng: Mamee is not supposed to be able to talk to them.

rin: Arog ka diri niya dapat man nababayad o nakakausip su mga pukuapuon niyang lalaki.
eng: Just as she's not supposed to be seeing or talking to her Lolos.

rin: Kaipwanan ko na maggalin.
eng: I have to go.

rin: Pigbabaoy na 'ko ni Mamee.
eng: Mamee's calling me.

rin: Sari ika?
eng: Sari ika?

rin: Diri ako nagsisimbag kin sari, 'nganing diri niya 'ko marungog.
eng: I don't say where, so that she won't hear me.

rin: Magngayamon kita nganod, Juanito, amo?
eng: We'll play later, Juanito, okay?

rin: Uno ginigibo mo?
eng: Uno ginigibo mo?

rin: Sadi sana ika.
eng: You stay right there.

rin: Uno ginibo mo?!
eng: What have you done?!

rin: Oras ko nang maturog.
eng: It's time for me to sleep.

rin: Isadi su demonyo.
eng: The demonyo is here.

rin: Si 'Uya, 'Anay, saka ako marurungog namo su demonyo kin nagbabatang na kami.
eng: Uya, 'Anay, and me can hear the devil coming when we are in bed.

rin: Su demonyo mag-aabot kasabay ka tunog ka pakpak.
eng: The demonyo always comes with the sound of wings.

rin: Pagbukas ka pirtan mapaparong na namo su demonyo.
eng: The door opens and we can smell the devil.

rin: Ag a parong niya bagana su tsiko sadto kusina na kin minsan malilingawan namong kaunon.
eng: And he smells like the chico fruit in the kitchen we sometimes forget to eat.

rin: Gigis'ngon ku demonyo si Mamee tapos kakausipon ni Mamee su demonyo.
eng: The demonyo wakes up Mamee and Mamee talks to the devil.

rin: Kakausipon ni Mamee su demonyo na arog kin iniing-ingan niya kami kin agko kami ginibong sala sa baloy ka ibang tawo o kin sadto baloy ni Papa Hesus.
eng: Mamee talks to the devil the way she would whisper to us when we do something bad in other people's houses or in the house of Papa Hesus.

rin: Sasabiyon ni Mamee sadto demonyo abo ako.
eng: Mamee would say to the devil I don't want to.

rin: Usad na beses binuklat ko su mata ko ta agko ako narurungog na mga ribok.
eng: One time I opened my eyes ta I was hearing these sounds.

rin: Bagana arog ku nangisog nang ayam sadto tindahan pag pigriringisan ako.
eng: Like the way that bad dog in the sari-sari store would growl at me.

rin: Nabayad ko su demonyo sadto ibabow ni Mamee.
eng: I saw the devil on top of Mamee.

rin: Uda supong na bado si Mamee.
eng: Mamee was not wearing clothes.

rin: Pigsusuntok ku demonyo su buros ni Mamee.
eng: The devil was punching Mamee's tummy.

rin: Pa'la nag-iwag su kamot ku demonyo pababa sadto nagsisipang mga tiil ni Mamee.
eng: And then the devil's hand moved down Mamee's kicking legs.

rin: Nabayad ako ni Mamee.
eng: Mamee saw me.

rin: Nagbubura si Mamee kaya gusto kong umiyan kanya.
eng: Mamee was crying and I wanted to go to her.

rin: Pero kinuyungan ako ni Mamee.
eng: But Mamee shook her head at me.

rin: Bagana iya nagsasabi.
eng: Like she was saying.

rin: Pinirong ko na sana utro su mga mata ko, Juanito.
eng: I closed my eyes again, Juanito.

rin: Minsan mata si Mamee bago mag-abot su demonyo.
eng: Sometimes Mamee is awake before the devil comes.

rin: Sasabiyan ako ni Mamee.
eng: Mamee would say to me.

rin: Diri ika magribok.
eng: Be quiet.

rin: Umatubang sana ika sa ringring, amo?
eng: Face the wall, okay?

rin: Basta tumuninong sana ika.
eng: Just be quiet.

rin: Paturog na.
eng: Sleep.

rin: Marurungog ko ribok ku demonyong bagana dayo pero uda ribok ki Mamee.
eng: I would hear the devil make the bad dog sounds again and no sound from Mamee.

rin: Pero isi ko, Juanito.
eng: But I know, Juanito.

rin: Isi kong nagtatangis si Mamee.
eng: I know that Mamee's crying.

rin: Pagkakausipon ako ku demonyo, Juanito.
eng: The devil talks to me, Juanito.

rin: Minsan pag nag-aabot su demonyo pag gab-i, uupsuon namo a medyas ag sapatos niya pala tatawan namo sa istip-in.
eng: Sometimes when the devil comes at night, we take off his socks and shoes and give him his slippers.

rin: Tapos tatawan namo sa kape.
eng: And then give him his coffee.

rin: Diri man ako kan mag-iinom ta maraot an para kanako.
eng: I can't drink that because it's bad for me.

rin: Pero bagana yan anting para sa demonyo pang'la kan magigin maray na su demonyo.
eng: But it's supposed to be like magic potion for the devil and then the devil becomes good.

rin: Kin minsan a anting diri mag-aasir kaya migpa-rangabil kanako sa nagraot.
eng: Sometimes the magic doesn't work and so the devil says bad things to me.

rin: Guranon mo si Juanito.
eng: Kill Juanito.

rin: Mamumuya kadi su demonyo ta mapabubura ako kan.
eng: The devil finds this funny because it makes me cry.

rin: Pero isi mo usad na beses maray su demonyo kaya su demonyo itinao ika kanako.
eng: But you know one time the devil was good and the devil gave me you.

rin: Bayda, payaba man ako ku demonyo.
eng: See, the devil loves me.

rin: Iya a Dada ko, sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo.
eng: He's my Dada, the wrinkled people say.

rin: Pero diri ko iya dapat kausipon.
eng: But I can't talk to him.

rin: Batit, diri magribok.
eng: Batit, be quiet.

rin: Umaabot na su demonyo.
eng: The demonyo is coming.

rin: Buko man ikang demonyo, Juanito, bukong amo?
eng: You're not a devil, Juanito, are you?

rin: Buko ika, bukong amo?
eng: You're not, are you?

rin: Tuninong, Juanito, amo?
eng: Quiet, Juanito, okay?

rin: Si 'uya agko kawon sa mga ngayamnan.
eng: Uya has a box of toys.

rin: Pag mala 'kong buot pangangayamnon niya 'ko ku PSP saka ku sadit-sadit na skateboard niya.
eng: When I'm really good he lets me play with his PSP and little skateboard, too.

rin: Tinawan sana iya ni Mamee sa ngayamnan na skateboard ta mababaak sana kuno a payo niya, hesusmariaiyosep, sabi ni Mamee.
eng: Mamee only gave him a toy skateboard because he's going to break his head hesusmariaiyosep, Mamee says.

rin: Pero mauungot si 'Uya kin minsan ta diri ko isusulit a mga paborito niyang ngayamnan sadto kawon, sabi niya.
eng: But Uya gets mad sometimes because I don't put his favorite toys back in the box, he says.

rin: Buko ko man kasalan.
eng: It's not my fault.

rin: Kasalan adto ku amigo niya.
eng: It's his best friend's fault.

rin: Su amigo niya pagtataguon a mga adto 'nganing uda makaanap.
eng: His best friend hides them and no one can find them.

rin: Di ko gusto su amigo ni 'Uya ta maraot iya para ki 'Uya arog ku sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo.
eng: I don't like his best friend because he's bad for 'Uya like the wrinkled people say.

rin: Si Uya mabuot saka makiamigo pero minsan makakakuko lugod sa mga kompromiso si 'Uya por medyo ka amigo niya.
eng: Uya is good and friendly but sometimes his best friend gets him into fights.

rin: Usad a beses basta na sanang sinikaran ni 'Uya su kagrado niyang lalaki ta a sabi bagarna kuno uda man sana iya sadto.
eng: One time 'Uya just kicked this boy in his class because he said the boy was like not there.

rin: Ba'na kuno turog su kagrado niya kindi buklat su mata.
eng: Like his classmate was asleep only he had his eyes open.

rin: Sabi ni 'Uya sinipa kuno niya su igin 'nganing maulian ta diri nagsisimbag ku pigbabaoy ni 'Uya.
eng: Uya said he kicked the boy to wake him up because he was not answering to Uya.

rin: Sabi ni 'Uya su igin kuno nakasilong kanya kindi ba'na nakatiurong sa kin uno man sadto tarikuran ku payo ni 'Uya.
eng: Uya said the boy was looking at him but more like staring at something behind 'Uya's head.

rin: Pinangagnow kuno saka biyong nakatakot si 'Uya sabi niya ki Mamee.
eng: It made 'Uya feel cold and scared he said to Mamee.

rin: Usad na beses man kinagat ni 'Uya su pisngi ku usad na igin na lalaki sadto basketbolan ta diri pinapasahan si 'Uya.
eng: And one time 'Uya bit this boy's cheek in the basketball court because the boy would not pass the ball to 'Uya.

rin: Diri kuno pagpasahan iya ta sadit si 'Uya saka diri man makapaluog ka bola.
eng: Never pass the ball to him because 'Uya was small and could not shoot the ball.

rin: Sabi ku igin pirmi, pirmi yan, pirming pagkakakasturan si 'Uya.
eng: That boy always said, always did, always pushing 'Uya around.

rin: Si 'Uya man uda na sana maginibo kindi kumuson a kamot niya sa ugot, tapos nangungubog-kubog, tapos nagbubura.
eng: Uya would just be left holding his fists close and tight, and shaking, and then crying.

rin: Diri marumruman ni 'Uya na kinagat niya su igin.
eng: Uya does not remember biting the boy.

rin: Amo adto sabi ni 'Uya ki Mamee.
eng: That's what 'Uya said to Mamee.

rin: Si 'Uya malang niwang saka sadit ag malungsi, bukong arog ka mga kagrado ag kangayamon niya.
eng: Uya is very thin and small and pale, not like his classmates and playmates.

rin: Buko man niyang kasalan.
eng: It's not his fault.

rin: Kasalan adto ku amigo niya, sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo.
eng: It's his best friend's fault, the wrinkled people say.

rin: Ta ku si 'Uya umboy pa saka sadto pa iya luog ku buros ni Mamee, su amigo niya sadto man.
eng: Because when 'Uya was a baby and he was still in Mamee's tummy, his friend was also there.

rin: A sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo ku sadto pa si 'Uya luog ku buros ni Mamee, puru-pirmi kunong makarurungog si Mamee sa pakpak sadto luwas ku baloy.
eng: The wrinkled people say that when 'Uya was in Mamee's tummy, Mamee would often hear wings outside the house.

rin: Ag su pakpak kuno amo nagdara ku amigo niya sadto buros ni Mamee labi iyang natuturog.
eng: And the wings brought his friend to Mamee's tummy while she slept.

rin: Pag si Mamee kinakausip si 'Uya manungod ka mga salang gawi niya, gagakuson iya ni Mamee tapos sasabiyan na magpakaray iya.
eng: When Mamee talks to 'Uya about the bad things he would do, Mamee would hug him and tell him to be good.

rin: Pirming sinasabiyan ni Mamee si 'Uya na magkaon sa dakol tapos inumon su baytamins niya pirmi.
eng: Mamee always tells 'Uya to eat more and take his vitamins more.

rin: Si Mamee luway sanang kausipon si 'Uya saka papuru-pundo.
eng: Mamee talks to Uya slowly and with pauses.

rin: Pag pinnupundo si Mamee, a kinakausip talaga niya su amigo ni 'Uya na sadto tarikuran niya.
eng: When Mamee pauses, she's really talking to 'Uyas best friend who's always behind him.

rin: Diri marungog ni 'Uya a usipan nira.
eng: Uya can't hear them talk.

rin: Diri niya mababayad a amigo niya.
eng: Can't see his best friend.

rin: Mababayad ko a amigo ni 'Uya, Juanito.
eng: I see 'Uya's best friend, Juanito.

rin: A amigo ni 'Uya igante na a utok sa luwas ka payo.
eng: Uya's best friend is a giant and his brain is outside his head.

rin: Mas dakulo pa ka payo niya.
eng: Bigger than his own head.

rin: Su igante nakalunad sadto taludtod ni 'Uya uru-aldow pala kinakaon kin uno kaunon ni 'Uya.
eng: The giant rides 'Uya's back every day and eats what 'Uya eats.

rin: Iniinom kin uno inumon ni 'Uya.
eng: Drinks what 'Uya drinks.

rin: Pero pag gab-i lulunas man iya tapos matuturog sadto kawon sa mga ngayamnan ni 'Uya kin ngamin na kami migturog.
eng: But at night he gets off 'Uya and goes to sleep in "Uya's toy box when we all go to bed.

rin: Usad na beses ku ngamin na sira turog, binnuwat ako tapos nag-iyan sadto kawon ku ngayamnan ni 'Uya ta pig-aanap ko su amigo niya.
eng: One time when they were all asleep, I got out of bed and went to 'Uya's toy box looking for his best friend.

rin: Buot ko iyang kausipon.
eng: I wanted to talk to him.

rin: Kindi narakop ako ni Mamee.
eng: But Mamee found me.

rin: Paturog na utro!
eng: Go back to bed!

rin: Buot ko man sana iyang sabiyan na pumundo.
eng: I just wanted to tell him to stop.

rin: Isi kong abo man an sabiyon ni 'Uya.
eng: I know 'Uya doesn't want to say that.

rin: Nungka mo yan paggibuhon!
eng: You can't ever do that!

rin: Narungog mo 'ko?
eng: You hear me?

rin: Pero di ko man makausip si 'Uya.
eng: But I can't talk to 'Uya either.

rin: Maturog na kita utro, Juanito.
eng: Let's go back to bed, Juanito.

rin: Buot kong magin amig si 'anay.
eng: I want 'anay to be my best friend.

rin: Iya agko pinakabilog na mga mata ag pinakamaib-og na pirok saka pinakamaabang naggayon nang kurong na bok.
eng: She has the roundest eyes and thickest lashes and longest pretty curly hair.

rin: Ngamin na maestra saka kagrado ag kangayamon ag pag-abayan namo payaba si 'Anay.
eng: All her teachers and her classmates and her playmates and our neighbors love 'Anay.

rin: Mabuot si 'Anay saka pirming tutuburon kin uno man sabiyon kanya ka mga tawo.
eng: Anay is a good girl and always does what people tell her to do.

rin: Ngamin sira gusto iyang kaibanan, dawa su mga kurupos na tawo gusto iya, pero buot ni 'Anay a magsolo.
eng: They all like being with her, even the wrinkled people like her, but 'Anay likes being alone.

rin: Trangkilo si 'Anay na magdrowing sana sadto mga papel niya ku mga pangulor niya o nagbabasa o pigkakantaan sadiri niya.
eng: Anay's okay just drawing on her pad papers with her crayons or reading or singing to herself.

rin: Gusto kong makingayamon ki Anay kindi abo man talaga niyang makingayamon kanako.
eng: I want to play with 'Anay but she mostly doesn't want to play with me.

rin: Buko man niya yan kasalan ta diri ko man kaya iya dapat pagkausipon, sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo.
eng: It's not her fault ta I can't talk to her either, the wrinkled people say.

rin: Pariyo man an ka gustong sabiyon ni Mamee, kindi sasabiyon na sana niya, "Batit... Di' mo pag-istorbuwon si 'Anay mo..."
eng: Mamee wants to say the same thing, but she just says, "Batit... Don't bother your Anay..."

rin: Su mga kurupos na tawo a sabi ku si 'Anay mas sadit pa kanako, magkakanta kuno 'di pag nababayad niyang nag-iiwag a kurtina.
eng: The wrinkled people say that when 'Anay was more little than me, she would sing whenever she saw the curtains moving.

rin: Pero su mga kurtina mag-iiwag dawa kin uda angin.
eng: But the curtains move even when there's no wind.

rin: Diri man talaga nagsosolo si 'Anay, sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo, ta pirmi niyang kaibanan su babaying igin, su igin na babaying malaka-ipo sa bok sa intero niyang lalawgon ag awak, su igin na babaying pirming nakatindog kaabay ni 'Anay.
eng: Anay is never really alone, the wrinkled people say, ta there is always the girl with her, the girl with hair all over her face and body, the girl always standing beside 'Anay.

rin: Sabi nira na su igin na babayi puru-pirming nakatindog kaabay kadto ni Mamee anggan sa magluwas sa buros ni Mamee si Anay ta iya su pinakaamiga ni Mamee.
eng: They say that the girl used to stand always beside Mamee until 'Anay came out of Mamee's tummy ta she's Mamee's best friend.

rin: Sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo linuwas man kuno su igin na babayi sadto buros ni Mamee.
eng: The wrinkled people say that the girl came out of Mamee's tummy, too.

rin: Magtatawa su igin na babayi pag inliwag niya su kurtina ta mapapakanta si 'Anay.
eng: The girl would laugh as she moved the curtains ta 'Anay would sing.

rin: Mapatatawa man pati si Mamee, tapos mapangingisi ag mapapatawa si Mamee pag nagkakanta si Anay.
eng: This makes Mamee laugh, too, and it makes Mamee smile or laugh whenever 'Anay sings.

rin: Magkakanta si 'Anay pag kinakaputan ku igin na babayi su bok ni 'Anay tapos pagngangayamnan adi.
eng: Anay sings whenever the girl would touch 'Anay's hair and play with it.

rin: Di' ko mabayad a mga kamot niya, Juanito, an sanang bok.
eng: I can't see her hands, Juanito, only hair.

rin: A usad pang beses na nababayad kong magbubura si Mamee a pag tutusaran na niya su bok ni 'Anay ta mala nang aba.
eng: The only other time I see Mamee cry is when she has to cut 'Anay's hair ta it's too long.

rin: Kasyan su sabi ni Mamee sa, "Pasensya na, kaipwanan ko 'ding gibuwon. Pasensya na."
eng: Mamee keeps on saying, "Sorry, I have to. Sorry."

rin: Si 'Anay pirming magsisilong ki Mamee na agko ngalas tapos sasabiyan niya si Manee na uda man iya ginigibong iyan kanya, paungot man si Mamee.
eng: Anay would always look at Mamee funny and tells her that Mamee's not doing anything bad to her, silly Mamee.

rin: Pero su igin na babaying kaiba ni Anay magtatangis ag makiki-mairak ki Mamee na purnundo, pumundo, pumundo, pupundo man nangga'd si Mamee ta narurungog na niya su igin na babaying nagrarait saka nababayad niyang su bok ni 'Anay nagrurugo na.
eng: But the girl with 'Anay will be crying and begging Mamee to stop, stop, stop and Mamee stops ta she hears the girl screaming and sees that 'Anay's hair is bleeding.

rin: Mababayad ko su igin na babayi, Juanito, pero si Anay diri.
eng: I see the girl, Juanito, but 'Anay cannot.

rin: Mababayad ko su mata ku igin na babayi ag abo kanako ku mata niya.
eng: I see the girl's eyes and her eyes don't like me.

rin: Pigsasabiyan niya ako na nungka ko pwedeng kausipon si 'Anay ko ta AKO... GURANON SI JUANITO...GURANON SI JUANITO... NYAAAAAAN...
eng: She tells me that I can't ever ever talk to my Anay and ta I... KILL JUANITO... KILL JUANITO... RIIIIIIGHT...

rin: Bana iya sawa pag kinakausip niya 'ko.
eng: She sounds like a snake when she talks to me.

rin: Kinukuko niya su 'Anay ko kanako saka gusto ko iyang sabiyan na pumundo pero sasabiyan ako ni Mamee sa, "Batit, di' magribok."
eng: She takes my 'Anay away from me and I want to tell her to stop but Mamee tells me, "Batit, be quiet."

rin: Minsan gusto kong putulon a bok ni 'Anay labi iyang turog ta makukulgan kadi su igin na babayi pang'la tibaad gumalin na iya.
eng: Sometimes I want to cut 'Anay's hair while she's asleep ta that would hurt the girl and maybe she would go away.

rin: Batit, ayaw... Kaya di man ako, ta sabi ni Mamee mabuot akong igin na babayi, Juanito, mabuot akong igin.
eng: Batit, don't... So I don't, ta Mamee always says I'm a good girl, Juanito, I'm a good girl.

rin: Kaya diri ako.
eng: So I don't.

rin: Payaba ako ni Mamee.
eng: Mamee loves me.

rin: Ag payaba man ika ni Mamee.
eng: And Mamee loves you, too.

rin: Juanito, sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo agko ginibo si mamee'ng iyan.
eng: Juanito, the wrinkled people say that mamee did something bad.

rin: Ku sadit pa iya na arog ko.
eng: When she was little like me.

rin: Buko man talaga niya adtong kasalan, sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo, pero dakol na remalasong nangyari ta... ta...
eng: It wasn't really her fault, the wrinkled people say, but bad things happened more ta... ta...

rin: Sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo na labing pigpaparakausip ni Mamee su mga kangayamon niya sadto kawoy na adto, mas makadu-dulag kuno su mga kangayamon niya sadto kawoy.
eng: The wrinkled people say that the more Mamee talked to her playmates in that tree, the more her playmates could leave the tree.

rin: Su mga kurupos na tawo a sabi iyan adi ta... ta...
eng: The wrinkled people say that this was bad ta... ta...

rin: Kaya pinabalik utro si Mamee sadto dati niyang baloy.
eng: So they sent Mamee back to her own house.

rin: Pero paggalin ni Mamee sadto lumang baloy ni Mama niya, dinara niya su tulong kangayamon niya.
eng: But when Mamee left her Mama's old house, she brought back three of her playmates with her.

rin: Diri adto dapat ginibo ni Mamee.
eng: Mamee wasn't supposed to do that.

rin: Su mga kangayamon niya dapat diri maggalin sadto kawoy, sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo.
eng: Her playmates weren't supposed to leave the tree, the wrinkled people say.

rin: Diri ngani sira dapat inniba ki Mamee.
eng: They weren't supposed to come with Mamee either.

rin: Ta sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo dapat sadto sana sira, arog nira.
eng: Ta the wrinkled people say that they were all supposed to stay there, just like them.

rin: Pero si Mamee ag su tulo niyang amigo nag-promisa sa kada usad.
eng: But Mamee and her three friends all promised each other.

rin: Di' ika maggalin.
eng: Don't go.

rin: Payaba tayka.
eng: I love you.

rin: Isi kong dinara ika ku mga pakpak kanako ku sadto pa 'ko buros ni Mamee.
eng: I know that the wings brought you to me when I was in Mamee's tummy.

rin: Arog man kanda ki 'Uya ag 'Anay saka su mga amigo nira.
eng: Just like 'Uya and 'Anay, and their best friends.

rin: Pero bukong arog nira 'Uya ag 'Anay ta pirmi ko ikang makakausip.
eng: But not like 'Uya and 'Anay because I could always talk to you.

rin: Among tuod ko ika, kindi lalaking igin ika arog ni 'Uya.
eng: You look like me, only you're a boy like 'Uya.

rin: Pero a lalawgon mo pang-bulawan na isura.
eng: But you have the face of a goldfish.

rin: Agko ika abong, matarom, patusok na ngipon.
eng: You have gray, sharp, pointy teeth.

rin: Dati sirang malumok pero kinukusa sa pagdadakulo ko.
eng: They used to be softer but they got harder as I grow.

rin: Dinnadakulo man ika.
eng: You grow.

rin: Su mga kurupos na tawo nagsabi na mababayad ko yan pag sinnisilung ako sa salming.
eng: The wrinkled people say that I can see that when I look in the mirror.

rin: Minsan mababayad ko ika, Juanito.
eng: I sometimes see you, Juanito.

rin: Saka mas lalo ko ikang mababayad pag di ta ika kinakausip.
eng: And I see you more and more when I don't talk to you.

rin: Sabi ku mga kurupos na tawo dapat kausipon tayka puru-pirmi 'nganing makauli nayka sadto kawoy.
eng: The wrinkled people say that I have to talk to you more so that you can go home to the tree.

rin: Si Mamee a sabi diri ko nayka pagparakausipon.
eng: Mamee says that I have to talk to you less.

rin: Dapat natuturog ako, pero isi kong kinakausip ika nguwan ni Mamee, isi ko.
eng: I'm supposed to be asleep, but I know Mamee's talking to you now, I know.

rin: Bumalik ika.
eng: Come back.

rin: Di na ko migribok, Juanito.
eng: I'll be quiet now, Juanito.

rin: Migngayamon na sana kita pagmata ko.
eng: We'll play again when I wake up.

rin: A tubong agimadmad sa usipon ni Tijam.
eng: The native agimadmad in Tijam's fiction.

rin: Danay ag dagos-dagos a bulos ka tubong imahinasyon sa mga istoryang nagsusulog sa Flowers for Thursday.
eng: The flow of the native imagination is constant and ceaseless in Flowers for Thursday.

rin: Malinaw na burabod ka imahinasyon na adi a agimadmad manungod sa Iriga, a ginikanan ni Mia.
eng: This lucidity springs from the consciousness about Iriga, Mia's birthplace.

rin: Alagad, bukong istorya sana sa lugar a nakaatang sa libro.
eng: It is, however, not just a story of a place that is offered here.

rin: A Iriga, na usad na duluwan bago umabot su mga Kastila ag sentro ka kulto sa aswang, banwa sana ka pagsakoy sa 'da upol na pag-una-una ag imahinasyon sa bago pang klase sa usipon, a nguwan binabaoy na speculative fiction.
eng: Iriga, a precolonial settlement and center of the cult to aswang, only serves as a wharf for sailing to the boundless expanse of wondering and the wandering imagination.

rin: A aswang ag su mga karakter na nakatakod kanya, nangangasot bilang metapora.
eng: The aswang and the other creatures linked to her character haunt like a metaphor.

rin: Ag gamot na ni Mia ka agimadmad sa lugar pinagkutkutan na nagtaong rarom ag kakanyahan sa mga istoryang parte kading koleksyon niya.
eng: And root where Mia draws her consciousness about the place which gives sharpness and uniqueness to the stories.

rin: Kaya sadi, si Mia bilang parausip ag parasurat, nagin usad ag simbolikong balyana.
eng: So here, Mia as both author and storyteller, becomes the symbolic balyana.

rin: Su suanoy na babaying namumuon ka rito para ki aswang.
eng: The precolonial woman who leads the ritual to aswang.

rin: A pagmidbid ka pag-usip ag pagsurat kina-kaipuwan na sambiton sadi ta katubuan ka mga istorya sa koleksyon nakagamot sa panahon sa pag-uusip, na kadto paagi sa pagkakatuod ag pagmuya-muya.
eng: Distinguishing the act of writing and narrating is needed to be noted here as most of the stories in the collection are rooted in the time of orality, when articulation was the medium for education and entertainment.

rin: Mia bilang parasurat, tinuytuyan ading pagkakaiba ag angganan ka pag-uusip, arog ka balyana na midyum ka pagbalyo ag pakikiusip galin sa nababayad ag di' nababayad na kinaban, sa nakaagi ag sa nguwan.
eng: Mia as a writer, crossed the bridge of difference and boundary of expression like the balyana who was the medium of dialogue between the visible and invisible world, between the past and the present.

rin: Sa sinublian na ngangabilon.
eng: In a borrowed tongue.

rin: Nagibo niya 'ding matrayumpo sa lenggwaheng nag-aguman su bisto ag estranyo, su luma ag kontemporaryo, su maugma ag malipungow sa espasyo ag turos ka speculative fiction.
eng: She achieves it in a language where the known and the stranger, the past and the contemporary, the joyful and melancholic merge in a space given free reign by speculative fiction.

rin: Sa "Waiting for Agua de Mayo, si Bakunawa, su suanoy na dragon na pigtutubudan na tutulnon a bulan (kin agko eklipse) ag pag-aaluwon ka mga kababaiyan sa pangunguna ka balyana, nagin dakulong ugot (bayawak sa Tagalog) na tutunga kin Mayo sa Barit na usad na salog sa Iriga.
eng: In "Waiting for Agua de Mayo", Bakunawa, the ancient dragon believed to devour the moon during an eclipse and which is driven away by women led by the balyana, is transformed into a giant monitor lizard (called bayawak in Tagalog) which comes out in May at the Barit River in Iriga.

rin: Sadi, ana tema ka pagpapasaluib ag kulog na dara kadi, tinawan sa pagpapaumay ka pag-usip kadi.
eng: Here, the theme of betrayal and the ensuing pain is given healing through the narrative.

rin: Kaya sa uri, nag-unga ag naisip na sana ku nag-uusip na:
eng: In the end, the narrator merely asked and thought:

rin: Pigtutubudan na ana unang uran sa Mayo makakapaumay.
eng: It is believed that the first rain in May has a healing power.

rin: Alagad sa nagdududang unga ka parausip, isi tang maapros a namamati niya ta nalingaw iya na utubon su pangako niya, o di ising a ugot sa taga-Iriga agko man kahulugan na sunson.
eng: But in the doubt of the narrator we know that what she is feeling is painful because she did not keep her promise nor know that the Irigueño term for monitor lizard, ugot, also means tight.

rin: Inutob ku ugot su sunson niyang pangako alagad su parausip buko.
eng: The amphibious lizard kept tight his promise but not the narrator.

rin: A pag-umay na dara ka Agua de Mayo makuko sana niya sa pag-uusip ag pag-una-una.
eng: She will only feel the healing power of Agua de Mayo by telling the story, and through mere speculation.

rin: Alagad sa "The Ascension of Our Lady Boy", nakamtan a pag-umay ka mayor na karakter na ku una maribong su dalagan ka buway.
eng: In "The Ascension of Our Lady Boy", the narrator experienced this healing even if she were previously leading a conflicted life.

rin: Sa una, bagana iya si Dr. Dolittle na nakakausip su mga mga teksas na pambulang ku si ama niya.
eng: Early on, she is like a Doctor Dolittle who can talk to the fighting cocks of his father.

rin: Sa uri, iya sinaro ag binalyuwan ku kapangyariyan ag kadunungan ku katabang na aswang.
eng: Later, she embodies and assumes the power and wisdom of their aswang househelp.

rin: Sadi, buko ading su nagmamaris-maris na linalang na ginibong maraot ku mga Kastila.
eng: Here, the aswang is not the shape-shifting creation of lore demonized by the Spaniards.

rin: O su nasa imahinasyon ku mga parasimbag sa pag-aadal ku Heswitang si Fr. Frank Lynch.
eng: Or the one imagined by the respondents in a study by the Jesuit Frank Lynch.

rin: Kindi usad na parasaray sa mga memorya.
eng: But a keeper and repository of memory.

rin: Si Lady Boy mismo bagana binuway na asog.
eng: Lady Boy herself became like a transformed asog.

rin: Su lalaking pag-aarog-arugon a gawi ag pagbado-bado ka balyana.
eng: The male priest of old who imitates the gesture and garb of the balyana.

rin: Nagpapabayad adi kapangyariyan ag alangkaw na kamutangan ku mga kababaiyan bago su kolonisasyon.
eng: This shows the power and high position of women before the country's colonization.

rin: Sa uri, maugmang nag-uuna-una na sana si Lady Boy.
eng: In the end, Lady Boy exalts.

rin: Winner talaga mga istorya ta magaan a paggamit ag pangayamon sa kontemporaryong lengwahe ag mga teksto sa popular na kultura na nagsasarumsom sa koleksyon.
eng: Yes, the stories are winners because of the light, playful, and contemporary language and texts from popular culture that pervade them.

rin: Ana Tagalog na ekspresyon na "mabilis pa sa alas-kwatro", literal na pigdakitaramon na "faster than four o'clock" na syempre makatatawa.
eng: The Tagalog expression "mabilis pa sa alas-kwatro" is literally translated as "faster than four o'clock, which certainly is funny.

rin: Su pamosong dayalogo ka taga-Irigang si Nora Aunor na "hayop, hayop, hayop" sa Ina ka ng Anak Mo, o si Kurt Cobain, Nirvana, ag Demi Moore, 'lakanatural ka pagkakaiba sa mga naratibo.
eng: Nora Aunor's famous line "hayop, hayop, hayop" in Ina ka ng Anak Mo, or Kurt Cobain, Nirvana, and Demi Moore are seamlessly merged in the narratives.

rin: Ag ana usad na silabang ta na sa Iriga agko kahulugan na silngan (bilang konsekwensya) o dahilan, maalnas na naisuksok sa pagsaysay ta kinakaipuwan ag agko rason, arog ku mga paraabol sa nipis de piña sa Iriga.
eng: And the single-syllabled Irigueño word ta, which also means to see the consequence and reason, easily melded in the narrative of "Talking to Juanito" because it is inevitable and reasonable like the deft weavers of the nipis de piña of old in Iriga.

rin: Sa koleksyon na adi, salak ana estilong Quentin Tarantino magin a noir ka mga Prangko, alimbawa sa "What the Children of Muerta Caxerex Say".
eng: In this collection, Quentin Tarantino and even the French noir are combined as in the "What the Children of Muerta Caxerex Say".

rin: Kin sa "Tandoz" ka taga-Sorsogon na si Delfin Fresnosa ana kawoy bagana sana prop sa entablado 'nganing palutuwon ana kusog ku karakter, sa darwang istorya sadi koleksyon, "Remembering Thursday" ag "Talking to Juanito".
eng: And where a tree in "Tandoz" by Sorsogon writer Delfin Fresnosa only serves as some kind of a prop in a stage play to show the power of the character, in "Remembering Thursday" and "Talking to Juanito".

rin: Ana kawoy agko mismo kusog ag kapangyariyan.
eng: The tree itself is endowed with supernatural power.

rin: Winner ta sa pagsurat sa usipon sa Ingles, pinapadagos ni Mia su tradisyon sa pagsurat ka mga Irigueña na pinu'nan ni Felicidad V. Ocampo, na segun ki Zoilo Galang, unang Filipina na nagsurat sa nobela sa Ingles.
eng: This collection is a winner because by writing fiction, Mia continues the literary tradition of Irigueña began by Felicidad V. Ocampo, who according to Zoilo Galang was the first Filipina to have written a novel in English.

rin: Ag ni Socorro Federis-Tate, na a mga usipon manungod sa mga ordinaryong buhay ka mga kababaiyan na katubuan pinapasipara.
eng: And Socorro Federis-Tate, whose short stories tell the ordinary lives of women otherwise ignored and marginalized.

rin: Winner ta a usad na potensyal na binuksan ka speculative fiction ag sa koleksyon na adi ana pag-una-una ag imahinasyon sa mga posibleng ibang mundo.
eng: This is a winner because a potential space opened by speculative fiction and this collection is the imagination of other possible worlds.

rin: Sa quantum physics binabaoy ading many worlds, parallel universe, alternative history.
eng: It comes in many words and descriptions in quantum physics like many worlds, parallel universe, alternative history.

rin: A posibilidad na magkaagko katampad na buway a usad na indibidwal resulta ka binabaoy na decoherence sa wave function ka uniberso.
eng: This possibility that an individual may have a parallel life is a result of what is called decoherence in the wave function of the universe.

rin: Alagad a "kambal" o doppelgänger, ag a kinopyan niya arog ka sinabi ni Kipling manungod ka Sirangan ag Sulnupan, diri migkasabatan.
eng: But the twin or doppelgänger of the other, like Kipling's East and West, will never meet.

rin: A darwa o dakol pang magkaparehong karakter migkaagko sadiring dalagan sa buway.
eng: The double or the other "copies" will live different lives.

rin: Ag sabi ngani ka parasaysay sa "Wishes Do Come True", a arog niya magigin sana "shadow of what might have been, of the what if, of that wish that you will make."
eng: As put by the narrator in "Wishes Do Come True,” she will only remain "a shadow of what might have been, of the what if, of that wish that you will make."

rin: A quantum physics ag speculative fiction inu-unga adi ag magigin posible.
eng: This self-same question is asked in both quantum physics and speculative fiction where things become possible.

rin: Unga ngani liwat ni Lady Boy, "Winner 'di ba?"
eng: Like Lady Boy's afterthought, "Winner 'di ba?"

rin: Pagrumrom ka Huwebes.
eng: Remembering Thursday.

rin: A mga ngayo-ngayo magigin matuod.
eng: Wishes do come true.

rin: A pagsubida ka kanatong inang binabayi.
eng: The ascencion of our lady boy.

rin: Mga balubagi ka mga igin ka Muerta Caxerex.
eng: What the children of Muerta Caxerex say.

rin: Para sa ragang rinaranga na tibaad magka-agko naman ibang glorya.
eng: For the beloved land that she may have a different glory.

rin: A pagluwas kading librong adi, dakulang utang na boot ko ki Kristian Cordero ag a bagong butwang Agnus Press.
eng: Coming out with this book, I owe a great deal to Kristian Cordero and the newly-surfaced Agnus Press.

rin: Mabalos man ki Patrick Bilog sa pagpipirot.
eng: Thanks too to Patrick Bilog for working overtime.

rin: Rinoromrom ko man si Rudy Alano ag si Mother Lily Realubit, sa pagbusol kanako ku mga unang aldow.
eng: I also remember Rudy Alano and Mother Lily Realubit for pushing me early on.

rin: Si Prof. Doods Santos, sa pagtaong kusog boot.
eng: To Prof. Doods Santos for the confidence-building.

rin: A mga ka-iba ko sa KABULIG-Bikol para sa iribanan ag magkaparehong pangaturugan para sa literaturang Bikol.
eng: My colleagues in the KABULIG-Bikol for the company and our shared vision for Bikol literature.

rin: A familia ko na pirmeng san dawa ono man ag sa Kagurangnan, para sa balaog niyang magkalaman a ngangabilon.
eng: My family who is always there no matter what and to God for the gift of giving flesh to the word.

rin: Aspaltadong apon, rinambongan sa maniba-ibang kolor.
eng: Asphalted afternoon, bloomed in various colors.

rin: Pagbagwak ku uran.
eng: At the sudden downpour.

rin: Mga nagbuklad na payong.
eng: Umbrellas unfolding.

rin: Aaabot a pagsulay ka atop ag pagpapapusog ka arigi sa ingod.
eng: The time for mending the shingles on the roof comes and supporting the house post.

rin: Magin ana pagtipon sa igatong sa dapog.
eng: As well as the gathering of firewood for the earth.

rin: Ta pag-abot ka uran agko imbong a pamaan sa bangbangan ag mainit sa buros ag tutulnan a kapeng tinutong na bugas, kaagom ka palupsing inanisan.
eng: For when the rain comes the ember gives warmth and the burnt rice coffee is hot on the tummy and the throat, and goes well with the sticky rice cake sprinkled with anise seeds.

rin: Ta ang mga manok nagtutugpaan na.
eng: For the chickens are homing now.

rin: Huli gayod ta su mga apoon ta man mga parabaklay.
eng: Perhaps because our ancestors were themselves voyagers.

rin: Kaya diri kita natotoon, o natutu-ong sa sadiri tang lugar.
eng: So we are restless, and do not stay in our own place.

rin: Maski su mga bagay o tawo na nagtao kanatong ngaran .
eng: Even those people and things which gave us fame.

rin: Su Alatco, si Nora, Saavedra sagkod si Taduran.
eng: Alatco, Nora, Saavedra and Taduran.

rin: Galin kanato alagad raga man nira ginalinan.
eng: are from our town which they also eventually left.

rin: Ta ono uda ta sadi ta pirme kitang nagtatan-aw.
eng: For what it is that we lack that we always look afar.

rin: Sa arayo sagkod ibang pangpang o ka-oman.
eng: Towards different shores and fields.

rin: Mantang mas masin-ag a aldow sa Sumagang.
eng: When the sun at Sumagang is brighter.

rin: A tubig padagos a bulos, sa Masoso ag Butawan?
eng: And water continually flows at Masosu and Butawan?

rin: Kusog-boot na naninirbiyan sa mga among dayuhan.
eng: Bravely our parents and children serve foreign masters.

rin: A mga kag-igin o igin ta, por medyo raw sana sa dolyar.
eng: Is it only for the dollar or so that when they come home.

rin: Onganing pagmagbalik-bayan agko ipaiinom sa mga binayaan, stateside na alak ag sigarilyo para sa mga istambay?
eng: They will have imported wine and cigarettes to offer to the bystanders?

rin: A mga raraga ta isinusugal, onra maski ana buway.
eng: Our daughters gamble their honor and life.

rin: Sa mga baga na inaabagat na pigseserbiyan.
eng: To their seemingly in-heat employers.

rin: A mga soltero ta linalabanan ana lula, katibaadan.
eng: Our sons fight seasickness or uncertainties.

rin: Sa iwas kana kadagatan, nganing magka-agko man atop a baloy.
eng: In the expanse of the ocean, so that the house will have a roof.

rin: Makapag-adal su kauriyan.
eng: The youngest will go to school.

rin: Mabalukat su raga, mabayaran su malang-abang listan sa utang sa kaabay na tindan ni Nana Istang.
eng: Or the land let will be redeemed, and the long credit line at Nana Istang's store can be paid.

rin: Tinitios nira a agnow ka nieve.
eng: They withstand the coldness of snow.

rin: Na iba man sa agnow kin Disyembre sadi.
eng: Which is much unlike the coldness in December here.

rin: Ta adi sinusuksok san tulang ag laman.
eng: For this cuts through the bones and flesh.

rin: Baga na ragom ka kamunduan.
eng: Like a needle for the sadness.

rin: Na tinutusok sa rurugan pagpisisilngan.
eng: Which prick the breast while watching.

rin: Ana maiwas ag da katapusan na kaputian.
eng: The vast and endless whiteness.

rin: O maski na ana init kana baybay.
eng: Or even the heat of the sand.

rin: Kin sari ana angin nagtataol sa kalipongawan.
eng: Where the wind howls in loneliness.

rin: Kinakaya nira di sa irarom ka ibang bitoon o bulan,
eng: They endure this under different stars and moon.

rin: Nangangaturugan para sa maray na aldow o kina-udmaan.
eng: Dreaming for a better day or tomorrow.

rin: Na di nira nasisilag sadi kanatong kabukidan.
eng: Which they do not see in our own mountains.

rin: Ta kulang raw kaya kita sa pagtubod sa kanatong sadiri.
eng: For do we lack faith in our own selves.

rin: Kaya binabayaan ta sa iba na magsabi.
eng: So we leave to others and say.

rin: Amo di maray para kaninyo, amo masabot.
eng: This is what is good for you, what is important.

rin: Alagad di ta naririsa su kanirang mga kamot, sibot sa baol basa ka kaninyong bag-ot.
eng: But we do not notice that their hands are busy and wet with your sweat.

rin: Naggalin raw kita ta di ta mabayad sadi raga.
eng: Do we leave because we do not see in the land.

rin: Na poon ka ngaran ta, a marambong na udma?
eng: The root of our name, a green future?

rin: Pinanluyan na raw kita sa boot?
eng: Have we lost faith?

rin: Sa mga nangako ag nag-abot sa kamot.
eng: In those who promised and gave their hands.

rin: Dadaraon kita sa minamawot.
eng: To bring us to the prosperity.

rin: Pag-uswag na pigoorop-orop?
eng: That we dream and hope?

rin: Naglalayog a mga ngangabilon ta.
eng: Our words soar.

rin: Alagad, mga panganoron kin tag-init.
eng: But they are clouds in summer.

rin: Na uda darang uran para sa guak na mga ka-oman.
eng: Which bear no rain for the gaping fields.

rin: Linulunad kita sa lawi ka mga kaogman.
eng: We ride in the feather of merriment.

rin: Inoyop ka angin ta malang gaan.
eng: Which the wind blows for its lightness.

rin: Kaya ngani nganod nakaugpa na tulos sa di uman paliyanan.
eng: And which later lands not in its destination.

rin: Pirme kitang nagbabaklay ag katubuan.
eng: We always journey and mostly.

rin: Parayo sa raga, baga na a distancia.
eng: Away from the land, as if the distance .

rin: Rason nganing silngan ta a Iriga.
eng: Is a reason we will see Iriga

rin: Na agko pag-ultanan, sa bitnga ta.
eng: With a chasm between us.

rin: Sagkod a kanyang kamutangan.
eng: And its fate.

rin: Na pirme sa nakaagi, na baga uda pakilabot.
eng: Which is always in the past.

rin: Baga na uda kita utang na boot.
eng: As if we don't care.

rin: Sa gatas ka kanyang pagkaboot.
eng: The milk of her love.

rin: Pabayaan na sanang a kanakong rawit-dawit.
eng: Let it be my songs then.

rin: A maglayog paabot sa langit.
eng: That will fly towards heaven.

rin: Ta sira mga uda tulang ag laman.
eng: For they do not have bones and flesh.

rin: Bukong ading mga ka-iginan.
eng: Not these children.

rin: Na mababarian o maruruguan.
eng: For they will be bloodied and broken.

rin: Pabayaan na a kanakong mga awit amo itaon sa pakikipagtatsian ka kanatong mga kabanwaan para sa udmang magigisngan.
eng: Allow my songs to be wagered in this gamble for the future.

rin: O, Iriga, Iriga.
eng: Oh, Iriga, Iriga.

rin: Ragang rinaranga.
eng: My beloved land.

rin: Sasangrangaw man ika.
eng: While you may be but an inch,.

rin: Sa sukol kana iba.
eng: In others' measure.

rin: Kanako, maski na.
eng: To me you are far wider.

rin: Maiwas pa'y ka sa mga lugar na inabutan.
eng: Than the land I have reached.

rin: O inabutan na kading mga lugar na inabutan.
eng: Or reached by those lands that I have reached.

rin: O binayaan, o tinurugan sagkod pinangaturuganan sa pagbabaklay.
eng: Or which I have left or slept in and dreamed in my travels.

rin: Ta uda ibang raga, na tinitindogan.
eng: For there is no other land where I will stand.

rin: Uda ibang raga, na tutumban.
eng: There is no other land where I will fall.

rin: Kindi ika sana, nabobotan kong Iriga.
eng: But only in you my beloved Iriga.

rin: Ay, alagad, kaipuwan na'y kang magmata .
eng: But you have to rise.

rin: Ta ana mga manok nagtutugpaan na.
eng: For the chickens are homing now.

rin: Garat na angin.
eng: Crack in the air.

rin: Inabol kading lawa na nakabitin.
eng: Was woven by the spider hanging.

rin: Ambon sa dawon.
eng: Dew on leaf.

rin: Pag-ulog sadto bobon nagalon-alon.
eng: When it fell on the well ripples

rin: Guak na oma ag magramrag na uran.
eng: Parched fields and rain overnight.

rin: Su tupang ogma.
eng: Overjoyed toads.

rin: Tabako, bunga isalak apog, buyo ngamin pupula.
eng: Tobacco and areca mixed with lime and pepper leaf all become red.

rin: Su pula palan kanatong namaanan tudang pamaan.
eng: The red we saw was an ember.

rin: Pakiturol raw ka asin.
eng: Please pass the salt.

rin: Napipila na ading maapros.
eng: My wound is healing.

rin: Uda na 'ko namamatian.
eng: I don't feel anything.

rin: Baka ako makaturog ag kumusa nang dagos.
eng: I'm afraid to fall asleep and end up hardened.

rin: Dawa gatingay sanang ibudbod nganing diri ako malumay.
eng: Just a sprinkle so I won't be enchanted.

rin: ka kantang pinaparungog para kita mananok.
eng: by the song I'm made to hear to make us slumber.

rin: Adi kayang alsom da na birtud.
eng: For sourness has lost its potency.

rin: Da na apri a lemonsito.
eng: the lemon lost its acidity.

rin: Da na kulog a latigo.
eng: the whip lost its pain.

rin: Abo kong maging bato.
eng: I don't want to turn into stone.

rin: Dagos a pasakit sa banwaan.
eng: The people continue to suffer.

rin: Ag ngamin na pagpapalingaw.
eng: And all that will make them forget.

rin: Kaya dapat na magbilar.
eng: So I have to stay awake.

rin: Pakiturol ka asin.
eng: Pass the salt please.

rin: Kinta unu uda relo a mga dispatsadora sa malls?
eng: Why mall salesladies have no wristwatches?

rin: Sadi, pupundo o papupundon a oras.
eng: Here, time stops or made to stop.

rin: ilado sana sa sadi ngowan.
eng: Frozen in the here and now.

rin: Pirmeng kaliwangan sa kaaldawan sinisiguro kading rinibong mga fluorescent lamps.
eng: The brightness of daylight ensured by the thousands of fluorescent lamps.

rin: Ana katuyuwan, nganing pumirme.
eng: The reason is for you to stay.

rin: Mauban kamo sading uda gab-i.
eng: To tarry longer here where there is no evening.

rin: Kin gumagalin man talagang nasukdanan sa pamamakal.
eng: If you must leave, it is because you have shopped and now ready to drop.

rin: Alagad, a oras agko sadiring pagpapaisi.
eng: But time has its own way of telling.

rin: Sa mga dispatsadora, break na.
eng: For the salesladies, it is break time.

rin: Pag-abot ka temporaryong karelyebo nira.
eng: If their temporary relievers have arrived.

rin: Nganing uminom sa tubig.
eng: For them to drink water.

rin: Pampasulog ku kin-10 na biscuit.
eng: To wash down their throat a ten-peso biscuit.

rin: Dawa abo nirang mag-break.
eng: Even if they do not want to take a break.

rin: Ginigibo na sana, para makaula basang ag maingaluan a mga paang mala nang laman, baga na si Scwharzenneger.
eng: They do so to at least give their feet some rest, their calves now looking like that of Scwharzenneger's.

rin: Para ka mga istambay.
eng: For the by-standers.

rin: Oras nang bumalyo sa lugar.
eng: It is time to change one's place.

rin: pag su sikyo, maraot na silong ag sira pigbabalik-balikan.
