eng: If the security guard now stares at them sharply, and keeps coming back.

rin: A sekreto kaya, nganing di ika sitahon.
eng: The secret actually so you wouldn't be harassed.

rin: Dapat agko'y ka kapot-kapot basang na French fries o kaya plastic bag na agko ngaran ka mall.
eng: You should hold at least French fries or a plastic bag with the name of the mall.

rin: Katubuan, ana buros, mata ag tiil ana magsasabing tama nang magkaon.
eng: Always, it's the stomach, the eyes and the feet which tell if it is time to eat.

rin: Nabayad mo na ngamin su mga sale.
eng: If you have seen all the items on sale.

rin: Ag ana maul-ol na rapa-rapa.
eng: And if your sole already ache.

rin: O kaya rinarayuma na ka kusog ka aircon.
eng: Or your arthritis bother you no end because of the aircon.

rin: Amo 'yan senyal na oras nang pauli sa baloy.
eng: That is the signal to go home.

rin: Alagad, ana pinakamaaasahan na relo na migsabing oras nang pumundo amo ana bulsa.
eng: But the most reliable watch which will tell it is time to stop is your pocket.

rin: pag uda na'y ka mabutbot san pitaka.
eng: if you can't fish anything anymore from your wallet.

rin: Para kan na naman na mga dispatsadora, a aldow tapos na.
eng: And for the salesladies it is the day's end.

rin: Su sigurado sirang mangitngit na sa luwas.
eng: When they are certain it is already dark outside.

rin: Amo pag-abot ka paglinya.
eng: When they stand in line.

rin: A ritwal na nagsasabing mataban sira.
eng: The ritual which says they are thieves.

rin: Kin kuno, usad-usad, sirang kakapkapan.
eng: When, one by one, they will be frisked.

rin: Poon sa paa, abot sadto kalson, pati bra.
eng: From down up to their panties and bras.

rin: Maski pati namamati nirang baga na agko malisya.
eng: Even when they sensed there was malice.

rin: Su pag apulas ko tibong sikyo sadto rurugan nira.
eng: In how the lesbian guard ran her hand on their breasts.

rin: Amo sana 'yan panahon na magagamit na su relo nira, nganing sabiyan sira ka kamaturan ka panoro-aldow nirang pagkabuway.
eng: That is the only time they can wear their watches to thell them the truth of their daily lives.

rin: Sadi luwas ka mall.
eng: Outside of the mall.

rin: Mantang mikipag-agawan naman sira sa lunadan.
eng: When they shove for a ride.

rin: Sa kusog ka uran.
eng: Under a stormy rain.

rin: Sadi republika sa kalamidad.
eng: In the republic of calamities.

rin: A pagigin bukas ka palad usad na ngangalasan.
eng: Generosity is a miracle.

rin: Toninong iyang mangyayari, baga na pagbubuswak ka burak ka waterlily san lamod.
eng: It happens silently like the unfolding of a waterlily in the muck.

rin: Susunod tulos iya ka lambang remalaso: linog, kasulo, bagyo.
eng: It follows fast each disaster: earthquakes, fires, typhoons.

rin: Nakaputos tulos a pagdamay: nakaplastic cup na mami, sardinas sa lata, lumang mga bado, madali nang mapasong bulong.
eng: Concerned comes always packed: noodles in plastic cups, sardines in cans, old clothes, medicines nearing expiration.

rin: Kasunod kadi, a mga kamera: photo op sadi, photo op siton, pan-front page udma sa newspaper ni Congressman o ni Governor.
eng: After this the cameras: photo ops here, photo ops there, front-page materials tomorrow for the Congressman or Governor.

rin: Sa dakulong mga letra, inoomaw sira.
eng: Which in bold letters, praise them,.

rin: Sirang natutudang mga bukas palad.
eng: They the only generous people left.

rin: Nagtatabang sa mga biktima ka kalamidad!
eng: Giving aid to the victims of calamities!

rin: Alagad, paguli sadto opisina nira.
eng: However, once they are in their offices.

rin: ka sibot na migkuenta pera man magugunting sadto calamity fund nira.
eng: They will be very busy counting how much they will get from their calamity fund.

rin: Meyor, migpakasal po ako ku soltero.
eng: Mayor, my son will get married.

rin: Ninang po ika.
eng: You will be a principal sponsor.

rin: Paromromon ko sana Sir na madrina si meyor.
eng: Sir, we will just remind the Mayor that she's a wedding sponsor.

rin: Kan nang fecha-30, ag su pangako niyang baktin, usad na sakong bugas, ag P5,000.
eng: This 30th and about the pig that she promised, the sack of rice and the P5,000. cash.

rin: Ono man ta ginigibo ninyo kong ping-pong?
eng: Why are you treating us like a ping-pong ball?

rin: Kin abo ninyo, 23 man sana kaming botante saa familia.
eng: If you don't want to give, we're just 23 voters in the family

rin: 2007 na bahala kamo!
eng: It's 2007 and it's up to you!

rin: Arog kadi pag-alop.
eng: This is what hunger is like.

rin: Maiwas a loog ka kanakong bituka.
eng: Wide is the inside of my entrails.

rin: Sa kamaturan baga na di kweba.
eng: Much more like a cave.

rin: Agko mga ngipon na baga na labaha.
eng: They have teeth that are razor-sharp.

rin: Kin kinakarit malang aritiit.
eng: Too painful when it cuts.

rin: Sirangon mo sa loog a ngitngit
eng: Look at the darkness inside.

rin: Ag rarom ka di na tatao sa pagkaon.
eng: And the depth of one who knows no food.

rin: Nababayad mo ana aldat na lila?
eng: Do you see the purple pain?

rin: Nganod-nganod, kumkirikot iya.
eng: Later, it will coil unto itself.

rin: Bubutnolon a mga laman sa buros ko.
eng: Tie into a knot the flesh in my stomach.

rin: Dangan tumtingkarag na baga na sawa.
eng: Then it will look you in the eye like a snake.

rin: Amo iyan lilikayan kong kamandag niya.
eng: I try to avoid its venomous stare.

rin: Ta amo di magpapalungsi, magpapa-ogot ka kanakong inangos.
eng: For it is this that implaes, tightens my breath.

rin: Agko man adi tambal arog baga kin nakakapurot sa mga tuda-tuda, na kaninyo basura.
eng: It has its cure, however as when we chance upon left-overs which you consider trash.

rin: Alagad kanamo anda na sa piyesta.
eng: But which are to us fit for a fiesta.

rin: Arog baga ku inapon na fried chicken.
eng: Like the fried chicken thrown.

rin: Na amo na nagin balon pagpirong ku darwa kong mga igin.
eng: Which my two children took home in their sleep.

rin: Kin namumurak a mga rap-rap.
eng: When the dap-dap are abloom.

rin: Naroromroman ko su rapa-rapa niya.
eng: I remember the sole of her feet.

rin: Namamaga sa pagparabaklay.
eng: Swollen from roaming.

rin: Sa mga bukid sagkod oma.
eng: The forests and the fields.

rin: Nali a mga tiil niyang natood sana sa mga salog na de alpombra.
eng: Of which they are ignorant having grown up in carpented floors.

rin: Umuula iya sadto gilid ko payag.
eng: She would sit in a corner of the shade.

rin: Ag iuunat su paa niya.
eng: Where she would stretch her legs.

rin: Dangan uupsoon na luway-luway.
eng: Then slowly pulls down her stockings.

rin: su medyas ag sapatos na a rira ngalngal na alagad da sana ribok ku rayong minartsa.
eng: And shoes which tongues stick out yet uncomplaining about the distance of the march.

rin: Toninong iyang mig-ukag ku tiil na agko na lapak ag mapula.
eng: Silently, she would massage her feet calloused and reddened.

rin: Pababayaan na amo magpa-umay.
eng: Allowing instead to soothe her aches.

rin: A angin na iniinging ana agrangay ka masa ginakos na niya.
eng: The wind which whisper the cry of the masses she had embraced.

rin: Baga na nauban nang naudang erencia.
eng: Like a long lost relative.

rin: Tinugpa na Jollibee sa Iriga.
eng: Jolilibee has alighted in Iriga.

rin: A tam-is na durudara niya.
eng: The sweetness it brings.

rin: Nagtaong kaogman sa mga mata.
eng: Gave happiness to the eyes

rin: Ka kaiginan na tubod ki Aga.
eng: Of children who admires Aga.

rin: Kaya ngowan sadto mga basuran.
eng: So now among the garbage bins.

rin: Sabay ka ayam nagbabarungkal .
eng: Along with the scouring dogs.

rin: Mga igin gusto man manamitan.
eng: Are street urchins wanting to taste.

rin: Tudang chicken joy ag hamburger yum.
eng: Chickenjoy and hamburger leftovers.

rin: Pula a mga mais sa San Pedro.
eng: The corn seeds are red in San Pedro.

rin: Natugma ko pinatiting rugo ko pinatumbang baru-bata nakagood sadto rap-rap.
eng: Dyed by the blood let by a youth killed tied on a dap-dap tree.

rin: Inoonga ta ngowan.
eng: We now ask.

rin: Para sa ono?
eng: For what?

rin: Para ki isay?
eng: For whom?

rin: Anggan kuno?
eng: Until when?

rin: Ta anggan ngowan malangsa pa a angin sa mga bukid.
eng: For until now the wind still smell of blood in the hills.

rin: A dawon ka mais sundang na malang tatarom.
eng: The corn leaves are sharp bolos.

rin: Ag a mais mismo mga ngipon na nagraragot sa pagka-ungut.
eng: And the kernels themselves are teeth that gnash in anger.

rin: Sari paiyan ading baga na uda katapusan na pagparabaklay sa mga kakadlaganan?
eng: Where is this seemingly endless wandering in the forests heading?

rin: Ading pagka-andal sa pag-abot ka kagab-iyan?
eng: This fear when the night sets in?

rin: Kuno makaturog sa nanok ading mga kabaluyan?
eng: When will these houses have a deep sleep?

rin: Na nasa bitnga ka kariribukan na di man nira inanap.
eng: They who are caught in the middle of this conflict which they did not seek.

rin: Alagad tinubo sa raga nirang baga na mga doot sadto kamaisan na abo nang magabot?
eng: But which grew on their land like weeds in the cornfields which do not want to be uprooted?

rin: Nagluludab na sili a mga mata.
eng: A fiery pepper its eyes.

rin: Malinaw na jolens di nagkikimat-kimat.
eng: An unblinking clear marble.

rin: Mantang luwas-loog sa kulit niya.
eng: Gets in and out of its skin.

rin: A ragom ag tursido.
eng: The needle and thread.

rin: Tama subago ararom alagad mantang pinupunas.
eng: A wound sustained awhile ago.

rin: A rugo na nagsusom sa laman.
eng: Deep but while the blood that seeps.

rin: Tindog iyang baga na da basang na kinupad-kupad ag baga na binutong.
eng: From the flesh is wiped away it stood erect as if nothing happened.

rin: A natutuda pang kusog, tinuturaok.
eng: What was left of its strength, it crowed.

rin: Usad na naman na aldow akong naka-ipli sa kirikiti ku kawali.
eng: It's one day gained from the frying pan again.

rin: Bilib ako ki ma'am.
eng: Ma'am amazes me.

rin: Baga na da basang.
eng: As if nothing happened.

rin: Di mo 'ya mababaydan sa ono man.
eng: You wouldn't see a trace.

rin: Na pagbabago kinaramgan.
eng: Of change the morning after.

rin: Maski rungog ko su gab'i.
eng: Even if I heard last night.

rin: Mga napupusang pinggan.
eng: Plates crashing.

rin: Ag pinupugong na ugong.
eng: And muffled moaning.

rin: Baga na da basang kinaudmaan.
eng: As if nothing happened the following day.

rin: Mantang pinagbabayubuan niya a kanyang mga masetas, mga rosas ag gumamelang lila arog ka pisngi niya.
eng: While she tends her garden, the roses, the purple hibiscus which is also the color of her face.

rin: Baga na da basang maski puro-pirme arog kadi a nangyayari.
eng: As if nothing happened even if it is always this way.

rin: Pag mag-uli si sir na tayong o orog na kin nakasungsong.
eng: Whenever sir goes home drunk or even more when stoned.

rin: Baga na da basang ku usad na gab'ing gisingon ako ni ma'am.
eng: As if nothing happened one evening when ma'am woke me up.

rin: Pinatatalbong kanako su mga pinidasong laman sadto mga masetas niyang mga rosas, ag gumamelang pula.
eng: She asked me to bury chopped pieces of flesh in her garden of roses and red hibiscus.

rin: Arog ko basang pranela ipinamputos niya.
eng: Like the drenched towel with which she wrapped them.

rin: Baga na da basang iyang nagbabayubo kinaramragan ku mga masetas niya.
eng: As if nothing happened the following morning while she tends her garden.

rin: Mga rosas ag gumamela na diri na miglila arog ka pisngi niya.
eng: Of roses and hibiscus which will no longer turn purple like her visage.

rin: Bilib talaga ko ki Ma'am.
eng: Ma'am amazes me.

rin: Di na Ilan.
eng: No more, ilan.

rin: dinahilan mo sana pagkalingaw ag a kanimong kaluyan.
eng: You just made your forgetfulness and weakness your excuse.

rin: Kaya, dilaan mo ngowan a maapros na gusto mong manamitan.
eng: So lick the wound you want to taste.

rin: Alagad binayaan mo sa kanakong rurugan, ito parong sa dinailan.
eng: But which you left in my breast, that which smells like shrimp paste.

rin: Kinutkot mo ko sa rarom ka kangitngitan.
eng: You dug me from the depths of darkness.

rin: Tinunow ka kalayong galin sa kanimong mata na nagngangabil sa katoninongan.
eng: Melted by the fire from your eyes which talks in silence.

rin: Linumok a puso ko alagad ku umagnow.
eng: My heart softened but when it went cold.

rin: Kinusa nang gayod arog ko pinaggalinan.
eng: It hardened once more as it was.

rin: Baga na uda na basang bagang natutuda
eng: As if there are no embers left.

rin: Ta luway-luway na akong inuubos sa takla.
eng: For slowly, I am being eaten by rust.

rin: Narurumruman ko su pagkapura ninyo.
eng: I remember your vanishing.

rin: Ginuno su Panganoron na Bulaw sadto kabukidan.
eng: The Brown Clouds climbed the mountains.

rin: Usad-usad na inaladan.
eng: And one by one, fenced in.

rin: Su mga kulod ag kadlagan.
eng: The hills and the forests.

rin: Dangan, ipinirma sa kasuratan.
eng: Then they signed on a document.

rin: Kanamo ading namumuhonan!
eng: These with landmarks are ours!

rin: Di ko na liwat nabayad su liksi ninyo.
eng: I have not seen since then your swiftness.

rin: Usa o angin baga sa kakawuyan.
eng: Like a deer or the wind among the trees.

rin: Na sa kapinunan na kanakong pagka-isi amo talaga ninyo sadiri o binabaoy ninyong moog.
eng: Which as far as I know is what you consider home, or what you call moog.

rin: Kaya kamo narumarom arog ka sisidmon.
eng: And so you faded like the twilight.

rin: A lalawgon ninyo diri matukran baga na pinag-oosipan na biglang inagow na inaaging uda ugaling demonyo.
eng: We cannot name your faces like a word at the tip of our tongue snatched by a rude devil passing by.

rin: Ngowan na apon ku bumutwa kamo sadto imburnal.
eng: This afternoon, when you emerged from the sewers.

rin: Nagaagwal ag nagaakal ku mga sagmaw ka mga Panganoron na Bulaw.
eng: Shoveling the filth of the Brown Clouds.

rin: Bigla kong naagimadmaran.
eng: I suddenly realized.

rin: A rarom ka kaninyong inalwan.
eng: The depths where had been driven.

rin: Nguwan na gab-i.
eng: Tonight.

rin: Pupunan ko kanimo su mga naulang panahon naubos sa pagparasulod sadto kakadlaganan.
eng: I will make up with you the times lost chasing in the forests.

rin: Ku mga nagsusunod sa pulang bitoon.
eng: Those who follow the red star.

rin: Mga nagtutubod sa gapas na bulan.
eng: Those who believe in the crescent moon.

rin: Maski unu gusto mong tiempo, cha-cha, lambada o tango.
eng: Whatever tempo you want, cha-cha, lambada or tango.

rin: Magbayle kang baga na uda udma, baga na uda gira.
eng: Dance as if there's no tomorrow, as if you have no feet.

rin: Bahala na si Ninoy Aquino ka DI, na bumbalyo ag mitao sa liksi ka tiil kong winarak ku minang taon ku mga Abu Sayaf.

rin: Dawa sa panahon ko pa, inaasahan kong malilingawan a kanamong rira.
eng: Even in our time, I was expecting we will forget our own tongue.

rin: Biktima sa pignegosyong edukasyon ag pagiisip na sugong.
eng: A victim of a commercial education and narrow mind.

rin: Baga na su Latin, na lengwahe ka hirarkiya sa Roma ka Simbahan Katolika.
eng: Like Latin, the language of the hierarchy of the Catholic Church in Rome.

rin: Ono, nagaako na sira sa babaying padi?
eng: Have they accepted women as priests?

rin: Kumusta na Iriga sa panahon ninyo?
eng: How is Iriga in your time?

rin: Sadto pa man raw su dating sentro.
eng: Is the old centro still there.

rin: O binalyo na paiyan sa Bato.
eng: Or was it relocated towards Bato.

rin: Ta pinutok su Asog arog ku Mt. Pinatubo?
eng: For Mt. Asog erupted like Mt. Pinatubo?

rin: Kin di man, dakul ma siguro kabaluyan sa itaas ka Ilian.
eng: If not, perhaps, there are already houses in Ilian.

rin: Dakul pa man raw a kakawuyan sa kaitaasan?
eng: Are there still trees up there?

rin: Malinaw pa man raw su Masosu ag Butawan?
eng: Is the water in Masosu and Butawan still clear?

rin: Nagtubo raw su tinanom namong tulang para ka sa nasyon tang Bikolnon?
eng: Did the seed we sow for a Bikol nation grow?

rin: O napura kita sa mapa dara sa kapabayaan ag uda pakiaram.
eng: Or were we erased from the map because of neglect, or apathy.

rin: O ku klase sa politika na su mga pamayo nakikipagabrakan sadto mga maamot ag nagkakapot sa poder.
eng: Or the kind of politics where our leaders cavort with the perfumed and powerful.

rin: Mantang nagaalop su kadaklan?
eng: While many of our people go hungry?

rin: Por dahil pa raw sa erencia, padi-padi ag ki Ninoy Aquino a pagpapaula sa puesto?
eng: Is it still because of the number of relatives, godfathers, and Ninoy Aquino that one gets to be elected?

rin: Banga a payo ag puso namo.
eng: My head and heart is split.

rin: Kin ono mamamate sa simbag ninyo.
eng: How I will feel about your reply.

rin: Kin ono man, a sigurado.
eng: Whatever, it is certain.

rin: Nagbaklay kami sadto tinampo.
eng: We took the road.

rin: Na pagona namo paiyan sadto pangaturugan na kinaudmaan ka banwaan.
eng: Which we thought will lead to our dreams for our city.

rin: Pausad-usad inabot sira, subago pa sana.
eng: One by one, they came, just this morning.

rin: Su kauriyan galin pa sa Australia.
eng: The youngest from Australia.

rin: Amo na sana inuulat talaga.
eng: Who's really expected last to arrive.

rin: Kaya udma, dagos na a pagpapatulod.
eng: So tomorrow, the burial will go on.

rin: Kading gurangan kading pamilya.
eng: Of the patriarch of the family.

rin: Sadto kabaong niyang bukas su sakob, nakakabit su mga laso.
eng: On the lid of his exposed coffin were ribbons tacked.

rin: agko ngaran ko ngamin na miembro ka familia, mga igin, manugang, maku-apo ag mga ngod.
eng: Containing the names of the members of the family, children, in-laws, grandchildren and siblings.

rin: Sadto tiilan, su mga korona na a burak mga nagluluyos na.
eng: At his feet, the wreaths with flowers now withered.

rin: Pinatunglay ku init ku patintiyan ag su daylight ku funeraria.
eng: Wilted by the vigil candle and the fluorescent lamp of the funerary.

rin: Magin a silaw ka kamera kading para-video na ngowan sibot na usad-usad na rinarakop a mga eksena ag mga lalawgon kading mga nagbibilar.
eng: Even the light of the video cameraman who is now busy capturing the scenes and faces of those in the wake.

rin: A gurang na igin, na ngowan sana nakapuli sa loog sa baynting taon sa States
eng: The eldest son, who only went home today after twenty years in the States.

rin: Pigiistorya kin gaumno ka istrikto ni ama nira.
eng: Recounts how strict his father was.

rin: Tangad man su mga para-irongog.
eng: His audience listen to him intently.

rin: mantang pinapalis-palis su imported na alak na ilinuluwas pa sana.
eng: As they pour swiftly on their glasses the whiskey just taken out of its box.

rin: Su nars sa London, nagparadawoy ku sadit pang igin na malang isdol.
eng: The daughter who works as nurse in London is kept busy trying to keep in place her toodler.

rin: Nag-oonga su galin sa Italy kin ta-ono ta bukong su Armaning padara niya a pinasupong.
eng: The one in Italy is asking why it was not the Armani she sent which her father wears.

rin: Mantang su sa Japan na bulaw su buk ag barutubot na sa sigarilyo, tango-tango na ku kantang iya sana nakakarungog.
eng: While the one in Japan, with dyed golden hair and smoking heavily, nods her head to the beat of the song she hears by herself.

rin: Su angot na ngod, na amo natagakan ag nagpara-ataman ku gurang.
eng: The spinster daughter, who took care of her father.

rin: Nagiinanakit kin ta ono kuno nguwan na sana laka galante kading mga katugbong sa pusod.
eng: Now wonders why suddenly all her siblings have become too generous.

rin: Ku buway pa maski bulong sana.
eng: When he was still alive even for medicine.

rin: Sadto, kusina, labo-labo na pagpapalas ku tolong 200-kiloson na mga baktin.
eng: In the kitchen, the helpers are busy chopping the carcass of the three 200-kilos pigs.

rin: Mantang tinutusok-tusok ko mga burat su maragpok na takas.
eng: While those drunk pick on the crispy entrails.

rin: Sadto luwas, napundo su mga nagbi-videoke nasuoy sa gurob-gurob ku pag-abot ku mga Cursillista, "na mga parasugot."
eng: Outside, those waiting for their turn to sing were interrupted by the arrival of the Cursilllistas, "the teasers."

rin: Pagngomon-ngomon man nang gayod, pakatapos ku "Oh, My Papa,".
eng: A little later indeed, after "Oh, My Papa,".

rin: Biglang iniyak su usad na igin sadto luwas.
eng: A child outside cried out.

rin: Ku ibinutang ko sa palad ko, linnayog man adi na bagana man alibangbang man, sana.
eng: When I placed it on my palm, it swayed as if it, too, wanted to be a butterfly.

rin: Nakapauli na galin sa zoo sindi Muna ag Milan.
eng: Muna and Milan had just come home from the zoo.

rin: Usad na Akong elepante.
eng: I am an elephant.

rin: Pabo na ko nguwan.
eng: Now I’m a turkey.

rin: Kaipuwan ko Ng maturog.
eng: I need to sleep.

rin: Punduwon mo na a sulo inay.
eng: Put out the lamp, Mother.

rin: Binuksan ni Muna su Mata Niya.
eng: Muna opened her eyes.

rin: Sa taas ka bukid, agko sadit na banwaan.
eng: On top of the mountain, there was a small village.

rin: Kamayanan a kanyang ngaran.
eng: Its name was Kamayanan.

rin: A mga naka-istar bagana diyos na mabubuot.
eng: The ones who lived there seemed like kind gods.

rin: Pareyo ka mga panganuron, a kandang mga kamot.
eng: They were like clouds, with their hands as if outstretched.

rin: Pag sira nagtaptap, nagkikitkilat.
eng: When they clapped, there was lightning.

rin: Pag pinagrukot a mga kamot, maski balyena nag-iiwag.
eng: When they squeezed their hands together, even whales would move.

rin: Nakaistar sira kaiba a mga bayong sa tuktok.
eng: They lived with the birds at the mountain’s peak.

rin: Tuninong saka uda ribok.
eng: It's quiet and there’s no noise.

rin: Nagkamang si Korona V paluwas sa kweba.
eng: Korona V crawled out of the cave.

rin: Sa mangitngit na palibot, diri ika maka-inga-inga.
eng: In the dark surroundings, you cannot breathe properly.

rin: Bagana multo a kanyang itsura.
eng: She looks like a ghost.

rin: Koronang nakatutungok a kanyang dara.
eng: He wears a crown of thorns.

rin: Nasindakan su ngamin dahil kanya.
eng: Everyone was frightened because of her.

rin: Naggibo na palan iya sa pandemya!
eng: She caused the pandemic!

rin: Kadaklan ku tawo, nanglungsi saka nagka-ilang;
eng: Most of the people turned pale and got sick.

rin: Nauda su iba, naggalin na palan.
eng: Some were gone, they had already left.

rin: Nagtipon su ngamin na taga-Kamayanan.
eng: All the people of Kamayanan gathered together.

rin: Nag-adit, nakatakot, mga tawo nagka-ilang.
eng: Stressed, frightened, people got sick.

rin: Uno gigibuwon ta na nguwan?
eng: What will we do now?

rin: Magtago, magsirong anggan kita maubos sa ilang?
eng: Shall we just hide and take cover until we all die from the illness?

rin: Nagtindog si Tandang Turo saka nagkanta.
eng: Tandang Turo stood up and sang.

rin: Magbayli, bumirik, pirawon a angin saka magpainit kita.
eng: Let’s dance and spin, feel the breeze, and warm ourselves up

rin: Anting-anting ka Kamayanan, kanatong rumrumon.
eng: Charm of Kamayanan, we must remember.

rin: Pandemyang adi, kanatong sugpuon.
eng: This pandemic, we must suppress it.

rin: Su iring-ingan, naging tarawanan!
eng: The whispers turned into laughter!

rin: Sabi nira, nakakapay na gayod sa kagurangan.
eng: They said, he might be going crazy because of old age.

rin: Linnukso saka pinnurbar su igin na si Atan.
eng: The child Atan jumped and tried.

rin: Iwag ka mga kamot, madadaog a virus na an!
eng: Move your hands, that virus will be defeated!

rin: Tinnunga su maating Korona V.
eng: The dirty Korona V appeared.

rin: Mabuway raw sira?
eng: Will they recover?

rin: Inatubang su virus ni Atan, makusog a boot saka isip pirmi.
eng: Atan faced the virus with courage and a strong mind.

rin: Nagkanta abang nagbabayle.
eng: Sang while dancing.

rin: Madadaog ko a virus na adi.
eng: I will defeat this virus.

rin: Ligtas na a Kamayanan!
eng: Kamayanan is now safe!

rin: A kanyang nasabi.
eng: That's what he said.

rin: Pag-ugas ka kamot, dapat gibuwon.
eng: Wash your hands, must be done.

rin: Sabon saka tubig a kanatong gamiton.
eng: Soap and water we must use.

rin: Ugasan, iludan, mga kamot pirming linigan.
eng: Wash and rinse your hands; always keep them clean.

rin: Mga ilang saka virus dadaugon saka malilikayan.
eng: Diseases and viruses will be defeated and avoided.

rin: Korona V, nayugyog, nagkubog-kubog.
eng: Korona V was shaken and trembled.

rin: Namanhid, natunow saka linnubog.
eng: Numb, melted and sank.

rin: Tunay na kapangyarihan, amo tinnunga.
eng: True power, that appeared.

rin: Malinig na kamot, a anting-anting nira.
eng: Clean hands are their secret charm.

rin: Iba-ibang mga kamot, mga nagsirang.
eng: Different hands, peeked.

rin: Ibinandera sa palibot ka banwaan.
eng: Was flagged around the town.

rin: Kanatong sadiri, a pirming aasahan.
eng: Ourselves, we can always depend on.

rin: Mga kalamidad, kanatong malalampasan.
eng: Disasters, we can overcome them.

rin: Kin a lambang usad, nagtitinabangan.
eng: If each and everyone helps one another.

rin: Puon kadto, sira nagkakausad saka nagtitinabangan.
eng: Since then, they have been united and helping one another.

rin: Mga kamot, pirming liniligan.
eng: Hands, always being cleaned.

rin: Kandang sadiri, napuprotektan.
eng: Themselves, being protected.

rin: makusog na sabi ni Nanay Sula.
eng: Nanay Sula firmly said.

rin: Ipinundo niya su pagbusol ku nalulunadan kong ulaan.
eng: She stopped pushing the seat I was riding on.

rin: Ku usad, nagin paratanom kami ni Nanay Sula.
eng: Last time, Nanay Sula and I became farmers.

rin: Tibaad magtubo tulos a mga nuyog ta.
eng: Perhaps the coconuts will grow right away.

rin: Si Nanay Sula a payaba kong lola.
eng: Nanay Sula is my beloved grandmother.

rin: Mamuya a aldow ko kin kaiba ko iya.
eng: I spent my days happily when I was with her.

rin: Paborito kong kangayamon si Nanay Sula.
eng: Nanay Sula was my favorite companion.

rin: Minsan nagin paraisura kami ni Nanay Sula.
eng: One time, Nanay Sula and I go fishing.

rin: Bininwit namo su mga tsinelas sadto planggana.
eng: We fished out slippers from the washbasin.

rin: Nakabinwit nako, Nanay!
eng: I caught one already, Nanay!

rin: Biglang inapon ni Nanay Sula su panbinwit niya.
eng: Suddenly, Nanay Sula threw down her fishing rod.

rin: Uda na talaga ako pakinabang.
eng: I’m really of no use anymore.

rin: Nagtatangis na sabi niya.
eng: He said this while crying.

rin: Kinausip iya ni Mama Lita saka pinabaydan sa mga ritrato nira.
eng: Mama Lita spoke to him and showed him their pictures.

rin: Kamuya sa maray ni Nanay Sula kaya inalok ku iyang magtagu-taguan pakagalin ni Mama Lita.
eng: Nanay Sula was so excited so I invited her to play hide-and-seek after Mama Lita left.

rin: Tagu-taguan maliwanag a bulan.
eng: Hide-and-seek under the bright moon.

rin: Kanta ku tanganing makatago si Nanay Sula.
eng: I sang so that Nanay Sula could hide.

rin: Pakausay ku mga hanger, nagrapo si Lisa ki Mama niya.
eng: After I was busy with the hangers, Lisa clung to her mother.

rin: Inanap ko si Nanay Sula.
eng: I searched for Nanay Sula.

rin: Nag-iyan ako sadto kwarto, sala, saka kusina.
eng: I went into the bedroom, the living room, and the kitchen.

rin: Nalibot ko su baloy pero di ko naanap si Nanay Sula.
eng: I went all around the house, but I couldn’t find Nanay Sula.

rin: Nagtatangis akong nagsumbong ki Mama Lita.
eng: Crying, I told Mama Lita,

rin: Diri namo naaanap si Nanay Sula kaya nagpatabang na sa mga tanod si Mama Lita.
eng: We can't find Nanay Sula, so Mama Lita has already asked the watchmen for help.

rin: Narungog kong pig-iiyak.
eng: I heard someone crying.

rin: Sadto Crossing Bula nambabaoy sa lumulunad si Nanay Sula.
eng: At Crossing Bula, Nanay Sula calls passengers.

rin: Dinnalagan ako tanganing gakuson si Nanay Sula.
eng: I ran to embrace her.

rin: sabi namo ku mga tanod na nagtabang kanamo ni Mama Lita.
eng: That's what we told the watchmen who helped us, along with Mama Lita.

rin: Pag-uli namo sinabi ni Mama Lita na agko Alzheimer's disease si Nanay Sula.
eng: When we got home, Mama Lita told us that Nanay Sula had Alzheimer’s disease.

rin: Ilang kuno adi sa mga naggugurang na arog ki Nanay Sula.
eng: She said it’s a sickness that happens to some elderly people like Nanay Sula.

rin: Neurons a nagdadara ka mensahe sa utak ta, Ador.
eng: The neurons carry messages in our brain, Ador.

rin: Neurons man a rason kaya naiintindiyan ta a mga bagay sa palibot ta.
eng: Those same neurons are the reason why we understand the things around us.

rin: Sa mga tawong arog ni Nanay Sula, nararaot saka natitigbak na a mga Neurons.
eng: In people like Nanay Sula, those neurons get damaged and die.

rin: Nagdadakol a mga espasyo sa utak nira kaya nagigin lilingawon, diri na nakakabisto o kaya uuyamon na sira.
eng: Spaces grow inside their brains, so they become forgetful, they can no longer recognize, or sometimes they get irritated.

rin: Kin nakaluluwas, madidipisilan na sirang anapon agiyan pauli.
eng: When they go out, they will have a hard time finding the way back home.

rin: Kaya palan diri na ako babauyon ni Nanay Sula ka ngaran ko.
eng: That’s why Nanay Sula no longer calls my name.

rin: Kaya palan bigla na sanang agtatangis saka mauudit si Nanay Sula.
eng: That’s why Nanay Sula suddenly cries and gets mad.

rin: Kaya palan diri nakabalik si Nanay Sula ku magtagu-taguan kami.
eng: That’s why Nanay Sula never returned when we played hide-and-seek.

rin: Kadakol palan nagbago ki Nanay Sula.
eng: So many things have changed with Nanay Sula.

rin: Kindi dawa dakol a nagbago, dakol pa nanggad a kayang gibuwon ni Nanay Sula.
eng: But even though much has changed, there are still many things she can do.

rin: Puon kadto naka-isip ako sa bagong ngayamon.
eng: That’s when I thought of a new game.

rin: Kin ramrag, sinusukrayan ko si Nanay Sula.
eng: In the morning, I comb Nanay Sula’s hair.

rin: Pakasukray ko kanya, susukrayon man niya ako.
eng: When I finish combing hers, she combs mine in return.

rin: Pirmi tabi ikang anukray, Nanay, ta la mong gayon.
eng: Always comb your hair, Nanay, because you are so beautiful.

rin: Kin mudto, weyter kami ni Nanay Sula.
eng: At noon, Nanay Sula and I became waiters.

rin: Inuusay namo a mga baso, plato saka kutsara sa lamesa.
eng: We arranged the glasses, plates, and spoons on the table.

rin: Tibay mo, Nanay, tama su pagkausay mo.
eng: You're amazing, Nanay, you arranged it so well.

rin: Kin apon, nagigin kaming paramangno sa itik ni Nanay Sula.
eng: In the afternoon, we became caretakers of Nanay Sula’s ducks.

rin: Inililibot namu su mga itik paiyan sadto lauman nira.
eng: We led the ducks back to their pond.

rin: Tibay mo, Nanay, napabalik mo su mga itik sadto lauman nira.
eng: You're amazing, Nanay, you brought the ducks back to their pond.

rin: Kin gab-i, mag-iistoryahan kami ni Nanay Sula.
eng: In the evening, Nanay Sula and I would tell stories.

rin: Dawa pauru-utro mamuya pa nanggad a istorya niya.
eng: Even if her stories were repeated, they were still delightful.

rin: Tibay mo, Nanay, di mo 'yan nalilingawan.
eng: You’re amazing, Nanay, you never forget that.

rin: Minsan, inunga niya ako kin uno na man namo ngangayamunon.
eng: Sometimes, she would ask me what we would play next.

rin: Doktor na man tabi Nanay ka sunod.
eng: Next time you’ll be the doctor, Nanay.

rin: Ka sunod Dok Ador na tabi a ibabaoy mo kanako.
eng: Next time, you will call me as Dr. Ador.

rin: Simbag ko kanya ta amo adi a gusto ko pagdakulo ko.
eng: My replied to her because that’s what I want to be when I grow up.

rin: Ibang klase na man a ngayamon namo ni Nanay Sula.
eng: It was another kind of game for Nanay Sula and me.

rin: Nagigin magayon pa nanggad a aldow ta kaiba ko iya.
eng: The day was still wonderful because I was with her.

rin: Si Nanay Sula pa nanggad a paborito kong kangayamon.
eng: Nanay Sula was still my favorite playmate.

rin: Kumpleto na a gamit ni Maria para sa pagpuon niya sa Grade One nguwan na ireskwelan.
eng: Maria already had everything she needed to start Grade One at her new school.

rin: Eksayted na iya sa maray na mag eskwela.
eng: She was very excited to go to school.

rin: Gusto na niyang mabisto a mga bago niyang kaklase.
eng: eager to meet her new classmates.

rin: Naamay na nagmata si Maria.
eng: Maria woke up early.

rin: Nagpreparar tulos iya tanganing diri mauri.
eng: She prepared immediately to avoid being late.

rin: Abang nagkakaon sa pamawan, biyo niyang narungog sa radyo na bawal nang magluwas a mga tawo ta agko kuno nagluluyap na pandemya.
eng: While eating breakfast, she heard on the radio that people were no longer allowed to go out because the pandemic was spreading.

rin: Uno po a pandemya?
eng: What is a pandemic?

rin: Pandemya a baoy ka lang daling pagluyap ka usad na ilang.
eng: A pandemic is a disease that spreads quickly.

rin: Buko sana sa usad na nasyon kindi sa bilog na kinaban.
eng: Not only in one nation but in the whole world.

rin: Lang takot palan Mama ka pandemya!
eng: Pandemic is scary, Mama!

rin: Amu igin, madaling makaumaliw a COVID-19 virus.
eng: Yes, child, it’s easy to get infected by the COVID-19 virus.

rin: Kaya dapat magmaan kita ngamin.
eng: That’s why we should all be careful.

rin: Bawal ngunang magluwas a mga gurang pati mga igin.
eng: The elderly and children are not yet allowed to go out.

rin: Makalipas su semana saka bulan diri pa nanggad nagluluwas a mga tawo.
eng: Weeks and months passed, people still weren’t going out.

rin: Kin magluwas man pirming naka facemask saka naka face shield.
eng: If they go out, they always wear a facemask and a face shield.

rin: Gusto na niyang mageskwela.
eng: She already wants to go to school.

rin: Uno man po Mama mga ginigibo sa eskwelan pag Grade 1 na?
eng: Mama, what do they do at school in Grade 1?

rin: Gusto ko pong maisiyan.
eng: I want to know.

rin: Ulat Maria ta mag iri-eskwela kita.
eng: Wait, Maria, let’s pretend to go to school.

rin: liba taman sa pagngayamon ading mga ngod ta tanganing mas mamuya.
eng: Let’s also include our siblings in playing so it will be more fun.

rin: Ako a titser kamo a magkaklase.
eng: I am the teacher, you are classmates.

rin: Sabay na simbag nira Manoy Nilo, Manoy Pilo saka ni Manay Lina.
eng: Manoy Nilo, Manoy Pilo, and Manay Lina said together.

rin: Ngamin sira agko kanya-kanyang bag na dara.
eng: All of them bring their own bags.

rin: A kanta nira kasabay ka gitara ni Manay Lina.
eng: They sang a song together with Manay Lina’s guitar.

rin: Sabi ni Titser Precy arugon a mga ayop na narurungog.
eng: Teacher Precy said to imitate the animals they heard.

rin: Nagluwas saka nag-iyan sira sadto agko mga baktin, manok, damulag kanding saka baka.
eng: They went outside and go to the places that has pigs, chickens, carabaos, goats, and cows.

rin: Pagkatapos, nagdrowing sira ko mga ayop na pig-arog nira.
eng: Afterwards, they drew the animals they had imitated.

rin: Si Maria nagtala sa baka.
eng: Maria draw a cow.

rin: Lang siram ka napaparong ko bagana nagluluto si Mama sa pansit Bato.
eng: Ismell something delicious, just like when Mama cooks pancit Bato.

rin: Mayna magkaon na kita,
eng: All right, let’s eat now.

rin: Ta busog na kamo, mayna ta basan ko kamo sa istorya.
eng: Since you're full, let me read you a story.

rin: Pagkatapos mag-istorya ni Titser Precy, nagngayamon sirang luksong baka.
eng: After Teacher Precy’s storytelling, they played luksong baka.

rin: Ika naman a baka Maria.
eng: You be the cow now, Maria.

rin: Lang gugubat man ninyo, di ko man kamo kaya.
eng: You are all heavy, I can’t handle you all.

rin: Diri na raw ka kaiba sa ngayamon ta!
eng: You will not join our game!

rin: Udit na sabi ni Manay Lina.
eng: Manay Lina angrily said.

rin: Abo ko nang magngayamon sa irieskwela abo ko naman kamong magin kaeswela.
eng: I'm tired of always playing school and I don't want you to be my classmates anymore.

rin: Gusto ko sa matuod na eskwelan!
eng: I want to be in a real school!"

rin: Nagtatangis na sabi ni Maria.
eng: Maria said, crying.

rin: Maria, sa baloy saka sa eskwelan pareyo man sana.
eng: Maria, whether at home or in school, it’s just the same.

rin: Nguwan na pandemya kamong magngungod a magkakaeskwela.
eng: During this pandemic, your siblings will be your classmates.

rin: Ading baloy ta a classroom ako a titser ninyo.
eng: Our house will be a classroom, and I will be your teacher.

rin: Pag sunod na aldow, nag-abot na su mga bagong modyul.
eng: The next day, the new modules arrived.

rin: Maigot na nagsimbag sa modyul si Maria.
eng: Maria diligently answered her modules.

rin: Dawa agko pandemya saka sarado a eskwelan, padagos a pag-adal ni Maria sa kandang baloy.
eng: Even though there was a pandemic and the school was closed, Maria continued her studies at home.

rin: Pwera ki Mama pigtatabangan man iya ko mga ngod niyang gurang.
eng: Aside from Mama, her grandparents also helped her.

rin: Kaya madali saka mamuya a pagkatood niya.
eng: That’s why she learned quickly and enjoyed her lessons.

rin: Si Tikboy a igin nira Manoy Kanor saka Manay Koring.
eng: Tikboy is the child of Manoy Kanor and Manay Koring.

rin: Parauma si Manoy Kanor mantang paragibo sa siggid si Manay Koring.
eng: Manoy Kanor was a farmer, while Manay Koring makes brooms.

rin: Nakaistar sira sa Barangay San Jose, kaya minsan sana sira makaiyan sa banwaan.
eng: They lived in Barangay San Jose, so they rarely went to the town.

rin: Usad na aldow, bago mag Bagong Taon, iniba si Tikboy nira Papa saka Mama niya sa sauran.
eng: One day, before New Year, Papa and Mama took Tikboy to the market.

rin: Bumabakal sira sa mga kaipwanan sa baloy.
eng: They were buying the things needed at home.

rin: Mantang naglilibot-libot sadto sauran, nabayad ni Tikboy su iba-ibang ngayamnan.
eng: While roaming around the market, Tikboy saw many different toys.

rin: Agko iya narungog na tunog kaya napalili iya.
eng: He heard a sound that caught his attention.

rin: Usad na torotot na inuuyop ku paratinda.
eng: One horn being blown by a vendor.

rin: Unga ku paratinda.
eng: The vendor asked.

rin: Purbaran mo, Noy.
eng: Try it, boy.

rin: Itinurol niya su torotot ki Tikboy.
eng: The child pointed the horn toward Tikboy.

rin: Nagsilong si Tikboy kanda Papa saka Mama niya na bagana nakikiusip na bakalan iya sa torotot.
eng: Tikboy went close to his Papa and Mama, as if asking them to buy him the horn.

rin: Kindi agko ining-ing si Mama niya kanya.
eng: But his mother whispered to him.

rin: Tikboy, kin kuno na sana kita magbakal sa torotot.
eng: Tikboy, maybe next time we will buy the horn.

rin: Baka kulangon ading sintabo tang pamplite pauli.
eng: Maybe we don't have enough money left for the fare going home.

rin: Simbag tulos ni Tikboy na pinupugol sana su itatangis.
eng: answered Tikboy right away, holding back his tears.

rin: Paggalin na sira sadto tindan pero diri pa nanggad naalin su silong niya sadto bakalan sa torotot.
eng: They left the store, but he still couldn’t look away from the horn being sold there.

rin: Ku pauli na sira, nalabusan nira su mga igin na nagkakamuy-an mantang nagpapasa -pasawan sa bolang gibo sa dawon sa nuyog.
eng: On their way home, they passed by other children happily playing, tossing around a ball made of coconut leaves.

rin: Papa, sari raw binakal a ngayamnan nir nira?
eng: Papa, where did they buy that toy?

rin: Tauno Tikboy?
eng: Why, Tikboy?

rin: Gusto mo man sa arog kan na ngayamnan?
eng: Do you also want a toy like that?

rin: Simbag na unga ni Manoy Kanor.
eng: Asked Manoy Kanor.

rin: Amo po kintana, Papa.
eng: Yes, Papa, I guess.

rin: Pero mas gusto ko po su ngayamnan na nabayad ko sadto banwaan.
eng: But I like even more the toy I saw in town.

rin: Adto pong nagtutunog.
eng: The one that makes a sound.

rin: Gustong-gusto ko po adto,
eng: I really, really like that one.

rin: Simbag ni Tikboy.
eng: Tikboy replied.

rin: Pag-abot sadto baloy nira, nagpatuod tulos si Tikboy sadto mga kag-igin na mikingayamon iya sadto luyong baloy.
eng: When they arrived home, Tikboy immediately went to his playmates, who were playing beside their house.

rin: Inistorya ni Tikboy sadto mga kangayamon niya su ngayamnan na nabayad niya sadto sauran.
eng: Tikboy told his playmates about the toy he saw in the market.

rin: Sana agko man kita arog kadtong ngayamnan, ngani?
eng: I wish we also had a toy like that, right?

rin: Sabi ku usad na kangayamon ni Tikboy.
eng: One of his friends said.

rin: Sabi ni Mama, babakalan niya ako ka sunod namong pagsaud.
eng: Mama said she’ll buy it for me the next time we go to the market.

rin: Bae sana.
eng: Forget it.

rin: Pauuramon ko kamo kin makabakal na kami.
eng: I’ll let you all borrow it once we finally bought it.

rin: Arani nang magngitngit ku mag-uli si Tikboy.
eng: It was almost dark when Tikboy went home.

rin: Nabayad niya si Mama niya na nagbubugkos sa siggid sadto baloy nira.
eng: He saw his mother tying up the broom in their house.

rin: Mama, sari po si Papa?
eng: Mama, where is Papa?

rin: Naggagawot na sa tuba si Papa mo ta madali nang magngitngit.
eng: Your father is already tapping the coconut wine, since it’s getting dark.

rin: Iniyanan ni Tikboy su Papa niya.
eng: Tikboy go to his father.

rin: Igin, isadi pa ako taas kadi nuyog.
eng: Child, I'm still here at the top of coconut tree.

rin: Pagbaba niya, agko bitbit si Manoy Kanor na mga dawon sa nuyog.
eng: When he came down, Manoy Kanor was carrying coconut leaves.

rin: Mayna, mag-uli na kita.
eng: Let’s go home now.

rin: Pa, uno po gigibuwon mo ka mga dawon sa nuyog?
eng: Papa, what will you do with those coconut leaves?

rin: Pag-uli ta sadto baloy, ipababayad ko kanimo, mamuyang simbag ni Manoy Kanor.
eng: When we get home, I'll show you, Manoy Kanor answered cheerfully.

rin: Pag-abot nira, tinipig-tipig ni Manoy Kanor su dawon sa nuyog.
eng: When they arrived, Manoy Kanor began weaving the coconut leaves together.

rin: Nagdakulo su mga mata ni Tikboy ku mabayad niya na nagin bola su mga dawon.
eng: Tikboy's eyes grew wide with excitement when he saw that the leaves had become a ball.

rin: Ulat nguna ta agko pa ako gigibuwon igin.
eng: Wait a bit, son, I still have work to finish first.

rin: Pinutol ni Manoy Kanor su usad na atlukot na dawon saka tinipig adi.
eng: Manoy Kanor cut a bunch of coconut leaves and seat them aside.

rin: Pinabirikan pa niya sa usad na dawon anggan sa dumakulo.
eng: He rolled the leaves until they grew bigger.

rin: Ku mabilog na adi, tinusukan niya sa giyoy sa puro ku dawon.
eng: When they formed a ball, he pierced it with a stick made from coconut midrib.

rin: Natapos ko na ding usad, sabi ni Manoy Kanor mantang itinatao su nabilog na dawon ki Tikboy.
eng: I'm finished with one, said Manoy Kanor as he handed the round toy made of leaves to Tikboy.

rin: Ku inuyop ni Tikboy su ginibo ni Papa niya, nagtunog adi arog ku tunog ku torotot sadto sauran.
eng: When Tikboy blew into what his father had made, it sounded just like the horn he had seen in the market.

rin: Namuya sa igo si Tikboy.
eng: Tikboy was delighted.

rin: Pa, pariyong-pariyo po ading tunog ku torotot sadto sauran.
eng: Papa, it sounds exactly like the horn in the market.

rin: Dakol a pwede tang magibo galin sa mga dawon ka nuyog.
eng: There are many things we can make from coconut leaves.

rin: padagos na sabi ni Manoy Kanor.
eng: Manoy Kanor continued.

rin: Nag-upak si Tikboy sa grabeng kamuy-an.
eng: Tikboy clapped his hands with so much joy.

rin: Pa, tutturuan mo po ako tanganing agko kami ngayamnan ku mga kangayamon ko.
eng: Papa, please teach me so that I'll also have toys to share with my playmates.

rin: Ku sumunod na aldow, tinutturan ni Tikboy su mga kangayamon niya sa paggibo sa torotot.
eng: The next day, Tikboy taught his playmates how to make horns.

rin: Dakol na torotot su nagibo nira saka pinanao sa mga pag-abayan.
eng: They made many horns and gave them around the neighborhood.

rin: Mamuyang sinabat ku mga taga Sitio Kalubihan su Bagong Taon.
eng: They happily welcomed the New Year in Sitio Kalubihan.

rin: Su tunog ku mga torotot na ginibo galin sa lukoy a makusog na narungog abot sadto luyong barangay.
eng: The sound of the horns they had made from coconut leaves was so loud it could be heard even in the next barangay.

rin: Rona, buwat na raw siton.
eng: Rona, get up there.

rin: Rona, pakarayon mo na iton na binatangan mo ta iyanan ta si Lola mo.
eng: Rona, fix your things so we can go to your grandmother.

rin: Takot po kaya akong maglunad sa kareta.
eng: But I’m afraid to ride in the cart.

rin: Ata Rona, gusto kuno ikang mabayad ni Lola mo.
eng: Come on, Rona, your grandmother wants to see you.

rin: Pamawow na ngani saka nganod tabangan mo akong pakarayon ading mga dadarawon ta.
eng: Breakfast already and later help me carry the things we’ll bring.

rin: Napiritan magbangon si Rona.
eng: Rona was forced to get up.

rin: Itay, sari man po a mga dadarawon ta?
eng: Papa, where are the things that we'll bring?

rin: Sadto tabi lamesa.
eng: They’re on the table.

rin: Tinabangan ni Rona si Itay niya ka pagpakaray ku mga dadarawon sadto lumang basket na ginibo niya.
eng: Rona helped her father arrange the things in the old basket he had made:

rin: Usad na sadit na kalderong agko kanon, darwang asul na basong plastik, upat na daddakulong tilapya, saka limang malang pupulang kamatis.
eng: One small pot with rice, two blue plastic cups, four large tilapia, and five ripe red tomatoes.

rin: Agom, nakaanda na ading kareta ta.
eng: Wife, our cart is ready.

rin: Biyong inaandal si Rona abang naglulunad.
eng: Rona was scared while riding.

rin: Naisip niya, pauno kin maulog iya?
eng: She wonder, what if she fell?

rin: Pauno kin pagbutong ku kareta biglang magbalintong saka marugan sira?
eng: What if the cart suddenly tipped over and they all got thrown out?

rin: Diri ika makatakot.
eng: Don’t be afraid.

rin: Bilangon mo na sana a mga bagay na mababayad mo.
eng: Just count the things you can see.

rin: Simbag ni Inay abang kapot su kamot ni Rona.
eng: Said Mother while holding Rona’s hand.

rin: Sadto aagyan, nakatan-aw sira sa mga alibangbang na nagraralayugan palibot-libot sadto tanom na agko mga burak.
eng: Along the way, they saw butterflies fluttering around the flowers.

rin: Bilangon mo raw Rona kin pirang alibangbang a nababayad mo?
eng: Can you count how many butterflies you see, Rona?

rin: Agko po unom na alibangbang, Inay!
eng: There are six butterflies, Mama!

rin: Biglang inandal si Rona ku mag-agi sira sadto malubak na aagyan.
eng: Suddenly, Rona become worried as they passed over a bumpy road.

rin: nakatatakot na sabi ni Rona.
eng: Rona said nervously.

rin: O, baydon mo Rona, agko mga baka na nagkakaon sa duot, pira sira?
eng: Oh, look, Rona, there are cows eating grass. How many are they?

rin: nagkukubog-kubog na sabi niya.
eng: Her voice shaking a little as she said.

rin: Nasa atubangan na po kita nira Lola?
eng: Are we at the front of Grandma's house?

rin: Nakaangos sa ararom si Rona.
eng: Rona was deeply relieved.

rin: A baloy ni Lola mo, sadto pa uruunaan."
eng: There’s your Grandma’s house, just up ahead.

rin: Pangala, pinaagi su damulag kaya nag-iwag su kareta.
eng: Then, the carabao walked by so the cart moved.

rin: Inandal utro si Rona!
eng: Rona was worried again!

rin: Rona, bayda ngani su mga pato.
eng: Rona, look at the ducks.

rin: Bilangon mo raw kin pira sira.
eng: Count how many they are.

rin: Binilang ni Rona su mga pato na nakalinya saka nagbabalyo sadto aagyan.
eng: Rona counted the ducks lined up and crossing the path.

rin: Padagos sa pagbutong su damulag ku kareta na nalulunadan nira.
eng: The carabao kept pulling the cart where they rode along.

rin: Agko mga guling-guling sadto raga na maluway na nagkakamang.
eng: There are worms slowly crawling on the ground.

rin: Pirang guling-guling a nababayad mo Rona?
eng: How many worms do you see, Rona?

rin: Siyam po ngamin Inay!
eng: Nine, Mama!

rin: Naminlod na si Rona kauungko saka kabibilang ku mga suso kaya nagtangad iya.
eng: Rona knelt down, busy counting snails, then she looked up.

rin: Agko mga bayong na naglalayog sadto itaas ka mga kawoy.
eng: There were birds flying above the trees.

rin: Usad, darwa, tulo, upat, lima, unom, pito, walo, siyam, sampulo!
eng: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten!

rin: Sampulong bayong a naglalayog sa langit!
eng: Ten birds flying in the sky!

rin: Makusog na sabi ni Itay sadto damulag.
eng: Father shouted loudly to the carabao.

rin: Mayna, bumaba na kita.
eng: Come on, let’s go down.

rin: Sigurado nag-imo sa tinolang manok si Lola mo.
eng: I’m sure your Lola made tinola.

rin: Gusto ko sanang payabaon.
eng: I just want to be taken care of.

rin: Pero pauno ko yan mamamatean kin a mga tawo pirming arayo kanako?
eng: But how am I supposed to feel it when people are always far from me?

rin: Napupurisaw ako kadi sa maray.
eng: I am bothered a lot by this.

rin: Puon ku nasulo ading kabanga kong awak, nakalbo na ako, nagkapeklat, saka nagkanos.
eng: When half of my body was caught on fire, I became bald, got scars, and got ugly.

rin: Amo adto a rason kin ngata ta naisip ka mga tawo na agko ako ilang.
eng: That is the reason why people think that I am sick.

rin: Bagana ungot sira kanako.
eng: It seems like they are angry with me.

rin: Usad akong lagalag na gusto sana man makapagngayamon, makakaon, saka payabaon ka na mga tawo.
eng: "I am a wanderer who only wants to play, eat, and to be loved by people.

rin: Usad na beses kadto abang ako nag-aanap sa mapagkaon, binaribad ako sa bato ku usad na grupong mga igin tapos pinagsisilyakan nira 'ko.
eng: One time when I was looking for food, a group of children threw stones at me and shouted at me.

rin: Mala mong uyam!
eng: You are so annoying!

rin: Diri ko na sana sira inintindi kaya nagpadagos na sana ako sa pag-anap sa mapagkaon-kaon.
eng: I no longer paid attention to them, so I continued looking for something to eat.

rin: Ku diri pa nanggad sira nagpupundo, naggalin na sana ko.
eng: When they still weren’t stopping, I just left.

rin: Gusto kong atamanon ako saka payabaon.
eng: I want to be looked after and taken care of.

rin: Pero pauno ko mamamatean a mga an kin puro mga mararaot na ngangabilon a sinasabi nira kanako kin sari man ako paiyan?
eng: But how am I supposed to feel all of those when all they say are hurtful things to me wherever I go?

rin: Agko man mga maboboot na tawo na nagpapakaon kanako, arog ku igin sadto bakery na tinawan ako sa tinapay.
eng: There are also kind people who feed me, like that time at the bakery when they gave me bread.

rin: Salamat sa pagkaon.
eng: Thank you for the food.

rin: Uno mo ngaran?
eng: What is your name?

rin: Migsimbag na kintana ako alagad nagdesisyon akong maggalin na sana ku narisa kong nagdadakol na su mga tawo sadto tinapayan.
eng: I was about to respond but I decided to just leave when I noticed that the number of people are increrasing at the bakery.

rin: Miggalin na ko.
eng: I'm leaving.

rin: Narungog ko na sinabi ku igin.
eng: I heard the child said.

rin: Agko mga tawong arog ki Kiko na nagbabawog kanako, pero agko man iba na pirmi akong pinapagalin.
eng: There are people like Kiko who feed me, but there are others who always make me leave.

rin: Usad na aldow, abang nag-aanap ako sa makaon, agko ako naiyanan na baloy.
eng: One day, while I was looking for food, I came across a house.

rin: Nagguno ako sadto alad tapos nabayad ko si Kiko na namumubo ku mga pananom.
eng: I climbed up the fence and saw Kiko watering the plants.

rin: Abang paiyan na ako kanya, nakabayad ako sa sawa sadto talikuran niya.
eng: As I was going toward him, I saw a snake behind him.

rin: Dali-dali kong kinamrang kading mga kuko ko.
eng: I quickly scratched with my nails.

rin: Abo kong kulgan mo si Kiko!
eng: I don’t want you hurting Kiko!

rin: Ku nabayad ni Kiko su nangyayari, nagdalagan tulos iya paluog sadto baloy na nag-iiyak.
eng: When Kiko saw what happened, he immediately ran into the house, shouting.

rin: Papa, mayang po dali!
eng: Papa, come quickly!

rin: Agko sawa sadto natad ta!
eng: There is a snake in our backyard!

rin: Ku su sawa diri na basang nag-iiwag, nag-iwas na ko.
eng: When the snake stopped moving, I stepped back.

rin: Si Kiko saka si papa niya dali-daling nagluwas.
eng: Kiko and his father hurriedly went out.

rin: Itinuldo ako ni Kiko.
eng: Kiko pointed at me.

rin: Nakatakot ako ku nabayad ko si papa niya na agko kapot na pala.
eng: I got scared when I saw his father holding a shovel.

rin: Kulgan raw ako niya?
eng: Will he hurt me?

rin: Alagad ku nagrani na iya, pinurot niya su sawa tapos ilinuog sa sako.
eng: But when he went closer, he picked up the snake and put it inside a sack.

rin: Nagrapo kanako su papa ni Kiko.
eng: Kiko’s father approached me.

rin: Kiko, uno mo sasabiyon sadi upos?
eng: Kiko, what are you going to say to this cat?

rin: Miggalin na kintana ako kinding binaoy ako ni Kiko.
eng: I was about to leave but Kiko called me.

rin: Salamat kanimo!
eng: Thank you!

rin: Nag-abay iya kanako tapos ginakos ako.
eng: He came near me and then hugged me.

rin: Diri 'ko namangno na nakaturog na palan ako sadto ruruggan ni Kiko.
eng: I didn’t realize that I had already fallen asleep on Kiko’s bed.

rin: Iko, mayang, magngayamon kita!
eng: Iko, let's go, let's play!

rin: Inataman ako ni Kiko saka ku pamilya nira.
eng: Kiko and his family take care of me.

rin: Ngowan, binabawog saka pinapayaba nira 'ko.
eng: Now, they feed and love me.

rin: Pirmi 'kong nakikingayamon ki Kiko saka natuturog sa kaabay niya.
eng: I always play with Kiko and sleep beside him.

rin: Mamuya na 'ko ngowan.
eng: I am willing now.

rin: Pagkatapos nira kitang gamiton, basta na sana kitang binayaan sadi saka liningawan na!
eng: After they used us, they'll just leave us here and let us go!

rin: Sabi ni Reyna Strawla sa mga kaiba niyang basura.
eng: Reyna Strawla said to her fellow trash.

rin: Nabobotan na reyna, agko na mga tawong nagtitipon kanato para i-recycle.
eng: My queen, there are people already gathering to recycle us.

rin: Sabi ku usad na boteng plastik.
eng: Said by the plastic bottle.

rin: Pero dakol pa nanggad a diri isi kin pauno magsuway-suway sa basura saka mga diri tattaong sumunod sa batas saka mga regulasyon.
eng: But there are still many who don’t know how to properly manage their garbage and those who don’t follow the laws and regulations.

rin: Narungog ko man na a mga tawo gurugatikot ng nagbabago, nabubutan na reyna.
eng: I also heard that people are slowly changing, my queen.

rin: Sabi ku kinumukumong papel.
eng: Said by the crumpled paper.

rin: Su ibang basura nag-uyon saka nagtango.
eng: The other trash agreed and nodded.

rin: Buko an na matuod!
eng: That’s not true!

rin: Patutunayan ko yan kaninyo ngamin na a mga tawo diri pa nagbabago!
eng: I will prove to you all that people have not changed yet!

rin: Uno gigibuwon mo kan, nabubutan kong reyna?
eng: What will you do then, my queen?

rin: Unga ku usad na taklaon na lata sa sardinas.
eng: asked by the rusty can of sardines.

rin: Tanganing mapatunayan su plano niya, nag-iyan si Reyna Strawla sa syudad tanganing maipabayad na a mga tawo diri pa nagbabago.
eng: To prove her plan, Queen Strawla went to the city to show that people still haven’t changed.

rin: Nagpuon iya sa mga basuran na arani sa kapeyan kin sari iya galin.
eng: She started at the garbage dumps near the place where she came from.

rin: Nabayad niya sadto su ibang mga straw na kapareyo niya.
eng: She saw other straws like her.

rin: Tauno ta isadi ika?
eng: What are you doing here?

rin: Mag-iba kamo kanako.
eng: Come with me.

rin: Labanan ta a mga tawo.
eng: Let's fight against the people.

rin: Anggan nguwan, diri pa nanggad nira isi kin pauno pagsuwayon a mga plastik sadto mga nalulupa!
eng: Until now, they still don’t know how to properly separate plastics from rotting ones.

rin: Amo, medyo mauban na.
eng: Yes, it's been a long time.

rin: Kaya mas maray pang maggalin na ika ta isadi su mga nalulupa, rugang ku natutudang straw na papel.
eng: So it’s better for you to leave because these are for rotting ones, said her fellow paper straw.

rin: Nagngisi sana si Reyna Strawla kanda.
eng: Queen Strawla only sneered at them.

rin: Usad na ngising plastik.
eng: A plastic smile.

rin: Pinagsisipa man a iba.
eng: Others were kicked.

rin: Dismayado, nagpadagos iya ku pag-iyan sa syudad.
eng: Disappointed, she continued roaming around the city.

rin: Nag-iyan iya sadto imburnal kin sari isi niya na su ibang plastik natitipon saka nagbabara sa bulos ka tubig.
eng: She went to the drainage and saw that plastics were piling up and blocking the flow of water.

rin: Nguwan, sigurado ako na su mga kapareyo kong plastik isadi saka mapatutunayan kong a mga tawo diri pa nagbago.
eng: Now, I'm sure that my fellow plastics are here, and I will prove that people have not changed yet.

rin: Namuti su lalawgon ni Reyna Strawla ku nabayad niya kin gaumno kalinig su imburnal.
eng: Queen Strawla’s face whitened when she saw how clean the drainage was.

rin: Su tubig lang linaw saka diretsong nagbubulos.
eng: The water was clear and flowed straight through.

rin: Uda na usad na pidaso sa basura a nagkakalat o naglulutow-lutow sa imburnal.
eng: There wasn’t a single piece of trash scattered or floating in the drainage.

rin: Ku pagtangad niya, nabayad niya su karatula sa usad na poste.
eng: When she looked up, she saw a sign posted on a pole.

rin: Diri kami naggagamit sa plastik.
eng: We do not use plastic.

rin: Nagngisi nanggad iya.
eng: She sneered again.

rin: Su plastik niyang ngisi.
eng: Her plastic sneer.

rin: Bagana matunow su awak na plastik ni Strawla ku nadiskubre niya, kindi diri iya naudaan sa pag-asa.
eng: It was as if Queen Strawla’s plastic body would melt when she discovered this, but she did not lose hope.

rin: Nag-iyan iya sa pangpang ta isi niya na su mga basura mababayad sadto.
eng: She went to the shore because she believed she would still find trash there.

rin: Diri nag-uban nabayad niya su grupo kin mga hobenes.
eng: Not long enough she saw a group of young people.

rin: Nagtatawa saka nag-uurunaan sa pagpurot ku mga plastik, boteng plastik, saka mga lata.
eng: They were laughing and helping each other pick up plastics, plastic bottles, and cans.

rin: Pinupurot nira a ngamin na basurang pwede nitang magamit saka mapakinabangan.
eng: They were picking up all kinds of waste that could still be reused and recycled.

rin: Nagdesisyon iyang alinon su mga namamatian niyang kauditan saka kamunduan ku nabayad niya adto.
eng: She decided to let go of the anger and sadness she felt when he saw that.

rin: Diri na iya nagpadagos sa kanyang pagbyahe.
eng: She no longer continued her journey.

rin: Nagbalik na sana iya sadto Basuran sa Agos.
eng: She will just return to the Garbage at the River.

rin: Ku nag-aagi na iya pabalik sa Basuran sa Agos, nalabusan niya su mga plastik na istro na pinag-uugasan.
eng: On her way back to the Garbage at the River, she passed by some washed plastic straws.

rin: Nabayad niya su mga ginibong magayon na bag, tsinelas, saka mga banig na gibo sa mga pinag-ugasan na mga istro.
eng: She saw the beautiful bags, slippers, and mats made from the cleaned straws.

rin: Bagana balangaw a mga kulor kadi.
eng: They looked like a rainbow of colors.

rin: Nag-iyan si Reyna Strawla kanda saka nakipagngisiyan.
eng: Queen Strawla went to them and smiled along.

rin: Su tunay na ngisi.
eng: A true smile.

rin: Itay, migluog nako ka ireskwelan?
eng: Father, can I go to school now?

rin: Kintana, kinding diri pa kita sigurado kin kuno a ireskwelan purmidyo ka COVID-19.
eng: I hope so, but we're not sure yet when we'll be able to go back to school due to COVID-19.

rin: Isay a magigin maestra ko?
eng: Who will be my teacher?

rin: Tutturuan ko ikang magbasa, magsurat saka magbilang.
eng: I will teach you how to read, write, and count.

rin: Migdrowing man kita.
eng: We will also draw.

rin: Uda man kita pisarra.
eng: But we don't have a blackboard.

rin: Sari kita migsurat?
eng: Where will we write?"

rin: Dakol amaduduag tang karton.
eng: We have plenty of big cardboard.

rin: Dakol pa a saray tang tang uring.
eng: We still have small pieces of charcoal.

rin: Amo adto gigibuwon tang tsok.
eng: That's what we will use as chalk.

rin: Uno gagamiton tang pangkolor?
eng: What will we use for coloring?

rin: Agko man lumang pangkolor si kuya mo.
eng: Your older sibling has old coloring materials.

rin: Pwede mo adtong gamiton.
eng: You can use those.

rin: Gusto ko man maging kag-igin na tulos.
eng: I want to become a parent right away.

rin: Tauno man ta gusto mo na tulos maging kag-igin?
eng: Why do you want to become a parent right away?

rin: Gusto ko kayang maging maestro!
eng: Because I want to be a teacher!

rin: A mga kag-igin palan maestro man.
eng: So, parents are teachers too.

rin: Hahaha! Ika talaga bunso, pigpapatawa mo si papa.
eng: Hahaha! You really make Papa laugh, little one.

rin: Usad na aldow sa kakawuyan, nagpuon ng magkusog su kalayo.
eng: One day in the forest, a fire broke out.

rin: Napiritan nang gumalin su ngamin na ayop.
eng: All the animals were forced to flee.

rin: Agko usad na hummingbird na nagpawatak.
eng: There is a hummingbird that has been left behind.

rin: Naglayog paiyan sa salog, tinnuka kin gatikat na tubig, naglayog pabalik, saka isinigbo sadto kalayo.
eng: It flew to the river, sipped a drop of water, flew back, and poured it onto the fire.

rin: Pabalik-balik, su hummingbird naglalayog paiyan sa salog, nagsasaldok sa usad na tubod kin tubig saka isisigbo sadto kalayo.
eng: Again and again, the hummingbird flew to the river, scooped up a bit of water, and dropped it onto the flames.

rin: Diri maka-tubod su mga ayop na nagsisilong arayo sa pangpang.
eng: The animals watching from afar of the seashore could not believe it.

rin: Pinag-ngisyan saka pinag-kantyawan su hummingbird.
eng: They laughed and mocked the hummingbird.

rin: Uno sa silong mo a ginigibo mo?'
eng: What do you think you're doing?

rin: Unga ko mga ayop.
eng: The animals asked.

rin: Uda pag-alangan, kalmadong sinnimbag so hummingbird.
eng: Without hesitation, the hummingbird calmly replied.

rin: Ginigibo kun uno a kaya ko.
eng: I am doing what I can.

rin: Usad na aldow, agko nag-agi-aging lalaki sa gilid kin kadagatan.
eng: One day, a man was walking along the seashore.

rin: Nakabayad syang ribo kan starfish na naianod sa pangpang.
eng: He saw thousands of starfish washed up on the shore.

rin: Ku nakasilong siya sa gilid ka dagat, agko siya nabayad na nag-iiwag na bagana nagbabayli.
eng: As he is watching from the seaside, he noticed something moving, almost like dancing.

rin: Ku arani na siya, nabayad niyang babayi palan adtu, saka diri siya nagbabayli.
eng: When he got nearer, he realized it was actually a woman and she wasn’t dancing at all.

rin: Kinding, nag-irarum pa siya, namumurot starfish saka minama-anan sindang ibinabalik paiyan dagat.
eng: Instead, she bent down, picking up starfish and gently throwing them back into the sea.

rin: Binauy siya.
eng: She was called.

rin: Maray na ramrag!
eng: Good morning!

rin: Unong ginigibo mo?
eng: What are you doing?

rin: Napundo su igin na babayi, nanilong-silong saka nagsimbag.
eng: The young woman stopped, looked up at him, and replied.

rin: Binabalik ding starfish paiyan dagat marig diri sinda matigbak.
eng: I'm returning these starfish to the sea so they won’t die.

rin: Diri ika mag-para-isip.
eng: Don't worry.

rin: Laka-dakol siton starfish.
eng: There are plenty of starfish.

rin: Uda man migbago.
eng: Nothing will ever change.

rin: Nag-irungog sana su igin na babayi.
eng: The young woman only listened.

rin: Tapos nag-ungko siya, nag-purot nanggad sa starfish, saka inapon sadtu dagat pag-agi ku dakulong alon.
eng: Then she bent down, picked up another starfish, and throw it back into the sea when the big waves came.

rin: Sinilngan nanggad niya su lalaki.
eng: She looked straight at the man.

rin: Saka sinabing, Nya, agko baga nabago!
eng: And then said, See? something has changed!

rin: Usad na gab-e, agko matakot na pangiturogan su hade.
eng: One night, the king had a frightening dream.

rin: Napangituroganan niya na habang nakalunad siya sa kabayo paiyan sa mauswag na kabukidan, nagsabi ah angin sa katimogan na.
eng: He dreamed that while riding his horse through a flourishing mountain, the southern wind whispered.

rin: Magmaan sa nangag uulogan na kawoy!
eng: Beware of the falling trees!

rin: Dawa luway anggan punok sanang innaangin, nakatakot pananggad su hade.
eng: Even though the wind blew gently and only a few branches swayed, the king was still terrified.

rin: Kaya pinabirik niya ah kabayo
eng: So he turned his horse around.

rin: Sunod na aldow, Nagmanda su hade na putolon ngamin na kawoy sa pagrurugaring niya.
eng: The next day, the king ordered that all the trees in his territory be cut down.

rin: Nag-uyon man a mga tawo sa pagboot ku hade.
eng: The people obeyed the king's command.

rin: Makakapili sira sa magayon na klase na kawoy na magagamit ninda pantugrok sa baloy anggan makagibo sa mga kagamitan habang a iba man ipapabakal.
eng: They could choose the best types of wood to use for building houses and making tools, while the rest were sold.

rin: Diri ta gugustohun na maulogan sa kawoy a mga igin ta.
eng: We don’t want our children to be hurt by falling trees..

rin: Aalinun ta a kakakawuyan, tapos migtanom na sana sa mga gulay.
eng: We will clear the forests, then plant vegetables instead.

rin: Namuya saka ginnaan su buot ku hade ku naputol su ngamin na kawoy.
eng: The king was delighted and encouraged when all the trees had been cut down.

rin: Pero diri namuya a mga tawo.
eng: But the people were not pleased.

rin: Nagsisirbing istaran sa bayong anggan nagtatao ah kawoy sa trabaho sa mga paragibo sa baluy.
eng: The trees serve as shelter for birds and provide employment for those who build houses.

rin: Kaya naudaan sinda sa trabaho, pati mga bayong.
eng: So they lost their jobs, and so did the birds.

rin: Alagad ku uda na mga kawoy, naging malain na ah panawon.
eng: But because there were no more tree, the weather turned bad.

rin: Natigbak na su mga pananom na gulay.
eng: The vegetable crops were destroyed.

rin: Uda na maginibo ah mga tawo kundi silngan a kandang natad na agko nagkakayat na mga putol na kawoy.
eng: People can do nothing but stare at their yard with scattered broken trees.

rin: Napurisaw su hade.
eng: The king was frustrated.

rin: Nagiyan siya utro sa kabukidan para baydon ah naraot sa kapalibotan.
eng: He went back to the mountains to see the damage to the environment.

rin: Uda na mga kawoy kaya uda na migsangga ku makusog na angin.
eng: With no more trees, the strong winds blew freely.

rin: Kaya nagkararaot a mga tanom anggan masitas.
eng: So the plants were ruined, including the crops.

rin: Pinanluya su hade sa nabayad niya.
eng: The king felt weak by what he see.

rin: Abang naka ungko nagpapaingalo su hade sa likod ku kabayo, narungog niya utro a angin na nagsasabing.
eng: While the king was resting on the back of his horse, he heard the wind again saying.

rin: Agko usa na kin mag-iwag luway.
eng: There is a deer who move slowly.

rin: A sungoy dakulo sa maray.
eng: The antler is so big.

rin: Bagana pakpak na tunay.
eng: It's like real wings.

rin: Agko tukko sadto mangga, nagpararulo-lukso sadto mga bunga, nag-uupot sa mga sanga, nagtatagong baga na ninja.
eng: There is a gecko on the mango tree, jumping on the fruits, defecates on the branches, hiding like a ninja.

rin: Alagad agko ko usad na kabisto namamundo saka nagsosolo-solo, si Kulapnit na amigo.
eng: But I know someone alone and lonely, he is my friend Kulapnit.

rin: Tauno ta nagtatangis ika, amigo?
eng: Why are you crying, friend?

rin: Rinarayuan saka ikinakaati kayaako.
eng: They shun me and hate me.

rin: Pauno ko raw mapamuya a amigo ko?
eng: How could I comfort my friend?

rin: Sa ngamin kong mga amigo Sa kabuotan, si Kulapnit numero uno.
eng: Of all my friends in terms of kindness, Kulapnit is number one.

rin: Diri iya namemerwisyo.
eng: He doesn’t get annoyed easily.

rin: Diri mo sana iya ilaom, na iyan sa preso.
eng: You wouldn’t see him in trouble or in jail.

rin: Iba man a pagsilong ta kanda.
eng: We look at them differently.

rin: Pagtatakot ni Bonong na nagtatago sa likod ka alad ku eskwelan nira.
eng: Bonong was scaring, hiding behind the school fence.

rin: Diri niya mapugulan na diri magngisi sa mga tawong naglalabos na nakikigkig niya.
eng: He couldn’t stop laughing at the people passing by who were surprised by him.

rin: Bonong! Pauli na raw sadto!
eng: Bonong! Go home now!

rin: Makapkap ngani ika siton!
eng: You'll get caught there!

rin: Patakot na dawoy ni Yoyo Undo na subago pa palan iya pigsisilngan ta arani su baloy nira sa eskwelan.
eng: Yoyo Undo shouted, watching him for a while because his house was near at the school.

rin: Buko man po a matuod,
eng: That's not true.

rin: Simbag ni Bonong na nagkakagow sa payo sabay agi pauli kanda.
eng: Bonong replied while scratching his head and then walks home.

rin: Kinaramragan, pagluog ni Bonong sa klasrum, rinapo tulos niya su mga barkada niya.
eng: In the morning, when Bonong entered the classroom, he immediately approached his friends.

rin: Uno pinag gigibo ninyo siton mural ni Ma'am France?
eng: What are you doing with Ma'am France's mural?

rin: Para pinapagayon namo ading mural ni Ma'am France.
eng: We are just making this Ma'am France's mural beautiful.

rin: Mas makusog ading Kikik na ginibo ko, nasasaklot ading prinsesa sadi mural!
eng: The Kikik I made is stronger, it even catches the princess in the mural!

rin: Di ko ipadaog adi duwende na nababatangan ading mga burak!
eng: I won't give up this dwarf that is lying on the flowers!

rin: Sabat man ni Cocoy na pigtutuldo su drowing.
eng: Cocoy replied while pointing at the drawing.

rin: Naengganyo si Bonong, saka nag-kurit-kurit man sa ringring.
eng: Bonong got excited and started doodling on the wall as well.

rin: Look at this, this is my drawing of ulalo, starring Bonong.
eng: Look at this, this is my drawing, starring Bonong.

rin: Namuya sira na nagkukurit-kurit sa ringring dawa mala nang ati ku mga lalawgon saka kamot sa man iba-ibang kulor ku krayola.
eng: They are happy drawing on the wall even though their faces and hands are very dirty because of the different colors of crayons.

rin: Siguradong isi mo yan ta san sana man likod a baloy ninyo.
eng: You definitely know that because your house is just there behind.

rin: sabi ni Yayo na malaka sigurado.
eng: Yayo said confidently.

rin: Di mapugulan ni Bonong su pagtawa niya na biyong napaluluwa.
eng: Bonong couldn’t stop laughing almost in tears.

rin: Nagmamalisya na kintana su mga barkada niya kinding, taiton na su maestra nira sa Filipino.
eng: His friends peeked nervously, worried the Filipino teacher might catch them.

rin: Agko kuno aswang sadi eskwelan.
eng: They say there's a ghost at school.

rin: Pagkapanggab-i, abang maagnow na su gab-i, nagdulag si Bonong sadto mga apuon niya na si Amay Inday saka si Yoyo Undo.
eng: At night, while the night was cold, Bonong drew it with his friends — Amay Inday and Yoyo Undo.

rin: Biyong nagdadalagan su mga tawong naglalabos galin Kamarin.
eng: People ran past quickly, coming from Kamarin.

rin: Di iya makapaniwala ta isi niya uda man kabayo sa loog ku eskwelan
eng: He couldn’t believe it, because he knew there were no horses inside the school.

rin: Agko kanako sadi nagriringgaw!
eng: There is something bothering me here!

rin: Nagdududang unga ni Bonong.
eng: Bonong muttered in doubt.

rin: Dawa nakakatakot na, inanap niya su pinaggalinan ku tunog.
eng: Even though it was scary, he searched for the source of the sound.

rin: Nakatatakot na unga naman ni Bonong na nangangalag-kalag sa palibot.
eng: Bonong shivered, he asked as he was wandering.

rin: Ku nakaabot si Bonong sadto klasrum nira, nagsirang iya sadto raot na bintana ku klasrum.
eng: When Bonong arrived at their classroom, he peered through the broken window.

rin: Mga drowing sadto mural ni Ma'am France nabubuway pag gab-i!
eng: The drawings on Ma’am France’s mural came alive at night!

rin: Paing-ing na sabi ni Bonong sa sadiri abang kanangangalas ku nababayad.
eng: Bonong whispered to himself in awe at what he was seeing.

rin: Agko mga nagbabayling burak, nagkakarantan na mga bayong saka mga prinsesang nag-iinabrakan.
eng: There were flowers dancing, birds singing, and princesses twirling in gowns.

rin: Kindi su pagkamuya niya nabalyuwan sa pagkatakot.
eng: But his amazement quickly turned into fear.

rin: Bigla-biglang naglutow su mga kinurit-kurit nira.
eng: Suddenly, the doodles they had drawn began to float.

rin: Nagkaripas sa dalagan su unglo.
eng: The monster ran wildly.

rin: Biyong pigsisikad su tiil sa kamumuy-an.
eng: he chanted, stomping his feet in excitement.

rin: Napikon si Prinsesa kaya sinimbag niya si Unglo.
eng: The Princess was annoyed and answered the monster.

rin: Tigsik ko ading kagdaog na unglo.
eng: Here is my verse for the boastful monster.

rin: Kin uno-uno sinasabi kanamo.
eng: Whatever is being said to us.

rin: Tinindog si Duwende sa ulaan tanganing mabayad.
eng: The dwarf stood on the chair so he could be seen.

rin: Nagtindog iya sa malakaburad tanganing maglurulangkaw.
eng: He stood higher to appear taller.

rin: Para nakikingasa kami pwede man kamong makiiba O kaya kamo na mag-impake.
eng: Since we’re asking for help, you may join us, or you can be the one to pack.

rin: Sabay-sabay na nagngabil su mga linalang tanganing madepensan a grupo nira.
eng: The creatures spoke in unison to defend their group.

rin: Abang naglalayog sa arani ku sulo inusay muna su bok sabay kindat.
eng: While flying near the fire, she fixed her hair and winked.

rin: Mantang nangangalas si Bonong ag napapaisip kin matuod su nababayad niya.
eng: While Bonong is puzzled, he also wonders if what he sees is true.

rin: Tabi po, makilabos.
eng: Excuse me, I'll pass by.

rin: Buntol na sabi ku ulalo.
eng: The ulalo slowly said.

rin: Sadto nakumpirma ni Bonong na matuod su mga nababayad niya.
eng: There Bonong confirmed that what he saw was true.

rin: Pigtabangan niyang maibusol paluog su ulalo ta kaluway-luway na pig uuusto su sadiri sadto bintana.
eng: He helped the ulalo enter as it slowly adjusted itself to the window.

rin: Abang nagngangabil su darwa, padagos pa man nanggad su pagrabong ku darwang grupo.
eng: While the two were talking, the two sides continued to fight.

rin: Anggan sa nagsirang na su aldow kaya sabay-sabay sirang nauda.
eng: Until the sun rose and they disappeared together.

rin: Namumundo saka nag-uurop-urop si Bonong pauli.
eng: Bonong walked home feeling down and all alone.

rin: Kasalan namo kaya nagrarabong sira.
eng: It's our fault, that’s why they’re fighting.

rin: Sabay angos sa ararom.
eng: Then sighed deeply.

rin: Ku Biyernes na ramrag, pagka-abot ni Bonong sadto klasrum pinunan na niyang alinon su mga kurit-kurit nira sadto mural ni Ma'am France.
eng: On Friday morning, when Bonong arrived at the classroom, he started erasing the drawings they had made on Ma'am France’s mural.

rin: Uban na palan na nagpaparamasid si Ma'am France, pangala nagrapo adi kanya saka inunga iya.
eng: It turned out that Ma'am France had been quietly watching him, then she approached and asked.

rin: Tauno ta pinag-aalin mo?
eng: Why are you erasing it?

rin: Sala po su ginibo namo Ma'am.
eng: It was wrong for us to do that, Ma'am.

rin: Simbag ni Bonong na nagluluwa-luwa sa pagkamundo.
eng: Answered Bonong, his eyes welling up in guilt.

rin: Agko kamo potensyal sa pagkurit-kurit, kinding di ninyo ginibo sa tamang lugar.
eng: You have potential in drawing but you haven't used it in the right place.

rin: Uno man na intensyon dawa maray, kin sala sa lugar nagigin sala man.
eng: No matter how good the intention, if it's in the wrong place, it's still wrong.

rin: San man kamo luyong ring-ring, san ninyo iligwat su mga pigkurit-kurit ninyo.
eng: You go to the other wall, move what you're drawing there.

rin: Puon kadto, tuninong na nagkakanta sa hele su mga drowing sa mural.
eng: Since then, the mural drawings have been peacefully singing lullaby.

rin: Makaskas a pag-agi ni Pogi sa mga nagpupulang korales sa dagat ka Balatan abang pigsusundan iya sa usad pang pugitang si Bogs.
eng: Pogi quickly passes through the red corals in the Balatan Sea while he is followed by another octopus, Bogs.

rin: Diri na magngayamon san.
eng: Don't play there anymore.

rin: Parumrom ni Bogs.
eng: Warned Bogs.

rin: Uda naginibo si Pogi kindi magsunod ki Bogs.
eng: Pogi did nothing else but follow Bogs.

rin: Magngod na pugita sira Pogi saka Bogs.
eng: Pogi and Bogs are octupus siblings.

rin: Uda na sira kag-igin kaya pirming amo nasusunod a gurang na si Bogs.
eng: They no longer have parents so the eldest, Bogs, is always the one being obeyed.

rin: Diri mag-iyan san.
eng: Don't go there.

rin: Diri ika mag-iyan sadi.
eng: Don't go here.

rin: Diri mo iton pagkaptan.
eng: Don't hold that.

rin: Minsan na namamasyar a magngod sa nagpupulang korales, bigla na sanang nakaisip sa plano si Pogi.
eng: One time, while the siblings were wandering among the glowing red corals, Pogi suddenly thought of a plan.

rin: Bogs, magtaga-tagaan kita.
eng: Bogs, let's play hide-and-seek.

rin: Pag narakop ko ika, ika mig-anap sa kasag na kaunon ta.
eng: If I catch you, you’ll be the one to find crabs for us to eat.

rin: Kin diri ako a miganap sa kasag.
eng: But if I don't catch you, then I'll be the one to look for crabs.

rin: Nagtago sirang darwa.
eng: The two began to hide.

rin: Nagtago tulos si Bogs sa mga pulang korales.
eng: Bogs quickly hide into the red corals.

rin: Si Pogi man, inarog a kolor ku baybay.
eng: Pogi, meanwhile, disguised himself with the colors of the sand.

rin: Makadudulag na ako ki Bogs.
eng: I'm going to sneak up on Bogs.

rin: Pinagpuruputan tulos adi ni Pogi ku mga galamay niya.
eng: Pogi quickly grabbed it tightly with his tentacles.

rin: Nasundan palan iya ni Bogs.
eng: But Bogs followed him.

rin: Adi, arog man ka kasag na paboritong kaunon ka mga pugita.
eng: This is similar to the crabs that octopus likes to eat.

rin: Nagtatangis si Pogi ku pigbubutong na iya ku tora-tora pataas.
eng: Pogi cried out as the tora-tora pulled him upward with great force.

rin: Uda na maginibo si Bogs kwasa arog man kadto su nangyari ku mga kag-igin nira.
eng: Bogs could do nothing, for it was the same fate that had already taken their parents.

rin: Ipinangako ko sa sadiri ko na poprotektaran ko a ngod ko sa tora-tora.
eng: I promised myself I would protect my younger sibling from the tora-tora.

rin: Nagtalikod na si Bogs tanganing magbalik na sadto mga mapupulang korales.
eng: Bogs turned away to swam back toward the red corals.

rin: Bogs, una ko talaga kasag adto, maray sanang nakadulag ako.
eng: Bogs, I really thought it was a crab, but luckily I escaped.

rin: Migsunod na ako kanimo puon nguwan.
eng: I'll follow you from now on.

rin: Pogi, amo adto tora-tora na kalalawgon sana ka kasag.
eng: Pogi, that’s the tora-tora that looks like a crab.

rin: Amo man adto nagkuko kanda Nanay saka ki Tatay.
eng: That's the same one that grabbed Mother and Father.

rin: Kaya, pirmi ko ikang pinagsasaway ta abo kong maarog ika kanda.
