eng: That's why I always scold you, so you won't get taken by it.

rin: Pinaggakos ni Bogs a ngod niya.
eng: Bogs hugged him.

rin: Sabi ni Sara abang nagbobomba ku gripo sa ipinlaba ni Mama nira.
eng: Sara said while pumping the faucet to rinse their mother's laundry.

rin: Sira Lisa saka Sara a magkambal na igin nira Mama Helen saka Papa Romeo.
eng: They are Lisa and Sara, twins and children of Mama Helen and Papa Romeo.

rin: Pareyo nasa ikarwang grado sa San Nicolas Elementary School.
eng: They're both in second grade at San Nicolas Elementary School.

rin: Si Sara, mabuot saka masinunod-sunod sa nakagugurang, mantang si Lisa kin uno kagustuwan amo gusto nasusunod.
eng: Sara is kind and obedient to the elders, while Lisa always wants things to go her way.

rin: Naglalaba sira Mama Helen saka Sara abang nag-iistoryan manungod sa mga gibo sa eskwelan.
eng: Mama Helen and Sara were doing the laundry while talking about school activities.

rin: Si Lisa, nakaula sa sala mantang nagsisilong sa TV.
eng: Lisa is in the living room watching TV.

rin: Lisa, usaya raw tabi a mga hanger siton ulaan.
eng: Lisa, please fix the hangers on that chair.

rin: Sige Mama, pero pasentro kita nganod.
eng: Sure Mama, let's go to the town later.

rin: Bumakal kita sa ngayamnan, opo?
eng: Let’s buy a toy, okay?

rin: Lisa, kadakol pang gigibuwon ni Mama nganod.
eng: Lisa, Mama still has a lot of things to do later.

rin: Buko man pati ikang kaiba nganod.
eng: You won't even be with me later.

rin: Agko baga ika gigibuwon.
eng: You have something to do.

rin: Pakausay ku mga hanger, nagrapo si Lisa ki Mama niya.
eng: After fixing the hangers, Lisa went to her Mama.

rin: Mama, migbakal akong sitsirya ta nag-aalop ako.
eng: Mama, I will buy chips because I’m hungry.

rin: Labi na baga ika Lisa.
eng: You're too much, Lisa.

rin: Isi mo man baga na bawal ikang magparakaon kan.
eng: You know you’re not allowed to keep eating that.

rin: Pinapabayaan na sana ngani ika ka gusto mong gibuwon, kin uno-uno pa naiisipan mo!
eng: You were already being allowed to do what you wanted, but you're still thinking of everything!

rin: Kin nag-aalop ika, agko siton kraker saka kanon.
eng: If you’re hungry, there are crackers and rice.

rin: Talagang sitsirya pa a gusto mo?
eng: You really want chips?

rin: Binnalik si Lisa sadto sala ta nagsilong na sana utro iya sa TV.
eng: Lisa went back to the living room and just continued watching TV.

rin: Arog kan pirmi a senaryo san baloy nira.
eng: That is always the scenario in their house.

rin: Kin uno ayaton ni Lisa, gusto niya maitao kanya.
eng: Whatever Lisa asks for, she wants to be given it.

rin: Usad na aldow sa Domingo, mala pa ka saki na nag-imo ku magpamilya para magsimba.
eng: One Sunday, the family prepared very early for church.

rin: Uda tanda sa uran o uno pa man na raot sa panahon.
eng: There was no sign of rain or any bad weather.

rin: Kadakul ku mga nagsirimba, kadakul man ku mga igin.
eng: Many people went to church and many children too.

rin: Alagad, nakabayad si Lisa sa nagtitinda sa magagayon na lobo.
eng: But Lisa saw a vendor of beautiful balloons.

rin: Mga lobong iba-iba a kolor saka porma.
eng: Balloons of different colors and shapes.

rin: Nagluwas iya para silngan su makokolor na mga lobo.
eng: She went out to look at the colorful balloons.

rin: Namuya iya ta nababayad niya su mga paborito niyang burak saka ngayamnan na nakadrowing sadto mga lobo na agko mga ibaibang kolor.
eng: She became happy because she saw her favorite flowers and toys drawn on the balloons that had different colors.

rin: Sinabiyan niyang magluog nguna sadto simban.
eng: He told them to go into the church first.

rin: Isi mo Sara, ading mga lobo lang gagayon.
eng: Look, Sara, these balloons are really beautiful.

rin: Lang gayon nirang naglalayog-layog.
eng: They fly beautifully.

rin: Gusto ko man kan kaya nganod migpabakal ako ki Mama sa darwa.
eng: I like them too, so I’ll ask Mama to buy me two later.

rin: An pating mga drowing sa mga ritrato san lobo gusto ko sirang kanga amon.
eng: I’d like those drawings on the balloon pictures to be ours.

rin: Nagmurusdot si Sara ku sinabi ni Lisa.
eng: Sara frowned at what Lisa said.

rin: Pero Lisa, sabi ni Mama magluog na nguna kuno ika.
eng: But Lisa, Mama said you should go inside first.

rin: Pagkatapos na sana kuno ika magluwas tangani kunong sabaysabay na sana kita.
eng: They said we should just go out together just after.

rin: Nagtindog si Lisa saka nagsunod ki Sara paluog sadto simban.
eng: Lisa stood up and followed Sara going inside the church.

rin: Pagkatapos ku misa, nagkaon su magpamilya sa usad na restawran.
eng: After mass, the family went to eat together at a restaurant.

rin: Mamuya sirang pagsilngan.
eng: They are beautiful to watch.

rin: Ritrato sa maray na pamilya.
eng: A picture of a good family.

rin: Pagkatapos magkaon, nagpauli na sira saka nagpaingalo.
eng: After eating, they went home and took a rest.

rin: Si Sara nag-uusay na ku mga gagamiton kinaudmaan sa eskwelan ta Lunes na naman.
eng: Sara was already arranging the things to be used at school for the next day because it’s Monday again.

rin: Mantang si Lisa, lang ray ku pagkaula na nagkakaon sa donat habang nagsisilong sa TV.
eng: As for Lisa, she was just sitting in the living room eating a donut while watching TV.

rin: Lawod na su gab-i.
eng: It was late at night.

rin: Punok na su kabaluyan.
eng: The house was quiet.

rin: Pinaturog na ni Mama Helen su darwa ta agko klase kinaudmaan.
eng: Mama Helen already put the two to sleep because they have class the next day.

rin: Napaturog na si Sara kindi napagmata iya ta nagngangabil sa kin uno-uno si Lisa.
eng: Sara had already fallen asleep, but woke up because Lisa was mumbling random things.

rin: Pinagsilngan sana niya su kakambal ta isi niya na
eng: He just watched the twin because he already knew.

rin: Pero biglang nagbuwat si Lisa na nag-aangos sa labo-labo.
eng: But suddenly, Lisa got up, breathing really fast.

rin: Ginakos niya si Sara abang nagtatangis.
eng: She hugged Sara while crying.

rin: Inunga ni Sara si Lisa kin agko namamatian o makulog.
eng: Sara asked Lisa if she was feeling anything or if anything hurt.

rin: Sige pa nanggad su tangis ni Lisa na nag-iistoya ku kakambal niya.
eng: Lisa kept crying while telling the story to her twin.

rin: Su mga lobo sadto simban subago nabuway.
eng: The balloons earlier in the church came to life.

rin: Gusto nira akong kuon tanganing darawon sadto kanda.
eng: They wanted to take me with them to their place.

rin: Diri na nira ako ibabalik kanda Mama saka Papa.
eng: They won't bring me back to Mama and Papa.

rin: Ilalayog na kintana ako nira paiyan sadto Asog ta san kuno a istaran nira.
eng: They were about to fly me to Asog because that’s where they live.

rin: Maray sana na napagmata ako.
eng: Good thing I woke up.

rin: Sinabiyan na dapat mag-iirungog sa akagugurang kanya.
eng: She was told to listen to those older than her.

rin: Dapat pirming mangadyi bago maturog tanganing diri pangaturugan sa kin uno-uno.
eng: Always pray before sleeping to not dream of anything.

rin: Nakaturog si Lisa na gakos-gakos ku kakambal niya.
eng: Lisa fell asleep hugging her twin.

rin: gatingay pa sana a nakaistar sa Sumagang.
eng: Only few live in Sumagang.

rin: Uda kaya ibang pagkukuan sa tubig a mga tawo kindi tubig sana sa uran.
eng: The people had no other source of water except for rain.

rin: Usad sa mga nagkapirang nakaistar sa Sumagang a tribo ka Cimarron.
eng: One of the tribes living in Sumagang was the Cimarron tribe.

rin: Si Apo Iraya a namamayo sa Tribo.
eng: Apo Araya was the leader of the tribe.

rin: Agko iya usad na igin na lalaki na a ngaran Iraga.
eng: He had an only son named Iraga.

rin: Pagtanom anggan pagrakop ka mga layas na ayop a kandang ikinabubuway.
eng: Farming and hunting wild animals were their means of survival.

rin: Kaya, pirming sadto bukid a mga lalaking Cimarron tanganing magbantay ka mga pananom saka mangbitik sa upon.
eng: The Cimarron men were always in the mountains to guard their crops and set traps for wild animals.

rin: Si Iraga a pinakamaurot na paratanom sa interong tribo.
eng: Iraga was the most hardworking farmer in the whole tribe.

rin: Iya a agko pinakamaiwas na tanuman sa batag, kamote saka kamoteng kawoy.
eng: He had the widest fields of rice, sweet potatoes, and cassava.

rin: Kaya, biyong pag-aagawan a mga ginusi niya pag iya innuuli.
eng: That was why his harvests were always sought after when he brought them home.

rin: Biglang innabot su alawig na tag-init.
eng: Then suddenly, a long drought came.

rin: Di basang innuuran.
eng: It was not raining.

rin: Kaya, pinnuon nang maggaralinan su ibang tawo sa Sumagang.
eng: So, people began to leave Sumagang.

rin: Amo sana natagak su mga Cimarron.
eng: That was when the Cimarrons were left behind.

rin: Kaya, uroaldow sirang nag-aapag saka nag-aatang ki Gugurang tanganing mag-uran.
eng: Every day, they prayed and offered to Gugurang, asking for rain.

rin: Alagad, uno man raw adto ta lalo man na inninit sa biyo su panawon!
eng: But, why is that the weather only grew hotter and drier!

rin: Diri na mig-uban mga ngod, migtios saka mig-alop kita sadi.
eng: Don't delay any longer my siblings, we'll suffer and hunger here.

rin: Kaipwanan ta nang makiusip ki Gugurang.
eng: We must seek Gugurang’s help.

rin: Kaipwanan na nirang mag-ayat sa tabang.
eng: They needed to call for aid.

rin: Alagad, makakausip sana si Gugurang kin iya tuyuwon sadto pinakataas na parte ka bukid.
eng: But Gugurang could only be spoken to at the highest peak of the mountain.

rin: Usad na aldow, isinubol ni Apo Iraya su ngamin na lalaking Cimarron na tumukad sadto pinakaitaas ka Bukid Asog.
eng: One day, Apo Iraya gathered all the Cimarron men to climb the very top of Mount Asog.

rin: Buot ko pong makatabang.
eng: I truly wish to help.

rin: Abo kintanang tugutan ni Apo Iraya na paibanon a kauusad niyang igin.
eng: But Apo Iraya did not allow his only child to go down.

rin: Alagad, para sa ikararay ka ngamin niyang ka-tribo, pinaiba niya si Iraga.
eng: Yet, for the sake of his whole tribe, he sent Iraga instead.

rin: Ku aldow man sanang adto tinnukad sira sadto Iraga.
eng: On that very day, they climbed with Iraga.

rin: Suway-suway nirang sinusog su mga raran pabukid.
eng: They carefully followed the trails up the mountain.

rin: Nag-alnas na su agiyan saka kadakol nirang ampas na linabusan.
eng: The path was steep, and they crossed many ravines.

rin: Sa grabeng pagkapaha, diri na kinayang makatukad ku ibang Cimarron.
eng: Because of the exhausting journey, some Cimarrons could no longer continue the climb.

rin: Su iba man, nalagalag sadto kadlagan.
eng: Others wandered off into the forest.

rin: Si Iraga sana a nakaantos sadto pinakataas ka Asog.
eng: Only Iraga endured until he reached the very top of Asog.

rin: Tinnangad tulos iya sadto langit.
eng: He immediately lifted his gaze to the sky.

rin: Tabangan mo tabi kami, Gugurang.
eng: Help us, Gugurang.

rin: Tawan mo tabi kami sa pigkuan sa tubig.
eng: Grant us water.

rin: Buot tabi namong mabuway.
eng: We wish to live.

rin: Linniwanag su langit saka nagdaguldol.
eng: The sky brightened and thunder roared.

rin: Itatao ko a kamawotan ninyo alagad, dapat makapagtanom kamo sa palibot ka bukid saka makapabuway kamo sa tanom.
eng: I will give you what you desire, but you must plant around the mountain and grow crops.

rin: Kaya, kaipwanan ninyo tulos gumalin sa Sumagang.
eng: Therefore, you must leave Sumagang at once.

rin: Sibot na binnaba si Iraga pauli sadto kandang tribo.
eng: Iraga quickly went down and returned to their tribe.

rin: Kinnuko sira sa mga pantanom galin sadto pag-abayan na lugar ka Sumagang.
eng: They took planting seeds from the neighboring lands of Sumagang.

rin: Tinamnan nira su palibot ku bukid alagad, nagkaluluyos man sa sobrang init.
eng: They planted around the mountain, but the crops withered because of the extreme heat.

rin: Nauudaan na sa paglaom su mga Cimarron.
eng: The Cimarrons began to lose hope.

rin: Kaya, naisipan na ni Apo Iraya na bayaan a Sumagang bago pa sira abutan sa pagtuga.
eng: So, Apo Iraya thought of leaving Sumagang before they would be caught by the eruption.

rin: Abong bayaan ni Iraga su Sumagang.
eng: Iraga refused to leave Sumagang.

rin: Makusog a buot niya na makabubuway iya sa tanom.
eng: His will was strong that he could live by his crops.

rin: Kin amo yan isi mong ikararay ka ngamin.
eng: If that's what you think that is best for us.

rin: Iparayo man lugod ika ni Gugurang sa katibaadan.
eng: May Gugurang keep you away from danger.

rin: Isi mo man kin sari kami aanapon.
eng: You know where to find us.

rin: Padagos na nagparatanom si Iraga.
eng: Iraga continued planting.

rin: Ku pinnupuon naman na maluyos, ginamit na niyang pambubo su natutuda niyang inumon na tubig.
eng: When the seedlings began to wither, he used his stored drinking water for watering.

rin: Anggan sa biglang nagdaguldol saka nagkitkilat.
eng: Until suddenly, thunder roared and lightning flashed.

rin: Natawban sa maitom na panganuron su Asog.
eng: Asog was covered by dark clouds.

rin: Nagpuon naman magbulos su tubig galin sa itaas ku bukid.
eng: The water began to flow down from the mountain.

rin: Sinabayan pa sa makusog na pag-uran.
eng: It was accompanied by heavy rain.

rin: Natubigan na intero su Sumagang.
eng: The whole of Sumagang was watered.

rin: Nakadulag man tulos si Iraga bago pa iya abutan ku baha.
eng: Iraga quickly escaped before the flood could reach him.

rin: Mamuya man iyang sinabat ni Apo Iraya saka iba niyang ka-tribo.
eng: On his way, he met Apo Iraya and the other members of his tribe.

rin: Pakaagi ku baha, nagburutwaan su mga bukal, busay, saka burabod sa manlainlain na lugar ka Sumagang.
eng: After the flood, springs, waterfalls, and fountains appeared in different parts of Sumagang.

rin: Matatan-aw man sa taas ka Asog su darwang maiiwas na ranow.
eng: From the top of Asog, the two wide lakes could also be seen.

rin: Nariparo nira na nagkabubuway su mga itinanom ni Iraga.
eng: They noticed that Iraga’s crops had grown well.

rin: Kaya, nag-atang sira sa pasasalamat ki Gugurang.
eng: So they offered their thanks to Gugurang.

rin: Puon kadto, nagin sagana sa tubig a Sumagang saka dakol na tawong buot sadtong mag-istar.
eng: From then on, Sumagang became abundant in water, and many people wished to live there.

rin: Madunong, maurot saka maaasahan.
eng: Wise, diligent, and dependable.

rin: Nagdakulo iya sa simpleng pamumuhay kaiba si Mama, Papa saka angod niya.
eng: He grew up in a simple life together with his Mama, Papa, and siblings.

rin: Nakaistar sira sa simpleng baloy sa gilid ka uma.
eng: They lived in a simple house at the edge of the rice field.

rin: Migpoon pa sanang mag-baoy si Mama niya taiton na tulos si Nanoy.
eng: Just as his Mama was about to call them, Nanoy immediately responded.

rin: Mag-iros na ika sa kanon ta magkaon na kita.
eng: Get the rice now so we can eat.

rin: Babauyon ko na man po si Lina.
eng: I'll call Lina too.

rin: Simbag ni Nanoy na dali-daling binaoy si Lina ta migkaon na.
eng: Nanoy replied, then quickly called Lina so they could eat.

rin: Pagkakaon ako na po minugas.
eng: After eating, I'll wash the dishes.

rin: Makingayamon na ika ku mga pinsan mo sadto luyo ta pig-uulat na ika.
eng: Go and play with your cousins over there because they're waiting for you.

rin: Saka luway-luway na nagdalagan paiyan sadto luyong baloy si Nanoy para mangayamon.
eng: Then Nanoy slowly ran towards the other house to play.

rin: Usad na aldow, nagisong si Nanoy na inaanap si Papa niya.
eng: One day, Nanoy woke up looking for his Papa.

rin: unga ni Nanoy ta di niya nababayad si Papa niya sa kwarto saka sala.
eng: Asked by Nanoy because his Papa was not around in the bedroom and the living room.

rin: Ka amay man ni Papa na naggalin, ay!
eng: Papa left early in the morning!

rin: Nanoy, igin, amay na naggalin si Papa mo ta kinuko iya ni Ankol mo na mig trabawo sa arayo.
eng: Nanoy, my child, your Papa left early because your Uncle took him to work far away.

rin: Mga usad na bulan man sana o diri ngani.
eng: It will only be for one month, maybe not even that long.

rin: Di man basang ako ginisong ni Papa ay!
eng: Papa didn't even wake me up!

rin: Nagsabi adto na migtawag na sana kuno iya pag nakaabot na iya sadto pigtrabawuwan niya.
eng: He said he would just call once he arrived at his workplace.

rin: Paliwanag ni Mama niya na namumundo man.
eng: His Mama explained, though she was also sad.

rin: Kadakol ta kayang gastusan nguwan, igin.
eng: We have many expenses now, my child.

rin: Saka para man an kaninyo a pagtrabawo ni Papa mo sa arayo.
eng: And that's why your Papa is working far away for your own good.

rin: Gusto mo bagang mag-high school sadto syudad saka tanganing mabakal ninyo a mga gamit sa eskwelan na kaipwanan ninyo?
eng: Don't you want to go to high school in the city and for you to buy the school supplies you need?

rin: Paliwanag ku mama ni Nanoy.
eng: Nanoy's mother explained.

rin: Di na nagpulaw si Nanoy.
eng: Nanoy could no longer sleep.

rin: Bagana namungnan iya na nag-iisip.
eng: He just lay still, thinking.

rin: Ulaton ta na sana su tawag niya.
eng: We'll just wait for his call.

rin: Saka pa sana nag-aliwalas su lalawgon saka napangisi na si Nanoy.
eng: Then his face seemed to brighten, and Nanoy smiled.

rin: Sabi ni Nanoy na naintindiyan su paliwanag ku Mama.
eng: He said that he understood his Mama's explanation.

rin: Tatabangan ko ika Ma, sa mga gibo sadi baloy.
eng: I'll help you, Ma, with the chores here at home.

rin: Ako na po a mig-imo ku mga paninda mong merindalan.
eng: I’ll be the one to prepare the snacks you sell.

rin: Pakasabi kadto ni Nanoy, nagtalikod na iya.
eng: After saying that, Nanoy turned around.

rin: Kinuko su nigo na nakakawit sadto ringring.
eng: He took the winnowing basket hanging by the window.

rin: Mag-adal na ika saka gibuwon mo na su assignment mo saka tutturuan mo si Lina ku assignment man niya.
eng: Go study now, finish your assignment, and help Lina with her assignment too.

rin: Sabi ku Mama na nagpuon nang mag-tawop ku mapulot na bugas sadto nigo.
eng: Said Mama, as she started to clean rice grains in the winnowing basket.

rin: Ma, tapos ko na po su assignment ko.
eng: Ma, I already finished my assignment.

rin: Saka tapos ko naman pong tabangan si Lina ku assignment niya.
eng: And I've also helped Lina with her assignment.

rin: Nagkakagow sa payo na sabi ni Nanoy.
eng: Nanoy answered while scratching his head.

rin: Makingayamon na po ako Ma.
eng: I'll go out and play now, Ma.

rin: Sabi ni Nanoy na nagdalagan paluwas sadto baloy nira.
eng: said Nanoy as he ran outside their house.

rin: Di pa tapos si Mama niya sa pagbaoy, taiton na naman tulos si Nanoy.
eng: His Mama wasn't even done calling him back, Nanoy was already gone.

rin: O, taiton na tulos ika?
eng: Oh, you left so quickly?

rin: La mo man na liksi, ay!
eng: You're really fast, huh!

rin: Sabi ku Mama na nagngangalas.
eng: Mama asked in surprise.

rin: Tapos na kamo ku ginigibo ninyo ni Lina?
eng: Are you and Lina done with what you were doing?

rin: Uro-aldow arog na kadto su naging ugali ni Nanoy.
eng: Every day, that was Nanoy's habit.

rin: Pirmi iyang alerto sa pagtabang ki Mama niya.
eng: He was always alert in helping his Mama.

rin: Maasikaso pati sa ngod niya.
eng: He also took care of his younger sibling.

rin: Maurot mag-eskwela.
eng: He studied diligently.

rin: Dawa nakikingayamon sa mga ibang igin, pirmi iyang listo.
eng: Even when he played with the other kids, he always stayed sharp.

rin: Amo yan si Nanoy a igin na di nagpapabaoy.
eng: That was Nanoy—a child who never disobeyed.

rin: Kinaudmaan nagdaddara su mga barkada ni Nanoy na maminwit sa isura sadto ranow.
eng: The next day, Nanoy's friends invited him to go fishing at the lake.

rin: Nanoy bukong uban mo nang gusto na mag-iyan sadto ranow ka Bato tanganing magbangka saka maminwit sa isura?
eng: Nanoy, don't you want to come with us to Bato Lake so we can ride a boat and fish there?

rin: Kaiba ko si Papa mimasyar kami sadto.
eng: My Papa and I will go there together.

rin: Alok ku mga barkada ni Nanoy.
eng: Nanoy's friends offered.

rin: Gusto ko kintanang umiba kaso nangako ako ki Mama na tatabangan ko iya sadto baloy.
eng: I really want to join, but I promised Mama that I'd help her at home.

rin: Mamundong simbag ni Nanoy.
eng: Nanoy answered sadly.

rin: Dipa tapos baoyon maliksing nagrapo si Nanoy ki Mama niya.
eng: Before his Mama could even call him, Nanoy quickly ran to her.

rin: Igin nagtawag si Papa mo, tapos na kuno su trabawo niya kaya mig-uli na kuno iya udma.
eng: Child, your Papa called. He said his work is done so he will come home tomorrow.

rin: Pag-uli kuno niya sabay sabay kitang migpasyar sadto ranow ka Bato para maminwit saka magbangka.
eng: When he returns, we'll all go together to Bato Lake to fish and ride a boat.

rin: Isi ko uban mo na yan na gustong iyanan.
eng: I know you've been wanting to go there.

rin: Mamuyang binarita ni Mama ni Nanoy kanya.
eng: Mama happily shared the news with Nanoy.

rin: Biyong naglulukso si Nanoy sa kamuy-an.
eng: Nanoy jumped for joy with excitement.

rin: Alas singko sa mararamrag nagisong na si Nanoy.
eng: At five in the morning, Nanoy woke up.

rin: Pagkabayad niya ki Papa niya ginakos niya sa malakaugot.
eng: When he saw his Papa, he hugged him tightly.

rin: Nabaritaan ko igin na tinatabangan mo si Mama mo sadi baloy abang uda ako saka di kuno ika nagpapatugal.
eng: I heard, child, that you've been helping your Mama at home while I was away, and that you never lazed around.

rin: Kaya nguwan iiyanan ta sa uban mo nang gustong iyanan.
eng: So now, we will go where you've always wanted.

rin: Migbangka kita saka miminwit sa isura kaiba si Mama mo saka si Lina sadto ranow ka Bato.
eng: We'll ride a boat and fish together with your Mama and Lina at Bato Lake.

rin: Mig piknik na kita dagos ta pinapaluto ko si Mama mo ku paborito ninyo ni Lina na isusura na pikadilyong tilapia saka gulay na katnga.
eng: Let's have a picnic right away, because I already asked your Mama to cook your and Lina's favorite dish—grilled tilapia with vegetables.

rin: Nagrurulukso si Nanoy sa sobrang kamuy-an.
eng: Nanoy jumped with so much joy and excitement.

rin: Namasyar na sira sadto Ranow ku Bato.
eng: They went on an outing to Bato Lake.

rin: Nagsasagwan si Papa niya.
eng: His Papa was rowing,

rin: Namiminwit man si Nanoy sa isura kaabay si Mama saka Lina.
eng: Nanoy was fishing on the side together with Mama and Lina.

rin: Abang nag-uuro istorya sira sadto bangka naparait sa lang kusog si Nanoy.
eng: As they chatted in the boat, Nanoy suddenly shouted loudly.

rin: Rait ni Nanoy na pinagtataw-an ni Papa saka Mama niya.
eng: His Papa and Mama laughed at Nanoy's loud voice.

rin: Nakarakop ako Pa sa isura.
eng: I caught a fish, Pa.

rin: Mas lalong narugangan su kamuy-an ni Nanoy.
eng: Nanoy's joy grew even more.

rin: Mamuya si Nanoy ta nakumpleto sirang magpamilya saka naabot su uban na niyang gusto na makaiba sirang sa mamasyar sadto ranow ka Bato.
eng: He was happy because their family was complete, and he finally achieved his wish to go on an outing together at Bato Lake.

rin: Nagpadagos si Papa ni Nanoy sa pagtrabawo bilang karpintero kin sari-saring lugar.
eng: Nanoy's father continued working as a carpenter in different places.

rin: Kaya si Nanoy, nakapag-eskwela sa syudad saka lalo pang nagmaurot, anggan sa nagdakulo iya na di nagpapabaoy.
eng: So Nanoy was able to study in the city and became even more diligent, until he grew up without disobedience.

rin: Unga ni Anopol abang nakatangad ki Tang-id.
eng: Asked by Anopol while looking up at Tang-id.

rin: Simbag ni Tang-id na nakarurungow ki Anopol.
eng: Tang-id replied, overhearing Anopol

rin: Agko na naman nanunubsob.
eng: Someone is lighting a fire again.

rin: Nagpara-arani saka nagpara-iwas sana a nagparasubsob sadi kadlagan uro-aldow.
eng: The one who burns this forest comes and goes and suddenly disappears every day.

rin: Nakakatakot na sabi ni Anopol.
eng: Anopol said fearfully.

rin: Pauno na kin sadi na yan kanato udma?
eng: What if that happens to us tomorrow?

rin: Nagtutupas na a mga angpas.
eng: The ravines are collapsing.

rin: Nagpararusros na su mga raga sadto tukad.
eng: The rocks are rolling down from the mountain peak.

rin: Uro-aldow na sanang agko nagraragatob na kawoy.
eng: Every day, there are no longer trees standing.

rin: Ribaraw na sabi ni Anopol.
eng: Anopol said with worry.

rin: Diri natuninong su darwa dawa la ka bulanon.
eng: The two could not find peace, even for just one night.

rin: Ay bayda, agko sadit na Rafflesia.
eng: Oh look, there's a small Rafflesia.

rin: Galagang sabi ku usad na burubata na kaiba ku grupong Bantay Bukid na nagmamangno ka kabukidan.
eng: Exclaimed one of the young people with the Bantay Bukid group who watch over the mountain.

rin: Amo di pinakasadit ka pinakadakulong mga burak sa interong kinaban.
eng: That’s one of the largest flowers in the whole world.

rin: Sabi ku agtang kaiba nira.
eng: Said by their fellow agta.

rin: Agko palan kan sadi Mt. Iriga.
eng: So there"s one here in Mt. Iriga.

rin: Sabi ku mga gurang, nabisto a Iriga ku panawon na sadi pagkukuon a na an na gigibuwon na olor sadto Manila.
eng: Elderly people say that Iriga was known in the past because it was the source of the perfume ingredients in Manila.

rin: Napaparong mo yan?
eng: Can you smell that?

rin: Unga ku burubata sadto mga kaiba niya.
eng: The young kid asked his friends.

rin: Amo, agko na naman nagsusulo.
eng: Yes, someone is burning again.

rin: Nabayad mo adto subago na naagyan tang nagtutupas su raga sadtu angpas?
eng: Did you see that landslide on the cliff we passed earlier?

rin: Pigparabuldoser kaya ta ipababakal a raga.
eng: They are using bulldozers because the land is going to be sold.

rin: Sabi man ku usad na agta.
eng: Another aeta said.

rin: A tunog ka chainsaw, arani sana yan sadi ngani?
eng: The sound of the chainsaw is just around the corner, isn't it?

rin: Sabi nanggad ku burubata.
eng: The child said it again.

rin: Kin magparapadagos ading mga parasubsob, paradugkal sa raga, saka paraputol sa kawoy, irak man kading Anopol saka Tang-id pati iba pang mga nabubuway sadi bukid.
eng: If these people continue to burn, dig up the land, and cut down trees, woe to Anopol and Tang-id and others who live here in the fields.

rin: Mauubos sira ngamin .
eng: They will all be gone.

rin: Udma magbalik kita nganing panrakpon ading mga nagraraot kading kabukidan.
eng: Tomorrow, we will return to catch those who are causing trouble in the mountains.

rin: Paggalin ku mga Bantay Bukid, nakainga-inga sa ararom si Anopol saka si Tang-id.
eng: When the Bantay Bukid left, Anopol and Tang-id were finally able to breathe deeply.

rin: Isi na nira a kasimbagan ku kinatatakutan nira, kaya ku gab-i, katuninong nirang pignagsilngan su bulan saka su mga bituon.
eng: They know the answer to what they fear, so at night, they quietly gazed at the moon and the stars.

rin: Agko mga narurungog sira Anopol saka Tang-id sa kabitngaan ka gab-i.
eng: Anopol and Tang-id heard something in the middle of the night.

rin: Agko sira napaparong na aso sa di-karayuan, agko nababayad na nagrurusros na raga galin sa itaas ku bukid.
eng: They smell smoke nearby, and they also see the rushing water coming from the top of the mountain.

rin: Sari raw adto galin?
eng: Where did that come from?

rin: Sa usad na arayong baryo sa Iriga, inaataman si Tikay ni Lolo saka Lola niya.
eng: In a remote village in Iriga, Tikay is being taken care of by her Lolo and Lola.

rin: Uda kaya kaiba sa baloy nira, ta sibot a mga kag-igin niya.
eng: There's no one at home, their parents are busy.

rin: Magayon a lugar nira.
eng: Their place is beautiful.

rin: Ngamin na bagay natural ta sadto kaya sira kanubnuban.
eng: All things are natural because they were in the countryside.

rin: Agko mga kawoy, sapa, isura, maiwas na mayisan, prutas saka gulay na ginugutos sana sa barisbisan.
eng: There are trees, stream, fish, wide cornfield, fruits, and vegetables that are freshly picked in the field.

rin: Diri adi maaabot, kin diri ika magbaklay, sa usad ikabangang kilometrong abilay.
eng: It's out of reach, unless you walk a kilometer and a half away.

rin: Maalnas, patukad-pababa, mapagal magtuytoy lalo kin baha sa spillway, dakol nang diri nakakabatloy.
eng: Slippery, uphill and downhill, difficult to walk on, especially when the spillway is flooded, many cannot cross.

rin: Kin minsan si Tikay, sinuswerte pa man, agko maiirak na magpalunad, anggan sa kasentrowan.
eng: At times, Tikay is fortunate to catch a ride that takes her all the way to the town.

rin: Dawa pa maluway, ta pababa sana man, pero uno raw si Tikay, ta namumuya man.
eng: Even though it's slow, it's only downhill, but why is Tikay so interested?

rin: Adtong arayong lugar, binaoy nirang "luyo,” ta migluyo sa sapa, bago umabot ki lolo.
eng: That faraway place they call luyo, because you have to cross the stream before reaching to Grandpa.

rin: Agko pirming nakatagama kanya, na tilapyang prito, nakabutang sa basket, nakabitin sadto atop na agko yero.
eng: He always has food hidden away, fried tilapia in a basket hanging from the tin roof.

rin: Alas kuwatro sa apon, si Tatay nagbibisita sa fish pond, umiiba si Tikay, magbawog sa bidaw.
eng: At four in the afternoon, Tatay visits the fishpond, Tikay would join, feeds cereal grain.

rin: Mga isura, biglang mig-aragawan, kanya-kanyang likwad, mamuyang pagsilngan, makaudang problema nanggad.
eng: Fish, suddenly fighting, each one escaping, so beautiful to watch, really helps get rid of problems.

rin: Kin oras na sa pagtanom sadto kaum-man, umiiba si Tikay ki Nanay sadto tanuman.
eng: When it is time for planting in the field, Tikay goes with Nanay to the field.

rin: Dara-dara a balde, saka mga kaipwanan inaatdan mga nagtatarok, sa tilapyang sinarukan.
eng: Carrying a bucket and the necessary supplies, he delivers cooked tilapia to the farmers.

rin: Si Laki na damulag, ataman ni Tata Papo, kuro-kaiba niya sa pag-aarado.
eng: Laki the carabao, Tata Papo's pet, accompanied him in plowing.

rin: Linulunadan man paiyan sa Antipolo, para manggusi ku kanyang mga produkto.
eng: He also rides it to Antipolo to harvest his products.

rin: Alas sais impunto, nakapanggab-i na.
eng: At exactly six o’clock, they already had dinner.

rin: Uda ibang marurungog, riwit sadto uma, ultimong libangan, su radyong de pila, Gabi ng Lagim, Simatar, saka su Matud Nila.
eng: Nothing else can be heard, singing in the rice fields, their only entertainment is battery-powered radio, Gabi ng Lagim, Simatar, and their Matud.

rin: Alawig a gab-i, usad sana kangitngit, kimat-kimat sana alinuwnow.
eng: The night is long, it's very dark, with only blinking of eyes.

rin: Takot si Tikay, na magpara baraybasay, ta kin masumpungan. mga aswang na nagbabantay.
eng: Tikay is afraid to walk around and might encounter the guarding aswang.

rin: Usad na aldow, si Tikay nakalintura, uda araning ospital, nars, o kaya doktora.
eng: One day, Tikay came down with a fever, but there was no nearby hospital, nor a nurse or doctor.

rin: Nagpakalakaga si Nanay sa bayabas saka artamisa, tinakpulan su buros sa buyo, pinayran sa menthol ointment, maray na.
eng: Mother boiled guava and artemisia, covered the stomach with betel leaves, rubbed it with menthol ointment, and she was fine.

rin: Sa oras na inaabtan si Tikay sa kalipungawan, kin unong mga bagay kanyang naiisipan.
eng: When Tikay is feeling lonely, she thinks of everything.

rin: Sadto bintana um-ula, saka minan-awan, sumisilong sa arayo, migbura sa kamunduan.
eng: Sitting there at the window, watching, looking into the distance, very sad.

rin: Abo sana ni Tikay, pag oras nagbibisita, kanyang Mama saka Papa, na agko sira dara-dara.
eng: Tikay doesn’t like it when her Mama and Papa visits, and they bring something.

rin: Mamuya si Tikay na lumulunad sadto pababa, paluwas sadto crossing, pauli sadto kanda.
eng: Tikay is happy take a ride downhill, going out to the crossing, going home to them.

rin: Abang nasa kasentrowan diri niya maintindiyan, tauno mas gusto niyang bumalik sadto kanubnuban?
eng: While in the town center, she cannot understand why she would rather return to the countryside?

rin: Apisar mamundo, sagkod nasa kabukiran.
eng: Although it’s up in the mountains, deep in the highlands.

rin: Mas gusto pa niya sadto, ta agko katrangkiluwan.
eng: She prefers it there, because there is peace.

rin: Sadto kasentrowan, dakol a kanyang libangan, na diri niya maanapan, sadto kanubnuban.
eng: In the town center, there are many things she enjoys, things she can’t find back in the countryside.

rin: Kompyuter, internet, telebisyon, anggan iba pang kasangkapan, baloy, awto, kwarta - senyales sa kauswagan.
eng: Computer, internet, television, and other equipment, house, car, money—signs of progress.

rin: Para kaya ki Tikay, agko pa mas importante, oras sa pamilya, paggiya, pagpayaba sa pwerte.
eng: Because for Tikay, there is something more important, time for the family, guidance, and being well taken care of.

rin: Di maitao sa igin kin pareyo na bukong presente, mga kag-igin na abala sa trabawo pirmi.
eng: A child cannot receive these if both parents are no longer around, always occupied with their work.

rin: Alagad sa hoben na edad, si Tikay napaisip, kin diri man mag ingua, unong klase raw a pagsakit.
eng: But at a young age, Tikay wondered, if she would not strive, what kind of suffering would it be.

rin: Pirang aldow nang sige uran, pero amo adto a unang beses na nagdagulgol sa malang kusog.
eng: It had been raining for several days, but that was the first time it thundered loudly.

rin: Nasindakan si Lilly na nakaturog sa pagpara-drowing ku isiw ku pato nira.
eng: Lilly was startled, having fallen asleep while drawing their duckling.

rin: Agko sira usad na gurangan na pato na nag-itlog sa lima.
eng: They had one old duck that laid five eggs.

rin: Kamuya ni Lilly ta primero niyang magkaagko ataman.
eng: Lilly was happy because it was the first time she had something to take care of.

rin: Kinding nagpaparauran na.
eng: But it already keeps raining.

rin: Diri nira narisa su paglangkaw ku tubig.
eng: They did not notice the water rising.

rin: Naabot su istaran ku mag-inang pato.
eng: It reached the home of the mother duck and her duckling.

rin: Napangrod su kauusad-usad na isiw anggan sa naalinan sa buway.
eng: The only duckling was swept away until it lost its life.

rin: Solo sanang igin si Lilly.
eng: Lilly is an only child.

rin: Dati gusto niya na magbaba su mga higante sa langit tanganing makingayamon kanya sadto uma na arani sa salog.
eng: Before, she wanted giants to come down from the sky so they could play with her in the field near the river.

rin: Kada mag-uran, nag-uulat iya na marungog a langit ta amo yan senyales na isan na su higante na nagsisinuludan sa taas.
eng: Every time it rains, she waits to hear the sky because that is the sign that the giants are running above.

rin: Pinagpaparaulat ni Lilly na agko magbaba sa langit.
eng: Lilly waits for something to come down from the sky.

rin: Mas lalo pa iyang namuya ku nangingitlog na su pato.
eng: She became even happier when the duck laid eggs.

rin: Katama na sige uran, gusto ka mga pato a lalanguyan.
eng: Just right that it was already raining, the ducks wanted a place to swim.

rin: Pero ku natigbak su kausad-usad na isiw nabuway nag-uno-uno iya ki Langit, inabuan naman niya su mga higante.
eng: But when the only duckling died, she complained to Langit, and she turned away from the giants.

rin: Kinirikisi nguna ni Lilly su mga mata niya saka sinilngan nanggad su pinagdrowing niyang pato na nginaranan niya sa "Maggy".
eng: Lilly first rubbed her eyes and then looked at the duck she had drawn, which she had named "Maggy".

rin: Binayaan nguna niya su drowing sadto katre tapos nagdiretso sa kusina.
eng: She left the drawing on the bed and went straight to the kitchen.

rin: Mama, natigbak lugod si Maggy kading di nagpupundong uran.
eng: Mama, Maggy died because the rain just wouldn’t stop.

rin: Bai sana Lilly, mingitlog man nanggad su pato ta.
eng: Don't worry, Lilly, our duck will lay eggs again soon.

rin: Sabi ni Mama na naggigiris ku sibulyas.
eng: Mama said while slicing onions.

rin: Tauno ta diri napupundo si Langit na magtangis?
eng: Why does Langit never stop crying?

rin: Nalilipungow pa si Langit, Lilly.
eng: Langit is still feeling lonely, Lilly.

rin: Isi ni Mama na namumundo si Lilly ku natigbak nirang isiw na pato.
eng: Mama knew that Lilly was grieving because their duckling had died.

rin: ing-ing ni Lilly sa sadiri niya abang nakasilong iya sadto luwas ku purtan sa kusina.
eng: Lilly whispered to herself while looking outside the kitchen.

rin: Pinupugol niya a luwa niya na magbulos dawa nalilipungow na iya ki Maggy.
eng: She held back her tears because she was missing Maggy.

rin: Bagana agko mga insekto na gusto nang lumuwas sa ruruggan niya tanganing mag-iba sa uran pero abo niyang biliwan ta abo niyang arugon a gibo ni Langit.
eng: It seemed like insects were coming out of her chest to join the rain, but she refused to let them go, not wanting to copy what Langit was doing.

rin: Nagsirang iya sadto luwas ku bintana kin agko natamaan na kawoy su kitkilat.
eng: She peeked outside the window to see if any tree had been struck by the lightning.

rin: Binnurikat su mga mata ni Lilly ku nabayad niya.
eng: Lilly’s eyes widened because of what she saw.

rin: Biglang nabiliwan niya su papel na kapot-kapot.
eng: She suddenly dropped the paper she was holding.

rin: Diri makaiwag si Lilly.
eng: Lilly can't move.

rin: Sabi ku nakangirit na higante na agko tikmong ngipon.
eng: Said the laughing giant with bared teeth.

rin: Uy, baka makatakot kanimo a igin.
eng: Hey, the child might be scared of you.

rin: Sabi man ku usad abang binabaton su alwag na sarwal.
eng: The other said while adjusting its loose pants.

rin: Nakaamba sana iya sadto bintana na salak-salak su namamatian.
eng: She was just leaning on the window with mixed emotions.

rin: Uban na namo ikang pinag-oobserbaran, Lilly.
eng: We've been observing you for a long time, Lilly.

rin: Sabi ku matabang higante na agko mabuot na mga mata.
eng: The fat giant with kind eyes said.

rin: Gusto man namo kintanang makingayamon, pero diri kami makababa.
eng: We also want to play, but we can't come down.

rin: Migsimbag na kintana si Lilly pero agko sinabi su pinaka alangkaw na higante.
eng: Lilly was about to answer, but the tallest giant spoke.

rin: Naunaan iya, tapos nag-ula arani sadto bintana kin isari si Lilly.
eng: He went first, then sat near the window where Lilly was.

rin: Nasimbag ku pinakaalangkaw na higante su unga ni Lilly sa isip.
eng: The tallest giant answered Lilly's question in her mind.

rin: Pinugulan ni Lilly a sadiri dawa nagkakatangis na iya.
eng: Lilly held back herself even though she wanted to cry.

rin: Sisirran na kintana niya su bintana ku binutbot ku matabang higante su isiw na pato sadto bulsa ku bado kadi.
eng: Lilly was about to close the window when the fat giant took the duckling from its pocket.

rin: Diri niya isi kin kaya pa niyang pugulon a itatangis niya.
eng: She did not know if she can still held back her cries.

rin: Luway-luway na isinuksok ku higante su kamot niya sadto bintana saka ibinutang su isiw na pato sadto katre.
eng: Slowly, the giant tucked his hand through the window and placed the duckling on the bed.

rin: Diri kami nagbubutig.
eng: We are not joking.

rin: Uno problema ta abo mo iyang mabayad utro?
eng: What's the problem, why don't you want to see him again?

rin: Simbag ni Lilly, sabay kirikisi ku mata.
eng: Lilly answered while rubbing her eyes.

rin: Isi mo kin tauno nagparatangis si Langit?
eng: You know why Langit keeps crying?

rin: Uda man problema kun arugon mo si Langit, Lilly.
eng: There is no problem if you want to copy Langit, Lilly.

rin: Sabi ku higante na agko pinakamabuot na mata.
eng: The giant with the most kind eyes said.

rin: Arog ni Langit, pigbubo niya a mga naluluyos nang mga tanom sa kinaban.
eng: Like Langit, it waters the withered plants on earth.

rin: Kaya, itangis mo na a namamati mo.
eng: So, cry what you are feeling.

rin: Namumuya sirang naglayog paiyan ki Langit na nagpupuon naman na magliwanag.
eng: They flew happily towards the sky which was also beginning to shine.

rin: Papayabaon kuno ko niya sa maray.
eng: He will love her so much.

rin: Masupog man ika.
eng: Have some shame.

rin: Irak man ika.
eng: Pity you.

rin: Agko na baga kita kadi.
eng: We already have this.

rin: Kamo naman raw.
eng: Your turn.

rin: Sari na su dating pinabisto mo?
eng: Where is the one you introduced before?

rin: mag bangon naka ta buko man ikang igen sa contractor.
eng: Get up now because you are not a child of a contractor.

rin: Nagparaluya na sana baga.
eng: It's getting weaker.

rin: Alas siyete pa sana uda na lunadan.
eng: It's only seven o'clock but there's no vehicles anymore.

rin: Abot palan nguwan?
eng: Up until now?

rin: Uno masasabi mo kadi?
eng: What can you say about this?

rin: Sari adi?
eng: Where is this?

rin: Diri adi ninyo isi.
eng: You don't know this.

rin: Adtu palan mas payaba niya so alak.
eng: That's why he loves liquor more.

rin: Payaba ko ika sa maray.
eng: I love you so much.

rin: Nag-linog namatian po ninyo?
eng: Did you feel the earthquake?

rin: Mauran na ramrag.
eng: Rainy morning.

rin: Pagal baga.
eng: So tiring.

rin: Di na gayud nakaantos.
eng: Maybe it didn't arrived yet.

rin: Ka mga patal talaga dawa kin kuno.
eng: Really stupid at all times.

rin: Inanod sadto baha.
eng: Washed away by the flood.

rin: Uno na di?
eng: What is this?

rin: Mangnuwa ta di lugod nakapasar.
eng: Look it didn't passed.

rin: Barag-barag pa.
eng: It's everywhere.

rin: Paturugi man ako.
eng: Let me sleep.

rin: Amu di kinaon ko subago.
eng: This is what I ate earlier.

rin: Abo ko na daw.
eng: I don't want anymore.

rin: Usad pa.
eng: Another one.

rin: Diri basang muna kaya pinag tais.
eng: It wasn't even polished first.

rin: panganta na muna.
eng: Sing first.

rin: Pirmi man akong late.
eng: I'm always late.

rin: Bana si rence.
eng: Like Rence.

rin: Kaya man sana ko nag quit.
eng: That's why I quit.

rin: Iiba ko tita ko.
eng: I'll take aunt with me.

rin: Ako na ka samod.
eng: I'll take care of the broom.

rin: Si Jerome pirmi biktima.
eng: Jerome is always the victim.

rin: Uda na.
eng: No more.

rin: Kami na sana ni Christine.
eng: Just Christine and I.

rin: So barkada ta.
eng: Our friend.

rin: Di kaya ika magsisilong.
eng: Because you don't watch.

rin: Agko palan pataas.
eng: There is an uphill.

rin: Lubot su tinampo.
eng: The road has a hole.

rin: Ata kumapot.
eng: Hold on.

rin: Katagam kanimo.
eng: Just like you.

rin: Maray ngani da nagsulod kanato.
eng: Good thing it did not chase us

rin: Mag luway kamo.
eng: Go slow.

rin: Mig bakal na sana ko.
eng: I'll just buy.

rin: Alnas mana.
eng: So slippery.

rin: Amu dapat adi service.
eng: This should be the service.

rin: Arog na di kan nguwan.
eng: It's like this now.

rin: Mus na tulos.
eng: Let's go already.

rin: Nag iinagawan pa kita dati.
eng: We still fight before.

rin: Bakal na kamo.
eng: Buy now, please.

rin: Bae raw.
eng: Let it be.

rin: Binayaan nako ku mga kaiba ko.
eng: My companion left me.

rin: Mayna kamo!
eng: Let's go!

rin: Basawon ta, alcalde ka Baao, nagtao nguwan kin pahayag dapit ku nagluwas na bareta sa tv ku usad na gab-i.
eng: Let's read, the mayor of Baao gave a statement regarding the news that came out on tv last night.

rin: Sa paagi ka kanyang facebook account, nagtao ngowan kin paglilinaw si Alcalde Jeffrey Besinio ka banwaan na Baao Camarines Sur manungod ka sinasabing abandonado kunong flood control project sa Barangay San Francisco.
eng: Through his Facebook account, Mayor Jeffrey Besinio of Baao, Camarines Sur gave a clarification regarding the allegedly abandoned flood control project in Barangay San Francisco.

rin: Agco problema a internet ka PLDT ngowan sa nagca-pirang lugar sa Rinconada.
eng: There is a problem with PLDT internet right now in several areas of Rinconada.

rin: Naoda su internet mga 3:57 ngowan na mararamrag.
eng: The internet went out at about 3:57 in the morning today.

rin: Nag-oolat kita kin update kun ono nangyari.
eng: We are waiting for an update to see what happened.

rin: Standby lang po kita.
eng: Please stay on standby.

rin: Naca-balik na po a serbisyo ka PLDT bandang 9:00 ngowan na ramrag.
eng: PLDT service has returned around 9:00 in the morning today.

rin: Viaje ka train, rurugangan ngowan na Peñafrancia.
eng: Train trip, additional trips this Peñafrancia.

rin: Migka-agco rugang na viaje a PNR ngowan na umaabot na September 20 anggan 21 panahon ka Peñafrancia tanganing ma-acomodar a dagsa ka mga viajero.
eng: PNR has added extra train trips this coming September 20 and 21 for Peñafrancia to accommodate the large number of travelers.

rin: Puwedeng mag-lunad a mga pasayro ka tren na viajeng Naga paiyan Iriga sa oras na 10:00 kin ramrag.
eng: Passengers can ride the train traveling from Naga to Iriga at 10:00 in the morning.

rin: Susundan man adi kin viajeng poon Iriga paiyan Naga sa oras na 11:15 kin ramrag.
eng: There will also be a train traveling from Iriga to Naga at 11:15 in the morning.

rin: Pag apon, mig-viaje man a tren poon Naga paiyan Iriga sa oras na 2:00 dangan susundan kin viajeng poon Iriga paiyan Naga sa oras na 3:15.
eng: In the afternoon, a train will also travel from Naga to Iriga at 2:00, followed by a return trip from Iriga to Naga at 3:15.

rin: Mismong si Presidente Bongbong Marcos Jr. amo nagbo-ot ka rugang na viaje tanganing ma-acomodar a pagdagsa ka mga deboto ni Nuestra Señora de Peñafrancia.
eng: President Bongbong Marcos Jr. himself approved the additional trips in order to accommodate the influx of devotees of Nuestra Señora de Peñafrancia.

rin: Regular man a viaje ka PNR sa rutang Lucena paiyan Calamba, Naga paiyan Sipocot, ag Naga paiyan Legazpi.
eng: There are also regular PNR trips on the Lucena to Calamba route, Naga to Sipocot, and Naga to Legazpi.

rin: Ipig-luwas na ka Malacañang a mga holiday ka sunod na taon.
eng: Malacañang will release the holidays for next year.

rin: Ngata uda February 14?
eng: Why is there no February 14?

rin: Babayda ngani, bagong bacalon na segunda manong motor, nagcalayo sa Iriga.
eng: Look, newly bought second-hand motorcycle caught up in fire in Iriga.

rin: Imbes na mapakaray, enterong nagcalayo ading motorsiklong pig-iiray cadi man sanang cagsadiri sa Brgy. San Isidro Iriga City subagong apon.
eng: Instead of being repaired, this motorcycle that was being repaired by its owner in Brgy. San Isidro Iriga City this afternoon caught fire.

rin: Basado sa impormasyon na nacaabot sa Pasada Rinconada, segunda mano ading motor na bago pa sanang bacalon cading rider sa cantidad na 10 mil de pesos.
eng: Based on the information that reached Pasada Rinconada, the motorcycle was second-hand and was newly bought by the rider for the amount of 10 thousand pesos.

rin: Pinurbaran sigbuwon ku mga kagawad kading barangay su calayo gamit a fire extinguisher alagad diri ninda nagsigbo.
eng: The barangay officials tried to put out the fire using a fire extinguisher, but they were not able to extinguish it.

rin: Silngan mo adi.
eng: Look at This.

rin: Flood control project sa Baao, diri tinapos, munisipyo ag DPWH, selyado a mga ngongo.
eng: Flood control project in Baao left unfinished, municipality and DPWH remain silent.

rin: Iniyanan ku GMA News su osad na flood control project sa San Francisco Baao.
eng: GMA News visited a flood control project in San Francisco, Baao.

rin: Nabayad mismo su kalidad ku proyekto cun sari gatikat na tiktik sana ku semento, nagin polvoron na sa pagca-pino.
eng: The quality of the project was revealed when the cement was only lightly tapped, it turned into polvoron because of its fineness.

rin: Taadi a report ni Mark Salazar.
eng: Here is the report of Mark Salazar.

rin: Semento ka riverbank protection sa osad na flood control project sa San Francisco Baao, Camarines Sur, enterong nagigin pino na bagana polvoron pag pinurbaran dukdukon!
eng: The cement of the riverbank protection in a flood control project in San Francisco, Baao, Camarines Sur, is becoming so fine like polvoron when tried to be tapped!

rin: Ang importante agko concert bago magelection.
eng: What’s important is that there is a concert before the election.

rin: Bistuwon ta a tolong mga contratista na naggibo kin mga flood control projects sadi Rinconada.
eng: Let's get to know the three contractors who built the flood control projects here in Rinconada.

rin: Amo adi a ikarwang daculong contractor sa Bicol na nakatakma kin 44 na mga flood control projects na nag-cacantidad 3.45 bilyones de pesos bilang solo sanang contractor!
eng: This is the second biggest contractor in Bicol that was assigned 44 flood control projects amounting to 3.45 billion pesos as the sole contractor!

rin: Cun kaiba sa mga kukuwentawon su mga proyekto na sinda co-contractor o agco kaiba na ibang kontratista, umaabot pa adi sa 51 na proyekto na nag-cacantidad 4.15 bilyones de pesos.
eng: If we include in the count the projects where they are a co-contractor or together with other contractors, this reaches 51 projects amounting to 4.15 billion pesos.

rin: Bilang solo-solong contractor, naibulsa kadi a 17 na flood control projects na nag-cacantidad 1.45 bilyones de pesos sa Camarines Sur ag 20 pang mga proyekto na nag-cacantidad 1.41 bilyones de pesos sa Albay.
eng: As a sole contractor, they pocketed 17 flood control projects amounting to 1.45 billion pesos in Camarines Sur and 20 more projects amounting to 1.41 billion pesos in Albay.

rin: Kaiba sa mga proyekto ninda ading tolong riverbank protection/esplanade sa salog ka Barit sa mga barangay ka Sagrada Familia Section Phase 2 anggan sa Sta. Justina Section sa banwaan ka Buhi, Camarines Sur na nag-cacantidad 419.6 milyones de pesos
eng: Included in their projects are three riverbank protection/esplanade along the Barit River in the barangays of Sagrada Familia Section Phase 2 and Sta. Justina Section in the town of Buhi, Camarines Sur, amounting to 419.6 million pesos.

rin: Kaiba pa kadi ading mga sumusunod.
eng: Also included here are the following.

rin: Paggibo kin Flood Mitigation Structure sa kalabaan ka Bicol River, Barangay Palsong Section, Bula, Camarines Sur na nag-cacantidad P139,925,000.00.
eng: Construction of a Flood Mitigation Structure along Bicol River, Barangay Palsong Section, Bula, Camarines Sur amounting to P139,925,000.00.

rin: Paggibo kin Riverbank Protection/Esplanade sa kalabaan ka salog ka Barit, Brgy. Sagrada Familia Section Phase 2, Buhi, Camarines Sur.
eng: Construction of Riverbank Protection/Esplanade along Barit river, Barangay Sagrada Familia Section Phase 2, Buhi, Camarines Sur.

rin: Paggibo kin Riverbank Protection/Esplanade sa kalabaan ka salog ka Barit, Brgy. Sta. Justina Section, Buhi, Camarines Sur.
eng: Construction of Riverbank Protection/Esplanade along Barit river, Barangay Sta. Justina Section, Buhi, Camarines Sur.

rin: Bagyon Opong, nagdadarang peligro ngowan sa Camarines Sur.
eng: Typhoon Opong, Bringing danger now in Camarines Sur.

rin: Abiso sa estado ka internet sa Rinconada.
eng: Notice on the state of the internet in Rinconada.

rin: A oficina ka Hi-Tone nasa Albay na pinamamayuwan ni Edgar Acosta bilang presidente.
eng: The office of Hi-Tone is in Albay and is headed by Edgar Acosta as president.

rin: Mientras na si dating Ako Bicol Party-list representative Christopher Co, amo man a co-founder.
eng: While former Ako Bicol Party-list representative Christopher Co is the co-founder.

rin: A oficina ka GCI Construction and Dev't. Corp. nasa Pili Camarines Sur.
eng: The office of GCI Construction and Dev’t. Corp. is in Pili, Camarines Sur.

rin: Sinda a pang-opat na daculong contractor kin flood control project sa Bicol.
eng: They are the fourth biggest contractor in flood control projects in Bicol.

rin: Bilang solong contractor, agco sinda 28 na flood control projects na nag-cacantidad 2.52 bilyones de pesos sa Bicol na cun sari a 27 na proyekto nasa Camarines Sur ag osad sa Albay.
eng: As a sole contractor, they have 28 flood control projects amounting to 2.52 billion pesos in Bicol, of which 27 projects are in Camarines Sur and one in Albay.

rin: Agco man sinda osad na proyekto na nag-cacantidad 138.48 milyones de pesos bilang co-contractor sa Camarines Sur.
eng: They also have one project amounting to 138.48 million pesos as a co-contractor in Camarines Sur.

rin: Kaiba sa mga dadaculong proyekto ninda sa Camarines Sur ading Bicol River cut-off channel 3 flood mitigation structure sa Milaor ag Bicol River flood mitigation structures sa Bula ag sa Nabua.
eng: Among their biggest projects in Camarines Sur are the Bicol River cut-off channel 3 flood mitigation structure in Milaor, and the Bicol River Flood Mitigation Structures in Bula and in Nabua.

rin: Sunwest Inc., na a dating ngaran amo ding Sunwest Construction & Development Corp., amo ana ika-limang daculong contractor kin flood control project sa Bicol.
eng: Sunwest Inc., whose former name was also Sunwest Construction & Development Corp., is the fifth biggest contractor in flood control projects in Bicol.

rin: Sinda man a agco pinaka-mal na flood control project sa Bicol basado sa datos na nasa website ka "Sumbong sa Pangulo".
eng: They also have the most expensive flood control project in Bicol based on the data from the “Sumbong sa Pangulo” website.

rin: Sinda man a contractor ka Baao Lakeshore dike road sa Baao, Camarines Sur na deklaradong kumpleto a proyekto ku 2024 na nag-cacantidad 241 milyones de pesos!
eng: They are also the contractor of the Baao Lakeshore dike road in Baao, Camarines Sur, a project declared completed in 2024, amounting to 241 million pesos!

rin: Agco man sinda 10 na flood control projects na nag-cacantidad 1.3 bilyones de pesos sa Camarines Sur.
eng: They also have 10 flood control projects amounting to 1.3 billion pesos in Camarines Sur.

rin: Agco pa sinda 5 na flood control projects sa Albay na nag-cacantidad 634.99 milyones de pesos.
eng: They also have 5 flood control projects in Albay amounting to 634.99 million pesos.

rin: Sa 15 na mga contruction companies, natakma ka Sunwest a pinaca-daculong cantidad matapos maka-bulsa kin 20 porsiyento sadto 545 bilyones de pesos na budget para sa mga flood control projects.
eng: Out of the 15 construction companies, Sunwest got the largest amount after pocketing 20 percent of the 545 billion pesos budget for flood control projects.

rin: Nacuco ka Sunwest a 10.1 bilyones de pesos sa 78 na mga flood control projects sa bilog na Pilipinas.
eng: Sunwest obtained 10.1 billion pesos from 78 flood control projects across the Philippines.

rin: 17 cadi nasa Bicol na nag-cacantidad 2.33 bilyones de pesos.
eng: 17 of these are in Bicol, amounting to 2.33 billion pesos.

rin: Si Ako Bikol party-list Rep. Elizaldy Co amo a dating incorporator ka Sunwest.
eng: Ako Bicol party-list Rep. Elizaldy Co is the former incorporator of Sunwest.

rin: Paisi: Ngamin na informacion sadi, galin sa datos ka Sumbong sa Pangulo website.
eng: Note: The information here comes from data on the Sumbong sa Pangulo website.

rin: Galanteng kontratista, nag-donar 30 milyon ki Escudero ku 2022 Election.
eng: Wealthy contractor donated 30 million to Escudero in the 2022 Election.

rin: Nagtuga si Lawrence Lubiano na nag-donar mananggad siya kin 30 milyones de pesos ki Senador Chiz Escudero, mientras na nasa kainitan ku karampanyahan ku eleksyon ku 2022.
eng: Lawrence Lubiano, admitted that he donated 30 million pesos to Senator Chiz Escudero during the height of the 2022 election campaign.

rin: Mientras na a kanyang kumpanya agco kapot na mga contrata sa gobyerno.
eng: Even though his company did not hold any government contracts.

rin: Sa pag-onga ni Congressman Chel Diokno sadto hearing sa Congreso, malinaw na sinabi ni Lubiano na isi niya cun pauno a sistema kin bidding pag-abot sa mga flood control projects poon pang taon 2009.
eng: During the questioning of Congressman Chel Diokno in that hearing in Congress, Lubiano clearly said that he knows how the system of bidding works when it comes to flood control projects since the year 2009.

rin: Sabi pa niya, a kanyang kumpanyang Centerways Construction nakatakma kin 80 na mga proyekto poon 2022 anggan 2025.
eng: He also said that his company, Centerways Construction, has secured 80 projects from 2022 until 2025.

rin: Nginaranan ading Centerways Construction na kaiba sa 15 mga contractors na naka-bulsa kin mga flood control projects sa unang tolong taon kading administrasyon ni Marcos.
eng: This Centerways Construction is named among the 15 contractors that pocketed flood control projects in the first three years of the Marcos administration.

rin: Pig-cumpirmar man ni Lubiano na kadaclan ku mga nacucong flood control projects ku kanyang pamilya nasa Sorsogon.
eng: Lubiano also confirmed that most of the flood control projects acquired by his family are in Sorsogon.

rin: Ku ongaon si Lubiano kun pirang proyekto ngamin, sinabi niyang 30 sana a narurumruman niya.
eng: When Lubiano was asked how many projects in total, he said he could only remember 30.

rin: Alagad sinabi ni Congressman Diokno ki Lubiano na agco 50 anggan 53 na flood control projects na ipig-award sa Centerways Construction.
eng: However, Congressman Diokno told Lubiano that there are 50 to 53 flood control projects awarded to Centerways Construction.

rin: Basado sa datos, agco mananggad 53 na flood control projects poon 2022 anggan 2024 na nakuko su Centerways Construction na nagcacantidad lampas 5.1 bilyones de pesos.
eng: Based on the data, there are 53 flood control projects from 2022 to 2024 that were acquired by Centerways Construction, amounting to over 5.1 billion pesos.

rin: Diri pa sadi kaiba su darwang multi-year na contrata na kulang su nakalistang gastos kin proyekto.
eng: Not including two multi-year contracts whose project costs were not listed.

rin: Aminado pa si Lubiano na si Chiz Escudero man sana kuno a candidato na kanyang tinawan donasyon.
eng: Lubiano even admitted that Chiz Escudero was the only candidate whom he gave donation to.

rin: Poon ku magputok ading isyu, pigpara-oro-otro ni Escudero na oda siya pag-aram sa kun ono man na flood control projects na konektado sa Centerways Construction.
eng: When this issue erupted, Escudero repeatedly insisted that he had no knowledge of any flood control projects connected to Centerways Construction.

rin: Alagad, inako ni Escudero na nag-resibe managgad siyang donasyon ki Lubiano.
eng: However, Escudero acknowledged that he indeed received a donation from Lubiano.

rin: Na sinasabing personal o sadiring kwarta kading kontratista.
eng: Which was said to be personal or his own money of the said contractor.

rin: Bayda ngani darwa na sana?
eng: Look only two?

rin: Napasari su iba?
eng: Where did the others go?

rin: Darwang luxury cars na sana a naabutan ku mga awtoridad pag-loog ninda sadto baloy ni Sarah Discaya sa Pasig City subago.
eng: Only two luxury cars were found by the authorities when they entered the house of Sarah Discaya in Pasig City earlier.

rin: Sadtong 12 na kotseng nasa listan ku Bureau of Customs, dadarwa na sana a kandang nakuko.
eng: From the 12 cars listed by the Bureau of Customs, only two were recovered.

rin: Osad na Toyota Land Cruiser ag osad na Maserati.
eng: One Toyota Land Cruiser and one Maserati.

rin: Sinabi sapon sa senado ni Sarah Discaya na agco siya 28 na laka mal na mga awto.
eng: Sarah Discaya told the senate yesterday that she has 28 expensive cars.

rin: Onga ngowan ka mga awtoridad ag publico, napasari na su mga kotse?
eng: The question now of the authorities and the public, where did the cars go?

rin: Dapat ikulong man so kagsadiri ka mga ayam sa gilid tinampo na baraybasay na.
eng: The owner of the dogs on the side of the road who are mischievous should also be jailed.

rin: Malinaw man po a pagsilong ninyo?
eng: Are your visions clear?

rin: O baka amo sana ninyo nababasa o malinaw na nababayad, a mga bagay o letra na arani?
eng: Or maybe what you can read or clearly see are only the things or letters that are near?

rin: Cun arayo na, malabo na?
eng: If it is far, is it already blurry?

rin: Cun arog na kuyan a pagsilong, a mga mata ninyo agco na myopia!
eng: If your vision is like that, your eyes have myopia!

rin: Diri magpo-ok, ta agco solusyon ka problemang iton.
eng: Don’t worry, because there is a solution to that problem.

rin: Pag-abot sa pag-bolong ag pag-mangno ka kanatong mga mata, osad sanang ngaran a talagang pigtitiwalaan.
eng: When it comes to caring for and protecting our eyes, only one name should truly be trusted.

rin: Laka pasil iyanan.
eng: Easy to go to.

rin: Malang dali pang tawagan.
eng: Also easy to call.

rin: Diri na kaipuwan pang mag-iyan sa kanunubnuban!
eng: No need to travel to the countryside anymore!

rin: Bayda, tinaban na motor sa Pampanga, naturakan sa Camsur.
eng: Look, stolen motorcycle in Pampanga, found in Camsur.

rin: Naka-resibe suggabi kin tawag sa telepono a Del Gallego Police manungod sa osad na binayaan na motorsiklong naka-parada sa Rolando Andaya Highway, Barangay Nagkalit, Del Gallego, Camarines Sur.
eng: Del Gallego Police received a telephone call last night regarding an abandoned motorcycle parked on Rolando Andaya Highway, Barangay Nagkalit, Del Gallego, Camarines Sur.

rin: Tolos man na nag-iyan sadto lugar su mga pulis ag nabayad mananggad ninda su motorsiklo.
eng: The police immediately went to the place and indeed saw the motorcycle.

rin: Naturakan man ninda su Official Receipt/Certificate of Registration na agco nakasurat na numero kin celfone.
eng: They also saw the Official Receipt/Certificate of Registration, which had a cellphone number written on it.

rin: Su motor, osad na White/Black Honda ADV 160 CC motorcycle na agco plakang 472WTY ag naka-rehistro palan sa osad na personang miyembro ka Philippine National Police na taga Kias, Baguio City, Benguet.
eng: The motorcycle is a White/Black Honda ADV 160 CC with plate number 472WTY, registered to a member of the Philippine National Police from Kias, Baguio City, Benguet.

rin: Natawagan man su kagsadiri ku motor ag kinumpirma niyang nataban palan su motor niya ku Agosto 24, 2025 sa Apalit, Pampanga.
eng: The owner of the motorcycle was also called and confirmed that his motorcycle was stolen on August 24, 2025, in Apalit, Pampanga.

rin: Pig-oolat na ngowan ka Del Gallego Police su kagsadiri ku motorsiklo.
eng: The Del Gallego Police are now waiting for the motorcycle’s owner.

rin: Bayda ngani, para-tindang karneng ayam, rinakop sa Baao.
eng: Look, dog meat seller, arrested in Baao.

rin: Diri na iya naka-batok matapos rakpon kin pulis.
eng: She did not resist after being caught by the police.

rin: Ading 52-anyos na babaying para-bariwas karneng ayam subagong apon sa Zone 6, Brgy. San Nicolas, Baao Camarines Sur mientras na naka-puwesto sa gilid ka tinampo ag nagpapabakal kin inadobong karneng ayam.
eng: The 52-year-old woman selling dog meat this afternoon in Zone 6, Brgy. San Nicolas, Baao, Camarines Sur was stationed at the side of the road and selling marinated dog meat.

rin: Osad na pulis a nagtesting bumakal na tolos man pinabakalan kading suspetsado kin 50 pesos na adobong ayam.
eng: One police officer tried to buy, and the suspect immediately sold 50 pesos of marinated dog meat.

rin: Kinumpiskar magin su dara pa niyang osad na kalderong karneng ayam.
eng: Another pot of dog meat that was brought by her was also confiscated.

rin: Pinag-inbentaryo ku mga pulis su mga ebidensya sa atubangan ku babaying tindera ag osad na kagawad sa barangay.
eng: The police inventoried the evidence in front of the female vendor and one barangay official.

rin: Sa irarom ka layi, striktong ipigbabawal a pag-bariwas karneng ayam segun sa Acta Republica 9482 o Anti-Rabis Act.
eng: Under the law, selling dog meat is strictly prohibited according to Republic Act 9482 or the Anti-Rabies Act.

rin: Osad sa mga suanoy nang termino sa Rinconada na sinasabi ku mga gurang kun gustong tuyawon a salang gibo o kun lana ka labos sadto inaasahan.
eng: One of the commonly used terms in Rinconada, said by elders when wanting to warn against bad deeds or is too much from what is expected.

rin: Agko na baga kuryente.
eng: There is already electricity.

rin: Na-korap na termino galin sa "brown out" na boot sabiyon, pagluya o totalmenteng pagka-oda o pag-pondo ka servicio ka elektrisidad/kuryente sa osad na lugar.
eng: A corrupted term from “brownout,” meaning power outage or complete interruption of electricity service in one area.

rin: Simpleng pag uran baha nanaman sadi Iriga.
eng: Just a simple rain, and there’s flooding again here in Iriga.

rin: Pati sa pangiturugan uda kuryente
eng: Even in dreams, there is no electricity.

rin: Ayatan su kagsadiri sa pampa anti-rabies vaccine.
eng: Ask the owner for the anti-rabies vaccine.

rin: Angsa na tulos.
eng: It's already hot.

rin: Nganod na gab-i na sana kita magbinaydan.
eng: Let's just meet tonight.

rin: Independente, diri migpa-dikta lalo sa mga naghahade-hade-an na poderoso ag maiimpluwensiyang tawo.
eng: Independent, does not impose, especially on those who are wealthy and influential.

rin: Solamenteng paglaom ka mga nalingawan na ka govierno.
eng: Only a hope for those neglected by the government.

rin: Iya si Boyet Ballesteros.
eng: He is Boyet Ballesteros.

rin: Nagdadalagan para alcalde ka banwaan na Baao!
eng: Running for mayor of the town of Baao!

rin: Osad-osad niyang tutukaron a mga isyu na anggan ngowan diri natatawan kin solusyon.
eng: He will address the issues one by one, which until now have not been given solutions.

rin: Ipipresentar niya a kanyang plataforma de govierno na magigin simbag sa mga problema ka banwaan.
eng: He will present his government platform, which will be a response to the town’s problems.

rin: Buko ading magayon na ideya.
eng: This is not a good idea.

rin: Taadi na!
eng: Here it is!

rin: Itatao namo a gusto ninyo!
eng: We will give you what you want!

rin: Kagawad sa Nabua, rakop sa kasong cybercrime.
eng: Barangay councilor in Nabua, caught In a cybercrime case.

rin: Silngan a kaninyong mga kandidato poon konsehal, bise alcalde, ag alcalde na magsimbag ka mga dipisil ag importanteng mga isyu galin sa mga respetadong panelist ag publico.
eng: Watch your candidates for councilor, vice mayor, and mayor answer difficult and important issues from respected panelists and the public.

rin: Tama po, live ninyong masisilngan ading mga kandidato sadi Iriga sa Arampangan 2025, ngowan na Mayo 9, Viernes, alas-6 kin gab-i sa Pasada Rinconada Facebook ag YouTube Channels.
eng: That’s right, you will see these candidates live in Iriga at Arampangan 2025, today, May 9, Friday, 6 in the evening on Pasada Rinconada Facebook and YouTube Channels.

rin: Dawa Uda ako matanggap na Kwarta sa eleksyon ok Ing, ang importanteng maray a mabago na pamamalakad ka probinsya.
eng: Even if I don't receive money during the election, it's okay, what’s important is good changes in the province’s governance.

rin: Agco pa man raw arog kading lider sadi Rinconada?
eng: Is there still a leader like this here in Rinconada?

rin: Arog cadi a lider na diri nungka migpa-dikta sa mga poderosong mayayaman!
eng: This is the kind of leader who will not let the rich dictate!

rin: Arog cadi a lider na kayang bangga-on a korapsyon sa gobyerno!
eng: This the kind of leader who can confront corruption in the government!

rin: Arog cadi a lider na kaipuwan sadi Rinconada!
eng: This is the kind of leader that is needed here in Rinconada!

rin: Mag taga isip sa maray.
eng: Think carefully.

rin: Diri magpadara sa mga ambog.
eng: Don't get swayed by the lies.

rin: Diri madara sa tentasyon ka kwarta.
eng: Don't be tempted by money.

rin: Pili-on a tamang lider na kayang surugon a mga namamanwaan.
eng: Choose the right leader who can defend its people.

rin: Cada tolong taon, tinatawan kitang pagkakataon na pili-on a tama, diri ta po uyan pag-sayangon.
eng: Every three years, we are given the chance to choose what is right, let us not waste it.

rin: Dawa kita tinawan 500, 1,500, 5000, o dawa sa-amno pa yan, pag-abot ka Mayo 12, pili-on a tamang lider na publico a pig-serbiyan, ag nungka migpadikta sa kun kiisay pa man!
eng: Even if you are given 500, 1,500, 5,000, or whatever amount, by May 12, choose the right leader who will serve the public and will not impose on anyone!

rin: Maswerte ana syudad, banwaan, probensya o enterong nasyon na arug kading lideres.
eng: Fortunate are the cities, towns, provinces, or the entire nation that have such leaders.

rin: Tamang pagserbisyo a itatao sa banwaan & probinsya.
eng: Will give right service to the town & province.

rin: Aksyonan tabi.
eng: Take action please.

rin: Jazmine send mo raw kanako su National ID mo.
eng: Jazmine send me your national ID.

rin: Nganod, pag-uli na namo.
eng: Later, when we go home.

rin: John Carlo pag nag-abot siton a E-Patrol Naga ungaon mo saamno TDC sa driving school.
eng: John Carlo, once the E-Patrol from Naga arrives, ask how much the TDC is at the driving school.

rin: Sige adi momotor mo uda man ika lisensya.
eng: You keep driving a motorcycle even though you don’t have a license.

rin: Tauno yan si Nanay nagtatangis, Krizel?
eng: Why is Nanay crying, Krizel?

rin: Uda na kuno kanya nag-aasikaso.
eng: No one is taking care of her anymore.

rin: Pag naiyanan mo, ungaon mo ka presyo nganing maisabi ko ka-Lunes sadto ka-opisina ko.
eng: When you get there, ask the price so I can tell my officemate.

rin: Amuyan su ngud ni Kuya Jun.
eng: That is the sibling of Kuya Jun.

rin: Unta, nakakuko na kamo sa jeep na malunadan ninyo ka Sabado?
eng: So, have you already gotten a jeepney you’ll be riding on Saturday?

rin: Migpadara kami ni Ate Jen sa pangbayad ka arkila.
eng: Ate Jen and I will send money for the rent.

rin: Inedit su urong.
eng: The nose is edited.

rin: Ipig-iba si Nanay udmang pa-Naga.
eng: Nanay will be taken along to Naga tomorrow.

rin: Uramon su wheel chair ni May Ladit nganing lunadan ni Nanay udma.
eng: Borrow May Ladit’s wheelchair for Nanay to use tomorrow.

rin: Diri na ninyo ipag-iba si Nanay, itagak na sana anggan si Tita.
eng: Don’t bring Nanay along anymore, just leave Tita too.

rin: Di mo na ipag-iba si Nanay ta grabe a tawo saka baka mag-uran pa.
eng: Don’t bring Nanay along anymore because there will be too many people and it might rain.

rin: Pag-isiton na raw su jeep paiyanon sadi ta adi kanon magubat.
eng: When the jeepney arrives, send it here because the rice is heavy.

rin: Yaga, siton si Uncle Don mo jeep?
eng: Yaga, is your Uncle Don there at the jeepney?

rin: Sabiyan ninyo ana driver migrugang na sana kita para sa tip niya.
eng: Tell the driver we'll add a little extra for his tip.

rin: Sabiyan mo si Yaga ta amu migtao sa bayad kading jeep.
eng: Tell Yaga because she will be the one to give the payment for the jeepney.

rin: Uda na signal.
eng: There's no signal anymore.

rin: Nagsasakoy na.
eng: The fluvial has started.

rin: Madali nang umabot sadi Basilica.
eng: It’s almost here at the Basilica.

rin: Sadi na kami Santiago Old.
eng: We're already here in Santiago Old.

rin: Mareklamo palan adto driver.
eng: That driver complains a lot.

rin: Kadakol sinabi sabi ni Mama.
eng: He said a lot, Mama said.

rin: Tinao ni Papa mo su 500 sadto driver?
eng: Did your Papa give the 500 to the driver?

rin: Tinawan man iya sa tip na 500.
eng: He was given a 500 tip.

rin: Sari kaya ninyo naanap a jeep na an?
eng: Where did you even find that jeepney?

rin: Kiisay kaya an?
eng: Who owns that?

rin: Taga sari an?
eng: Where is that from?

rin: Sa sunod diri na kamo kumuko kan.
eng: Next time, don’t take that anymore.

rin: Uno sabi ki Mama mo?
eng: What was said to your Mama?

rin: Mig-inom na sana ko sa gatas.
eng: I'll just drink milk.

rin: Jhony painumon mo si Nanay ka bulong niya sa puso at kuradkutad pagkakaon niya.
eng: Jhony, give Nanay her medicine for the heart and the one for her palpitations after eating.

rin: Siton su payong na dara ko sapon?
eng: Is my umbrella, the one I brought yesterday, there?

rin: Dara sadi baloy.
eng: It was brought here to the house.

rin: Kuon ko iton pagkatapos ka misa sa barrio.
eng: I’ll get it after the mass in the barrio.

rin: Miggalin na ako.
eng: I'll now leave.

rin: Diri ako makapagsarita ka Rinconadang tultol.
eng: I can't speak Rinconada well.

rin: Nagsasarita ika sa Ingles?
eng: Do you speak English?

rin: Agko sadi nagsasarita ka Ingles?
eng: Is there someone who speaks English?

rin: Diri ko maintindiyan.
eng: I don't understand.

rin: Sari a kasilyasan?
eng: Where is the toilet?

rin: Pabayai sana raw ako.
eng: Leave me alone.

rin: Diri mo ko pagrutaan!
eng: Don't touch me!

rin: Migbaoy ako sa pulis.
eng: I'll call the police.

rin: Magbaoy ika sa pulis!
eng: Call the police!

rin: Kaipuwan ko a tabang mo.
eng: I need your help.

rin: Nauuda ako.
eng: I'm lost.

rin: Nauda su pitaka ko.
eng: I lost my wallet.

rin: Agko ko ilang.
eng: I'm sick.

rin: Kaipuwan ko sa doktor.
eng: I need a doctor.

rin: Pwede ko raw tabing gamiton a kanimong selpon?
eng: Can I use your phone?

rin: Mamira a tiket paiyan sa Iriga?
eng: How much is a ticket to Iriga?

rin: Usad na tiket tabi paiyan sa Iriga.
eng: One ticket to Iriga, please.

rin: Paiyan tabi sari a bus na adi?
eng: Where does this bus go?

rin: Nagpupundo raw a bus na adi sa Baao?
eng: Does this bus stop in Baao?

rin: Kuno tabi miggalin a bus na adi?
eng: When does this bus leave?

rin: Kuno tabi mig-abot a bus na adi sa Iriga?
eng: When will this bus arrive in Iriga?

rin: Pwede mo raw tabi kanako ipabayad a mapa?
eng: Can you please show me the map?

rin: Lumiko ika sa wala.
eng: You turn left.

rin: Lumiko ika sa tuo.
eng: You turn right.

rin: Diretso sana.
eng: Just straight ahead.

rin: Agko tabi kamo available na kwarto?
eng: Do you have any rooms available?

rin: Gaamno tabi a kwarto para sa darwang tawo?
eng: How much is a room for two people?

rin: Pwede ko tabi mabayad muna a kwarto?
eng: May I see the room first?

rin: Agko pa kamo mas tuninong pa kadi?
eng: Do you have any thing quiter than this?

rin: Sige, kuonon ko na di.
eng: Okay, I'll get this.

rin: Sadi sana ko nguwan na gab-i.
eng: I will stay here tonoght.

rin: Unong oras a pangmudto?
eng: What time is lunch?

rin: Pakilinigan tabi a kanakong kwarto.
eng: Please clean my room.

rin: Pwede mo raw tabi akong gisungon pag-ala una na sa apon?
eng: Can you wake me up at one in the afternoon?

rin: Agko tabi kamo alak?
eng: Do you have alcohol?

rin: Darwang baso ka red wine, tabi.
eng: Two glasses of red wine, please.

rin: Usad pa tabi.
eng: One more, please.

rin: Unong oras kamo nagsasarado?
eng: What time do you close?

rin: Nag-aako kamo sa American dollars?
eng: Do you accept American dollars?

rin: Pwede mo tabing balyuwan ading sintabo?
