rin: Sari ako pwedeng magpabalyo sa sintabo?
eng: Where can I get money changed?

rin: Uno tabi a exchange rate?
eng: What is the exchange rate?

rin: Sari tabi a ATM?
eng: Where is an ATM?

rin: Lamesa para sa usad katawo.
eng: A table for one person.

rin: Pwede ko tabing mabayad a menu?
eng: Can I look at the menu, please?

rin: Gulay sana a pigkakaon ko.
eng: I only eat vegetables.

rin: Diri ako nagkakaon ka karneng baktin.
eng: I don't eat pork.

rin: Agko kamo labas na gulayon?
eng: Do you have fresh vegetables?

rin: Agko tabi kamong kasukol ko?
eng: Do you have this in my size?

rin: Gaamno tabi adi?
eng: How much is this?

rin: Kamahal man kiton.
eng: That's too expensive.

rin: Diri ko yan kayang bakalon.
eng: I can't afford it.

rin: Abo ko kiton.
eng: I don't want it.

rin: Pigdadaya mo ko.
eng: You're cheating me.

rin: Buko ako interesado.
eng: I'm not interested.

rin: Pwede ko nang kuonon a bag ko?
eng: Can I get my bag?

rin: Nagpapadara kamo sa ibang nasyon?
eng: Do you ship overseas?

rin: Kaipuwan ko sa bulong sa sip-on.
eng: I need a cold medicine.

rin: Pwede raw ako magkuko sa insyurans?
eng: Can I get insurance?

rin: Diri pwedeng magparada.
eng: No parking.

rin: Uda ako nagibong sala.
eng: I haven't done anything wrong.

rin: Diri sana nagkaintindiyan.
eng: It was a misunderstanding.

rin: Sari mo ako dadarawon?
eng: Where are you taking me?

rin: Rarakpon mo ko?
eng: Am I under arrest?

rin: Pwede tabi akong magbayad nguna sa multa?
eng: Can I just pay a fine now.

rin: Gusto ko sa iniyow na isura.
eng: I want grilled fish.

rin: Siisay nagdara sa kakaunon?
eng: Who brought food?

rin: Maasgad baga ading pansit.
eng: The noodles are salty.

rin: Abo akong magkaon ka karneng baka.
eng: I don't want to eat beef.

rin: Bago umabot sa main line.
eng: Before reaching the main line.

rin: Sari a dakol na mga restawran?
eng: Where are there a lot of restaurants?

rin: Miggalin kuno kita nguwan.
eng: We will leave now.

rin: Kabanga pa sana kita.
eng: We're only halfway there.

rin: Maglikay ika!
eng: Look out!

rin: Kaipuwan niya sa tabang.
eng: He needs help.

rin: Makiagi tabi.
eng: Excuse me.

rin: Mamuya ako na mabistado ka.
eng: Nice to meet you.

rin: Uno a ngaran mo?
eng: What is your name?

rin: Kumusta na ika?
eng: How are you?

rin: Maray man, salamat.
eng: Fine, thank you.

rin: Sari ika nag-iistar?
eng: Where do you live?

rin: Agko gad sadi parataban.
eng: There is a thief here.

rin: Bangon na, ramrag na.
eng: Wake up, it's morning already.

rin: Diri na kamo magpundo sadi.
eng: Don't stop here anymore.

rin: Mudtu nanaman ako nagisong.
eng: I woke up late again.

rin: Kwasa lawod na sige pananggad piripildit kadtong kompyuter.
eng: Because it's already late at night and is still using the computer.

rin: Tambak a gigibohon.
eng: There's a lot of things to do.

rin: Pauno malang sakit pag naudaan ikang trabawo.
eng: it's so hard if you lose a job.

rin: Dawa unong mag-abot tinitira.
eng: You take everything that comes.

rin: Magka-income sana nguwan na pandemya.
eng: Just to have an income this pandemic.

rin: Masakit a pagbuway nguwan.
eng: Life is so hard right now.

rin: Bana niloloko kita kan kanatong gobyerno.
eng: Looks like our government is deceiving us.

rin: Urasa ayy!
eng: So hot ayy!

rin: Sabi ni Inay.
eng: Inay said.

rin: Kwasa kaya nagkakape ika malaka mudtu.
eng: Because you're drinking coffee at noon.

rin: Talaga maurasaan ika.
eng: You'll really get hot.

rin: Nalingawan ko.
eng: I forgot.

rin: Paborito palan niya a kape.
eng: She likes coffee.

rin: Ay ta dawa malang isnitan na malaka-pwerte ka paghigop niya.
eng: Even though it's so hot, she sips so good.

rin: Siguro tinutuod kita sa pasakit na tinatao kanato
eng: Maybe we’re being trained to endure the hardships given to us.

rin: Arog kading gibo ko, nagkakape naman ako dawa malaka-mudtu.
eng: Like what I’m doing, drinking coffee at noon.

rin: Diretso sa lalawgon ko a sulo galin sa langit.
eng: The light from the sky is shining straight into my face.

rin: Pinipirit na indahon a kulog tas pait.
eng: Forcing to ignore the pain and bitterness.

rin: Ngata ta kaipuhan kitang pasakitan kin pwede man sanang ayoson a nasasakupan.
eng: Why do we have to suffer if the area can be fixed.

rin: Ay inda, maray pa magkape na sana.
eng: Ay whatever, better to just drink coffee.

rin: Pirang gab-i na kitang arog kadi?
eng: How many nights have we been like this?

rin: Nag-aanap sa kin uno a pwede.
eng: Looking for what can be done.

rin: Maina-inaan man basang a kakundian .
eng: To ease the sadness a liitle.

rin: Arog ka upos na diri mo ma-anapan.
eng: Like the cat you can't find.

rin: Sadto palan luwas.
eng: Which happened to be outside.

rin: Nag-aanap nanaman sa kin uno man a pwedeng ma-unas.
eng: Looking again for what can be obtained.

rin: A problema ko ngani, diri makaluwas.
eng: My problem is, I can't go outside.

rin: Bawal kuno, agko na batas.
eng: It is not allowed, there's a law.

rin: Pirang aldow pa kong mig-ulat.
eng: How many more days will I wait.

rin: Gusto ko naman magluwas.
eng: I already want to go out.

rin: Minsan a kaipuhan ka tawo, talinga na migrungog, matang nakakabayad ka kulog, ngangang diri nagriribok.
eng: Sometimes a person needs ears that listen, eyes that can see what hurts, a mouth that doesn’t complain.

rin: Minsan mas maray na mag-irungog.
eng: Sometimes, it's better to listen.

rin: Kaysa sa sabayan a pagsilyak ku pinag-aagihan.
eng: Than to join the noise.

rin: Kaysa magngabil sa uda man kamalmagan.
eng: Than to say nonsense things.

rin: Sa lugar na uda man iiyanan.
eng: In a place that leads to nowhere.

rin: Minsan mas magayon na magtambay sa lugar na uda pakialamanan.
eng: Sometimes it’s better to just hang out in a place where no one interferes.

rin: Sa lugar na a sadiri mo sana a iisipon mo.
eng: In a place where you can focus only on yourself.

rin: Sabay silyak kading mga namamatian.
eng: And shout what you feel.

rin: Sa irarum ku kanimong matam-is na pagrukot.
eng: Beneath your sweet touch.

rin: Naintindihan ko kung uno ibig sabihon ku pagkapot mo ku kanakong kamot.
eng: I understand what it means when you hold my hand.

rin: Ku mga text mong malang siram ulit-ulitong basahon.
eng: Your texts I love to read over and over again.

rin: Ku magrani ka mga labi mo sa labi ko.
eng: When your lips touched my lips.

rin: Guru-gab-i ko nababayad a magayon mong mga mata.
eng: Every night I see your face.

rin: Maganting talaga a mga bituon.
eng: The stars are indeed great.

rin: Pigdara ko kanimo ku panahon na nauuda ako.
eng: It lead me to you when I'm lost.

rin: Diri kabisado a lugar, nagtangad sana ako tapos tig sundan paiyan kanimo.
eng: Not familiar with the place, I just looked up and follow them to you.

rin: Kaiba ko ika sa irarum ku mga bituon.
eng: I am with you under the stars.

rin: Nakatangad sana kita tapos pigsisilngan su bulan na malakabilog.
eng: We're just looking up, looking at the full moon.

rin: Nag-ayat sa pabor na sana bayaan na su nangyari kadto.
eng: Asking for a favor, hoping that what happened back then be left alone.

rin: Migpuon sa panibago, gibohon na sanag ekspersyensya su dating nangyari ku kanatong mga deperensya.
eng: Start anew, and turn past events from our differences into experience.

rin: Utro, puon sa uno.
eng: Again, starting from the beginning.

rin: Nguwan diri ko na tutugutan na mabayad ta ulit su puro.
eng: Now, I won’t let us see the end again.

rin: Isi mo dawa kadakol na buwan su naglipas, diri nagbago su tiwala ko kanimo.
eng: You know, even though many months have passed, my trust in you hasn’t changed.

rin: Lang siram na payabaon ka.
eng: It feels so good to love you.

rin: Ika sana, uda na iba.
eng: Only you, no one else.

rin: Kanakong prinsesa na diri mig-uban magiging reyna.
eng: My princess will soon become a queen.

rin: Pa, nakabayad ako sa kapay sadto sentro ngaran Owe.
eng: Pa, I saw a crazy person, his name is Owe.

rin: Alop na ko, magluto na ika sa isura nato ta ika ko kaunon.
eng: I'm hungry, cook our meal now, or I’ll eat you instead.

rin: Nabayad mo nang sadi sabi mo uda, uno ika buta?
eng: You saw it was here, but you said it wasn’t, are you blind?

rin: Pumundo ika ta lang ribuk ka nganga mo.
eng: Stop it, your mouth is too noisy.

rin: Isay raw a pinaka-magayon sa room?
eng: Who is the prettiest in the room?

rin: Agko baga ko tinaong sabon na bar.
eng: I gave bar soap.

rin: Tinao na sana ki Froilan ta nagkakaon na kaya iya.
eng: He just gave it to Froilan because he's already eating.

rin: Matawo man raw sadto tindan sapon?
eng: Were there many people at the store yesterday?

rin: Pinabakal ko na sana si Krizel sa darawang kandila.
eng: I just asked Krizel to buy the two candles.

rin: Suluan ko na adi nganod pag-iyan sa chapel.
eng: I'll light this up when I go to the chapel.

rin: Su mga order palan subago pinagcancel o diri man?
eng: Were the orders earlier cancelled or not?

rin: Dapat kaya agko mga pulis na nakabantay o kaya security guard.
eng: There should be a police or a security guard on duty.

rin: Amo na adi lista ku migkuko sa lisensya.
eng: This is the list of those who will get license.

rin: Pira kuno bayad?
eng: How much is the payment?

rin: Kuno kamo paiyan sadi Nabua?
eng: When will you go here in Nabua?

rin: Ulaton pa namo a target date nira mayor.
eng: We will wait for the target date of the mayor.

rin: Dapat binutang mo sa ref nganing umagnow sa maray.
eng: You should have put in the refrigerator for it to be cold.

rin: Unta nag-iyan sadi baloy si Jhony?
eng: Did Jhony went here in the house?

rin: Kinuko mo na su batag?
eng: Did you get the banana?

rin: Diri ko isi, uda man ngani ako sa group chat.
eng: I don't know, I'm not in the group chat.

rin: Nganod pa akong apon mig-uli.
eng: I'll be going home later this afternoon.

rin: Mga unong oras raw?
eng: Around what time?

rin: Depende kin unong oras kami matapos.
eng: It depends on what time we'll be finished.

rin: Sadi na kami gate.
eng: We're already here at the gate.

rin: Ungaon mo si Kuya Boboy kin pira tinao niya ki Sonny.
eng: Ask Kuya Boboy how much he gave Sonny.

rin: Agko ka Tutay Gcash?
eng: Tutay, do you have Gcash?

rin: Dawa sari trapik.
eng: It's traffic everywhere.

rin: Zel, diri ninyo paglingawan su kalderong agko kanon.
eng: Zel, don't forget the pot with rice.

rin: Isay tabi kaiba ni Nanay na migpacheckup?
eng: Who is accompanying Nanay for her checkup?

rin: Bagong bagyo, pwedeng mabilog ngowan na semana.
eng: A new storm might form this week.

rin: Upat na mga pinag-cacatiwalaan na forecast models a nagsasabi na agco panibagong bagyo a puwedeng mabilog bago matapos ading semana.
eng: Four trusted forecast models say that there will be a new storm that might form before this week ends.

rin: Pigbabantayan ngowan ading daculong panganuron na nasa subangan ka Visayas ta sinasabing puwede magin bagyo ag posibleng magrani sa Luzon o Visayas.
eng: A weather disturbance in Visayas is currently being monitored, it could become a storm and might approach Luzon or Visayas.

rin: Mag-antabay sana sa pinaka-bagong informacion manungod sa panahon.
eng: Make sure to stay updated on the latest weather information.

rin: Nagka-pisikalan su mga pulis ag mga jovenes ngowan pa sana sa toytoy ka Ayala paiyan Mendiola.
eng: There was a clash today between the police and youths on the bridge from Ayala to Mendiola.

rin: Nagpa-riboc ading mga jovenes matapos mambatikal kin bato, bote ag maparat na iyi sa mga pulis.
eng: The youths caused a commotion after throwing stones, bottles, and urine at the police.

rin: Lampas 300 su rinakop ku mga pulis.
eng: Over 300 were arrested by the police.

rin: Mig-atubang ading mga rinakop na jovenes sa magcacanigong kaso.
eng: The arrested youths will face different charges.

rin: Sadi nanaman kita bitnga.
eng: Here we are again at the middle.

rin: Ku mga unga na uda simbag.
eng: Of the questions with no answer.

rin: Nakakabungog na tuninong.
eng: A deafening silence.

rin: A pirming simbag niya kanako.
eng: What his answers always were.

rin: Sari ako mig-iyan?
eng: Where will I go?

rin: Pirmi na sanang pulang sulo a naagiyan.
eng: I always walk into red light.

rin: Kuno migpundo a kulog?
eng: When will the pain stop?

rin: Kuno ko migtawa?
eng: When will I laugh?

rin: Kuno ko makukuko a simbag?
eng: When will I get the answer?

rin: Sa ngamin na unga sa buway ko?
eng: To all my questions in life?

rin: Buway pa kaya ako?
eng: Will I still be alive?

rin: Pagnag-abot a simbag.
eng: when the answer arrives

rin: Na inuulat ko?
eng: I have been waiting for?

rin: Nagdakulo akong tinatao kanako a gusto ko.
eng: I grew up receiving what I want.

rin: A mga kaipuwan ko.
eng: The things I need.

rin: Kin nababayad ko sana a mga mingyari pa sana.
eng: If only I see what will happen.

rin: A mga kaipuhan nira.
eng: All their needs.

rin: Diri na kintana nagrayo pa.
eng: I shouldn't have gone further.

rin: Pero agko naman ako sadiring pangangaipo.
eng: But, I also have my own needs.

rin: Malang sakit sana nguwan.
eng: It's just so hard right now.

rin: Ta dakol problemang binabayaran.
eng: Because there are a lot of problems to deal with.

rin: Pero diri man ibig sabihon diri na ako migtabang.
eng: But that doesn't mean I won't help.

rin: Paluway-luway sana.
eng: Just slowly.

rin: Gatingay na oras pa.
eng: Few more time.

rin: Di pa man kita uri.
eng: We are not yet late.

rin: Makaka-abot man kita.
eng: We'll get there.

rin: Dawa ako uru-aldow.
eng: Even everyday.

rin: Pirmi man na aldow.
eng: It's always a day.

rin: Matatapos man adi.
eng: This will end.

rin: Baydun mo.
eng: Just see.

rin: Mig-uli man ako.
eng: I'll go home.

rin: Diri adto sapat.
eng: It was not enough.

rin: Pigbutang ko adi bago a eleksyon.
eng: I posted this before the election.

rin: Minggana si Leni, amo iyan a namati ko.
eng: Leni will win, that's what I felt.

rin: pero diri ko isi na amo iyan matuod.
eng: But I didn't know it as a fact.

rin: Kaipuwan tang maniwala na naging maganting kita.
eng: We need to believe that we did great.

rin: Nagkakaon iya sadto gilid ku salog ku nabaretaan niya na inarado nanggad ku igin niya su raga.
eng: He was eating by the river when he heard news his child ploughed the land again.

rin: Dawa uda pa tubig adtong oma nira.
eng: Even as their rice field had not water yet.

rin: Pag nagbakal akong tsokolate.
eng: When I buy chocolate.

rin: Pag nagbakal akong burak.
eng: When I buy flower.

rin: Pag nagbakal akong bado.
eng: When I buy clothes.

rin: Pag nagbakal akong sapatos.
eng: When I buy shoes.

rin: Luway na tunog sa kanakong bulsa.
eng: Low sound from my pocket.

rin: Nag-iiyak sa bagana uda kinaudmaan.
eng: Shouting like there's no tomorrow.

rin: Lubot na ko!
eng: I already have a hole!

rin: Uda na ako butang!
eng: I am already empty!

rin: Ka mal mong payabaon.
eng: You're expensive to love.

rin: Pero sa matuod sana.
eng: But to be honest.

rin: Dawa la ko ka mal payabaon.
eng: Even though it's expensive to love you.

rin: Payaba ko pa man nanggad ika.
eng: I still love you.

rin: Isi mo kin tauno?
eng: You know why?

rin: Sapat na kanakong payaba ko ka.
eng: It's enough that I love you.

rin: Pagal na kong maging makusog.
eng: I'm tired of being strong.

rin: Gusto ko na sanang mamating maluya ko.
eng: I just want to feel vulnerable.

rin: Gusto kong magtangis sa malangkusog.
eng: I just want to cry out loud.

rin: Pagbukas ka mata, nagsilong sa salming.
eng: When I opened my eyes, I look at the mirror.

rin: Unong misteryo a dara kadi salming?
eng: What mystery does this mirror bring?

rin: Narungog ko kang nagngisi sa likod.
eng: I heard you chuckle at the back.

rin: Diri ko palalampason a tunog kan.
eng: I wouldn't miss that sound.

rin: Usad iyang babayi.
eng: She's a girl.

rin: Lang gayon na babayi.
eng: A beautiful girl.

rin: Taga-UST base ka kanyang uniporme.
eng: From UST based on her uniform.

rin: Pinirit mo kong magbayle.
eng: You forced me to dance.

rin: Tinulak sa bitnga ka baylehan.
eng: Pushed me in the middle of the dance floor.

rin: Nag-abo ako ag sinabi kong diri ako tatao magbayle.
eng: I resisted and told you I don't know how to dance.

rin: Uda ika pakealam!
eng: You didn't care!

rin: Sige ko tawa, uda na ko oras para magsimbag pa.
eng: I kept on laughing, I had no time to reply.

rin: Narakop ko nanaman a sadiri ko.
eng: I catch myself again.

rin: Na binabayad a mga mata mo.
eng: Looking at your eyes.

rin: Maski ubuson mo pa a numero.
eng: Even if you finish all the numbers.

rin: Diri mo masusukol a pagsilong ko kanimo.
eng: You won't measure my feelings for you.

rin: Lingaw ko na kin sari nagpoon.
eng: I forget where did it start.

rin: Posible kaya na magraan dawa diri ika ginuguraan?
eng: Is it possible to die, without dying?

rin: Diri isi kin sari mig-iyan.
eng: Don't know where to go.

rin: Pirming nagpupundo.
eng: There's always a pause.

rin: Pirming diri nadadagos.
eng: There's always a delay.

rin: Pirming agko nagpupurisaw kanako na diri man importante.
eng: There's always something that bothers me that's not even important.

rin: Amo sana iyan.
eng: That's it.

rin: Isi kong la mo kabusy.
eng: I know you're really busy.

rin: Isi ko a mga aldow na an.
eng: I know those days.

rin: Paryo ka kanta.
eng: Just like the song.

rin: Mig-ulat ako.
eng: I'll wait.

rin: Pero diri na paryo nguwan.
eng: But it's not the same this time.

rin: Diri pakamuya sa maray.
eng: Don't be happy too much.

rin: Nguwan, isi ko na uno nangyayari.
eng: This time, I know what is happening.

rin: Nguwan, abo ko nang makulgan.
eng: This time, I don't want to be hurt.

rin: Paryo ku sinabi ko.
eng: Just like what I said.

rin: Isi ko na a simbag sa mga unga ko.
eng: I know the answers to all of my questions.

rin: Nguwan, gusto ko na sanang mamuya.
eng: This time, I want to be happy.

rin: Diri para sa kanya, kundi para kanako.
eng: Not for her, but for me.

rin: Nauuda ako sa mga ngangabilon.
eng: I'm at a loss for words.

rin: Amo yan linya ko!
eng: That's my line!

rin: Kikirikon na niya 'ko!
eng: He's kicking me!

rin: Sigurado ika?
eng: Are you sure?

rin: Ya uno?
eng: So what?

rin: Buko ading importante.
eng: This is not important.

rin: Pwede mong gibuwon.
eng: You can do it.

rin: Buko man an a intensyon ko.
eng: That wasn't my intention.

rin: Uno yan nagsimbag mo?
eng: What did you answer?

rin: Payaba tayka.
eng: I love you.

rin: Diri ko isi na gigibuwon na uno.
eng: I don't know what to do anymore.

rin: Salamat kanimo!
eng: Thank you very much!

rin: Maray an ideya kan!
eng: That's a good idea!

rin: Ako a ngaran, Jack.
eng: My name is Jack.

rin: Nauda su pitaka ko.
eng: I have lost my wallet.

rin: Lang init nguwan na aldow.
eng: It is very hot today.

rin: Uda nag-iiyan.
eng: Nobody came.

rin: Silngan mo ko pag nakakausip ko kanimo!
eng: Look at me when I talk to you!

rin: Pagal na ko.
eng: I'm tired.

rin: Kuno raw kami mig-abot?
eng: When do we arrive?

rin: Magbaoy ika sa pulis!
eng: Call the police!

rin: Dapat na mong magrungog kanako.
eng: You should have listened to me.

rin: Kin sari agko will, agko way.
eng: Where there's a will, there's a way.

rin: Diri magpo-ok, magigin mamuya!
eng: Don't worry, be happy!

rin: Naka-unow nguwan.
eng: It's cold.

rin: Abo kong mageskwela.
eng: I don't want to go to school.

rin: Nag-uuran na.
eng: It is raining.

rin: Mangitngit na ngamin sadto luwas.
eng: It's all dark outside.

rin: Lalo ko gurang na para sadi kinaban.
eng: I am too old for this world.

rin: Uno yan pigparabisara mo?
eng: What are you talking about?

rin: Diri ko makapaniwalaan iya!
eng: I can't believe it!

rin: " Salamat kanimo." "Biyong na sana ika."
eng: "Thank you." "You're welcome."

rin: Sabi mo na peligro a buway ko?

rin: Kin agko usad na tawo sadto luwas na nagdudududang na a Amerika a lugar kin sari ngamin na bagay posible, na nag-iisip pa nanggad kin matuda na su pangaturganan ku mga parausip ta sa kanatong panahon, na nag-unga pa nanggad su podero ka kanatong democrasia, nguwan na gab-i a simbag ninyo.
eng: If there is anyone out there who still doubts that America is a place where all things are possible; who still wonders if the dream of our founders is alive in our time; who still questions the power of our democracy, tonight is your answer.

rin: Ag nguwan na gab-i, iniisip ko man ka ngamin na nabayad niya sa paagi ka kanyang sentro sa Amerika - a kulog sa puso ag paglaom; a pagsilag ag pag-apoy; a mga beses na sinasabi kanamo, ag a mga tawo na nagtutupus sa mga amerikal na tubod: Amo kaya kita pwede.
eng: And tonight, I think about all that she's seen throughout her century in America — the heartache and the hope; the struggle and the progress; the times we were told that we can't, and the people who pressed on with that American creed: Yes we can.

eng: It's been a long time coming; but tonight, because of what we did on this day, in this election, at this defining moment, change has come to America.

rin: Pero pirmi kong honesto kanimo manungod ka mga pagkapapasan na kami. Listen ko kanimo, lalo na pag nag-uuna-una kami. Abo ka ngamin, ipag-iba ko kanimo sa pagtrabawo ka sadi na nasyon, a usad na ginibo sadi Amerika na 221 na taon; block po block, baktin po baktin, napulaw na kamot po napulaw na kamot.
eng: But I will always be honest with you about the challenges we face. I will listen to you, especially when we disagree. And above all, I will ask you to join in the work of remaking this nation, the only way it's been done in America for 221 years; block by block, brick by brick, calloused hand by calloused hand.

rin: Ag nguwan na gab-i, naiisip ko ka ngamin na nabayad niya sa paagi ka kanyang sentro sa Amerika. A pag-atungas ag pag-uop, a pagpupulangan ag pag-apoy. A mga panawon na sinabi kanamo 'di pwede, ag a mga tawong nagprasupon sa mga kaisipan na kadto: Amo, kaya kita pwede.
eng: And tonight, I think about all that she's seen throughout her century in America. The heartache and the hope, the struggle and the progress. The times we were told that we can't, and the people who pressed on with that American creed: Yes, we can.

rin: Nag-iyan ako sadi 'nganing isinyuwan na ngowan sa Amerika ag sa mga Mu'limang sa palibot ku kinaban, na basado sa kamaturan ag kapagmatayan, ag basado sa kamaturan na Amerika ag Islam diri sinda eksekwensyo, ag diri kaipuwan mag-kongayamon. Kindi, binalap sira, ag pariyong mga searching-testo: searching ka taisnidad ag ka progresso, tolerasyon ag ka punggod ka ngamin na tawo.
eng: I have come here to seek a new beginning between the United States and Muslims around the world; one based upon mutual interest and mutual respect; and one based upon the truth that America and Islam are not exclusive, and need not be in competition. Instead, they overlap, and share common principles – principles of justice and progress; tolerance and the dignity of all human beings.

rin: Su pangaturganan ka opportunity para sa ngamin na tawo diri na matuod para sa ngamin sa Amerika, pero agko nanap a pangaturganan kadi para sa pangpang na kanatong pang-ka-Amerikas na nagcacantidad sa mga Aldow na Amerika na nag-cacantidad sa uring milyon na American Muslim sa kanatong lugar na mamuya a tulo ag edukasyon na higher than mediyon.
eng: The dream of opportunity for all people has not come true for everyone in America, but its promise exists for all who come to our shores – that includes nearly seven million American Muslims in our country today who enjoy incomes and education that are higher than average.

rin: A mga biktima mga lalawgon na lugod na mga lalaking babayi ag igin galin sa Amerika ag dakol na ibang nasyon na uda basang ginibo sa tawo Arog pa man nanggad a piniliwan ni Al Kaida sa mga tawo, nagtubod sa pag-a attacko, ag pa nanggad nguwan a deklarasyon nira na maguraan sa masilan.
eng: The victims were innocent men, women and children from America and many other nations who had done nothing to harm anybody. And yet Al Qaeda chose to ruthlessly murder these people, claimed credit for the attack, and even now states their determination to kill on a massive scale.
